Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description: The Business Systems Analyst, under limited supervision, provides advanced system support for the applications used by supported departments. This includes, but is not limited to, gathering business requirements, design and maintenance of business applications, application configuration, systems testing, and end-user production support. The Business Systems Analyst will provide both technical and functional support to the business and should have a solid understanding of the business processes and how they relate to the supported business applications. Technical skills are required to understand the table structures, provide adequate issue resolution, and develop complicated reports. This employee has heavy contact with other company departments as well as outside vendors JOB DUTIESPlan, organize and direct the implementation and/or development of supported applications in accordance with strategic business plans and industry standards on multiple large projects.Analyze business and user needs, document requirements, and implement or revise new or existing systems as necessary.Devise or modify procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operation time, and form of desired results.Assist with the creation, documentation, and execution of test scripts for supported systems and research and implement solutions to issues identified during testing.Responsible for analyzing and resolving functional and technical problems of supported applicationsMonitor scheduled application interfaces and provide issue resolutionProvide production and ad-hoc reporting and interface solutions to complex query needs of the business using a variety of reporting tools.Interface with software vendors and suppliers in support of business applications.Coordinate with program development teams on software interfaces used by supported business applications.Provide direction to and mentor entry-level specialists.Communicate with management and business partners on business systems and project status.Work closely with internal business units to facilitate project completion.Provide After-hours support as assignedOTHER IMPORTANT DUTIESMaintain system and functional awareness and competence.Assist Quality Assurance and business partners during the testing phases of projects as needed.Perform Unit Testing on Maintenance Items and Production Break Fixes.Assist with systems implementations and the evaluation of the results.Serve as contact to relationships outside of the Company as appropriate.Perform special projects and other related duties as assigned/required.REPORTING RELATIONSHIP Reports to: Technical Applications Manager, AVP Corporate Business Systems, AVP Commercial Lending Systems or VP ITS Software Solutions  Direct Reports: None KnowledgeThorough working knowledge of information systems and operations.Advanced functional knowledge of the work processes of supported departments.Working knowledge of project management methodology.Strong knowledge of relational database structures, models, and diagrams.SkillsCompetent in the use of Microsoft Office software.Strong functional and moderate technical skills in supported business applications, preferably Oracle E-Business Suite modules, Wholesale Management System, Dealer Access System, CreditQuest Suite, SAP Business Objects, Markview, KRONOS, ADP, and others.Ability to write medium to complex SQL queries.Ability to analyze PL/SQL packages is a plus.Ability and willingness to achieve organizational and individual goals by seizing opportunities and learning from experience.Ability to analyze work, set goals, develop plans of action, and utilize time effectively.Ability to build consensus, use active listening skills, and work harmoniously with others in getting a job done while promoting a culture of teamwork, excellence, and integrity.Good communication skills displaying timely and accurate information sharing with active listening skills.Good time management skills and a demonstrated understanding of expected delivery dates and the tasks necessary to achieve objectives.Ability to provide prompt, high-quality customer service to members, staff, vendors, and integrating various applications preferred.WORK CONDITION Normal office environment, with stresses of deadlines and dealing with business partners, other departments, and outside vendors. Some travel to company and vendor sites is required.

Name: Data/Business Analyst
Description: Business Centric Technology has partnered with a marketing company seeking a Business Analyst in Fort Worth. This role will be tasked with pulling data from Salesforce anlyze the Return on Investment. This is a contract to hire role and to be qualified you must have the ability to support multiple programs at once. The responsibilities of Business Analyst will include:Set client expectations and meet deadlinesProvide business insight back to clients and managers on a regular basisAnalyse how to measure successPerform business reviews through data analysisTo be qualified for the position you must have:Experience with SalesforceA strong understanding of calculating and reporting Return on InvestmentStrong attention to detail and accuracyThe ability to hold a strategic perspective If you are interested in speaking to a recruiter about this role please apply online or call 972.267.7950.

Name: Test/Business Analyst
Description: This position supports the FAA Program.Karsun Solutions (as the prime contractor)has been awarded the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) Software Solutions Delivery Services (SSD) contract. This is a single award IDIQ over a five year period of performance. We will be fulfilling the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) Office of Information and Technology (AIT) requirement for technical support services to assist with the implementation and continuing support of enterprise-wide software application and database development and maintenance related activities that can be broadly categorized as solution development (new systems) and enhancement and sustainment (existing systems). Implement End-to-End Test Automation and Tools Strategies/Roadmaps, including performance and load testing.Analyze current architecture and test platforms to formulate a vision for growth and expansion.Perform detailed test designs using sound software test engineering principals in the context of test platforms and integration across distributed systemsCollaboratively elaborate requirements to enable Acceptance Test Driven Development (ATDD) with BAs and developers.Improve existing test automation frameworks (i.e. make them faster, more flexible and easier to use). Utilize parallel processing or grid systems to speed up the testsRequired Skills:Create Test Plans, Quality Plans, Test Cases, and executing & reporting Test results.8+ years’ experience software development testing experience required.3+ years agilesoftware development testing required.3+ years’ experience Business Analyst experience, so they can apply KARSUN Test Driven Development requirements methodology. (UX/UCD experience a plus)Participate in Project Planning and Reviews as well as Test Design, Execution, and Assessment of Results for Solution Delivery Services (SDS) Software Development Projects. Examples of detailed task assignments – might vary by specific project:Support the definition/design of a project’s Test environment.Review input artifacts for testability and Participate in preparation of test dataCreate and execute project test scripts. Functional and non-functional including (not limited to) Data/database, interface, business functionality, performance, load, usability, and security.Design and write automated regression test packages.Develop/perform CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) database testing using SQL.Log and communicate test findings to the project manager for resolution of issues.Track and report testing activities/statusTransfer test scripts and knowledge to Application Support team to facilitate regression testing of production releases.Experience with traditional, DevOps and agile software testing.Experience developing organization specific metrics to measure and improve Software Testing.Experience working in adaptive methodologies like Agile, DevOps and Scrum, etc.Strong written and communication skills required.Must be a self-starter/self-directed member of the team.Desired Skills:Test automation and/or performance/load test scripting a plus. (HP/Microfocus Unified Functional Tester/Load Runner, Selenium, Jmeter, Cucumber Postman experience a plus)Demonstrated experience with Continuous Integration, including one or more of the following build/deploy/version control tools:JenkinsMavenGitGruntQualifications:Requires a Bachelor’s Degree in Information systems, business systems, management information systems, IT Management, or other IT degree and a minimum of 10 years of relevant experienceEngineering, math, and/or science degrees are acceptable substitute degrees.The ability to successfully obtain and maintain a U.S. Suitability/Public Trust Background ClearanceTelework options for this position may be discussed with the Program Manager after three months of solid performance on the project. For more information on this or any other position, chat one-on-one with our recruiters during our weekly virtual chat event every Thursday at 12:00pm EST. Karsun Solutions is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer. Name: Business Analyst II
Description: Job Summary The Business Analyst I (BA - II) supports the continued development, rollout, and maintenance of Elevate’s products and services. The BA– II gathers and documents product feature requirements to provide clear direction for the strategic planning of business and software development. He or she provides recommendations to improve product delivery, productivity, and education of the development team. The BA - II assists in the creation of acceptance test approaches. The BA - II works with end-users, developers, QA, and project stakeholders to analyze the organization’s strategic business needs. He or she will also provide ongoing support for production processes. Essential FunctionsWork with business stakeholders to understand, refine, and document requirements.Identify and document business processes and use cases.Perform gap, impact, and risk analysis.Work with end users to understand system needs and issues; identify opportunities for improvement.Support ongoing product maintenance, including production support and cross-team communication.Assist in defining, coordinating, and executing test conditions and acceptance tests.Assist project managers in enforcement of project deadlines and schedules.Develop internal and external meeting objectives and agendas and facilitate meetings.Support the product owner and stakeholders on project priorities.Work closely with other BAs, project manager, product owner,& stakeholders on project priorities.Propose solutions to problems and consider timeliness, effectiveness, and practicality in addressing client needs.Recommend improvements and assist in changes to best practices.Research new products and participate in the new product development process.Education and ExperienceBachelor’s degree or equivalent work-related experience3+ years’ business analysis experience, prefer at least 1 year in Financial ServicesUnderstands Internet and web-based technologies as well client/server architecturesPossesses excellent understanding of internet consumer products and/or personal lending marketsUnderstands how various issues affect each other and the outcome of projectsAccurately prepares written business correspondence that is coherent, grammatically correct, effective, professional, and engagingPreferred experience working in both Waterfall and Agile methodologiesFluent with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook; familiar with MS Project, Visio, and SQLCore TraitsDemonstrates refined written and verbal communication skills, fosters open communications, listens effectively, and builds strong partnership networks that result in consistent forward momentumSkilled at solving challenges in a directed, methodical manner and analyzes the current issue to envision creative solutionsTakes initiative to complete critical tasks, especially in team settings with dependencies on other peopleWorks effectively in the face of stress, ambiguity, difficult situations, and shifting prioritiesSteps outside of“comfort zone” to tackle new issues/challenges in an aggressive manner; deals well with ambiguity in a fast-paced, cutting-edge, and entrepreneurial environmentChallenges the status quo to generate new ideas and implements unique solutions to fix challenging problemsCollaborates and openly seeks and shares information across teams and departmentsHas a solid background in his or her technical field and continually augments experience and skills with the latest research results and techniquesDemonstrates a bold commitment to the total alignment of actions, words, and professional beliefsUses solid analytical and problem solving skills, and is able to analyze current situations with new requirements to synthesize into creative solutions The following breakdown summarizes the types and frequency of activities typically performed by employees in this position. It is not a guarantee of the actual distribution of activities to be performed.Item%ActivityDescription 50  Develop product feature requirement details  Create, review, flesh out, and revise features in the product backlog. 20  Acceptance Tests  Specify acceptance tests for prioritized features. Review tests created by yourself and Test Writers.3  15  Maintenance Support  Support ongoing product maintenance, including production support.4  10  User Study  Work with end users to understand system needs and issues; identify opportunities for improvement.5  5  BPE Recommendations  Provide recommendations to improve quality product delivery and maximize productivity. Educate product development team in business and application knowledge.Working Conditions/Physical Demands Frequent keyboard and mouse use is required. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus. The position may spend up to 8 hours or more per day sitting. The position may require occasional movement throughout the facility. Occasional use of the telephone is likely. Name: Developer/Senior Developer, IT Business Intelligence
Description: Location: AA Headquarters 2 (DFW-HDQ2)  Additional Locations: None Requisition ID: 21761 OverviewJoin us for a career with endless possibilities.Looking for a job where a passion for innovation, a culture of teamwork, and opportunities for growth are valued and rewarded? You’ve come to the right place.You don’t have to be an airline aficionado to join American Airlines. It takes more than cool planes to keep us ahead of the curve, and thanks to our team of behind the scenes professionals, we do just that. As the largest airline in the world, American Airlines is in the business of serving the global travel needs of our customers. At the core of the Company is our commitment to each customer and each employee. We are dedicated to developing and delivering what our customers value and are willing to pay for. Customer-centric planning, innovative marketing, and an exceptional customer experience are supported by a cadre of talented people. What does it take to join us? We’re glad you asked! We expect exceptional skills in your discipline and a dedication to being the best as we relentlessly pursue our goal of being not just the largest airline in the world, but also the best airline in the world.Fortunately, we’re building on almost a century of innovation and firsts in our industry – and we plan to continue that tradition of excellence.About The JobThis position sources, compiles and interprets key IT operational and statistical data, analyzes metrics performance, and generates a variety of value-added Business Intelligence (BI) reports for the business and senior-level executives, including key performance indicators and critical success factors for both services and processes. This role requires a deep understanding of data structures and a strong working knowledge of BI tools, databases and SQL.Specifically, you’ll do the following:Ensures the timely and accurate generation of all ITS reporting, ensuring consistency and standardization amongst the various types of reports and databasesLeads reporting requirements gathering sessions with customers. Works with departmental Analytics and Reporting team SMEs to understand Business Requirements, data structures, definitions and various data sourcesAnalyzes, interprets and reports performance trends from various channels and departments, identifying areas performing outside of expected resultsResponsible for data mining for enterprise decision support, as well to provide data support for organization's improvement initiativesLeads efforts to review and recommend improvements and subsequent development of reporting enhancements, including the creation of new reporting templates and analytical reportsMaintains a reporting schedule and documentation of reporting procedures. Generates and maintains control documentation of reporting procedures to comply with governance audits and regulatory requirementsProvides mentoring and guidance to less experienced analysts on topics such as documentation, analysis, job responsibilities, organizational expectations, process execution, and industry best practicesPerform ad hoc duties in accordance to business needsQualificationsRequired QualificationsBachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Technology, Information Systems (CIS/MIS), Engineering or related technical discipline, or equivalent experience/training3 years of relevant comprehensive data analysis and design experience as a part of an Incident and/or Problem team3 years of experience and expertise in Tableau driven dashboard/analytics design, development and implementationPreferred Qualifications5+ years of relevant comprehensive data analysis and design experience as a part of an Incident and/or Problem teamBusiness Intelligence development certifications. DBA / Report Developer / Data Scientist qualificationsWorking knowledge of Tableau administration/architecture (preferred) Working knowledge of BA/data warehouse functionality (preferred) Knowledge of BA project/program management (preferred) ITIL v3/2011 Foundation certification is preferred, with preference for advanced Intermediate certification in ITIL's Service Operations or Operational Support and Analysis certificationExperience in architecting, designing, developing BI and other analytical, reporting solutions using standard BI tools Experience in creation of functional specifications and project documentation and translating functional requirements into detailed technical requirementsExpertise in developing, maintaining and experience in managing/leading Tableau driven dashboards & analytics, preferably with working knowledge of TableauExperience with MS SQL Server, Tableau, Business Objects, Microsoft Reporting Services strongly preferredExtensive background in measurements of IT, services, deliverables and inputsQualifications (Continued)Experience working with Agile project management methodologies and toolsExperience in DevOps Toolchain technologiesDemonstrated initiative, flexibility and ability to adapt to changing priorities and work environmentsAbility to thrive in a sense-of-urgency environment and leverage best practicesAbility to build and maintain effective relationships with team members, customers, and external groups, as well as working in a collaborative environment with geographically dispersed resourcesStrong Name: Business Systems Analyst II
Description: The Business Systems Analyst II position, within the Business System Support team, is required to represent Auto Operations by supporting technology initiatives and programs aimed at enhancing the core Auto system applications (ALA, CALS, iCAF, Quest, TCS, RCV) and positively impacting the Employee and Customer Experience.  The individual will participate in Monthly and Coordinated Release initiatives, production breaks, small system enhancements and other technology development efforts. They will be accountable to assist in business analysis and epic and story development. In addition, the incumbent will work closely with technology and business resources to implement the appropriate testing methodologies and project management activities to ensure on-time delivery of technology releases, with minimal business interruptions. Responsibilities + System Liaison between LOB and Information Technology, Risk Management, Legal, Compliance and Project Office providing subject matter expertise.  + Participate in project scope/impact reviews as a SME to determine potential impacts to functionality and business processes and procedures  + Draft, review, comment and approve Epic and User Stories.  + Draft, review, comment and approve Test plans based on development requirement and technical designs.  + Act as a liaison with other business units or IT teams and vendors in support of assigned initiatives.  + Provide post implementation support to clients as needed.  + Support escalated systems issues, coordinating with Systems Administrators, IT and other parties as necessary to resolve defects.  + Manage small to medium scale projects and initiatives as required, adhering to the Project Life Cycle and documentation protocols and policies as necessary. Required skill sets: + Requires a minimum of 5+ years in a Business Analyst, Project Manager, Production Support or Testing Manager role focusing on supporting large applications  + Must be able to work with end-user community, and interact with the Business, Information Technology, Risk, Audit, Legal, Compliance, etc. as required to investigate and resolve issues, or address application challenges.  + Required experience with any of the following systems: ALA, CALS, Quest, iCAF, RCV, TCS and other Auto Finance system applications and interfaces.  + Required experience in Loan Operations, Servicing or Collections or with loan servicing technology.  + Required experience in a Systems Support or Systems Administration role with problem solving and analytical abilities  + Advanced self-management skills with proven ability to manage multiple and diverse priorities, achieving desired objectives within deadlines.  + Advanced project management skills with the ability to work across various functional areas and multiple levels of management.  + Ability to assess cross-impacts and risks associated with technology initiatives and ensuring that appropriate controls are identified and maintained.  + Excellent communication and collaboration skills. Preferred skills sets: + Strong experience with testing tools, writing test plans, executing test cases and reviewing results.  + Knowledge of testing methodology and use of test tracking tools.  + Technical expertise with systems interfaces, data queries and data tools.  JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Name: Commercial PBA Business Analyst
Description: Transforming the future of healthcare isn’t something we take lightly. It takes teams of the best and the brightest, working together to make an impact.As one of the largest healthcare technology companies in the U.S., we are a catalyst to accelerate the journey toward improved lives and healthier communities.Here at Change Healthcare, we’re using our influence to drive positive changes across the industry, and we want motivated and passionate people like you to help us continue to bring new and innovative ideas to life.  If you’re ready to embrace your passion and do what you love with a company that’s committed to supporting your future, then you belong at Change Healthcare.Pursue purpose. Champion innovation. Earn trust. Be agile. Include all.Empower Your Future. Make a Difference.Position Purpose  The Business Analyst III assists the R&D staff in understanding the organization’s operational needs for both automated and manual solutions to business systems and procedures of diverse scope. The Business Analyst is involved in planning, organizing and conducting detailed analytical studies to define problems, identify deficiencies and improve solutions which impact the enterprise’s effectiveness, and provide the basis for issue resolution. The Business Analyst is responsible for executing the system definition and design processes within the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). They collaborate with users to define business requirements for system enhancements and new functionalities to achieve process improvements. Name: Information Systems Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Overview The Information Systems Business Analyst is a vital team player in the IS department. The IS Business Analyst plans and conducts the analysis, design, testing, documentation and deployment of new and existing technology solutions to meet TBN’s business and operational requirements; develops business process requirements and improvements; facilitates development of priorities with managers; coordinates and participates in applications testing and problem resolution; executes quality assurance activities. This position operates as the subject matter expert providing technical and functional system analysis services to enable TBN to develop and implement software and technology solutions to meet business, operational and functional objectives.  In addition, the IS Business Analyst will establish and maintain technical and architectural documentation standards and mentor and provide leadership to technical resources conducting systems analysis. Primary ResponsibilitiesAnalyze and document complex as-is and future business processes to turn business requirement into documents for procedures, applications, tools, and reportingCollect and develop detailed business and functional requirements across the enterprise and serve as a liaison between the business and technical teams.Assist Application Support team with troubleshooting and root-cause analysis.Troubleshoot issues with current software applications and interfaces identifying potential solutions and working with the development team to resolve.Assist the development team with writing test cases, test scripts and scorecards.Create, contribute to and organize operational procedures and user manualsCollect and Analyze data to identify risks and perform root-cause analysis on areas of risk.Establish and track action plans, working with cross functional teams.Ability to identify solution options with pros/cons and present to various stakeholders and decision makers.Monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, recommending actions.Schedule, facilitate and document meetings with all levels of staff for purposes of discovery, presentation, review, approval, and problem resolution.Ability to answer questions, provide detail, address changes to requirements, and facilitate dialog across teams when issues and challenges are encountered to ensure the end product is delivered as specified.Create, maintain, and analyze metrics, KPIs and reports for Software Applications.Contribute and facilitate the Continuous Improvement of Software Applications providing recommendations and action plans for enhancements and upgrades.Responsibilities extend to multiple projects, applications enhancements, risk mitigations and/or continuous improvement simultaneously.Qualifications and SkillsBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Information Technology Computer Engineering or similar field5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, Business Systems Analyst, Senior Application Support or Senior Development positions.Experienced in at least one of the following areas: CRM/Customer Service solutions. Donor management, transaction processing and product fulfilment. (Donor Direct StudioEnterprise experience will be highly desired)Customer Engagement: Direct Mail processing, Call Center (inbound and outbound), email campaigns.Financial systems. All areas including AP, AR, GL, Fixed Assets, Purchasing and Reporting (Oracle Cloud Fusion ERP will be highly desired)Knowledge and experience on financial transaction processing: Payment gateways and credit card processingElectronic Fund Transfers and ACHPaypalHighly proficient gathering and developing detailed business and functional requirements.Excellent analytical skills so that a customer’s business needs are properly interpreted and translated into application and operational requirementsDemonstrated ability to quickly grasp complex technical concepts and make them easily understandable in text and pictures.Excellent written and oral communication skills effectively communicating in individual and group settings in all levels of the enterprise, from C-level position to end users as well as external vendors.Strong knowledge of systems capabilities, software platforms, and processes.Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.Demonstrated report writing skills in either SQL Report Writer, Crystal Reports or other reporting or BI platform.Working familiarity with writing SQL queries, creating database views, and reading/writing basic stored procedures.Familiarity with the SDLC and software development.Knowledge of different development languages and software architecture will be highly desired.Proficient organizational and time management skills, multi-taking, and working under minimal supervision.Strong attention to detail.Proficiency with MS Office, MS Visio and other documentation and organizational tools. Company DescriptionTBN is the world's largest Christian television network and America's most-watched faith-and-family channel. Launched by Paul and Jan Crouch in 1973 with one small station broadcasting to the Los Angeles area, TBN today is a growing family of over thirty global networks reaching every inhabited continent with a broad range of inspirational, entertaining, and life-changing programming twenty-four hours a day.  In the U.S. TBN's family of networks is available to 98 percent of television households, and globally TBN reaches an estimated two billion potential viewers each day!  And as for programming, TBN has an unmatched tradition for airing the very best in faith and family-friendly content for every age group. Anchored by TBN's flagship ministry and talk show Praise, TBN's innovative programming lineup includes: ministry programs featuring the world's most respected pastors, Bible teachers, and Christian leaders; exclusive news, current events, and documentary programs; award-winning content for children, teens, and young adults; wholesome movies the whole family will enjoy; and exclusive specials like the GMA Dove Awards and Hillsong worship conferences from around the world.  TBN is also a leader in using cutting-edge technology to reach more viewers around the world with programming that entertains, inspires, and changes lives through God's message of hope and grace. From its online archive giving viewers access to tens of thousands of life-impacting programs, to its mobile app that brings more than a dozen global TBN networks to smart phones, iPads, and tablets anywhere in the world, TBN continues to be the standard bearer for faith-and-family broadcasting across the earth.

Name: Business Analyst Level 1
Description: Job Summary  One of our highly respected client is currently seeking a highly motivated and qualified Business Analyst to join a dynamic team responsible for ensuring the quality of important and highly visible projects. The primary function of the Junior Business Analyst will be to executive all phases of the business analyst life cycle consisting of but not limited to: requirements gathering, design, implementation, documentation and end user support. A successful candidate will be driven and will make certain that project deliverables meet client specifications, are delivered on time and are of high quality. Name: SAP SD/OTC Business Systems Analyst
Description: SAP SD/OTC Business Systems Analyst  12 month+ contract  Location: Irving, Texas  IMMEDIATE new job opening for an SAP SD/OTC BSA focused in sales and distribution specifically in OTC. This individual will join our global client’s team at their North American headquarters in Irving, Texas. This is a great opportunity to join a fantastic company that is number one in its industry and become part of a dynamic IT team that is integral to the that company's operations and success. This role will be 70-80% functional and 30-20% technical. This individual will work with the business to solve SAP system processing problems and create new configuration to solve business problems. This role will require knowledge of AR, contracts, pricing and invoicing in addition to SD OTC.  This is primary an SAP support role but there will be some development that will consist of creating templates and assisting with tests as well as tweaking existing functionality as needed. Additionally, this individual will assist with migrations. Primary responsibilities will include providing user support, gathering user requirements, and configuring the system for new functionality. Aside from the S&D and OTC support, this individual may also assist with supporting project system, AR and fixed assets. This role will report to the Lead SAP BSA as well as the Manager of Business Systems.  RESPONSIBILITIES  o Provides 2nd and 3rd level SAP support to end users  o Works with developers to create and test new system functionality  o Partners with business users to coordinate application and testing of system enhancements  o Creates technical specifications for developers  o Installs and configures applications  o Acts as a liaison with vendors and consultants to address support activities  o Develops documentation to improve the use and availability of applications  o Provides expert level support and maintenance of core software functionality and technology components  o Works cross-functionally to solve problems and implement changes  o Up to 10% travel may be required  REQUIREMENTS  o 7+ years of functional SAP BSA  o FICO experience, strong in AR  o Recent experience supporting OTC  o SD experience  o Experience creating templates and assisting with tests  o Experience tweaking existing functionality  o Experience with migrations  o Knowledge of AR, contracts, pricing, and invoicing  o Experience with project System, AR and Fixed Assets is a Plus!  o Expertise in both business and configuration knowledge for functional areas  o Requires project management skills; designs solutions for internal/external clients  o Considered a subject matter expert resource for others  o Proven experience in troubleshooting, testing and quality assurance techniques  o Proficient in the development of documentation to support functional specifications, data flows, etc.  o Bachelor's degree in Information MIS, Information Technology, Engineering, or other related field  *Must be a U.S. Citizen, Green Card Holder, or hold other status that allows you to be employed in the United States on a W2 basis without having to be sponsored by your employer.  **To view all of our open positions, please visit: http://www.alleareconsulting.com/job-openings.

Name: Sr. Business Process Analyst
Description: Sr. Business Process Analyst Pay Range From 72,760 Pay Range To 94,588 Closing Date 12/5/18Apply NowRequisition Number:51244Department:Transportation Public WorksFull-Time/Part-Time:Full-TimeRegular/Temporary:RegularThis positions will be part of Transportation Public Works (TPW) and will provide support to various divisions within the department. You will be part of a collaborative team working to provide support for the Asset Management Initiative. Your primary function will be overseeing the maintenance of the GIS data for TPW. Currently, TPW has over 990,000 known assets for streets, traffic and storm water.  Your primary duties and responsibilities will include: Develop and manage a GIS maintenance process for all TPW assets. This position will supervise the process and employees to ensure all assets and associated attributes are accurately captured and recorded in the asset databasesOversees the database design for all GIS databases in TPW. This includes 3 complex databases focused on assets for storm water, streets and traffic. This position will collect information from the end users; make database design recommendations; work as a liaison with the IT department and various outside vendors; and test configuration changes before and after the changes are made to ensure everything is working properly.Manage 3rd party contracts for GIS Asset data development or other GIS projects. The candidate will be required to develop scope, solicit work, select a vendor and manage vendor expenses while ensuring a quality product is developed.Manage internal GIS analysis and mapping projects. This includes documenting needs, defining scope, facilitating meetings and communicating with partners and customers.Develop Quality Control for various GIS feature classes such as storm water, traffic, pavement and easements providing feedback to team members and correcting issues.Conducting semi-annual reviews for direct reports.Assist with integrating 3rd party software with GIS. This would include products like Accela, VueWorks and IT Pipes to set-up map services and symbology for various products. We are looking for a candidate that thinks logical and has the ability to communicate well with others in a professional capacity. The candidate should be able to work independently with minimal supervision when provided a task or objective. They should have a strong GIS background with experience editing, reading plans, conducting quality control and supervising others.  Preference will be given to candidates with a GISP and strong organizational and analytical skills. Minimum Requirements:Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in Business Administration, Public Administration, or related field.Five (5) or more years of business experience and business analysis experience.Valid Texas Driver’s License.

Name: Business Operations Analyst - Research
Description: JPS Health Network is a $950 million, tax-supported health care system for Tarrant County in North Texas. Licensed for 578 beds, the network includes an acute care hospital and more than 40 community-based clinics, including 19 school-based clinics. John Peter Smith Hospital is home to Tarrant County's first and only Level 1 Trauma Center, its only psychiatric emergency services site and has the largest hospital-based family medicine residency program in the nation. Our network employs more than 6,500 people.  Acclaim is our multispecialty medical practice group. Acclaim has over 300 providers serving the JPS Health Network in specialties ranging from primary care to general surgery and trauma. The Acclaim group has been formed around a common set of incentives and expectations supporting the operational, financial and clinical performance  outcomes of the network. Description: Location: Flight Training Academy (DFW-FTRN)  Additional Locations: None  Requisition ID: 24697OverviewJoin us for a career with endless possibilities. Looking for a job where a passion for innovation, a culture of teamwork, and opportunities for growth are valued and rewarded? You’ve come to the right place.  You don’t have to be an airline aficionado to join American Airlines. It takes more than cool planes to keep us ahead of the curve, and thanks to our team of behind the scenes professionals, we do just that. As the largest airline in the world, American Airlines is in the business of serving the global travel needs of our customers. At the core of the Company is our commitment to each customer and each employee. We are dedicated to developing and delivering what our customers value and are willing to pay for. Customer-centric planning, innovative marketing, and an exceptional customer experience are supported by a cadre of talented people.  What does it take to join us? We’re glad you asked! We expect exceptional skills in your discipline and a dedication to being the best as we relentlessly pursue our goal of being not just the largest airline in the world, but also the best airline in the world.  Fortunately, we’re building on almost a century of innovation and firsts in our industry – and we plan to continue that tradition of excellence. Name: Operations Program Analyst- Compliance, Intern
Description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.The Infrastructure Data Center Business Support team designs, implements and continuously evolves systems and processes to support all aspects of the Data Center Operations function. One critical pillar to its overall resiliency is the adherence and continuous improvement to compliance functions. Two of the key Compliance Programs within the Data Center are:  ;-**Data Eradication**ensures that all user data stored and operated within the Data Center assets are appropriate handled and eradicated prior to the asset leaving Facebooks possession. ;-**SOX** (Sarbanes Oxley is a US Federal law which provides guidance on accounting standards) ensures that all Data Center equipment is tracked and handled within our systems in a way that is transparent and accessible by groups, such as Finance, Internal Auditors and External Auditors.In this role you will work closely with the SOX Compliance Manager and ERAD Operations Program Manager to ensure that our compliance operational programs are accurate, efficient, and scalable as we continue to grow our global Data Center footprint.  This is a 12-week internship position based in Fort worth, TX with some domestic and international travel required (5-10%). including end user training, product testing, and rollout related to SOX and data eradication programs Foster a culture of data driven decision makingMininum Qualifications:Pursuing an MBA or Masters Name: Data Analyst

Our analysts are responsible for data mining and business intelligence. In this role, you will conduct advanced analyses, custom reporting/dashboards, and standardize all data used for developing client solutions. Name: Business Operations Analyst Staff
Description: Description:Responsible for supporting the development and deployment of the new NBF investment analytics tool suite to include, but not limited to, an enterprise wide standardized performance management dashboard and associated analysis of the various portfolios from both a performance management and cost perspective. Supports the enterprise NBF data governance, including collection and verification of information from NBF stakeholders. Conducts training on the various NBF tools with stakeholders across the enterprise.  Responsible for supporting building recommendations and associated analytics for budget trade-offs across LoBs to support the annual NBF planning process, monthly and quarterly NBFEC meetings and ad-hoc decisions as necessary.  Supports the compilation of the annual Aero NBF Portfolio insights and analytics planning analysis for presentation to the NBF Executive Council. Perform special assignments as required by Aero leadership.  MUST BE A US CITIZEN - This position is located at a facility that requires special access. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. Theyre dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Name: Business Systems Analyst/Data Modeler
Description: Description:Fort Worth - TX, TX13601F, 13601 North Freeway, 76177  Jeanie Lynn Bannon  0905-43305 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of ‘own your tomorrow’ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.  As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. Our Opportunity: As a Business System Analyst/Data Modeler, you will work closely with business partners to understand the data and business challenges to propose new functionality into the enterprise data warehouse. You will analyze data using SQL, identify and propose alternative questions, and design a data model and/or application data flow to deliver the business capability. You will be required to quickly learn Schwab’s business model, business vision and the associated analytical/reporting requirements. A successful candidate will be curious about the business and the data that enables it. A successful candidate will also be passionate about partnering with our business teams and exploring data to find the best solutions. ERwin), creating metadata definitions, and creating source-to-target mappingActing as requirements coordinator for 1-2 medium to large projects, capturing usage requirements and designing the and technical teamsCoordinating data model review and handoff with the ETL development teamBuilding deep understanding of the warehouse data and capabilitiesWhat you have:At least 3-5 years of experience as a technical business analyst with a track record of delivering well-documented data requirementsSubstantial experience in Data Warehousing / Information Management preferably using Teradata database platformExpert level SQL skillsExperience in data modeling (logical and/or physical) with solid understanding of 3NF, Star Schemas and performance concernsExperience using ErwinFamiliarity with Informatica, Hive and Teradata preferred.Experience /knowledge of Project Management with the ability to drive projects to successful completionExperience in Agile development methodologyPrior experience interfacing with various partners, including vendors, offshore development teams, and internal groupsStrong interpersonal, analytical, problem-solving, influencing, prioritization, decision- making and conflict resolution skillsExcellent written/verbal communication skillsStrong knowledge of MS Project, Excel, MS Word and Visio Drawing tool along with general familiarity with Outlook and other MS Office applications is also requiredWhat you’ll get:Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits packageFinancial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discountsWork/Life Balance: Sabbatical, Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee Matching Gifts ProgramEveryday Wellness: Health and Lifestyle Wellness Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Food Choices, Wellness ChampionsInclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnershipsNot just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life Learn more about Life@Schwab. Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: Alternate Locations: Fort Wayne, IN (Indiana)  Relocation assistance is not available for this opportunity. Today, more than 17 million customers trust our retirement, insurance and wealth protection expertise to help address their lifestyle, savings and income goals, as well as to guard against long-term care expenses. Name: Business Application Analyst
Description: Company Overview  MCPc is a technology logistics company that helps clients empower their employees to work from anywhere and on any device through innovative end point computing architectures.  The company's heritage as a top 100 solution integrator and unique anyplace workspace ideology has positioned it to become a thought leader in the rapidly expanding next generation Internet of Things (IoT) marketplace.  As customers continue to expand their use of connected devices, MCPc will also continue to deploy and develop enhanced services around managing the intelligent device life-cycle in a proactive and efficient fashion. Headquartered in Cleveland and with branch locations across the Midwest, MCPc provides custom solutions for the three biggest issues facing customers today: Logistics, the Secured Client and Workspace Transformation. These three offerings make up the core of the Anyplace Workspace ®, our answer to the Internet of Things and PC-as-a-Service.  MCPc is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, focused on recruiting and retaining top talent at every level. We employ premier associates in the industry who deliver value and support to our growing customer base. In order to ensure MCPc is holding itself to the highest level of security, as a trusted and premier endpoint solutions provider, all new employees must undergo our standard background check and drug screen test for pre-employment purposes.  As a NorthCoast 99 winner for 8 consecutive years, MCPc is consistently recognized as one of Northeast Ohio's best places to work. MCPc offers a comprehensive benefits package which includes optional Medical, Dental, Vision, Short Term Disability, 401k, Voluntary Life Insurance (for you and your family), Group Accident and Critical Illness Insurances as well as company-paid Life and Long Term Disability Insurances. We also offer Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays, a Wellness Program and other perks to take advantage of through our strategic partnerships!  Position Overview  We are seeking an experienced and motivated individual to join our dynamic team. This candidate will be part of the IT-Enterprise Information Management team and will be expected to take a lead role in SQL Server Database across the development, quality assurance and production environments for multiple applications. Additionally, they will assist in the ongoing development and implementation of technical best practices for SQL database administration. Excellent knowledge of Data Backup and Recovery, Security, Authentication, and SQL. Experience with Capacity Planning, Performance Monitoring and Tuning. Expect experience with at least MS SQL.)MS SQL Server: Experience with Windows SQL Server 2008 R2, 2012 R2, 2016 R2DB Design, documentation, coding: Familiarity withQualificationsAdministration experience with MS SQL 2005 through 2014, with basic knowledge of SSIS, SSAS, SSRS.Native monitoring solutions using database mail and alerts.Previous SQL developer experience.Physical file structures and placement within the SQL Server environment.Database maintenance tasks and index maintenance.Database Console Command checks (DBCC).Database Disaster Recovery planning and testing.Database Security, via both SQL logins and Windows authentication.Experience with Active Directory groups, as they pertain to database permissions.Basic understanding of enterprise environments that include Domain Name System, Firewalls, Active Directory, SAN Storage and VMWare.Familiar with a mixed Linux/Windows environment and the database connection settings in each.On-call support as required.4 year degree in IT, Business Administration, or related field.Minimum 5-7 years' experience in a similar role.Preferred/Additional:SAP ECC experience would be helpful.Knowledge of SAP Replication Server (administration and deployment) would be helpful.CommVault data protection and information management solutions experience would be helpful.Experience with Idera Diagnostic Manager would be helpful.SDL2017

Name: ERP Business Analyst Sr Stf
Description: Description:Lead projects to design and implement business requirements in an integrated SAP environment. The role is unique in that the candidate must be technically knowledgeable and have the leadership skills to lead across functions, organizations, applications and companies. The candidate must have a strong financial background and the ability to relate the impact of system changes with changes required to disclosure statements and ensure changes are consistent with MMAS and CAS as well as tax laws and financial reporting.While this candidate does not have to be an expert they do have to have the skills, knowledge and back ground to lead such an effort. In this type effort they would be responsible for self supervising, making assignments and engaging the appropriate personnel inside and outside the immediate organization in order to ensure a successful implementation. This candidate would be required to maintain status to budget and schedule and periodically provide that status to management for flow up to the PMO. Since SAP is an integrated product the solutions that are developed must be integrated as well. The candidate will be called upon to develop complex solutions and then ensure they are agreed to by all impacted parties. Implementation includes leading and coordinating training and roll out plans. The candidate must also recognize what needs to be accomplished on their own and initiate go forward plans get them funded and staffed. The candidate will be the external face for the projects to management, other organizations and the customer. Breadth of responsibility for the SAP Financial Support organization is very wide and project leadership is required in the following areas at any point in time Accounting (Material Cost, Accounts Payable, FI Interfaces, Labor Distribution, Project Systems, Asset Accounting, Overhead Allocations, Results Analysis), Billings, Estimating (MCE/MLE) and Earned Value Management (Manufacturing Earned Value and Material Earned Value). We will be stabilizing and completing the sunset of legacy processes.  No Clearance Needed **  Must be a US Citizen or legally authorized to work in US as a permanent resident. This position is located at a facility that requires special access Basic Qualifications: Proficient SAP experience.  Experience analyzing and solving complex SAP problems.  Experience in Project Management (budget/schedule).  Experience in leading others and/or cross-functional teams. Desired Skills: Understanding of Accounting, Estimating and Earned Value Requirements  Strong Financial Background  Strong Technical Proficiency in SAP  Full Understanding of SAP and it's integration points  Ability to manage up and down the organizational lines  Strong Organizational Skills  Experience making presentations to audiences up to and including senior-level executives  Experience with government contractors BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  Join us at Lockheed Martin, where were engineering a better tomorrow. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional
