Name: Technical Analyst
Description: Effective Date: 9/6/2018 Business Title: Technical Analyst Division/Business Unit: Shared Services Center Reports To: Business Analytics Manager Work Location: Irving, TX Position Summary: The Technical Analyst s focusis to work on projects that drive business awareness and decisions; Predict what the Business needs and make recommendations; See the solution beyond the code; Work across multiple systems, supporting all departments within the Shared Services Center, Finance Transformation Team (FTT) and other corporate departments as needed. Organizational Relationships: Interacts with internal customers and external lenders at various levels, peers, supervisor and management. Job Responsibilities:Develop reports and tools using advanced Excel and MS VBA and formulas.Utilize knowledge of applicable data sources, tables and data relationships.Execute data queries across various systems utilizing SQL, Microsoft Access and Access.Work with management and subject matter experts to help define reporting requirements.Design efficient data collection techniques and develop reports that compile the data into simple and understandable formats such as dashboards, tables, graphs, etc.Scope and develop automated business solutions.Support the various SSC Departments and assist the Data Analytics Team by responding to ad-hoc data requests, answering questions and providing technical support and data analysis.Identify opportunities to develop standardized reports for repeated data requests and work with IT to implement automation solutions.Build and maintain effective professional relationships within the SSC and develop strong working knowledge of current business processes.Leads or participates in process improvement. Is a catalyst for change.Demonstrate behaviors consistent with the Company Vision, Mission, and Values and SSC Social Contract, in all interactions with customers, co-workers, and suppliers.Qualifications:Bachelor s degree in Information Systems, Management or related field.4-6 years data analytics or equivalent experience.Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Access.Experience developing advanced Excel macros using VBA.Experience developing databases.Experience analytical and computer skills.Demonstrated ability to perform technology-based data mining and analytics.Ability to work in a highly dynamic environment and handle multiple priorities and competing deadlines.Detail oriented and organized.Essbase experience (Preferred)Next Possible Position: Technical Analyst II Physical Requirements: This is a largely sedentary role with extended period looking at computer monitors and using a keyboard and mouse.

Name: Senior Data & Business Analyst
Description: What you’ll be doing...In this role as a Senior Data & Business Analyst, you’ll be part of the Wireless Supply Chain – Reverse Monetization team to deliver incremental revenue in traditional and non-traditional channels (Secondary Marketplaces, Agent Channel, Alternative Online Marketplaces like eBay/Amazon/etc, and VZW.com, etc.). You’ll be managing and developing projects, deliver incremental revenue streams across multiple programs by sourcing data and merging complex data streams.  Because our business is complex, we need someone with both a strong business acumen as well as excellent technical skills to dive deep into the data sources to generate the insights.  We are looking for a technically-minded, strong analytical thinker and problem solver who is able to efficiently deliver analytic insights across multiple teams within Verizon. Most importantly we are looking for someone who is a builder and entrepreneur, someone who is excited about using data and analytics to push the team forward.  In this role, you will work closely with the entire Reverse Logistics teams, Supply Chain Senior Management & staff and other internal groups as needed. The Senior Analyst will have an understanding of Indirect Sales Channel and Alternate Marketplaces, including pricing and velocity. You’ll be periodically creating executive summary and presentations to senior leadership on the health of various programs. The Core responsibility is building and maintaining monetization programs that consistently maximize revenues, margins and market share. Drive achievement of strategic and revenue objectives:Lead the identification of alternative revenue streams to diversify our Reverse Monetization portfolio to increase the inflow of devices for resale across various programs.Tracking, analysis and reporting on key Sales & financial metrics like EBITDA targets, Gross Revenue, Net Margin, COGS, Selling Prices, Recovery Value, and Expense Avoidance.Utilize analytics to understand key issues, identify and implement best in class solutions.Build and maintain an understanding of products and price information.Foster growth and drive sales through internal & external relationships that increases profitability and revenue across secondary marketplaces.Develop bid packages & business cases designed to maximize revenue opportunities.Develop ideas or recommendations that may have an impact on existing or future systems/ applications, products, service or procedures and business processes.Lead collaboration across functional teams to achieve Key MetricsProactively manage inventory of multiple programs for Secondary marketplace sales to ensure inventory KPIs such as Days of Supply, Aging, and Working Capital are achieved.Work closely with Marketing, Operations, and Inventory accounting leadership to ensure product availability and correct financial booking for revenue & margin by program.Support, coordinate and lead Market & field teams; listen to field challenges/successes and implement programs/improvements accordingly.Manage shipping process by collaborating with Operations team to optimize cycle time and flow, reduce costs, and ensure on-time delivery.Investigate and resolve shipping and product discrepancy issues; make recommendations for process improvements which will reduce or eliminate discrepancies and returns.Manage returns processes across marketplaces and optimize each programs returns, as well as design, implement, and improve new program returns process as they are launched.What we’re looking for...You’ll need to have: A Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.4 years’ experience in analytics tools/systems,such as Excel, Access; SharePoint, Tableau etc.Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneouslyProject management skills. Even better if you have: Bachelor's degree in Math, Science, Business Administration, or related field.Strong competency in VZW systems/practices and sales and support channels.Strong Proficiency with Excel, Teradata SQL and VZ Data Warehouse, and SAP.Ability to write Excel Macros, VBA scripts for data processing automationStrong understanding of and experience with KPI management.Strong organizational, communication, problem solving, and data analytical skills.Competency with both strategic and tactical decision making.Highly developed critical thinking and analytical skills.Proven ability to independently organize and prioritize multiple complex assignments and projects, and successfully driving them to completion within the required timeframe.Ability to be a self-starter; proven success working in a highly dynamic, deadline-driven environment.Ability to cultivate strong collaborative working relationships and contacts within work group, across the company, and with external organizations.Demonstrated competency in communication and presentation skills; capability to develop clear messages across multiple communication platforms and tools.Demonstrated success independently leading and implementing solutions.Telecommunications business acumen.When you join Verizon... You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon. Equal Employment Opportunity We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

Name: IT Business Analyst Sr.
Description: Company Profiles  Weir has been in business since 1871 and our sustainability and success has been built on attracting, retaining, and developing exceptional people.  As a global company, employing around 15,000 people in over 70 countries, we reflect the diversity of our customers in the diversity of our people and ensure everyone is given the opportunity to flourish regardless of their gender, race, beliefs or background.  Weir is an inclusive and innovative organisation where you can be your authentic self. We continually develop our talent and diversity of thought to keep our business relevant, innovative and successful for the future.  Enabling our people to unleash their full potential is central to 'We are Weir', our vision, mission, and strategic priorities. We aim to be the most admired engineering business in our markets and we'll achieve that ambition by being the employer of choice in our markets.  We offer a wide range of career opportunities across a variety of technical and business roles in engineering, manufacturing and service locations worldwide.  Business Need / Purpose of Role  This position works with technical analysts, corporate sponsors, internal/external customers, and other team members to implement the Infor Syteline ERP Solution that supports business processes, and are aligned with business strategies. This position facilitates the optimization of business unit performance by enhancing the alignment between business process and information technology, and is integral to any decision-making involving technology.  Objectives & Measurement - Key Responsibilities Including but not limited to:Ability to lead the development of business requirements, functional designs, process maps, and user test plans.Demonstrates full knowledge of all phases of technology implementation.Responsible for recognizing potential problems, resolving conflicts, and updating IT management regarding business management progress.Understand the evolving needs of their assigned user community.Responsible for actively resolving day-to-day technology needs of the user community with a focus on analysis and broad-minded solutions.Collaborates with internal and external customers, other functional teams, development teams, and other stakeholders to identify user requirements, assess available ERP Functional technologies and recommend solution options. Advises on options, risks, costs versus benefits, and impact.Advises on options, risks, costs versus benefits, and impact.Develops and promotes good business relationships. Prioritizes work to be done and coordinates activities with internal and external customers and IT colleagues to ensure successful project implementation and meet expected service levels.Maintains full knowledge of all phases of technology implementations aligned to their user community; apprises business management of progress; keeps IT management aware of issues and potential problems, and resolves conflicts.Assists in the development of design and functional specifications to affect IT solutions as requiredParticipates in system configuration to satisfy business requirements in accordance with solution designDrives the development business processes and priorities. Evaluates alternative business process and technology solutions, and participates in making technology recommendations to enhance business operations.Leads the development of business requirements, functional designs, process maps, user test plans, and training materials associated with business process and technology solutions. Facilitates user involvement in User Acceptance Testing.Works in conjunction with senior leaders in other functional areas to ensure that program launches, scope expansions and the development of new business capabilities are supported and delivered within the business architecture.ERP experience in manufacturing, logistics environment, lot/serialization a major plus.Infor Syteline ERP experience preferred not required.SSRS experience a must. Experience in data warehouse implementation, Crystal report development, IBM Cognos BI. Analyzes and resolves end users ERP (Syteline) application issues in timely and accurate fashion, ensure the stable operation of assigned and support modules.Create and modifies MS T-SQL to facilitate data mining, problem solving, ise SSRS to support reporting.Problem Solving-Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; gathers and analyzes information skillfully; develops alternative solutions; works well in group problem solving situations; uses reason even when dealing with emotional topicsPlanning/Organizing- Prioritizes and plans work activities; uses time efficiently; plans for additional resources; sets goals and objectives; organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; develops realistic action plans.Innovation- Displays original thinking and creativity; meets challenges with resourcefulness; generates suggestions for improving work; develops innovative approaches and ideas; presents ideas and information in a manner that gets others' attention. Job Knowledge / Education and QualificationsEducation/Experience:Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university; 3-5 years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Language:Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public. Mathematical Skills:Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry. Reasoning Ability:Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Computer Skills:The incumbent should have knowledge of the following software: Syteline ERP System, Microsoft Office Suites, Lotus Notes. Certificates, Licenses, Registrations, Special Skills:IT related certifications preferred; Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment. Physical Requirements:The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close, distance, color and peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. Personal protective equipment is required in certain areas of the facility. Work Environment:The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Personal Protective Equipment is required in certain areas of the facility. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.Core Competencies  Business Acumen -Knows how businesses work; knows the competition; is aware of how strategies and tactics work in the marketplace.  Planning- Prioritizes and plans work activities; uses time efficiently; plans for additional resources; sets goals and objectives; organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; develops realistic action plans  Analytical - Synthesizes complex or diverse information; collects and researches data; uses intuition and experience to complement data.  Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations.  Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.  Customer Service - Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.  Professionalism - Approaches others in a tactful manner; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.SDL2017

Name: Analyst, Business Systems- Finance
Description: BASIC PURPOSE AND SCOPE OF POSITION Support the Product Resources Department by becoming a subject matter expert of the business unit in order to streamline the life cycle of projects, starting from inception to after implementation support.  The position, under the supervision of the Project Manager, will be involved with business departments and key stakeholders to deliver timely, well-organized and in-scope projects to further increase operational efficiencies and also implement new business strategies as they arise PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES: This position does the following in accordance with all applicable Federal, State and local laws / regulations and the Company’s policies, procedures and guidelines:  1. Defines and documents business functions and processes.  2. Consults with functional unit management and personnel to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access.  3. Acts as a liaison between departmental end-users, technical analysts, information technology analysts, consultants and others in the analysis, design, configuration, testing and maintenance of systems to ensure optimal operational performance.  4. Analyzes the feasibility of, and develops requirements for, new systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensures the system design fits the needs of the users.  5. Tracks and fully documents changes for functional and business specifications; writes detailed universally understood procedures for permanent records and for use in training.  6. Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system driver changes; assists in the preparation of proposals to develop new systems and/or operational changes.  7. Reads and interprets functional technical literature and translates in terms understandable to the end-users.  8. Plans, organizes and conducts business process reengineering/improvement projects and/or management reviews of strategic projects. (Examples are projects requiring strategic analysis of an entire process or operating area where specific issues or items to be corrected, examined or recommended have not been identified. Recommended solutions should be developed in consultation with impacted internal and external stakeholders, but should remain objective and independent of the specific stakeholders.)  9. Researches and prepares statistical reports using data from SAP and other internal systems. Consolidates information into cohesive and understandable correspondence or other written form for use in management decision-making.  10. Conducts change impact analysis to assess the potential implications of changes and documents business rules, functions and requirements.  11. Participates in user acceptance testing and testing of new system functionality.  12. Collaborates with the training department for technical assistance in training, mentoring, and coaching professional and technical staff.  13. Collaborates with the training department to develop training curriculum and conducts formal training sessions covering assigned systems module as needed.  14. Directs or participates in studies of new and existing programs and special projects to determine feasibility, resolve problems including organizational, procedural, technical and fiscal research and analysis; develops policy and procedures to improve efficiency and cost-effectiveness; develops information system documentation to support efficient operations; prepares reports and written findings and recommendations; and monitors changes. SPECIAL PROJECTS As assigned MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSEDUCATION, CERTIFICATIONS, AND TRAINING: 1. Bachelor’s Degree required in Business, Engineering, or Computer science at an accredited University.  2. 4+ years of SAP experience.  3. 4+ years of financial services.  4. Experience with a manufacturing or distribution company is a plus.SKILLS AND BACKGROUND: 1. Excellent written and oral communication skills with ability to convey technical concepts to a non-technical audience.  2. Microsoft office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).  3. Microsoft Visio.  4. Ability to rapidly adjust to changing priorities and assignments. LANGUAGE REQUIREMENTS: Ability to communicate in English EQUIPMENT OPERATION (% of time, description, nature of service):  None PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Typical office requirements. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: DISCLAIMER:  The information provided in the description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by incumbents within the classification. This description is not intended to be a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, qualifications and working conditions required of employees assigned to this job/classification. This job is intended to include the current essential functions of the job. Management reserves the right to add or modify the duties and responsibilities and to designate other functions as essential at any time.

Name: SAP FI AR Business Systems Analyst
Description: SAP FI AR Business Systems Analyst  12 months+ contract  Location: Irving, Texas  IMMEDIATE new job opening for an SAP FI AR BSA focused in AR. This individual will join our global client's team at their North American headquarters in Irving, Texas. This is a great opportunity to join a fantastic company that is number one in its industry and become part of a dynamic IT team that is integral to the that company's operations and success. This role will be 70-80% functional and 30-20% technical. This individual will work with the business to solve SAP system processing problems and create new configuration to solve business problems. This role will require knowledge of AR, cash application (high radius) and credit management (get paid), specifically using these 3rd party tools.  This is primary an SAP support role but there will be some development that will consist of creating templates and assisting with tests as well as tweaking existing functionality as needed. Additionally, this individual will assist with migrations. Primary responsibilities will include providing user support, gathering user requirements, and configuring the system for new functionality.  RESPONSIBILITIES  o Provides 2nd and 3rd level SAP support to end users  o Works with developers to create and test new system functionality  o Partners with business users to coordinate application and testing of system enhancements  o Creates technical specifications for developers  o Installs and configures applications  o Acts as a liaison with vendors and consultants to address support activities  o Develops documentation to improve the use and availability of applications  o Provides expert level support and maintenance of core software functionality and technology components  o Works cross-functionally to solve problems and implement changes  o Up to 10% travel may be required  REQUIREMENTS  o 7+ years of functional SAP BSA  o FI and AR senior level experience  o Experience working with cash applications and credit management  o Experience tweaking existing functionality  o Experience with migrations  o Knowledge of AR, contracts, pricing, and invoicing  o Experience with project System, AR and Fixed Assets is a Plus!  o Expertise in both business and configuration knowledge for functional areas  o Requires project management skills; designs solutions for internal/external clients  o Considered a subject matter expert resource for others  o Proven experience in troubleshooting, testing and quality assurance techniques  o Proficient in the development of documentation to support functional specifications, data flows, etc.  o Bachelor's degree in Information MIS, Information Technology, Engineering, or another related field  *Must be a U.S. Citizen, Green Card Holder, or hold other status that allows you to be employed in the United States on a W2 basis without having to be sponsored by your employer.  **To view all of our open positions, please visit: http://www.alleareconsulting.com/job-openings.

Name: JPC - 1323 - Business Functional Analyst - II
Description: Location: Folsom, California  About this Position:  Overview  PeopleSoft Financials Tester will provide leadership and technical guidance to test teams and has accountability across multiple functions as it pertains to the newly created Verizon Network Quick Bid tool. Creates test deliverables (for example, strategies, plans and test cases) and performs hands-on testing for internally developed or external purchased products. Types of testing may include system, integration, regression and end-to-end testing. Testing Specialists deploy or execute job streams for creating test beds as appropriate, design test scenarios, author test scripts, execute tests and track defects to certify that applications meet the approved system requirements. Testing Specialists collaborate with other IT staff as appropriate, to review and understand system requirements and design, review test strategy and design, identify resolution for defects identified during testing, and also to analyze and make specific recommendations on usability/functionality improvements that can be integrated into business processes. Name: SAP QTC Business Analyst
Description: SAP QTC Business Analyst  Contract-to-Hire  Location: Irving, Texas  We have an immediate job opening for an SAP Quote to Cash (QTC) Business Analyst. This is an exciting opportunity to work on-site at our client's North American HQs in Irving, Texas. They are the leader in their industry and this will be a chance to become part of a huge initiative that is integral to their operations and success. This individual will support the SAP project across multiple business lines in North America working hand-in-hand with IT, SAP Project Team, Global Process Owners, and North American businesses conducting business process analysis and proposing process redesign. This role will work with the rest of the Quote to Cash work stream to both understand the existing as well as design and implement new business functionality, business requirements, and models into SAP processes from beginning to end within the Quote to Cash SD modules. This position will focus on technical and functional business units redesigning processes for driven business applications.  RESPONSIBILITIES  o Interacts with non-information technology related business areas to identify requirements, scope, support implementation of solutions.  o Provides end-to-end coverage for the process teams.  o Creates design of reports, forms, interfaces, and conversion.  o Facilitates system understanding and assist the training team in identifying requirements and validating final materials.  o Develops business scenarios and test scripts as well as lead efforts to conduct testing.  o Develops and maintains user documentation.  o Drives continuous improvements with use of technology solutions by demonstrating value add propositions.  o Tests, modifies and documents the system configuration.  o Provides post implementation support.  o Works in parallel with the training and communication team to ensure all aspects of change is handled.  REQUIREMENTS  o 4+ years of SAP business analysis experience specifically related to Quote to Cash (QTC)  o Proven experience working in an enterprise size IT environment.  o Must have the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced deadline intensive environment.  o A broad understanding of business process, including front office and back office operations.  o Skilled with redesigning processes for technology driven business applications.  o Experience working in IT and cross-functional project teams.  o Knowledge of prevalent IT methodologies, project management methodologies, management practices, architectures, system development lifecycles and best practices.  o Must have strong technical writing skills & excellent communication and organization skills, verbally and in writing.  o Ability to transform and support advanced business functions and requirements into design.  o Strong business user who is experienced partnering with IT.  o Ability to flourish in an ambiguous working environment.  o Minimally requires education and/or experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree.  **To view all of our job openings, please visit: http://www.alleareconsulting.com/job-openings

Name: Business Analyst 3 Core
Description: Business Analyst 3 Core I. DESCRIPTION OF SERVICESThe Department of Information Resources (DIR) requires the services of one or more Business Analysts, hereafter referred to as Worker(s), who meets the general qualifications of ITSAC Business Analyst 3 Category, Core Technology Type and the specifications outlined in this document for the Texas Comptroller of Public Accounts (CPA).   All work products resulting from the project shall be considered “works made for hire” and are the property of the CPA. CPA may include pre-selection requirements that potential Vendors (and their Workers) submit to and satisfy criminal background checks as authorized by the Texas law. CPA will pay no fees for interviews or discussions, which occur during the process of selecting a Worker(s).  Worker will performs highly advanced analysis and programing tasks such as:• Work with programmers and business analysts to develop Business Application Overview for the Business Information Model (BIM) sections of the Integrated Tax System (ITS).• Develop detailed documentation for each section of the Business Information Model (BIM) sections of the Integrated Tax System (ITS).• Work with other IT sections to collect and customize application-specific instructional material for the development of new hires• Assist with the development of application-specific training materials for the development of new hires A senior level Business Analyst must have a strong background in the Texas Comptroller’s Integrated Tax System with experience with Natural Programming, TSO, DB2 and SQL in a zOS environment, Endevor, PAC, and Infopac. Must be able to quickly develop expertise in complex systems, be quality conscious and be dedicated to delivering quality products on time and on budget. Worker must cross-train and transfer knowledge to and from current CPA staff. Onsite Requirement: Worker will be required to work onsite with the team. Working remotely will be limited and must be pre-approved by the Project Manager/Direct Supervisor WORKER SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS  • Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills • Must be able to work independently• Must be able to work in a diverse team environment• Must possess problem-solving skills and ability to multi-task• Must be able to retain knowledge of environment and systems once given instruction• Knowledge of project management and software development methodologies• Must be able to work around projects and deadlines with readiness to put in extra efforts when necessary• Perform related work as assignedMinimum Requirements: Years Skills/Experience 8 Extensive experience with gathering, creating, and maintaining documentation of business requirements and information system processes 8 Detailed knowledge of all processes of the Texas Comptroller’s Integrated Tax System from Tax Payer Setup through Return Processing, Collections, Allocations and Reporting 3 Experience with software development processes  3 Experience working with application programmers 3 Familiar with mainframe application programming tools such as Natural, JCL, TSO, QMF, SQL, and DB2. 3 Experience in unit and system integration testing of developed application 3 Experience developing training material for programmers and business users. 3 Extensive experience with highly complex security application requirementsPreferences: Years Skills/Experience 8 Proficient with the Microsoft Office products, including Microsoft Project, Word, Visio, Excel and PowerPoint 3 Assist with the development of Training Materials III. TERM OF SERVICEWork Order Term: 3 – 3.5 Months February 15, 2016 thru May 15, 2016. 519 hours per worker.  Estimated hours for FY16: 1300. This assignment may be extended based on project need and funding. IV. WORK HOURS AND LOCATIONA. Services shall be provided during normal business hours unless otherwise coordinated through the CPA. Normal business hours are Monday through Friday from 8:00AM to 5:00PM, excluding State holidays when the agency is closed. *Candidate may have to work evenings or weekends in order to meet business needs and or deadlines.B. The primary work location(s) will be at 111 E. 17th Street, Austin, Texas 78774. Any and all travel, per diem, parking, and/or living expenses shall be at the Worker’s and/or Vendor’s expense.C. CPA will provide pre-approved, written authorization for travel for any services to be performed away from the primary work location(s). Pre-approved travel expenses are limited to the rates and comply with the rules prescribed by the State of Texas for travel by its classified employees, including any requirement for original receipts. D. The Worker(s) may be required to work outside the normal business hours on weekends, evenings and holidays, as requested. Payment for work over 40 hours will be at the hourly rate quoted and must be coordinated and pre-approved through CPA.  ESPONSE DEADLINE for consideration and should be received by February 2, 2016 @ 5:00 PM (CT).

Name: Training and Quality Analyst
Description: Location: AA Headquarters 1 (DFW-HDQ1) Additional Locations: NoneRequisition ID: 23396 OverviewJoin us for a career with endless possibilities.Looking for a job where a passion for innovation, a culture of teamwork, and opportunities for growth are valued and rewarded? You’ve come to the right place.You don’t have to be an airline aficionado to join American Airlines. It takes more than cool planes to keep us ahead of the curve, and thanks to our team of behind the scenes professionals, we do just that. As the largest airline in the world, American Airlines is in the business of serving the global travel needs of our customers. At the core of the Company is our commitment to each customer and each employee. We are dedicated to developing and delivering what our customers value and are willing to pay for. Customer-centric planning, innovative marketing, and an exceptional customer experience are supported by a cadre of talented people.What does it take to join us? We’re glad you asked! We expect exceptional skills in your discipline and a dedication to being the best as we relentlessly pursue our goal of being not just the largest airline in the world, but also the best airline in the world.Fortunately, we’re building on almost a century of innovation and firsts in our industry – and we plan to continue that tradition of excellence.About The JobThe Cargo Customer Experience team is passionate about transforming and improving the communication and service to our customers to surpass their expectations and increase their satisfaction. As such we are looking for the right individual to fill a Quality and Training analyst role that will work with and lead our 4 cargo contact call center locations to deliver legendary customer experience. This position will maintain and update training materials and focus on the day to day quality and front line agent processes at our contact centers. The position will also potentially lead the Introduction of a new booking channel (Chat) and a new email management tool in multiple locations. The position will play a key supporting role in the design and introduction of our future Cargo end to end system. We are looking for someone who can set a high standard in quality and training for our contact center support group.Specifically, you’ll do the following:Designing, building and managing the quality assurance and training function to support the Contact Center vendor performance, covering all 4 locations and all specialty desks.Measuring, evaluating and improving customer interactions and customer care center operational performance through call, email, speech and text analytics and chat monitoring.Identifying trends within the interactions; providing feedback to internal/external leadership.Overseeing the training at the vendor locations to ensure training manual is updated and reviewed for accuracy on a regular basis.Creating and maintaining a training certification program for our vendor location to ensure delivery of material is meeting department expectations.Participating in the Cargo Contact Center agents’ recruitment for key positions.Providing strategic guidance and leadership to the Cargo Contact Center operations.Serving as a thought leader within the Cargo Contact Center leadership Team.Driving organizational direction associated with increasing operational efficiency, customer satisfaction, revenue growth and enhancing the overall customer experience.Taking initiative to prevent and solve issues and risks to the business, is committed and holds others accountable, makes sound decisions and manages risks to business. Serving as a backup for the Customer Service Manager.QualificationsRequired QualificationsBachelor’s degree in relevant field or equivalent experience/trainingCargo Process and Procedure knowledgePreferred Qualifications4 year degree or equivalent work experience in the management of contact center quality and training3+ years of demonstrated competency in contact center leadership roles managing at least one of the following areas (Quality Assurance, Training, Call Center Technology Services, or Operations), or comparable Customer Service experience2+ years of experience working closely with cross-departmental teams including leadership​Hard-working, team-oriented, and dedicated with at least two years related experience in a customer promotion roleDemonstrated success in championing initiativesAbility to quickly learn, understand, troubleshoot, and collaborate with other stakeholders to solve issues of a technical nature including electronic messaging, web technologies, online interfaces, etc.A forward-thinking self-starter who easily transitions between independent and collaborative team work environments Talent to effectively manage and complete multiple projects and priorities on schedule with a strong attention to detailMust be able to maintain a high performance level and deliver strong results while still managing to have funAbility to travel up to 60-80% of the time on potentially short notice, Domestic and InternationalWork in locations across the globe and work variable shiftsAdditional Locations: NoneRequisition ID: 23396

Name: Systems Analyst Principal
Description: Job Summary The Systems Analyst Principal conducts business process analyses, needs assessments, and preliminary cost/benefits analyses in an effort to align information technology solutions with business initiatives. Principal Accountabilities Establishes complex operational databases, software configuration control and systems interfaces for computer system(s) assigned. Prepares system for operational use and oversees operational tests. Formulates and defines system scope and objectives through research and fact-finding. Prepares detailed specifications from which programs will be written. Coordinates the analysis and design of automated solutions to business problems. Participates in test process for new development, report modification, functionality enhancement and system upgrades. Assists user community

Name: Program Management Analyst
Description: Job Description:Line of Business Description: The Life & Specialty Servicing (L&SS) area is a part of Consumer Operations that focuses on specialized processes such as military customer benefits, bankruptcies and anti-money laundering, as well as key support functions such as customer correspondence and invoice processing. L&SS is embarking on a three year plan to transform the operations by modernizing customer interactions and streamlining and automating processes.  The L&SS Program Office Analyst will have responsibility for supporting numerous projects will be in progress simultaneously related to the transformation plan as well as other projects for regulatory sustainment. Role will assist the lead role and will be engaged in various actions for projects including tracking and reporting on status, issues, risks, benefits, and change controls. The ability to understand the scope and impacts broadly will be important to ensuring the right level of reporting and escalation is occurring.  Enterprise Role Overview:  Contributes to programs/projects specific to corporate change initiatives that have significant impact on how the company does business, provides a product or service, or executes a function. Assesses the adoption risk associated with the change effort. Identifies, develops and executes strategies and supporting tactics to engage and influence all stakeholders to make needed behavioral changes. Partners with the business to develop and transition plans, including ongoing success measures, to sustain the change. Responsible for tracking project milestones while developing, maintaining and reporting on an overall integrated delivery plan. Experience with BAC Change and Project Management tools and processes. Responsible for Clarity and PCM updates and project documents. Effectively communicates with managers, peers and business partners on deliverables, timelines and support needed from them. Strong project management skills, including the ability to prioritize work and meet deadlines. Typically 1-3 plus years of project or program management support experience. Required Skills:Experience with project management and implementationPrior engagement with portfolio or program management functionsAbility to understand multiple projects, scope, issues, etc and distill information into status, issues and risks.Excellent written and verbal communication skills,Ability to work with multiple change managers, technology partners, and other key project staffDesired Skills:Experience with AgileConsumer operations knowledgeUnderstanding of project financialsShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Business Development Analyst Principal
Description: Description:The Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control Strategy & Business Development organization is seeking a Business Development Analyst Principal to support the Integrated Air & Missile Defense Line of Business.  Areas of responsibility include all U.S. Armed Forces Air and Missile Defense weapons and systems developed or fielded by MFC. Responsible to work side-by side with Program Management and engineering team members to translate customer needs (current and anticipated) into discriminating technical and business solutions for Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control product lines.  This role is responsible for assessing customer strategic capability gap requirements and advocating advanced program technology solutions, planning, business opportunity identification and validation, capture plan development and execution, and customer interaction management. Additionally, this role is responsible for developing and synchronizing the long range strategic plans for the Integrated Air and Missile Defense Line of Business with the Army Cross Functional Team, the Missile Defense Agency, OSD, the Joint Staff, and Combatant Commands. This role also focuses on new business captures in defense sciences and technology, specifically focusing on Defense Department and Services Research and Development Activities; Science and Technology Centers, DARPA and other advanced technology activities of the US. Government.  Position location is flexible Basic Qualifications: Bachelors Degree  Minimum 15 years experience in U.S. military, U.S. Government, or technology based industry.  Subject matter expert on U.S. Armed Forces fielded Air and Missile Defense (AMD) Programs with specific area of expertise in PATRIOT, THAAD, and IAMD.  Possess experience and a current working knowledge of DoD Acquisition process and DoD Directive 5000.1, the Joint Capability Integration and Development System (JCIDS), and Army Air and Missile Defense Combat Developments process.  Possess experience with the U.S. Army and MDA Program Objective Memorandums (POMs), acquisition and procurement business processes, and U.S. Armed Forces Service cultures to align strategic objectives and capture strategies.  Must possess strong organizational and interpersonal skills to  communicate effectively verbally and in writing, with all levels of  management, engineers, Department of Defense officials and Functional employees.  Ability to obtain US Government Top Secret clearance.  Ability to travel domestically and internationally as needed Desired Skills: Advanced degree in an engineering or science discipline  Superior knowledge of U.S. Armed Forces AMD operational strategy, tactical employment and modernization strategy.  Knowledgeable of U.S. Army and MDA Program Objective Memorandum (POM) build, acquisition and procurement business processes and U.S. Armed Forces Service cultures.  Demonstrated outstanding leadership skills and proven success leading high-performing organizations.  Superior understanding of the Department of Defense and U.S. Army budgeting and acquisition processes.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills necessary to clearly articulate strategies at multiple levels of business and government.  Knowledgeable of linkage and coordination between U.S. Army Fires Center of Excellence and U.S. Army Air Defense Center Combat Development processes; Program Executive Office, Missiles and Space and Lower Tier Program Office operations; HQDA Air and Missile Defense Program operations in the Pentagon.  Effective Team Player Outstanding organizational ability and  demonstrated excellence motivating a diverse set of individuals in pursuit of common objectives.  Recent experience working with the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) or similar government S&T (Science & Technology) agencies.  Previous military experience.  Understanding of Integrated Air and Missile Defense weapons systems, sensors and military advanced technologies. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  Join us at Lockheed Martin, where were engineering a better tomorrow. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. U.S. Bancorp is the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States.Elavon is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who enjoys solving business problems. He/she will interact with business stakeholders and technology teams to define requirements, mine data, and provide insights and business recommendations. This role will be measured by timeliness, frequency, and accuracy of insights delivery and their impacts on Elavon business stakeholders assigned. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: At Exeter Finance, we are committed to helping customers find the right financing for their next vehicle purchase. By building strong relationships with our customers and network of dealer partners we are able to give options that make sense, getting customers behind the wheel of their car.  Every team member is integral to our success. Whether you’re at a servicing center helping customers with their loans, in the field building relationships with dealers, or supporting the company from its corporate offices, you'll enjoy a nurturing, invigorating and positive work environment.  Our vision is to be a premier finance company and lender of choice known for its People, Performance and Service.Job SummaryThe Business Systems Analyst is responsible for understanding, analyzing and generating business and functional requirements documents and consequently assisting with delivering of the requirements to production for larger sized corporate initiatives.Essential FunctionsSupport large-level projects and serve as an SME on medium-level projects by reviewing business cases and performing in-depth analysis to translating into detailed business and functional requirements; as well as facilitate discussions and review with the teams to obtain sign-off on all requirements from the project sponsor(s) and technical lead(s).Work with the development team to validate the system requirements against the requirements.Facilitate the UAT process by performing smoke screen testing when coding is complete, creating test cases with traceability between the requirements, conducting the testing, and working with the business to receive the approval.Develop and maintain a detailed understanding of business processes and applications and customer needs. Understands technology solutions and communicates them to the business in a non-technical manner.Communicate requirements to development and quality assurance staff and serves as the point of contact for business, development, and QA during the project lifecycle.Build and maintain relationships with key business, IT stakeholders, team members, vendors, and other departments involved in the projects, and manages expectations. Promotes a constructive, positive team environment and maintains a spirit of openness, information sharing, inquisitiveness, problem-solving, and support for our common goals.Work with the appropriate production support team members to troubleshoot issues and/or operational questions.Perform post production review to ensure successful implementation and work with production support team members to research any issues.Other duties as assigned.Education and ExperienceBachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required.Four (4) or more years of prior experience as a Business Analyst.Business Analyst certification a bonus.Experience in the auto or finance industry preferred.Basic SQL skills required.Advanced SQL skills preferred.Excellent facilitation, collaboration, communication and presentation skills.Strong analytical skills.Proficient with standard business analysis, business process definition and project management concepts and tools.Skill in organizing resources and establishing priorities.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Ability to learn and support new systems and applications. Exeter Finance LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Budget Analyst I
Description: Budget Analyst I Pay Range From 47,826 Pay Range To 62,174 Closing Date 12/7/18Apply NowRequisition Number:50976Department:Performance and Budget OfficeFull-Time/Part-Time:Full-TimeRegular/Temporary:RegularThe City of Fort Worth’s vision is to be the most livable and best managed city in the country. With Fort Worth being the 15th largest city in the United States, Fort Worth offers a wide variety of services to residents ranging from public safety to drinking water to world-class recreational amenities. We are highly motivated, collaborative, innovative and one of the fastest growing “big cities” with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.  The Performance and Budget Department is seeking an exceptionally talented, inquisitive, and self-motivated individual with strong analytical skills and a passion for continual learning for the position of Budget Analyst I.  In this fast paced role you will provide detailed analysis and operational guidance to departments regarding the operational and capital budget processes of the City. Additionally, you will coordinate departmental budgeting, financial, personnel activities and special projects while identifying opportunities to drive efficiency within the department. This role demands a strong sense of urgency, accuracy and the knack to work independently on assignments while demonstrating sound judgment, while being a great team player. You will also work frequently with teams on various projects with firm deadlines. Demonstrated ability to respond effectively and efficiently while remaining flexible, responsible and extremely adaptable is essential. A good sense of humor is important, as is being proactive and the ability to simplify.  Key to the position is the ability to be inquisitive, be at the forefront of new processes/initiatives, conduct strong and thorough research and analysis, enjoy continual learning, and meet deadlines. The position requires the capacity to work successfully in a team environment, build effective working relationships inside and outside of the departments and maintain a comprehensive awareness of the organization. This job requires a fearlessness in learning and mastering new technical skills. Responsibilities include:Provide accurate, high quality, and insightful analysisLearn & administer budgetary and administrative processesCommunicate budgetary and administrative processes clearly and conciselyTimely execution of assigned tasks, from review of legislative materials to entry of budgetary changes to completion of published materialsAssist departments through the operational and capital budgetary processesLearn and understand the operations of assigned departmentsDevelop clear and concise reports and executive summaries for senior managementQUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with major course work in Public Administration, Finance, Business Administration, or related and no previous experience required. The ideal candidate must have: Advanced Excel, PowerPoint and Microsoft Word skills  Strong, written, verbal and interpersonal skills  Desire and aptitude for learning new concepts and job-specific technical skills  Experience with team collaboration tools such as Basecamp, Freedcamp, Slack, Trello, etc.  Demonstrated ability to prioritize and handle multiple assignments in a fast paced environment  Demonstrated creative problem-solving skills  Ability to understand and apply accounting concepts

Name: Risk Analyst

Name: Items Analyst Associate
Description: Description:The Items Analyst (IA) will work with his or her Technical Lead providing Total Asset Visibility (TAV) for F-22 spares and repair assets. The IA will coordinate the day-to-day efforts in support of F-22 program requirements. Each IA will acquire the knowledge to fully utilize the F-22 program and company legacy systems to accomplish TAV in support of company and customer operational requirements. In doing so, the IA will coordinate with the Technical Lead the actions to direct, redistribute, re-order and coordinate asset movement within the pool of program assets that will best support immediate and forecasted needs. In fulfilling this responsibility, the IA is specifically responsible for development of provisioning data, cataloging, requirements determination, and the associated ordering of initial and replenishment spares. The IA will be responsible for directing and coordinating asset movement to satisfy grounding aircraft requirements not able to be filled from existing stock. The IA will work with the engineering design authority and Technical Lead to understand change activity and the impact engineering changes have on the hardware he/she manages. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter and have demonstrated leadership and good organizational skills.  Must be a US Citizen; this position requires a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Basic Qualifications: Pursuing a bachelor's degree from an accredited college in Supply Chain Management, logistics, operations management, or another business related degree. Desired Skills: Candidate must have demonstrated initiative, good organizational skills and knowledge of Microsoft Office Tools. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  Join us at Lockheed Martin, where were engineering a better tomorrow. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: 4 yr and up College

Name: Associate-Incident Management Analyst
Description: Description:Fort Worth - TX, TX13601F, 13601 North Freeway, 76177  Leticia Mitchell  20180627-4222 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of ‘own your tomorrow’ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.  As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. Our Opportunity: Become part of our Incident Management team which is responsible for end to end Incident and Crisis management. In this role you will work in a team responsible for facilitation of service restoration, through incident ticket quality control and assignment of follow-up actions via the problem management tool and processes. You will get to work in cross organizational efforts to ensure we not only achieve quick restoration of services for our clients, but also identify and document; process, technical, and procedural improvement opportunities, throughout the lifecycle of our high priority incidents. What you’ll do: The Incident Management Analyst ensures all impacting incidents are managed effectively and professionally, resulting in the restoration of normal service quickly, efficiently and with minimal impact to our internal and external customers. Incident Management includes extensive interaction with Operations, System Support, internal customers, and management including senior or executive management positions. The Incident Analyst is responsible for ensuring that the Incident Management process is followed for every incident. Reporting for incidents generated by all technology teams will be required. What you have:Distribution of clear and concise communications, summarizing incidents and the business/customer experience to a wide group of technical and non-technical audiences.Provide detailed notes of highly visible production issues (P1 level tickets) on a timely basis to the production support staff and executive management (executive summaries).Ensure incident data is accurately captured and documented in the incident recording tools.Priming appropriate materials and follow ups to hand-off to the Root Cause Analysis phase in the Problem Management process.Working as part of a global Team, providing 24 x 7 production support coverage on a rotating basis with primary hours being Monday-Friday standard business hours. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work.What you’ll get:Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits packageFinancial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discountsWork/Life Balance: Sabbatical, Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee Matching Gifts ProgramEveryday Wellness: Health and Lifestyle Wellness Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Food Choices, Wellness ChampionsInclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnershipsNot just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life Learn more about Life@Schwab. Name: Analyst/Senior Analyst, Co-Brand Performance
Description: Location: AA Headquarters 2 (DFW-HDQ2)  Additional Locations: None  Requisition ID: 22954OverviewJoin us for a career with endless possibilities. Looking for a job where a passion for innovation, a culture of teamwork, and opportunities for growth are valued and rewarded? You’ve come to the right place.  You don’t have to be an airline aficionado to join American Airlines. It takes more than cool planes to keep us ahead of the curve, and thanks to our team of behind the scenes professionals, we do just that. As the largest airline in the world, American Airlines is in the business of serving the global travel needs of our customers. At the core of the Company is our commitment to each customer and each employee. We are dedicated to developing and delivering what our customers value and are willing to pay for. Customer-centric planning, innovative marketing, and an exceptional customer experience are supported by a cadre of talented people.  What does it take to join us? We’re glad you asked! We expect exceptional skills in your discipline and a dedication to being the best as we relentlessly pursue our goal of being not just the largest airline in the world, but also the best airline in the world.  Fortunately, we’re building on almost a century of innovation and firsts in our industry – and we plan to continue that tradition of excellence. About The Job ​This job is a member of the Co-Brand Performance within the Marketing Division. The Co-Brand Partnerships team seeks to provide industry leading co-branded credit cards that provide compelling value to our customers, American Airlines and other stakeholders. Co-Brand Partnerships has millions of card members, two very significant relationships with card issuers (Citi and Barclays US), a direct relationship with Mastercard, and dozens of international co-brand relationships around the globe. The group generates billions in revenue through the ongoing evaluation of embedded card benefits, better targeting and placement of offers and promotions to new and existing card members, and improvements to the operational and financial structure of our relationships with partners.  The Analyst Co-Brand Performance will be part of a team tasked with evaluating the financial performance of AA’s co-brand portfolio at both the macro and micro level. The position reports to the Manager, Co-Brand Performance. Specifically, you'll do the following: Collaborate in the development of in-depth standardized reporting and forecasting across AA’s two domestic issuers to evaluate and predict portfolio performance, both at the issuer level and on a consolidated basisAssist co-brand teams throughout the organization in evaluating the performance of discrete initiatives, including improvements to acquisition and existing card member offers and channels, and evaluating the relative performance of numerous other promotions and eventsSupport co-brand teams in tracking performance against established long-term strategic goalsAssist with co-brand’s annual budgeting process including coordination with other Loyalty groups and Finance in establishing the overall department’s annual budgetContribute to Customer Loyalty & Insights’ monthly performance review with VP Customer Loyalty & Insights and SVP Marketing, Loyalty & SalesQualificationsRequired QualificationsBS/BA or advanced degree with significant coursework or experience in a quantitative discipline (economics, mathematics, engineering, finance, etc.)Advanced skills with MS OfficeStrong strategic thinking and analytical skills with proven ability to pro-actively conduct complex analyses that identify and distill relevant information quickly and accuratelyAbility to travelPreferred Qualifications​MBA preferredExperience with SQL, SAS, PowerPivot and creating reports in Tableau preferredPrior experience in AA’s Commercial and/or Finance organizations preferredDemonstrated ability to effectively collaborate with and influence internal and external partnersAbility to communicate both verbally and in writing in a clear, thorough, and concise manner to all levels of AA and external partners, including Senior ExecutivesAbility to take ownership, prioritize tasks, work well with minimal supervision, and manage projects simultaneously from conception through completionAirline budgeting and forecasting experienceData analytics, reporting, financial modeling and forecasting for sales projections, behavioral trending and market analysisAdditional Locations: None  Requisition ID: 22954 Nearest Major Market: Fort Worth Nearest Secondary Market: Dallas Job Segment: Branding, Brand Manager, Engineer, Senior Brand Manager, Developer, Marketing, Engineering, Technology22954

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Business Process Analyst When was the last time you had the opportunity to inspire the creativity locked up within your co-workers? Do you have a vision to see how different technologies can be used to improve the experience of those working around you? Are you fascinated with business process and passionate about technology?  Polk Mechanical Company is expanding their IT department to include a data-driven, business-minded analyst to assist in the standardization and optimization of our core business processes. We are looking for a highly-technical software analyst to work with the end users to understand their current processes and make suggestions on how different features, functions and workflows can improve their workday. Organization Structure and Interfaces: Reports to: IT Director  Primary Interfaces: Polk employees at all levels from staffers through the Executive Team Environment: Multi-location: jobsite and office based business model  Pace: constant changing targets and quick turnaround is essential due to shifting priorities, changing client needs and project specifications  Demographic diversity: workforce enjoys a wide range of diversification associated with ethnicity, culture, position qualifications, socio-economic background, geographical differences, white & blue collar, etc. Success Factors:Key functional experience needs to include the basics of: MS-SQL Server and Data Analysis, Business and Technical requirement analysis, Project management skills, Overseeing software implementation and testing, Business process modeling and mapping, Data modelingAbility to communicate with users and create solutions: Collaborate with teams to develop, standardize, and maintain new or improved processes based on findings and analysis.Holistic view and understanding of operations: Understanding the relationships of each portion of our business, and creating solutions based on multi source analysis, business process modeling and mapping.Ability to set and maintain realistic schedules and deadlines: Multitasking and working on multiple projects at once, while communicating approach and schedule to leadership. If you re up to the challenge of organizing a great group of can-do personalities and showing them how standardization will improve their overall quality of work, send us a copy of your resume along with a writeup of your most creative business process improvement. In a tech-starved industry, you need to be creative in how you apply technology to processes, clear and concise in your presentation, and ready to face objection.

Name: Internal Business Process Analyst
Description: McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. It starts with the chain of events you initiate when you work with McKesson Pharmaceutical - a chain that extends across the country and results in millions of people getting more from their healthcare. As the leader in pharmaceutical distribution and supply chain management, McKesson Pharmaceutical delivers vital branded and generic pharmaceuticals, as well as over-the-counter products, to more than 40,000 customers in three primary segments: retail chains, independent retail pharmacies and institutional providers such as hospitals, health systems, integrated delivery networks and long-term care providers.We base our distribution excellence on electronic order processing, asset management tools, a commitment to Six Sigma methodology, order accuracy and supply chain safety. We work with our customers on solutions - including supply management technology, world-class marketing programs, managed care and repackaging products and services - that help them meet their business and quality goals. Our entire team works to ensure patients receive their medications efficiently and begin the process of healing.As the nation’s largest pharmaceutical distributor, US Pharmaceutical is committed to driving total pharmacy health for customers and ensuring that customers receive the right drug at the right time, every time. This commitment is underpinned by McKesson’s focus on providing customers with the industry’s highest product availability, intelligent ordering capabilities and unmatched service accuracy.Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career.Current NeedTo manage and successfully drive process improvement in McKesson Corporation. This person will be a critical player in McKesson's ever changing and growing business to deliver the right service, to the right customers, at the right price.Provide consultative services to our senior executives and business unit managers including process evaluation, business case development, and strategic project identification.Manage projects throughout various areas of the business to deliver incremental revenue, cost/expense reductions, and working capital optimization.To be a change agent driving cultural change focused on the success of our business and its customers. Position DescriptionSupports the identification and evaluation of the organization's risk areas to identify process automation and improvement opportunities.Leads teams through meetings, interviews, process mapping, document reviews, composing reports and project plans, completing Six Sigma projects and coaching functional areas to meet Business Process and McKesson financial metrics.Monitors and communicates the results of process improvement projects/ initiatives to management and team leaders.Develops and delivers comprehensive requirements documents and standard operating proceduresMinimum Requirements0-2 years business experience.Critical Skills3 years relevant experience, optimally in project management or process improvementFinancial acumen - ability to calculate cost benefit analysis, Return on Investment, and identify financial savingsExposure to application and virtual environment-based automation tools such as Winshuttle and/or Automation AnywhereData analysis, interpretation, and the evaluation of reportsExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsPC skills: Microsoft Office (including Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Visio)Extensive Business Process capture and mapping experienceSelf-motivated, organized and capable of handling multiple responsibilities and projects to successful completion Lean Six Sigma experience, black or green beltAdditional Knowledge & SkillsExceptional business acumen/aptitudeStrong problem solving, analytical and decision-making skillsStrong project management skillsSix Sigma tools and methodologies including DMAIC, Lean, Kaizen, Workout, and DFSSEducation4-year degree in related field or equivalent experiencePhysical RequirementsGeneral Office DemandsBenefits & Company StatementMcKesson believes superior performance – individual and team – that helps us drive innovations and solutions to promote better health should be recognized and rewarded. We provide a competitive compensation program to attract, retain and motivate a high-performance workforce, and it’s flexible enough to meet the different needs of our diverse employee population.We are in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payers, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting.But we can’t do it without you. Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—whatever your title, whatever your role, you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company—and of healthcare. At McKesson, you’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.McKesson is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer – minorities/females/veterans/persons with disabilities.Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history.Agency StatementNo agencies please.
