Name: Operations Analyst Principle
Description: Description:--Lockheed Martin Advanced Development Program--  This position is with our Advanced Development Program (ADP), known as the historic Skunk Works, in Ft Worth, Texas. We are looking for world-class talent for this position to join the 75 year tradition of creating advanced aircraft. The primary area of responsibility for this position will be as the Operations Analysis Virtual Simulation Execution Technical Lead/Integrator. This position will be responsible for overseeing the execution of all Human-In-The-Loop(HITL) Simulation events that LM Aero OA supports; including, at the Partner Manned Tactical Simulator (PMTS), Integrated Warfare Development Center (IWDC), Virtual Warfare Center (VWC), LM Lighthouse, Multi-Domain Analysis Center (MDAC), etc. Responsibilities include:Managing the Virtual Simulation Event schedules, contracting requirements, execution goals, and communicating technical and program status to leadership & customersEnsuring execution successCoordination with the Operations Analysis Modeling & Simulation Integrator and Customers to identify & track capital and IT requirementsEnsure personnel/hardware/software requirements provided and fulfilledCreation of Strategic Vision across OA Virtual Simulation Venues and Implementation plan for visionIdentification of overlaps, synergies, and/or dependencies across venues/events In addition, the selected candidate will maintain a high level of expertise on LM Aero Product Lines (F-35, F-22, F-16, NGAD Concepts, and ADP programs). This includes all aspects of the aircraft system air vehicle, mission systems, weapons, and concepts of employment in realistic combat environments. This position will require the selected candidate to think strategically about short-term and long-term investments to allow OAs Virtual Experimentation to provide relevant insights to our customers driving acquisition decisions. This will include a strategy to ensure the venue(s) viability and personnel are properly qualified and trained to provide customer instruction via briefings and cockpit familiarization to achieve strategic objectives. This technical lead will work closely with our Virtual Simulation customers (Strategy & Business Development, Air Combat Modernization, Aero Programs F-35/Integrated Fighter Group/Advanced Development Programs/etc), Labs & Technical Services (L&TS), and other Operations Analysis Technical Leads to coordinate event execution.  The individual shall have: a TOP SECRET security clearance to start; meet the minimum related experience with an extensive background in Virtual/Human-In-the-Loop Simulation; the ability to comfortably interface with civilian government, DoD and industry leaders; and a solid understanding of basic systems engineering processes and principles.  Travel on occasion (approximately 6 - 12 times a year). **Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Must have an Active Top Secret clearance with the ability to obtain higher level clearances as needed.***Basic Qualifications:**Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Must have an Active Top Secret clearance with the ability to obtain higher level clearances as needed.***Bachelors or higher level degree from an accredited college in a related technical discipline; Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Aerospace, with appropriate years of professional experience.Experience in Human-In-The-Loop/Virtual Simulation environmentExperience making presentations to senior level management and customersGovernment customer interaction and interface experienceSolid understanding of 4th and 5th Gen Fighter AircraftDesired Skills:Experience in multiple OA Supported Virtual Environments: PMTS, IWDC, MTS, Lighthouse, VWCDemonstrated strong relationship with L&TS and ADP Software development teamsExtensive operational military aviation backgroundProgram management experienceExperience in Virtual Simulation environment as either an Instructor Pilot, Event Lead, or Virtual AnalystFuturistic visionary thinking is highly desiredF-22, F-35 and ADP Program Clearances/SAP Capability knowledgeStrong oral and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to interface with senior civilian government, DoD and industry leaders.Demonstrated ability as an independent, proactive leader who works well within a team, with strong oral and written communication skills.Ability to communicate and coordinate effectively with team members, internal & external customers, and senior leadership.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA's first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences.  The Senior Financial Analyst position is responsible for providing financial consultation and actionable information to the Integrated Operations (IO) organization at the Bell headquarters in Fort Worth, Texas. The IO organization is comprised of several functions including Manufacturing & Assembly, Production Support, Procurement, Logistics, Facilities, Security, and Environmental Health & Safety. Primary Position Responsibilities:Annual Budget development and maintenance for Overhead, Capital, SET (Sustaining, Engineering, & Tooling)Work with IO organizations to develop, monitor, and analyze operation plans to achieve company performance objectives and financial goalsWeekly / monthly cost analysis and forecastingWeekly / monthly manpower reporting, analysis and forecasting including trends related to labor utilization and overtimeProvide Finance & IO leadership with actionable information to assist in cost managementSupport IO organizations in preparing business cases for Capital Acquisition Requests (CARs) and Expense Projects, managing the CAR process, and forecasting spend for projects.Maintain working knowledge of Bell cost accounting practices and CAS Disclosure statement to support compliant processes and financial decision making in the Bell Integrated Operations organizationWeekly reporting, analysis and forecasting of manufacturing base performance related to Forward Pricing Rates (FPR)Monitor monthly Forward Pricing Rates applicable to IO organizationsAssist the Rate Management team with FPR impact analyses and forecasting performanceRequired Education:Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or similar disciplineRequired Skills and Experience:At least 5 years relative experience in Finance or Accounting within similar aerospace or manufacturing industryWorking knowledge of GAAPUnderstanding of government contracting regulationsClear understanding of material, production and supply chain system and costing ramificationsAbility to analyze complex financial objectives, accounting or tax issues and provide alternative solutions or approachesMust be able to communicate effectively and relate well with others at all levelsExperience preparing and maintaining budgetsDemonstrated ability to act independently with general directionSolid working knowledge and experience using Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPointPreferred Skills and Experience:At least 5 years manufacturing and/or Aerospace & Defense experience with emphasis in finance, accounting audit or industrial engineeringShould be self-motivated and have strengths in customer service and dealing with ambiguity Don't miss the chance to join a diverse, inclusive environment where you feel a sense of belonging. As a member of our global workforce, you will collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where unique experiences, backgrounds and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.SDL2017

Name: Budget Analyst- DEA
Description: The essential functions include, but are not limited to, the following duties. Additional essential functions may be identified by the organization and listed as such in the incumbent's performance appraisal elements. Various tasks may be assigned under each essential function. Those that are listed under the examples of work are not all inclusive; they are examples only and may be amended or added to as needed by the organization:· Responsible for ensuring accuracy of financial reporting in accordance with FAR, CAS, GAAP and company policies· Provides leadership and direction to Accounts Payable personnel· Planning and reporting of budgets to support program budget/forecast planning· Applies principles of accounting to analyze financial information · Compiles and analyzes financial information to record transactions, prepare reports, review and verify accuracy· Develop personnel, short term and annual cost forecast· Provide variance/trend analysis· Ensure adequate funding availability by maintaining accurate records of expenditures· Support proposal development activities · Ensure vendor invoices are inspected, verified and processed for payment at due terms and conditions· Prepares journal entries · Ensures compliance with company and contract Policies and Procedures and the Vertex Aerospace Ethics program.· Ensures compliance with the Environmental, Health and Safety program.Incumbent performs other job-related tasks as assigned and required; any duties/tasks included in the employee's performance evaluation elements are essential to that employee's position within the job classification. *LI-MN1The following minimum qualifications have been identified by subject matter experts (SMEs) who have supervised this position or functioned in the position; they are based on job analysis information supplied by these SMEs. However, if a candidate believes he/she is qualified for the job although he/she does not have the minimum qualifications set forth below, he/she may request special consideration through substitution of related education and experience, demonstrating the ability to perform the essential functions of the position. Any request to substitute related education or experience for minimum qualifications must be addressed to the Program Manager in writing, identifying the related education and experience which demonstrates the candidate's ability to perform all essential functions of the position. If a candidate believes he/she needs a reasonable accommodation to meet these minimum qualifications or, if called for an interview, to attend such an interview, the candidate must notify the Program Manager in writing of the need for the accommodation and identify the position. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance preferred, plus 0-2 years’ experience in an Accounts Payable process, and experience leading and supervising 2 or more personnel OR Associate’s Degree in Accounting or Finance preferred, plus 4 years ‘experience in an Accounts Payable process, and experience leading and supervising 2 or more personnel OR High School Diploma or Equivalent, plus 8 years’ experience in an Accounts Payable process, and experience leading and supervising 2 or more personnel. Experienced with CAS, GAAP and the FARExperience in contracting with the Federal Government is a plusKNOWLEDGES, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND OTHER CHARACTERISTICS:The following skills and abilities are required:· Possesses strong analytical and problem solving skills. · Attention to detail; ability to meet deadlines; multi-task oriented· Ability to report cost and forecasts; prepare comparative evaluation of actual cost against budgeted funds and determine rationale for variances between costs and budgets.· Prepare regular and special purpose reports; maintain historical records· Ability to speak well; have good communication and interpersonal skills; ability to interface with both internal and external customers.· Ten key ability · SAP experience is a plus. · Proficient in MS Office; i.e. Excel, PowerPoint and Word for data compilation/entry and report generation.PHYSICAL DEMANDS:The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.The employee works in an office type environment the majority of the time sitting, typing, using a computer terminal, conducting business on the phone. The employee may be required to reach with hands and arms as well as push and pull items. The employee must able to lift and/or move up to 10 pounds regularly. Equal Opportunity Employer – minorities / females / veterans / individuals with disabilities / sexual orientation / gender identity.

Name: Analytics Analyst Staff
Description: Description:As an analytics professional, you will be part of a team that has enterprise-wide responsibility for optimizing decision-making through the use of advanced analytical models, driving insight to establish consistent and predictable process execution, identifying performance and process health, and focusing resources on the most critical issues driving effective cross-organizational solutions. Will include interaction with data scientists who develop supporting algorithms.  Specific analytic responsibilities for this position will include: Utilize all parts of the data analytics pipeline, such as data collection, wrangling, cleaning, analysis, visualization, presentation to deliver critical insights to internal customersLead agile teams working complex data analytics projectsCommunicate effectively to internal customers on project results, timelines, and risksSolve complex challenges involving data modeling, scenario creation, risk analysis, data mining/validation, and development of business rules to guide technology development.Document requirements, designs and detailed technical specifications, training materials, operating instructions, and test plans to support development of predictive analytic solutions.Partner with business & technical experts to identify analytic opportunities and define requirements.Demonstrated ability to relate process and data to insightful actionIncorporate new technology capability into design development. Some travel may be a required, as needed, up to 10%. Name: Financial Analyst (FAA expertise preferred)
Description: Job Description: The NISC III Group at Leidos currently has an opening for a Financial Analyst to work in our Ft. Worth, Texas office. This is an exciting opportunity to use your experience helping the NISC III mission. The candidate will provide Financial Analyst support to the Central Service Area (CSA) NISC III Program Management in Fort Worth, Texas. In this role, you will provide analysis of actual costs, budget variance analysis, monthly financial statements, Estimate at Completion (EAC), Task Order cost estimates, and Task Order close-outs. Participate in weekly meetings with the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) customer to discuss task order financial status. On a routine basis, the candidate will perform the following tasks:Verify and validate monthly Invoice expensesResearch and correct invoice discrepanciesProvide Invoice Certification for the FAA customerRun financial report and verify funding balanceDevelop monthly Estimate At Completion (EAC) reports for each Task Order SubtaskUpdate internal Financial DatabasesUpdate Travel and Training ReportResearch and prepare cost estimates - labor, travel, and other direct costs (ODC) - for specific requirements, upon requestPrepare and input Task Order cost estimates into the FAA's Contract Management systemPrepare and submit Task Order Close-out documentation after researching and validating all expenses have been processed, approximately 6 - 8 months after Task Order End DateReview Travel Authorizations and Training Authorizations for accuracy and enter amounts on Funding spreadsheetsReview Subcontractor charges and validate time, travel, and Other Direct Cost (ODC) expensesMust be able to take on new tasks and meet established deadlines  Typical education and experience:Typically requires a BA degree and 2 - 4 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with less than 2 years of prior relevant experience.Prior FAA experience preferred.

Name: SAP Business Analyst - Q2C
Description: Genuent is hiring a SAP Business Analyst - Q2C for our direct client in Irving, Texas . Qualified candidates should send their resume to Tele De La Cruz at Tdelacruz@genuent.com SAP Business Analyst - Q2C Irving, TX Contract to Hire Reporting to the SAP Business Process Team Lead, the SAP Business Analyst will support the SAP project across multiple business lines in North America working hand-in-hand with IT, SAP Project Team, Global Process Owners, and NAM businesses conducting business process analysis and proposing process redesign. This role will work with the rest of the process work stream to understand existing and design and implement new business functionality, business requirements and models into SAP processes from beginning to end within the Quote to Cash SD modules. This opportunity is perfect for the techno/functional professional who is looking to grow their career with an industry leader. This position will focus on technical and non-technical related business units redesigning processes for driven business applications. This is a unique opportunity for you to begin your career with a proven leader in the cement and construction materials industry. Interacts with non-information technology-related business areas to identify requirements, scope, support implementation of solutions. Provides end-to-end coverage for the process teams. Creates design of reports, forms, interfaces, and conversion. Facilitates system understanding and assist the training team in identifying requirements and validating final materials. Develops business scenarios and test scripts as well as lead efforts to conduct testing. Develops and maintains user documentation. Drives continuous improvements with use of technology solutions by demonstrating value-add propositions. Tests, modifies and documents the system configuration. Provides post-implementation support. Works in parallel with the training and communication team to ensure all aspects of change is handled. HERE'S WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR Minimally requires education and/or experience equivalent to a Bachelor's degree. Minimum 6-8 years of experience in an information technology environment. Minimum 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst. Basic SAP experience is preferred. Must have the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced deadline intensive environment. An energetic passion for continuous improvement. A broad understanding of business process, including front office and back office operations. Skilled with redesigning processes for technology-driven business applications. Experience working in IT and cross-functional project teams. Knowledge of prevalent IT methodologies, project management methodologies, management practices, architectures, system development lifecycles and best practices. Must have strong technical writing skills & excellent communication and organization skills, verbally and in writing. Ability to transform and support advanced business functions and requirements into design. Strong business user who is experienced partnering with IT. Ability to work collaboratively in a team. Ability to flourish in an ambiguous working environment. Qualified candidates should send their resume to Tele De La Cruz at Tdelacruz@genuent.com - provided by Dice(SKILLS TO BE ASSIGNED )

Name: Senior Analyst, Crew Scheduling - Quality Assurance
Description: Location: Flight Training Academy (DFW-FTRN)  Additional Locations: None  Requisition ID: 21627OverviewJoin us for a career with endless possibilities. Looking for a job where a passion for innovation, a culture of teamwork, and opportunities for growth are valued and rewarded? You’ve come to the right place.  You don’t have to be an airline aficionado to join American Airlines. It takes more than cool planes to keep us ahead of the curve, and thanks to our team of behind the scenes professionals, we do just that. As the largest airline in the world, American Airlines is in the business of serving the global travel needs of our customers. At the core of the Company is our commitment to each customer and each employee. We are dedicated to developing and delivering what our customers value and are willing to pay for. Customer-centric planning, innovative marketing, and an exceptional customer experience are supported by a cadre of talented people.  What does it take to join us? We’re glad you asked! We expect exceptional skills in your discipline and a dedication to being the best as we relentlessly pursue our goal of being not just the largest airline in the world, but also the best airline in the world.  Fortunately, we’re building on almost a century of innovation and firsts in our industry – and we plan to continue that tradition of excellence. About The Job ​This job is a member of the Crew Scheduling Team within the Integrated Operations Division. ​Responsible for analyzing crew customer service data, building forecasting models using advanced statistical methods, creating business intelligence dashboards and automated reports. This position will also build crew scheduling staffing plans using advanced forecasting and optimization techniques.  Specifically, you’ll do the following: Advanced statistical analysis of crew calls and service level dataBuilds statistical predictive models, derives service quality goals and develops staffing models for crew schedulingDevelops automated data mining abilities through advanced SQL and SAS programmingDevelops automated dashboards using Tableau, Cognos and HyperionLeads IT and Systems projects to improve crew customer service experienceMaps and engineers customer service processes to improve crew customer service experienceObtains, manipulates, cleans, and analyzes large structured and unstructured data from diverse sources; Name: Data Analyst
Description: Virbac, shaping the future of animal health  Founded in 1968 by a French veterinarian, Virbac is an independent pharmaceutical laboratory since always dedicated to animal health. Currently ranked 7th worldwide, the company is present in more than 100 countries, offering a comprehensive and practical range of products and services covering the majority of species and pathologies. Virbac innovation, based on both technological advances and listening to the customers, relies on reactive production facilities which meet the highest international quality standards. For nearly fifty years, these specific features have allowed the company to build a personalized relationship with veterinarians and farmers in every country. Through this privileged partnership, in which social, health and environmental issues come together, Virbac contributes, day after day, to shape the future of animal health.  Data Analyst  Mission  To ensure that the organization's data asset is monitored, maintained, managed as well as their processing and interactions with different applications and business processes. Data administrator ensures that the entire life cycle of data use and processing is on par with the enterprise's objective by typically creating system conception, logical management of data in which the flow of data is analyzed, data models are created and the relationships among them, ensuring there is a data dictionary to help maintain consistency, avoid redundancy, and model the database so as to make it logical and usable. To turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions by information flowing a timely and secured manager to and from the organization as well as within.  Permanent Assignments  Area of accountability no.1: Enterprise Data & Data Quality Management Main activities:Create and enforce policies for effective data managementFormulate techniques for quality data collection to ensure adequacy, accuracy and legitimacy of dataDevise and implement efficient and secure procedures for data handling and analysis with attention to all technical aspectsEstablish rules and procedures for data sharing with upper management, external stakeholders etc.Monitor and analyze information and data systems and evaluate their performance to discover ways of enhancing them (new technologies, upgrades etc.)Ensure digital databases and archives are protected from security breaches and data lossesTroubleshoot data-related problems and authorize maintenance or modificationsDevelop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and qualityAcquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systemsFilter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problemsWork with management to prioritize business and information needsLocate and define new process improvement opportunitiesExpected results: To provide the enterprise with Master Data Management process and quality data that can be used for business decision to improve efficiencies and performance. Area of accountability no.2: Enterprise Data Analysis Main activities:Troubleshoot problems and conduct analysis for efficient program/application solutions to support business processes and functional requirementsDevelop existing systems by analyzing and identifying areas for modificationEvaluate and make recommendations concerning software additions and upgradesHelp Data Architecture and Application designsPrimary source for documentation for all data related activities like data dictionary, list values and other applications datasetHelp define Database designDevelop data model describing data elements and how they are used, following procedures and using pen, template, or computer softwareDevelop and manage implementation, testing, and training plansPerforming routine audits of systems and softwareSupport others in the daily use of data systems and ensure adherence to legal and company standardsAssist with reports and data extraction when neededInterpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reportsIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data setsExpected results: To provide easy access of quality data to business for their daily decision making process Area of accountability no.3: Enterprise Business Analysis and QA Main activities:Developing technical solutions to business problems by defining, analyzing and documenting requirements.Perform testing on various software and reporting systemsTo continuously improve data quality and usage software products and applicationsTo train end usersExpected results: Effective use of data and systems in the company Area of accountability no.4: Facilitate compliance support for IT ERP and application to Computer System Validation & QA group. Main activities:Provide support of ERP and application to comply with cGMP regulations related to CSV including CFR 21 Part 11, EU GMP Annex 11 and GAMP standardsHelp with writing, reviewing and executing computer validation documentation ( Validation plan, IQ, OQ, DQ, SOP)Supports and/or actively participates in change control, and validation efforts.Oversees and/or performs validation testing by executing detailed test scripts on computerized systems.Perform regular audit on the validate status of ERP and other GxP applications.Expected results: ERP & Other GxP applications are in validated status all the time Area of accountability no.5: Information Innovation and Support Main activities:Plans, coordinates, and supervises all activities related to the design, development, and implementation of the organization's applications development and analysis function. Manages multiple development teams supporting different lines of businesses. Work closely with clients in order to map and support their operational needs. Responsible for developing, distributing, supporting, enforcing, and integrating best practices and technology standards across the organization.Working with the Operations and Business users in coming up with solutions that address the analytics requirement for the company.Expected results: Implementation of best of breed solutions for the business users KNOW-HOW: Job-related skills required to complete activities Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracyAbility to solve problems and respond quickly in a fast-paced customer focused environment Analytical & Creative Mind.Integrity and the ability to maintain confidentiality.IT: Understanding of Scripting & Statistical Languages. Good working knowledge of Microsoft Server, Microsoft Office applications, and associated technologies required. Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Tableau, Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (ETL frameworks)ERP applications and application development expertise with Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)Experience in the development and implementation of an EIS and Executive Dashboards.Excellent communication and collaboration skillsIT Business Analysis and QA skill level 4 ~ 5 *1 is beginner and 5 is an expertProject Management (Technical) with skill level 1 ~ 3 *Change Management with skill level 3 ~ 5 *Technical Documentation with skill level 3 ~ 5 * BEHAVIOUR: Interpersonal skills required to complete activities  Validated Skills Model: Individual Contributor Excellent problem-solving, strong analytical skills, communication, presentation skills and strong personal interaction skills.Experience gathering and preparing requirements specification for data replication, extraction, cleaning, and loading processes in a data warehouse environment.Promote innovation, demonstrate visionary and astute thinkingManage execution showing drive and results orientationPromote collaboration across functional and geographical boundariesCommunicate effectively and influence othersKnowledge of dimensional and decision support modelling techniques: experience developing and maintaining metadata repositories, and in developing and maintaining executive dashboard applications: knowledge of the principles, theories, practices and techniques for software development and implementation.Experience in summarizing analysis findings for executive management.Good working knowledge of Microsoft Office applications. Name: Risk Analyst II - Portfolio Forecasting
Description: Are you looking for a role building and maintaining complex Excel-based models? Do you have a background in data mining and analysis? Do you have business acumen that lets you "tell the story" rather than just deliver the data? Are you ready to take a challenging role with a company that embraces a culture of respect, integrity, innovation, and personal development? We may be looking for you! GM Financial's North American division, based at our corporate headquarters in Fort Worth, TX, is experiencing tremendous growth, and to support this growth our Risk Management team is ready to hire a key individual with the following attributes: Strong analytical skills Querying (coding) experience in a complex data warehouse environment Experience building and maintaining complex Excel-based models Data delivery and presentation experience with Excel and PowerPoint Acute attention to detail Can-do attitude If this description sounds like you, and you're ready to join a dynamic, growing company, check out the full job description below and apply now! About the Risk Management Forecasting Team The Risk Management Forecasting team is responsible for analyzing and projecting credit losses, delinquency, and outstanding receivables for the North America APR and Lease portfolios on a monthly and quarterly basis. The team supports multiple departments including Servicing, Corporate Finance, Pricing and Product Development. The forecast models and related analysis are also the primary framework for communicating portfolio performance trends and expectations to Executive and Senior leadership. The Risk Analyst II - Portfolio Forecasting is responsible for assisting in the design, development, and maintenance of complex portfolio forecasting models. The models are used to support corporate planning, financing and account servicing operations. In addition, this position is responsible for analysis and reporting on factors that affect portfolio performance such as delinquency, loss frequency, loss severity and bankruptcy, and payoffs. JOB DUTIES: Assist in the design, development, and maintenance of sophisticated portfolio forecasting models Utilize data mining and advanced spreadsheet skills to participate in complex portfolio forecasting, modeling, analysis, and reporting related to factors that affect portfolio performance such as delinquency, loss frequency, loss severity, bankruptcy, and payoffs Employ best practices of data analysis and validation to ensure data results are accurate Promote innovative ways to visualize and digest complex data Proactively monitor and report relevant changes in portfolio performance to management Effectively summarize and communicate portfolio performance trends, expectations, forecast methodology and results to management REPORTING RELATIONSHIP: Reports to: AVP - Portfolio Forecasting Direct Reports: none Skills Advanced with Microsoft Excel, particularly in building multi-tab, complex models Experience with Excel VBA is a plus Experience with respect to data analysis and spreadsheet modeling and/or reporting Experience with coding (SAS or SQL preferred) for data mining and manipulation Querying skills and knowledge in a data warehouse environment Demonstrated quantitative skills Acute attention to detail Effective written and verbal presentation skills Ability to interact collaboratively and proactively with internal customers Capable of managing multiple projects, including ability to coordinate and balance numerous tasks in a time-sensitive environment, under pressure, meeting deadlines Knowledge Demonstrated understanding and experience with the following: Data warehouses Data mining Reporting Data analysis and visualization techniques Understanding of the metrics utilized in monitoring the performance of a consumer lending portfolio is a plus Experience Bachelor's degree required and Master's degree (preferred) in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, MIS, or other quantitative field 3+ years of experience working with complex Excel models, querying large multi-table datasets, and data presentation required Experience in consumer loan portfolio forecasting and analysis preferred The qualified candidate will also be able to demonstrate proficiency with the following tools: Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word SAS and/or SQL (preferred) VBA (preferred) WORK CONDITION: Normal office environment ADDITIONAL DETAILS: GM Financial is the captive finance arm of General Motors, providing leasing and lending solutions to GM customers across the globe. As a Risk Analyst II you will be a key team member for one of the most well-known automotive organizations in the world, with a global reputation for excellence. Not only will you enjoy the stability of working for an established industry-leading company, but our continued dynamic growth will also provide you with exceptional career development opportunities and genuine potential for advancement. In addition to a competitive salary we offer a comprehensive, affordable, and flexible benefits package, offering you peace of mind and the opportunity to invest in your future. Read more about our company at www.gmfinancial.com Here is some of what we have to offer: Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage Health Savings Account and/or Flex Spending Account Life and Disability Insurance 401(K) with company match* Annual performance incentives* GM vehicle discounts for you and your family Generous paid time off (holidays, vacation, sick, personal, and floating holidays) Paid time off for volunteer work through GM Financial's Community Investment Program Learning and professional development programs * future payouts are not guaranteed and are based on annual Board approval - provided by DiceRisk Analyst II - Portfolio Forecasting

Name: Operations Analyst Staff
Description: Description:Lockheed Martin is looking for world-class talent in Operations Analysis to join our historic Skunk Works team located in Fort Worth. We need extraordinary people who are passionate about working on cutting-edge design or technology; comfortable with ambiguity; enjoy being part of a team; driven to learn and explore new areas; willing to think strategically and creatively with proven analytical & engineering problem-solving skills.As a member of the Operations Analysis organization, the candidate will be performing cost modeling and analysis of military systems to quantify domestic and international budgetary assessments, aircraft procurement cost, operations and sustainment cost, force mix/structure sizing, and acquisition programs. Responsibilities will include researching military systems performance and operations, modeling cost effectiveness metrics for domestic and international force structures, generating Operating and Support (O&S) cost assessments, and providing various force structure assessment trades. In this role, the individual will act as the Operations Analysis Cost lead. The selected candidate will be a member of a high-performing multi-site team and must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic, time-management, and interpersonal skills. The ability to work in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team environment is critical. This individual will be in the Aeronautics Strategic Planning Operations Analysis team; however, their focus will be to provide analysis products to the Strategic Studies Group. This will include air combat force structure, force mix, and budgetary cost assessments supporting the ASBD organization. This candidate will develop and apply methods for evaluating emerging war fighting concepts and technologies. They will collaborate with leadership to define study objectives, identify Measures of Effectives, select/develop analytical approaches, execute analysis, and communicate of results. This individual may also be called on to support analysis for any program/platform needed within the Operations Analysis organization.Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. An Active Secret Security Clearance with a current background investigation is required to start. The ability to obtain a DoD Top Secret clearances and access to Special Access Programs will be needed after hire.Basic Qualifications:--Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Business, Estimating, or Engineering Management with 5-7 years of professional experience within this field --Experience thinking analytically and problem solving while working in a multi-disciplinary team environment. --Experience with DoD Acquisition processes --Experience in military force structure and acquisition programs. --Experience in Microsoft Office suite.Desired Skills:--Knowledge of military acquisition programs, finance modeling, cost benefit analysis, force structure studies, and/or campaign modeling.--Familiarity with military (domestic and international) force structures and service management systems/databases such as AFTOC--Experience with Excel and VBA--Mathematical and/or Statistical Modeling skills--MATLAB knowledge--Experience with Operational analysis Tools is desired --Design of experiments and/or optimization knowledge--Ability to formulate structured approaches for analyzing complex problems involving multiple domains.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:job.QualificationsLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Name: Business Development Analyst Principal
Description: Description:The Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control Strategy & Business Development organization is seeking a Business Development Analyst Principal to support the Integrated Air & Missile Defense Line of Business.  Areas of responsibility include all U.S. Armed Forces Air and Missile Defense weapons and systems developed or fielded by MFC. Responsible to work side-by side with Program Management and engineering team members to translate customer needs (current and anticipated) into discriminating technical and business solutions for Lockheed Martin Missiles and Fire Control product lines.  This role is responsible for assessing customer strategic capability gap requirements and advocating advanced program technology solutions, planning, business opportunity identification and validation, capture plan development and execution, and customer interaction management. Additionally, this role is responsible for developing and synchronizing the long range strategic plans for the Integrated Air and Missile Defense Line of Business with the Army Cross Functional Team, the Missile Defense Agency, OSD, the Joint Staff, and Combatant Commands. This role also focuses on new business captures in defense sciences and technology, specifically focusing on Defense Department and Services Research and Development Activities; Science and Technology Centers, DARPA and other advanced technology activities of the US. Government.  Position location is flexible Basic Qualifications: Bachelors Degree  Minimum 15 years experience in U.S. military, U.S. Government, or technology based industry.  Subject matter expert on U.S. Armed Forces fielded Air and Missile Defense (AMD) Programs with specific area of expertise in PATRIOT, THAAD, and IAMD.  Possess experience and a current working knowledge of DoD Acquisition process and DoD Directive 5000.1, the Joint Capability Integration and Development System (JCIDS), and Army Air and Missile Defense Combat Developments process.  Possess experience with the U.S. Army and MDA Program Objective Memorandums (POMs), acquisition and procurement business processes, and U.S. Armed Forces Service cultures to align strategic objectives and capture strategies.  Must possess strong organizational and interpersonal skills to  communicate effectively verbally and in writing, with all levels of  management, engineers, Department of Defense officials and Functional employees.  Ability to obtain US Government Top Secret clearance.  Ability to travel domestically and internationally as needed Desired Skills: Advanced degree in an engineering or science discipline  Superior knowledge of U.S. Armed Forces AMD operational strategy, tactical employment and modernization strategy.  Knowledgeable of U.S. Army and MDA Program Objective Memorandum (POM) build, acquisition and procurement business processes and U.S. Armed Forces Service cultures.  Demonstrated outstanding leadership skills and proven success leading high-performing organizations.  Superior understanding of the Department of Defense and U.S. Army budgeting and acquisition processes.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills necessary to clearly articulate strategies at multiple levels of business and government.  Knowledgeable of linkage and coordination between U.S. Army Fires Center of Excellence and U.S. Army Air Defense Center Combat Development processes; Program Executive Office, Missiles and Space and Lower Tier Program Office operations; HQDA Air and Missile Defense Program operations in the Pentagon.  Effective Team Player Outstanding organizational ability and  demonstrated excellence motivating a diverse set of individuals in pursuit of common objectives.  Recent experience working with the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) or similar government S&T (Science & Technology) agencies.  Previous military experience.  Understanding of Integrated Air and Missile Defense weapons systems, sensors and military advanced technologies. Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: At Exeter Finance, we are committed to helping customers find the right financing for their next vehicle purchase. By building strong relationships with our customers and network of dealer partners we are able to give options that make sense, getting customers behind the wheel of their car.  Every team member is integral to our success. Whether you’re at a servicing center helping customers with their loans, in the field building relationships with dealers, or supporting the company from its corporate offices, you'll enjoy a nurturing, invigorating and positive work environment.  Our vision is to be a premier finance company and lender of choice known for its People, Performance and Service.Job SummaryThe Business Systems Analyst is responsible for understanding, analyzing and generating business and functional requirements documents and consequently assisting with delivering of the requirements to production for larger sized corporate initiatives.Essential FunctionsSupport large-level projects and serve as an SME on medium-level projects by reviewing business cases and performing in-depth analysis to translating into detailed business and functional requirements; as well as facilitate discussions and review with the teams to obtain sign-off on all requirements from the project sponsor(s) and technical lead(s).Work with the development team to validate the system requirements against the requirements.Facilitate the UAT process by performing smoke screen testing when coding is complete, creating test cases with traceability between the requirements, conducting the testing, and working with the business to receive the approval.Develop and maintain a detailed understanding of business processes and applications and customer needs. Understands technology solutions and communicates them to the business in a non-technical manner.Communicate requirements to development and quality assurance staff and serves as the point of contact for business, development, and QA during the project lifecycle.Build and maintain relationships with key business, IT stakeholders, team members, vendors, and other departments involved in the projects, and manages expectations. Promotes a constructive, positive team environment and maintains a spirit of openness, information sharing, inquisitiveness, problem-solving, and support for our common goals.Work with the appropriate production support team members to troubleshoot issues and/or operational questions.Perform post production review to ensure successful implementation and work with production support team members to research any issues.Other duties as assigned.Education and ExperienceBachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required.Four (4) or more years of prior experience as a Business Analyst.Business Analyst certification a bonus.Experience in the auto or finance industry preferred.Basic SQL skills required.Advanced SQL skills preferred.Excellent facilitation, collaboration, communication and presentation skills.Strong analytical skills.Proficient with standard business analysis, business process definition and project management concepts and tools.Skill in organizing resources and establishing priorities.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Ability to learn and support new systems and applications. Exeter Finance LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Systems Analyst
Description: Description:Our employees are the core of everything we do, and they are helping the future arrive. As a leading technology innovation company, our team of over 100,000 people works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Headquartered in Bethesda, MD, Lockheed Martin has employees based in all 50 states and more than 570 facilities that span 70 countries.  This Enterprise Operations (EO) position supports the Lockheed Martin Aeronautics division located in Fort Worth, Texas. The primary responsibility of the Multi-Function Information Systems Analyst will be responsible to provide support for the F35 Server and Desktop classified environments. This professional will ensure that the Lockheed Martin networks and IT systems are managed, controlled, and compliant with the Joint Special Access Program Implementation Guide (JSIG) specifically the Risk Management Framework (RMF) portion. This includes routine updates, major upgrades, and on-going maintenance and support to Microsoft Servers, Storage Area Networks (SAN), tape backup systems, and the Windows 7 & Windows 10 Desktop infrastructure. The Multi-Function Information Systems Analyst will also work requests for IT assistance related to desktops/laptops, software and/or hardware problems, domain accounts and password issues.  The Multi-Function Information Systems Analyst assists users with resolving technical issues with applications, network connectivity and hardware. The team member will assist with Information Assurance tasks to include performing environment vulnerability scans, remediation of vulnerabilities by applying recommended patches provided by multiple vendors on server, desktop, laptop, printer, plotter, scanner, and removable storage device deployments.  They will ensure that all Lockheed Martin assets and software are properly accounted for, managed, and controlled. All work must be performed on-site, including some off-shift hours, weekends and occasional travel. The position also supports a 24 X 7 weekly on-call rotation schedule.  Possess an active DoD Secret security clearance, based upon a National Agency Check with Local Agency Check (NAC/LC) conducted within the last five years and access eligibility for Special Access Programs.  Subject to routine government security investigations and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information throughout their employment as required by the job. Basic Qualifications:Active DoD Secret Clearance (investigation within 5 years)Experience with Windows Server and Desktop Operating SystemsExperience with Risk Management Framework (RMF)U.S. Citizenship required for this locationDesired Skills:Active DoD Top Secret Clearance (investigation within 5 years)Knowledge of the creation and administration of Group Policies and Active Directory Domain ServicesKnowledge of Virtualization (VMware, Horizon, vSphere, vCenter, vCloud, vRealize, NSX, vSAN or VXRail)Knowledge of Linux Administration (RH6.x, RH7.x) Knowledge of configuration management tools and software deployment Ability to troubleshoot issues arising from the OS and networkSetup and manage Storage Area Network (SAN)Demonstrated ability to work in a dynamic IT environmentExperience working in a teaming/collaborative environmentExperience with Windows server administration and installation (2008 R2/2012/2016) (system hardening, log management, configuration management (Nessus, McAfee, WSUS, SCCM, Shavlik, Blade Logic, Splunk, ACAS, SCAP, HBSS, etc.)) Experience with McAfee EPO configuration and administrationExperience with vulnerability remediation and security managementBASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. Theyre dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Virbac innovation, based on both technological advances and listening to the customers, relies on reactive production facilities which meet the highest international quality standards. For nearly fifty years, these specific features have allowed the company to build a personalized relationship with veterinarians and farmers in every country. Name: Contract Price/Cost Analyst
Description: Videos  Duties  Help Help Duties Summary Fort Worth is the 15th-largest city in the United States and the 5th-largest city in the state of Texas. The city is located in North Texas. It is the county seat of Tarrant County, covering nearly 350 square miles into four other counties: Denton, Johnson, Parker and Wise. According to the 2017 census estimates, Fort Worth's population is 874,168. The city is the second-largest in the Dallas-Fort Worth-Arlington metropolitan area, 4th most populous metropolitan area in the United States. Learn more about this agency  Responsibilities Plans and performs in-depth analyses of prices and costs for prime contracts with numerous sub-contracts for complex weapons and communications systems programs and their related production phases.Uses independent judgment and discretion in selecting areas for review such as interpreting data and studying trends and forecasting patterns in the contractors' business environment to project costs.Conducts detailed cost analysis of all aspects of contractor's proposal including operations methods, make-or-buy decisions, management operations, and financial policies and practices.Utilizes economic, statistical, accounting, and financial analysis principles and techniques to evaluate contractors projections, analyze auditor and technical reports, project price trends, isolate economic factors, and evaluate price/cost data.Recommends negotiation positions to ensure proposals for prices and costs reflect legal and regulatory requirements, and comply with established cost accounting standards.Serves as the senior cost/price analyst for preliminary audit and price analysis reviews which have areas of significant differences and/or difficulties to be resolved between the DoD and the contractor. Travel Required Occasional travel - Business travel 10% of the time Supervisory status  No  Promotion Potential  13  Job family (Series)  1102 Contracting  Requirements  Help Help Requirements Conditions of Employment Appointment may be subject to a suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a completed background investigation.Must be able to obtain and maintain a Nonciritcal-Sensitive Secret security clearance. Qualifications Who May Apply:Current Federal EmployeeReinstatement EligibleVeterans and Preference Eligible under Veterans Employment Opportunity Act (VEOA) of 1998Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP) EligibleQUALIFICATIONS: In order to qualify, you must meet the experience requirements described below. Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student; social). You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Your resume must clearly describe your relevant experience; if qualifying based on education, your transcripts will be required as part of your application.Experience required: To qualify based on your work experience, your resume must describe at least one year of experience which prepared you to do the work in this job.To qualify, applicants must possess one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade/level GS-12. Specialized experience is defined as: Experience evaluating contractor compliance, accuracy, and consistency, with Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) and Cost Accounting Standard of highly complex, high dollar contract programs. Evaluate and analyze all cost elements of price/cost data contained in proposals. Independently formulate and implement strategic positions to support negotiations involving rigid timeframes. Provides innovative recommendations to highly skilled professional experts and senior level officials to meet mission requirements.Education can not be substituted for experience.  You will be evaluated on the basis of your level of competency in the following areas:Advanced Cost and/or Price AnalysisContract Performance ManagementProposal Evaluation (Contracting by Negotiation)Time in Grade Requirement: Applicants who have held a General Schedule (GS) position within the last 52 weeks must have 52 weeks of Federal service at the next lower grade or equivalent (GS-12). Applicants must meet basic eligibility requirements such as minimum qualifications, and other regulatory requirements by the closing date of the announcement.BASIC EDUCATION REQUIREMENT: A bachelor's degree from an accredited educational institution authorized to grant baccalaureate degrees AND at least 24 semester hours in any combination of the following fields: accounting, business finance, law, contracts, purchasing, economics, industrial management, marketing, quantitative methods, or organization and management. (This requirement can be obtained within the degree or in addition to the degree).NOTE: Current civilian personnel in DoD, who occupied GS-1102 positions or contracting positions with authority to award or administer contracts above the simplified acquisition threshold in an Executive Department on or before September 30, 2000 are exempt from meeting this requirement. Current military members who occupied a similar occupational specialty to the GS-1102 on or before September 30, 2000 are also exempt from meeting this requirement.  Education FOREIGN EDUCATION: If you are using education completed in foreign colleges or universities to meet the qualification requirements, you must show the education credentials have been evaluated by a private organization that specializes in interpretation of foreign education programs and such education has been deemed equivalent to that gained in an accredited U.S. education program; or full credit has been given for the courses at a U.S. accredited college or university. For further information, visit: http://www.ed.gov/about/offices/list/ous/international/usnei/us/edlite-visitus-forrecog.html.  Additional information Selection is subject to restrictions resulting from Department of Defense referral system for displaced employees.The Department of Defense (DoD) policy on employment of annuitants will be used in determining eligibility of annuitants. The DoD policy is available at: www.dtic.mil/whs/directives/corres/pdf/1400.25-V300.pdfIn accordance with section 9902(h) of title 5, United States Code, annuitants reemployed in the Department of Defense shall receive full annuity and salary upon appointment. They shall not be eligible for retirement contributions, participation in the Thrift Savings Plan, or a supplemental or redetermined annuity for the reemployment period. Discontinued service retirement annuitants (i.e. retired under section 8336(d)(1) or 8416(b)(1)(A) of title 5, United States Code) appointed to the Department of Defense may elect to be subject to retirement provisions of the new appointment as appropriate. (See DoD instructions 1400.25, Volume 300, at http://www.dtic.mil/whs/directives.)This is a Defense Acquisition, Logistics and Technology Workforce position. Selectees must meet position requirements for certification at Level III within 24 months of entrance on duty.Multiple positions may be filled from this announcement.Male applicants born after December 31, 1959 must complete a Pre-Employment Certification Statement for Selective Service Registration.Two year trial/probationary period may be required.May require overtime work.Relocation/Retention Incentive will not be authorized.Defense National Relocation Program will not be authorized.Ability to communicate orally and in writing.All selections under an announcement must be made within 6 months from the issuance date of the certificate referral list.Tour of Duty: Full time.FLSA: Exempt.Bargaining Unit: YesPosition has a positive education requirement.Read more  How You Will Be Evaluated You will be evaluated for this job based on how well you meet the qualifications above. Interagency Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP): The Interagency Career Transition Assistance Plan (ICTAP) provides eligible displaced Federal competitive service employees with selection priority over other candidates for competitive service vacancies. If your agency has notified you in writing that you are a displaced employee eligible for ICTAP consideration, you may receive selection priority if: 1) this vacancy is within your ICTAP eligibility, 2) you apply under the instructions in this announcement, and 3) you are found well-qualified for this vacancy. Well-qualified is defined as meeting all of the minimum qualification standards and eligibility requirements as well as possessing skills that clearly exceed the minimum qualification requirements for the position. Under competitive delegated examining, an ICTAP eligible will be considered well-qualified if they attain an eligibility rating of 90 or higher, not including points for veterans' preference. You must provide proof of eligibility with your application to receive selection priority. Such proof may include a copy of your written notification of ICTAP eligibility or a copy of your separation personnel action form. Information about ICTAP eligibility is on OPM's Career Transition Resources website at https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/workforce-restructuring/employee-guide-to-career-transition/. Your application package (resume, supporting documents, and responses to the questionnaire) will be used to determine your eligibility, qualifications, and quality ranking for this position. Please follow all instructions carefully. Errors or omissions may affect your rating or consideration for employment. You should list any relevant performance appraisals and incentive awards in your resume as that information may be taken into consideration during the selection process. If selected, you may be required to provide supporting documentation. As described above, your complete application includes your resume, your responses to the online questionnaire, and documents which prove your eligibility to apply.If you fail to provide these documents, you will be marked as having an incomplete application package and you will not be considered any further.1. Your resume: Your resume may be submitted in any format and must support the specialized experience described in this announcement.If your resume includes a photograph or other inappropriate material or content, it will not be used to make eligibility and qualification determinations and you may not be considered for this vacancy.For additional information see: What to include in your resume.You MUST submit documents verifying your eligibility with your application package. These documents may include, but are not limited to: For current employment verification, SF-50, DD3434 or other federal agencies official "Notification of Personnel Action" equivalent (Note: SF-52 or agencies "Request for Personnel Action" is not acceptable); For MSP claims PCS orders and marriage certificate; For verification of Veteran status, DD214 (which indicates character of service), SF-15, VA Letter and/or Activation/Deactivation orders.2. If you meet this requirement based on education you MUST submit a copy of your transcript with your application package or you will be rated ineligible.Future Military Retirees*: You are required to submit a copy of your retirement DD Form 214 (Member 4 Copy) OR certification document** OR a copy of your retirement letter AND a copy of your terminal leave request (if applicable). You will be required to provide your DD Form 214 (Member 4 Copy) upon issuance.Future Separation from the Military*: You are required to submit a copy of your most recent DD Form 214 (Member 4 Copy) OR certification document** OR a copy of your most recent active duty orders AND a copy of your terminal leave request (if applicable). You will be required to provide your DD Form 214(Member 4 Copy) upon issuance.*Active duty military members who are selected may not be appointed unless on terminal leave or already separated from the armed forces.** The "certification" is any written document from the armed forces that certifies the service member is expected to be discharged or released from active duty service in the armed forces under honorable conditions not later than 120 days after the date the certification is submitted. The Statement of Service must be signed by, or by direction of, the adjutant, personnel officer, or commander of your unit or higher headquarters, AND the Statement of Service letter must include your rank, dates of active duty service, the Type of Discharge, Character of Service (i.e. honorable), and, if applicable, when your terminal leave will begin.Special Employment Consideration: DCMA encourages persons with disabilities to apply, including those eligible for hiring under 5 CFR 213.3102(u), Schedule A, Appointment of persons with disabilities [i.e., intellectual disabilities, severe physical disabilities, or psychiatric disabilities], and/or Disabled veterans with a compensable service-connected disability of 30% or more. For information on how to apply under this appointment authority via the Selective Placement Coordinator, please visit http://dcmacareers.com/index.cfm/disabilities/.  If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:  Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.  Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating. Name: Sr Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Elavon provides end-to-end payment processing services to merchants and financial institutions in the United States, Brazil, Canada, Mexico, Puerto Rico, and throughout Europe. Our payment products are supported by the most reliable network in the industry and include credit and debit card processing, electronic check services, gift cards, dynamic currency conversion, multi-currency support, and cross-border acquiring. We handle every aspect of the acquiring relationship?transaction processing, risk and underwriting, settlement, equipment deployment, chargeback management, reporting, and customer service. Our customers can also count on us to keep their payment processing compliant with changing payment security requirements.  Elavon employs about 3,600 people located worldwide. Together, we support more than one million clients spread among the retail, restaurant, hospitality, government, healthcare, education, and e-commerce sectors. Elavon utilizes a white-label branding model, and we work with strong partners to market our services through a variety of sales channels, including large financial institutions, community banks, trade associations, government agencies, and ISOs/MSPs. We are the:  + \#1 airline processor  + \#2 hospitality processor  + \#4 U.S. acquirer, based on bank card volume  + \#6 European acquirerElavon?s Global Acquiring Solutions organization is part of U.S. Bank?s Payment Services division. U.S. Bancorp is the fifth-largest commercial bank in the United States.Elavon is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst who enjoys solving business problems. He/she will interact with business stakeholders and technology teams to define requirements, mine data, and provide insights and business recommendations. This role will be measured by timeliness, frequency, and accuracy of insights delivery and their impacts on Elavon business stakeholders assigned. Main responsibilities include:  + Develops executive-level reports and presents complex, customized analytic findings to senior leadership team;  + Delivers actionable and measurable insights that drive business for the organization;  + Analyzes customer behavior and business performance data; and  + Assists in streamlining and broadening the access of analytics to strategic decision makers  + Motivated by driving revenue through data based analytics  _Your Career is Here._ *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications** + Bachelor?s degree in accounting, finance, statistics, engineering, or equivalent experience  + 5 years in an analytical role  + Possess great communication skills and a passion for analysis  + Ability to articulate how data and analysis relates to Key Performance Indicators  + Communication and persuasion skills at the executive level  + Excels at bridging between the customer, relationship management and data  + Understanding of what can be improved by better data and analysis  + Ability to provide stewardship/ evangelism to drive standardization, adoption, and acceptance on an ongoing basis  + Ability to navigate, extract, explore, qualify, and analyze diverse internal and external data  + Experience building multidimensional analysis models  + Experimental/R&D based mindset  + Ability to self-govern Business Intelligence content and analytic environment  + Ability to train and educate others *Preferred Qualifications** + SQL Experience  + Tableau Experience  + Statistical modeling experience in regression, forecasting, and segmentation  + Extensive knowledge of financial analysis concepts and methodologies  + Excellent financial analysis, forecasting, and planning skills *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** Minnesota-MN-Minneapolis*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180042354*Other Locations:** United States U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Senior Data & Business Analyst
Description: What you’ll be doing...In this role as a Senior Data & Business Analyst, you’ll be part of the Wireless Supply Chain – Reverse Monetization team to deliver incremental revenue in traditional and non-traditional channels (Secondary Marketplaces, Agent Channel, Alternative Online Marketplaces like eBay/Amazon/etc, and VZW.com, etc.). You’ll be managing and developing projects, deliver incremental revenue streams across multiple programs by sourcing data and merging complex data streams.  Because our business is complex, we need someone with both a strong business acumen as well as excellent technical skills to dive deep into the data sources to generate the insights.  We are looking for a technically-minded, strong analytical thinker and problem solver who is able to efficiently deliver analytic insights across multiple teams within Verizon. Most importantly we are looking for someone who is a builder and entrepreneur, someone who is excited about using data and analytics to push the team forward.  In this role, you will work closely with the entire Reverse Logistics teams, Supply Chain Senior Management & staff and other internal groups as needed. The Senior Analyst will have an understanding of Indirect Sales Channel and Alternate Marketplaces, including pricing and velocity. You’ll be periodically creating executive summary and presentations to senior leadership on the health of various programs. The Core responsibility is building and maintaining monetization programs that consistently maximize revenues, margins and market share. Drive achievement of strategic and revenue objectives:Lead the identification of alternative revenue streams to diversify our Reverse Monetization portfolio to increase the inflow of devices for resale across various programs.Tracking, analysis and reporting on key Sales & financial metrics like EBITDA targets, Gross Revenue, Net Margin, COGS, Selling Prices, Recovery Value, and Expense Avoidance.Utilize analytics to understand key issues, identify and implement best in class solutions.Build and maintain an understanding of products and price information.Foster growth and drive sales through internal & external relationships that increases profitability and revenue across secondary marketplaces.Develop bid packages & business cases designed to maximize revenue opportunities.Develop ideas or recommendations that may have an impact on existing or future systems/ applications, products, service or procedures and business processes.Lead collaboration across functional teams to achieve Key MetricsProactively manage inventory of multiple programs for Secondary marketplace sales to ensure inventory KPIs such as Days of Supply, Aging, and Working Capital are achieved.Work closely with Marketing, Operations, and Inventory accounting leadership to ensure product availability and correct financial booking for revenue & margin by program.Support, coordinate and lead Market & field teams; listen to field challenges/successes and implement programs/improvements accordingly.Manage shipping process by collaborating with Operations team to optimize cycle time and flow, reduce costs, and ensure on-time delivery.Investigate and resolve shipping and product discrepancy issues; make recommendations for process improvements which will reduce or eliminate discrepancies and returns.Manage returns processes across marketplaces and optimize each programs returns, as well as design, implement, and improve new program returns process as they are launched.What we’re looking for...You’ll need to have: A Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.4 years’ experience in analytics tools/systems,such as Excel, Access; SharePoint, Tableau etc.Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneouslyProject management skills. Even better if you have: Bachelor's degree in Math, Science, Business Administration, or related field.Strong competency in VZW systems/practices and sales and support channels.Strong Proficiency with Excel, Teradata SQL and VZ Data Warehouse, and SAP.Ability to write Excel Macros, VBA scripts for data processing automationStrong understanding of and experience with KPI management.Strong organizational, communication, problem solving, and data analytical skills.Competency with both strategic and tactical decision making.Highly developed critical thinking and analytical skills.Proven ability to independently organize and prioritize multiple complex assignments and projects, and successfully driving them to completion within the required timeframe.Ability to be a self-starter; proven success working in a highly dynamic, deadline-driven environment.Ability to cultivate strong collaborative working relationships and contacts within work group, across the company, and with external organizations.Demonstrated competency in communication and presentation skills; capability to develop clear messages across multiple communication platforms and tools.Demonstrated success independently leading and implementing solutions.Telecommunications business acumen.When you join Verizon... You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon. Equal Employment Opportunity We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.
