Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences.  The Senior Financial Analyst position is responsible for providing financial consultation and actionable information to the Integrated Operations (IO) organization at the Bell headquarters in Fort Worth, Texas. The IO organization is comprised of several functions including Manufacturing & Assembly, Production Support, Procurement, Logistics, Facilities, Security, and Environmental Health & Safety. Primary Position Responsibilities:Annual Budget development and maintenance for Overhead, Capital, SET (Sustaining, Engineering, & Tooling)Work with IO organizations to develop, monitor, and analyze operation plans to achieve company performance objectives and financial goalsWeekly / monthly cost analysis and forecastingWeekly / monthly manpower reporting, analysis and forecasting including trends related to labor utilization and overtimeProvide Finance & IO leadership with actionable information to assist in cost managementSupport IO organizations in preparing business cases for Capital Acquisition Requests (CARs) and Expense Projects, managing the CAR process, and forecasting spend for projects.Maintain working knowledge of Bell cost accounting practices and CAS Disclosure statement to support compliant processes and financial decision making in the Bell Integrated Operations organizationWeekly reporting, analysis and forecasting of manufacturing base performance related to Forward Pricing Rates (FPR)Monitor monthly Forward Pricing Rates applicable to IO organizationsAssist the Rate Management team with FPR impact analyses and forecasting performanceRequired Education:Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or similar disciplineRequired Skills and Experience:At least 5 years relative experience in Finance or Accounting within similar aerospace or manufacturing industryWorking knowledge of GAAPUnderstanding of government contracting regulationsClear understanding of material, production and supply chain system and costing ramificationsAbility to analyze complex financial objectives, accounting or tax issues and provide alternative solutions or approachesMust be able to communicate effectively and relate well with others at all levelsExperience preparing and maintaining budgetsDemonstrated ability to act independently with general directionSolid working knowledge and experience using Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPointPreferred Skills and Experience:At least 5 years manufacturing and/or Aerospace & Defense experience with emphasis in finance, accounting audit or industrial engineeringShould be self-motivated and have strengths in customer service and dealing with ambiguity Don’t miss the chance to join a diverse, inclusive environment where you feel a sense of belonging. Name: E1354:Operations Analyst Stf
Description: E1354:Operations Analyst Stf  27-Jun-2018 Req ID439089BRLMCareers Business UnitESS0343 AERONAUTICS COMPANYWork Schedule FLEX9x80A-Friday off in 2nd week w/flex hrs/day Security Clearance Top Secret Shift First Direct/Indirect Direct Business Area Aeronautics Company Department1AD100:FW ADP OPERATIONS ANALYSISRelocation/Housing Stipend Available Yes Job Code/Title E1354:Operations Analyst Stf Job Class Systems Engineering: Other Job Category Experienced Professional Industry Job Title Operations Analysis Software Developer Staff Req Type Full-Time Job Description This position is with our Advanced Development Program (ADP), known as the historic Skunk Works, in Ft Worth, Texas. We are looking for world-class talent for this position to join the 75 year tradition of creating advanced aircraft.  Lockheed Martin is seeking a Modeling and Simulation Software Engineer to support the Aeronautics Advanced Development Programs (ADP) operations analysis team leveraging advanced modeling and simulation capabilities to address our customer’s most challenging problems. The candidate will be responsible for software development required to model military systems and scenarios in constructive and Human-In-The-Loop (Virtual) simulations to support requirements definition, CONOPS evaluation, operational and cost effectiveness studies, and military utility assessment, including development of and modifying of operational analysis tools. Candidate will be expected to apply system & software engineering skills to solve technical engineering problems and develop code and applications to improve the analysis capability. Applying system & software engineering skills, candidate must clarify & derive user requirements; research & develop algorithms to represent systems, interactions between systems, and environmental impacts; design software architecture and algorithms to meet user requirements; test & verify software application to meet user needs and complete documentation.  This specific position focuses on software development within a US Government tool called AFSIM (Advanced Framework for Simulation, Integration, and Modeling) which is being utilized across LM Aero programs to address mission effectiveness analysis needs.  The successful candidate will be developing AFSIM software improvements, creating some effects-based plugins, and integrating plugins in C++ Lockheed developed software modules relating to sensor performance, battle management, weapons, and resource management and allocation algorithms. Responsibilities will include working with the Operations Analysis team members to define development requirements, perform software architecture design, and perform development and testing of new AFSIM capabilities and plugins.  Candidate will interface with project management, customers, and other technical organizations. Candidate will be expected to develop and maintain up-to-date knowledge and understanding of military operations and systems; as well as up-to-date software engineering technologies and methods. Active DOD security clearance required. Applicant selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. **Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access.*** This position requires a Top Secret Clearance to start.Basic QualificationsBS degree or above in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Physics, Applied Math or Engineering required with appropriate years of experienceSoftware development experience; applying object-oriented software design & skills to technical problemsProficient developing object-oriented software in C, C#, C++, or JavaExperience with technical and analytical skills to understand and interpret technical system performance dataExperience developing software with the Visual Studio integrated development environmentMust have an active Top Secret ClearanceDesired skillsExperience with Modeling, Simulation and AnalysisExperience modeling weapon systems and the operation of air & ground systems in constructive or virtual simulations (Especially BRAWLER, ESAMS, EADSIM, SUPPRESSOR, or AFSIM)Knowledge of scripting languages: Perl, Python, etcExperience with CMake Experience with software version control tools. Ability to work in a fast-paced, multi-disciplinary environmentState Texas Virtual no City Fort Worth Zip76108EEOLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.* As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.

Name: Analyst/Senior Analyst, Network and Schedule Planning
Description: Looking for a job where a passion for innovation, a culture of teamwork, and opportunities for growth are valued and rewarded? Youve come to the right place.  You dont have to be an airline aficionado to join Employer. It takes more than cool planes to keep us ahead of the curve, and thanks to our team of behind the scenes professionals, we do just that. As the largest airline in the world, Employer is in the business of serving the global travel needs of our customers. At the core of the Company is our commitment to each customer and each employee. We are dedicated to developing and delivering what our customers value and are willing to pay for. Customer-centric planning, innovative marketing, and an exceptional customer experience are supported by a cadre of talented people.  What does it take to join us? Were glad you asked! We expect exceptional skills in your discipline and a dedication to being the best as we relentlessly pursue our goal of being not just the largest airline in the world, but also the best airline in the world.  Fortunately, were building on almost a century of innovation and firsts in our industry and we plan to continue that tradition of excellence.  About The Job  Network Planning is currently hiring Analysts/Sr. Analysts for three separate teams: Extended Range (ER)/International, Strategic Schedules, and P1/P2/P3.  The ER/Intl team is responsible for the maintaining the active seasonal schedules for the AAG widebody fleet (757 and up) in addition to the selling schedule and a variety of ad hoc scenario schedules. Responsibilities include building aircraft routings, validating schedule feasibilities, and creating scenarios to meet the needs of the International Capacity Planning and Operational teams. The successful candidate should possess an understanding of Americans domestic and international route network and detailed experience with aircraft routings. The candidate should have the ability to manage multiple projects at one time. Candidates should be prepared to work collaboratively across NP in addition to Crew Planning, Operations Planning, Base & Line Maintenance Planning, and the Executive team.  The Strategic Schedules team develops various schedule scenarios 1-to-5 years out to validate profitability and operational feasibility. The team also supports the NP Schedule Analysis team on projects relating to hubs and infrastructure, as well as operational metrics and fleet deployment. The successful candidate should possess a vast understanding of airlines route networks and can apply this knowledge to contribute to Americans long-term vision and company goals. The candidate will be able to creatively link analysis and scheduling fundamentals in order to develop aircraft flows for flight scenarios. Candidates must display an ability to think dynamically and display the ability to work collaboratively on multiple projects at one time.  The P1, P2 and P3 teams build schedules based on development cycles. Schedulers take capacity inputs from Global Planning and ensure that all operational requirements are met. The analysts drive network value by finding opportunities to improve timings, increase utilization and/or optimize markets for aircraft size through creative scheduling and problem solving. Schedulers also serve as front-line contact points for all management and operational groups, including stations/hubs. Successful schedulers have knowledge of Americans worldwide network, a passion for the commercial aviation industry, and a strong aptitude for puzzle solving. Qualifications Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline: Operations Research, Mathematics, Engineering or equivalent experience/training  2 years experience in airline Network Planning/Scheduling, Revenue Management or analytical field, or Masters degree in a related field  Preferred Qualifications  Graduate Degree  2 years experience in modeling, project management, and/or data manipulation at Employer  Ability to solve complex problems and puzzles in a constrained and dynamic environment  Ability to leverage understanding of the airline business and commercial goals to drive results and innovative solutions  Ability to be adaptive to new ideas and business processes in an ever-changing marketplace  Ability to challenge self and team to develop future-oriented network strategies  Ability to communicate and collaborate, work with cross-functional groups to drive outcomes which benefit the entire airline  Skilled at sharing knowledge to develop the expertise of the team as a whole  Knowledge of Microsoft Office to include Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.  Knowledge of Air Vision Schedule Manager Additional Locations: None Requisition ID: 24144

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionInfinite Computer Solutions LTD provides business technology solutions, next-gen mobility solutions and product engineering services, specializing in the Healthcare, Banking & Finance, Telecommunications & Technology and Media & Publishing industries, for Fortune 1000 companies.  We do have an immediate opening for the position of ETL developer in Alpharetta, GA location for our direct telecom customer.  Kindly find the below Job description and share your updated resume to praveen.kumar4@infinite.com. Job Description:Develop new ETL processes and data transformation in postgresql and TalendConvert existing SSIS and other data transformation processes into cloud based postgreSQL using TalendProvide regular project updates to Information Analysts and management as neededCommunicate issues, risks, and concerns proactively to managementDocument ETL process thoroughly to allow peers to assist with support as needed.Required skills :Four or more years of relevant work experience (Database development, ETL development, scripting)Four or more years of experience in PostgreSQL.Two years of experience working in Talend.Two or more years of experience working in AWS/cloud based database development.Two or more years of experience with SSIS, MS SQL and overall Microsoft Stack .Experience in working with data automation across multiple environments (ETL).Plus:Experience in conversion of ETL/data transformation to open source from MS SQL is plus. We are currently interviewing to fill this and other similar contract positions. If you are interested in this position, please apply online for immediate consideration. About Infinite Computer Solutions LTD: Infinite Computer Solutions LTD provides business technology solutions, next-gen mobility solutions and product engineering services, specializing in the Healthcare, Banking & Finance, Telecommunications & Technology and Media & Publishing industries, for Fortune 1000 companies.  Our solutions build on proprietary industrial frameworks that significantly reduce work effort and cost while providing faster go-to-market speeds and nimble responses to market dynamics, a solution we call Platformization . The 5000+ employees at Infinite manage activities aimed at social causes through the Employees' Club, iVerve. iVerve was initiated a decade back, in 2004, formed with the primary idea of ensuring that employees enjoy a great mix of work and play or the clich d "Fun at work". What started off as a platform for employees to showcase their talent and sports enthusiasm has evolved into a fantastic energy system that spreads its reach to the society in addition to employees through various engagements and partnerships with various NGOs. Infinite has offices spread across India, US, UK, China, Malaysia, Singapore and Hong Kong.  Thanks  Praveen-Senior Execuitve  Praveen.kumar4@infinite.com

Name: Senior Analyst - Cerner Millennium
Description: Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with pro forma annual revenue of circa € 12 billion and circa 100,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.  Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, Unify and Worldline.  Position Title:  Senior Analyst - Cerner Millennium  Location:  Remote, US Wide  Core Responsibilities:  Serve as Senior Electronic Health Record (EHR) subject matter expert for the provision of any combination of two or more Cerner Millennium Clinical Solutions (SurgiNet; SurgiNet ANES; CareNet or PharmNet). Scope of duties include all aspects of implementing and subsequent operational support of Cerner Millennium.  Responsible for working collaboratively with all Atos Cerner Millennium Solution Teams Consultants for the delivery of migration services at the client engagement level.  Minimum Qualifications: Assigned to and works with the Cerner Millennium EHR migration team (domestic and global) to articulate business requirements related to client projects and operational support.Is fully compliant in the use of Atos’ “end-to-end” and “Best Practices” documented framework for EHR migration initiatives, abides by all defined processes, activities and goals to maintain the repeatability, leveragability and reference-ability for EHR related services.Identify opportunities, performance measurement methodologies and reporting tools necessary to improve business processes resulting in improved efficiencies and/or quality in healthcare and delivery of services to our clients.Act as a liaison between client operations, client informati, and Anthelio EHR practice service teams to ensure systems meet the functional specifications as defined by operations.Acts as a liaison between client(s) and vendor(s) related to system functionality specificationsSupports and/or leads EHR departmental and interoperability business process optimization activities as assigned for client sites.Maintains current knowledge of applicable federal and state EMR/EHR related laws and accreditation standards; monitors and communicates changes to ensure customer adaptation and compliance.Documents and maintains a knowledge base of Cerner Millennium products implemented at client sites. Mentors junior team members on product functionality, package validation as well as application solution build activities etc.Consistently demonstrates skills with thorough documentation in customer issue cases.Participates in Domain validation; package testing ; application break/fix resolution ; design change build/testing as approved by customer and other application support related activities as assigned.Serves as a Cerner Millennium SurgiNet/SurgiNet Anesthesia Subject Matter Expert in the delivery of services including but not limited to:Consults with client on workflow design; functional specifications, design, build and test changes to workflow logic in response to requested changes; provides education for build and maintenance of master tables from the EHR databaseDevelops and/or updates test scripts for all system implementations, changes and upgrades.Participates in system functional and integrated testing as assigned.Participates in change control process meetings and if fully compliant with Atos Change Management processes.Develops internal WIKI support articles/troubleshooting tipsheets for Cerner Millennium Solution analysts and Atos’ Healthcare National Service Desk.Provides knowledge transition to client staff and/or Cerner Millennium Solution teams and other sub-practice service teams to perform daily, weekly and monthly system maintenance and monitoring to ensure the good health of the systems (if applicable).Works collaboratively with all Atos Service Delivery teams to achieve high customer satisfaction levels for services delivered. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent healthcare and/or technical certification/licensing required. Registered Nurse highly desired.3-5 years of practical experience in the Cerner Millennium SurgiNet/SurgiNet ANES or Supply Chain Management required.3+ years experience in EHR system related implementations and/or application support in a healthcare environment required, hospital experience preferred. Skills & Requirements:Analytical ability to identify, analyze and evaluate market changes, create solutions to difficult administrative, technical or human situations.Effective written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills for contact with internal and external customers and peers to obtain and interpret a variety of information based on knowledge of departmental practices, hospital policies and programs and specific technical and regulatory knowledge.Must possess the ability to learn new things in a variety of ways (i.e., self learning and/or virtual classroom setting) and think innovatively for solutions to business and technical problems related to patient care/record process flow.Ability to participate on multiple projects simultaneously and remotely.Superior organizational skills.Intermediate to expert level skill in use of standard Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.Ability to travel as required by client engagement and as otherwise defined by the Atos’ Digital Healthcare Solutions Leadership team. Name: Specialist, Business Analyst
Description: If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra Energy family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online. Job DescriptionOverview:The Business Intelligence and Analytics team provides transactional and financial insights to management by analyzing trends in sales, gains, losses, margin and other key performance metrics to drive strategic and operational performance optimization. The team is also responsible for providing analytics support and reporting services for driving ongoing performance improvements for other business units.Within TXU Energy, the Specialist job function has lead and subject matter expert responsibility for analyzing and developing improvements to business processes, identifying and facilitating the creation of appropriate reporting and definition around each function, managing and integrating processes relating to operations, and delivering an improved customer experience.Responsibilities:Deliver key insights by uncovering root causes for trends in sales, gains, losses and swaps by transaction type, channel, campaign, product and over time. Ability to derive insights from complex data for presentation and decision making.Partner with our Marketing, Credit and Information Technology team to develop / deliver structured and ad-hoc reporting that supports analytical groups across the company utilizing tools such as SAS and SQL for data extraction and Tableau, Excel and others for visualization. Partner with our modeling team to create models which help improve customer retention, acquisition and improve customer value.Provide deep-dive analytical support for various sales channels, including campaign performance measurement. Focus on acquisition and retention performance optimization by analyzing current processes. Analyze financial impact of trends and opportunities leveraging business metrics of success such as NPV, PV/I etc. to develop financially justifiable recommendations.Partner with Pricing and Performance Management teams to build and further improve relevant business cases. Perform sensitivity analyses for key assumptions and market scenarios, as necessary.Partner with business functions across the company and with acquisition, retention and service channels, including reactive and targeted call centers, Door to door, DM, Online and others to provide relevant, insightful, timely and accurate views of performance and incentive reportingRequirements:Bachelors with 5+ years or Masters plus 2+ years of relevant industry experienceExcellent business, financial and analytical acumenPrior experience in extracting and analyzing large volume of data using SAS / SQL or other large data analysis tools. Very strong Microsoft Excel & Power-point skillsExperience in a customer-focused and/or relationship building roleProject Management / Planning & Leadership SkillsStrong problem solving and analytical skills•Prior experience in creating visual dashboards using tools like Tableau is highly preferredExcellent inter-personal, communication skill and Presentation skillsPrior experience in big data technologies like Hadoop/HANA, Voice Analytics desirablePrior experience in Web technologies desirablePrior experience with data modeling desirable Very high level of initiative in terms of learning the business and designing valuable analysesOn-time production of analyses and results of the highest integrity and qualityAbility to adapt and work in complex and ever changing environmentDevelopment of clear, concise, and effective executive level reporting and presentationsJob FamilyGeneral ServicesCompanyTXU Retail Services CompanyLocationsIrving, TexasTexasWe are a company of people committed to: Exceeding Customer Expectations, Great People, Teamwork, Competitive Spirit and Effective Communication. If this describes you, then you will have a good career here!If you currently work for Vistra Energy, TXU or Luminant please apply via the internal career site.

Name: Budget Analyst
Description: Kenneth Copeland Ministries reaches out with uncompromised Bible teaching focused on faith, love, healing, prosperity and restoration. Additionally, over the years, more than 60 million people have responded to the message of salvation through our ministry efforts. Together with the prayer and support of our Partners, we are impacting the world for Jesus Christ and changing lives every day! BUDGET ANALYSTAccounting 8:00am - 6:00pm Monday through Thursday POSITION SUMMARY: Budget analyst provides support to ministry managers and directors. The budget analyst is responsible for providing assistance and analysis during the budget-development process. The budget analyst must be able to, on a periodic and ongoing basis, look at the departmental budgets to assess current expenditures compared to budget. This analysis must include the development and use of quantitative measures to be able to properly assess the status of budgetary goals and direct the future decision-making on organizational expenditures. The budget analyst must also be able to present this information to management, executives, and other team members in a clear, comprehensive manner that allows individuals without extensive financial training to understand the current and future budget situation. Works with leadership to develop departmental budgets and forecasts. Integrates as part of the team for the managers and directors they support, becoming informed and aware of the team’s operations. PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Prepare monthly financial and report packages for distribution to management team.Conduct monthly budget meetings with management team.Support accounting activities within the department to ensure accurate recording and reporting of expenses, projects and revenue.Directs compilation of data based on statistical studies.Analyze past and current years to prepare budgets and to justify funds requested.Review operating budgets periodically to analyze trends affecting budget needs.The Budget Analyst will also consult with management to ensure changes or new initiatives are quantified, in order to facilitate accurate long-term planning.Direct preparation of regular and special budget reports to interpret budget directives and to establish policies for carrying out directives.Assist with special projects.KEY SKILLS REQUIRED: Ability to analyze problems reach objective conclusions, prepare and make oral/written presentations in a clear, concise and compelling manner - Verbal Reasoning, Logical Reasoning, Numerical Reasoning Ability to apply a high level of sound, independent judgment in the administration of a collaborative budget management program. - Logical reasoning, team work Attention to detail and strong analysis skills - abstract reasoning, quantitative aptitude Excellent written and verbal communication skills - verbal ability Financial analysis experience - accounting and financeJOB REQUIREMENTS:Education and Experience:Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Accounting (preferred) or Bachelor’s degree in Business.One to three years of related experience is required.Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Ability to define problems, collect data, and draw valid conclusions and reports is required.Excellent listening, analytical and problem-solving skills are required.Ability to work independently on assignments or projects, while working cooperatively in a team environment.Ability to work effectively on multiple projects or tasks concurrently and prioritize to meet deadlines.Adept at using Microsoft Excel.Experience with or ability to learn ERP, Reporting and Budgeting software.Good organizational skills are a necessity.Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills.Working knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures used in accounting, planning and budgeting.EQUIPMENT TO BE USED:Standard office equipment, including, but not limited to: computer, calculator, facsimile, telephone, copier and printers.TYPICAL PHYSICAL DEMANDS:Must be able to sit at a desk and/or computer for a minimum of 7.5 hours per day.Requires manual dexterity sufficient to operate standard office machines such as computers, fax machines, calculators, telephones and other office equipment.Requires normal range of hearing and vision.Must be able to walk or move to and from various conference or meeting room locations throughout ministry buildings.TYPICAL MENTAL DEMANDS:Must have the ability to give, receive, and quickly analyze information, formulate work plans, prepare written materials and articulate goals and action plans.Must be organized and detailed.Must be task and goal oriented with minimum supervision required.Must be able to strategize and think analytically.Must have the ability to multi-task.Must have a good command of the English language.Must adapt well and react favorably to changing work situations and be able to grasp and apply new ideas.Must relate and interact favorably with people across departments and at all levels of the organization.WORKING CONDITIONS:Works in a secured office environment.

Strong MS Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint).Must possess high standards of ethics and integrity.Excellent written and verbal communications skills to communicate with all levels of staff.Strong relationship building skills.Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting or Finance from an accredited college/university.Prefer 1-3 years progressive financial experience in a manufacturing environment.

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences. We are seeking a Financial Analyst for our Commercial Programs group. This position supports all financial analysis requirements for Bell’s Commercial Programs organization and serves as a vital member of the Finance team. Position Responsibilities: • Ensure the correctness of month end consolidations and closing, including coordination with Bell Finance organizations across worldwide sites and their intercompany accounting processes. • Understand actual results/costs - especially through variance analysis vs. prior forecast and the annual plan. • Utilize variance analysis to develop ideas to drive improved margins through cross functional teams. • Initiate and coordinate business case analysis. • Works across departmental lines to support the implementation of system enhancements to improve the accessibility, accuracy and reliability of information. • Coordinate, distribute, and track performance of labor hour and material cost budgets for major proposals coordinating with Pricing to ensure alignment of expectations and proper variance analysis. • Works closely with Program Management, Information Technology, Contracts, Procurement, Subcontract Evaluation, Pricing, Accounting, Financial Planning and Analysis and other functional organizations as required. • Support offset budget tracking and quarterly reporting. • This position is responsible for budget, investment and cost center planning for annual and long-range planning. • Provide monthly forecast updates and metrics packages in support of Program Management objectives. • Identify risks and opportunities and initiate action plans to avoid negative impacts. • This position is responsible for the execution and updates, as required, of workflows in compliance with Textron policies and Sarbanes-Oxley. Education Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration - or a related field of stud.yPosition Requirements:At least 2 years of professional Finance or Accounting experience in a GAAP and Sarbanes Oxley environment Strong Microsoft Office knowledge, including MS Excel Ability to build moderately complex financial modelsMust have the ability to work well in a groupMust be able to take initiative to proactively seek out root cause issues and find solutions to business issues.Strong Intellectual Curiosity to learn about the complexities of the business and the why’s and to gain knowledge of best of practices in Finances to positively impact the business. Ability to build strong collaborative business relationships Preferred Skills and Experience:SAP experience is highly preferred.A self-motivator is highly preferredDon’t miss the chance to join a diverse, inclusive environment where you feel a sense of belonging. As a member of our global workforce, you will collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where unique experiences, backgrounds and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.

Name: Fraud Analyst
Description: It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!  We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.  Compliance Specialist I performs a variety of administrative tasks to support other Fraud Compliance Specialists and a Fraud Compliance Manager to meet the requirements of the assigned regulatory area of the Compliance Management Program which includes researching, reviewing, and interpreting existing and pending laws and regulations.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities  + Assists with researching, reviewing, and interpreting existing and pending laws and regulations, which potentially affect the assigned regulatory area, such as FACTA, BSA, Compliance, etc.  + Works directly with the Fraud Compliance Specialists and Fraud Compliance Manager to meet the requirements of the Compliance Management Program, which includes associate training, conducting internal assessments, and board reports.  + Provides ongoing assistance and support to the Fraud compliance manager in administrative responsibilities.  + Ensures that all departmental documents and activities are performed in compliance with applicable laws, regulations, policies and procedures as applicable to this position, including completion of required compliance training.  + Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned. Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Skills + Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence and memos.  + Ability to read and interpret documents such as procedure manuals, general business correspondence and/or journals or government regulations.  + Ability to read, analyze and interpret financial report and/or legal documents.  + Ability to write simple-to-business correspondence, routine reports, and procedures.  + Ability to respond in writing to customer complaints, regulatory agencies or members of the business community.  Education and/or Experience  + BS/BA Degree (4 year) from an accredited university /college or two to four years? experience in equivalent compliance position, preferred.  Specialized Training  + None  Computer Skills  + MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook  Other Qualifications (including physical requirements)  + Must have good time management, communication, and organizational skills. These programs require positive action in lieu of neutral non-discrimination and merit hiring/performance policies.  Since 1903, Simmons Bank has been dedicated to helping people and businesses realize their financial dreams. Simmons is the subsidiary bank for Simmons First National Corporation (NASDAQ: SFNC), a publicly traded bank holding company headquartered in Pine Bluff, Arkansas. After merging with First Texas BHC, Inc., parent company of Southwest Bank, and Southwest Bancorp, Inc., parent company of Bank SNB, Simmons First National Corporation has grown steadily to more than $14 billion in assets along with 2,700 associates located in Arkansas, Colorado, Kansas, Missouri, Oklahoma, Tennessee and Texas. Name: Price Cost Analyst
Description: Description:This position will be responsible for complex supplier proposals. Some of the responsibilities will include reviewing supplier proposals, cost and pricing data submitted and all other factors provided by supplier in support of their proposal. The selected candidate will also confer with suppliers and analyze supplier operations to determine factors that affect price. They will prepare reports and charts that present findings, negotiate standard and non-standard contracts with suppliers, maintain communications to ensure timely contract execution by parties, and provide final contract negotiation documents that are consistent with agreements reached in negotiations. Finally, this position will also plan and participate in training of Price/Cost Analysis practices and negotiation techniques to company personnel. This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance and will also require travel. Must be a US Citizen. Name: Operations Analyst Staff
Description: Description:Lockheed Martin is looking for world-class talent in Operations Analysis to join our historic Skunk Works team located in Fort Worth. We need extraordinary people who are passionate about working on cutting-edge design or technology; comfortable with ambiguity; enjoy being part of a team; driven to learn and explore new areas; willing to think strategically and creatively with proven analytical & engineering problem-solving skills.As a member of the Operations Analysis organization, the candidate will be performing cost modeling and analysis of military systems to quantify domestic and international budgetary assessments, aircraft procurement cost, operations and sustainment cost, force mix/structure sizing, and acquisition programs. Responsibilities will include researching military systems performance and operations, modeling cost effectiveness metrics for domestic and international force structures, generating Operating and Support (O&S) cost assessments, and providing various force structure assessment trades. In this role, the individual will act as the Operations Analysis Cost lead. The selected candidate will be a member of a high-performing multi-site team and must be self-motivated with a strong work ethic, time-management, and interpersonal skills. The ability to work in a dynamic, multi-disciplinary team environment is critical. This individual will be in the Aeronautics Strategic Planning Operations Analysis team; however, their focus will be to provide analysis products to the Strategic Studies Group. This will include air combat force structure, force mix, and budgetary cost assessments supporting the ASBD organization. This candidate will develop and apply methods for evaluating emerging war fighting concepts and technologies. They will collaborate with leadership to define study objectives, identify Measures of Effectives, select/develop analytical approaches, execute analysis, and communicate of results. This individual may also be called on to support analysis for any program/platform needed within the Operations Analysis organization.Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. An Active Secret Security Clearance with a current background investigation is required to start. Name: Senior Analyst - Cerner Millennium
Description: Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with pro forma annual revenue of circa € 12 billion and circa 100,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.  Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, Unify and Worldline.  Position Title:  Senior Analyst - Cerner Millennium  Location:  Remote, US Wide  Core Responsibilities:  Serve as Senior Electronic Health Record (EHR) subject matter expert for the provision of any combination of two or more Cerner Millennium Clinical Solutions (SurgiNet; SurgiNet ANES; CareNet or PharmNet). Scope of duties include all aspects of implementing and subsequent operational support of Cerner Millennium.  Responsible for working collaboratively with all Atos Cerner Millennium Solution Teams Consultants for the delivery of migration services at the client engagement level.  Minimum Qualifications: Assigned to and works with the Cerner Millennium EHR migration team (domestic and global) to articulate business requirements related to client projects and operational support.Is fully compliant in the use of Atos’ “end-to-end” and “Best Practices” documented framework for EHR migration initiatives, abides by all defined processes, activities and goals to maintain the repeatability, leveragability and reference-ability for EHR related services.Identify opportunities, performance measurement methodologies and reporting tools necessary to improve business processes resulting in improved efficiencies and/or quality in healthcare and delivery of services to our clients.Act as a liaison between client operations, client informati, and Anthelio EHR practice service teams to ensure systems meet the functional specifications as defined by operations.Acts as a liaison between client(s) and vendor(s) related to system functionality specificationsSupports and/or leads EHR departmental and interoperability business process optimization activities as assigned for client sites.Maintains current knowledge of applicable federal and state EMR/EHR related laws and accreditation standards; monitors and communicates changes to ensure customer adaptation and compliance.Documents and maintains a knowledge base of Cerner Millennium products implemented at client sites. Mentors junior team members on product functionality, package validation as well as application solution build activities etc.Consistently demonstrates skills with thorough documentation in customer issue cases.Participates in Domain validation; package testing ; application break/fix resolution ; design change build/testing as approved by customer and other application support related activities as assigned.Serves as a Cerner Millennium SurgiNet/SurgiNet Anesthesia Subject Matter Expert in the delivery of services including but not limited to:Consults with client on workflow design; functional specifications, design, build and test changes to workflow logic in response to requested changes; provides education for build and maintenance of master tables from the EHR databaseDevelops and/or updates test scripts for all system implementations, changes and upgrades.Participates in system functional and integrated testing as assigned.Participates in change control process meetings and if fully compliant with Atos Change Management processes.Develops internal WIKI support articles/troubleshooting tipsheets for Cerner Millennium Solution analysts and Atos’ Healthcare National Service Desk.Provides knowledge transition to client staff and/or Cerner Millennium Solution teams and other sub-practice service teams to perform daily, weekly and monthly system maintenance and monitoring to ensure the good health of the systems (if applicable).Works collaboratively with all Atos Service Delivery teams to achieve high customer satisfaction levels for services delivered. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent healthcare and/or technical certification/licensing required. Registered Nurse highly desired.3-5 years of practical experience in the Cerner Millennium SurgiNet/SurgiNet ANES or Supply Chain Management required.3+ years experience in EHR system related implementations and/or application support in a healthcare environment required, hospital experience preferred. Skills & Requirements:Analytical ability to identify, analyze and evaluate market changes, create solutions to difficult administrative, technical or human situations.Effective written and verbal communication skills and interpersonal skills for contact with internal and external customers and peers to obtain and interpret a variety of information based on knowledge of departmental practices, hospital policies and programs and specific technical and regulatory knowledge.Must possess the ability to learn new things in a variety of ways (i.e., self learning and/or virtual classroom setting) and think innovatively for solutions to business and technical problems related to patient care/record process flow.Ability to participate on multiple projects simultaneously and remotely.Superior organizational skills.Intermediate to expert level skill in use of standard Microsoft Office products such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.Ability to travel as required by client engagement and as otherwise defined by the Atos’ Digital Healthcare Solutions Leadership team. Name: Business Analyst, Sr - IS
Description: SCOPE The Sr. Business Analyst works with and establishes solid relationships with the Department Management, IS Managers, Mouser Executives, and other “key” individuals. The Business Analyst will analyze department processes, requirements, and user requirements; develop functional design; be the functional subject matter expert (SME); document business and technical requirements; establish priorities for requirements; identify process improvements; develop test plans; prepare workflow documentation; develop and gain approvals on Project Charters; and maintain clear, timely communications with all interested parties. ACCOUNTABILITIES This position functions at a Sr. level in all aspects of the position including being a ‘go to’ person for the other Business Analysts within the department.  Expected to learn, develop and maintain a strong Mouser business acumen and use it with each assignment.  Meet with Company Executives to learn strategy, tactical approaches, priorities, requirements, and business process.  Document business requirements, may develop and oversee project plans, oversee and coordinate the development of technical specifications.  Establish open, fluid and timely communications with all interested parties, stakeholders and the project team. This could include all levels of participants from Company Executives to individual contributors.  Expected to utilize organizational skills to document, categorize, prioritize, provide easy access to information, ask questions, follow up, and maintain communications.  Must take initiative to spend time with all levels of users (formal meetings, informal meetings, observing work, etc.)  Collaborate with developers, quality assurance, business teams and technical support to provide a mix of business and technical direction on systems, design, development, testing and deployment.  Is required to develop and maintain project schedules with appropriate input, including all necessary activities and dependencies.  Develop and maintain all Project Documentation as defined by Mouser’s IS Policies and Procedures.  Represents the company and IS in a professional manner.  Mentor associates and foster a learning and growth environment.  Establishes and maintains effective relationships with internal and external contacts.  Team-player/leader.  Works with minimum supervision and makes independent judgments.  Arrives on time to work hours needed to fulfill assigned responsibilities. QUALIFICATIONSEDUCATION & EXPERIENCE Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline or equivalent required.  At least 2 years’ experience as a Business Analyst or Associate Business Analyst role. SKILLS & CERTIFICATIONS • Demonstrated skills with project management tools and methodologies, software development lifecycle, and software methodologies (waterfall, agile, prototyping, JAD, SCRUM)  • Working knowledge of databases (SQL, Oracle, Sybase, Access, PICK, UV) and experienced with data mining, gap analysis and business models  • Ability to define functional (specific business goals) and non-functional (performance, external interfaces, security, training) requirements and develop a business hypothesis based on analyzed data  • Exhibits strong analytical, problem solving, negotiation, organizational and teaching skills  • Interacts effectively with individuals and groups inside and outside the organization  • Excellent verbal and non-verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly describe business problems or processes to technical and non-technical audiences  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and priorities with a strong attention to detail  • Demonstrated success in leading cross-functional teams  • Strong ability to work in teams with a collaborative interpersonal style.  • Demonstrates a positive attitude toward self and others  • Ability to set and track goals  • Available to work early, late and weekends when needed to fulfill assigned responsibilities  • PC experience in a Microsoft Windows environment, proficient with internet e-mail, Microsoft Visio, Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook and other software  • Able to use, read, and interpret spreadsheets, printed reports, and terminal screen  • Ability to analyze business processes and workflows  • Strong skills in Process Mapping and Business Process Reengineering  • Lean Six Sigma experience a plus This is a summary of the primary accountabilities and requirements for this position. The company reserves the right to modify or amend accountabilities and requirements at any time at its sole discretion based on business needs. Any part of this job description is subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

Name: Treasury Management Sales Analyst
Description: Location - Fort Worth, TX POSITION SUMMARY:  The Treasury Sales Analyst is an assertive, sales focused individual supporting Treasury Management Sales Officers and their sales of Treasury Management solutions to LegacyTexas’s Commercial and Retail clients and prospects. The individual has strong computer skills to assist with sales management, presentations, reporting, product and solution documents, and models for analyzing markets, revenue and profitability, pricing, etc. The individual may evaluate referrals from Retail colleagues in our branches and call center, follow up accordingly to deliver new revenue, and coordinate to ensure Retail colleagues understand the LegacyTexas Treasury Management solution set and the appropriate positioning thereof to Retail clients and prospects. The individual will serve as a back-up to the Treasury Management Sales Team for issue escalation and resolution. The role is intended to provide the individual the development of professional skills, business acumen, and financial service industry knowledge to become a Treasury Management Sales Officer. PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:Support Treasury Management Sales Officers with sales management, presentations, reports, collateral review and design, product review and enhancements, analysis of markets, portfolios, revenue, profitability, and pricing, and other duties as requestedMay support the sale of Treasury Management solutions to Retail clients and prospectsReview and respond to referrals from Retail colleagues requiring a fast paced analysis and professional communication to deliver new revenue and manage expectations of Retail clients, prospects, and colleaguesPrepare and ensure proper execution of onboarding documentation for Treasury Management solutions sold to Retail clients/prospectsProvide ongoing education to Retail colleagues of the LegacyTexas suite of Treasury Management solutions and appropriate positioning thereofSupport the LegacyTexas Treasury Management Sales Team across its sales efforts including but not limited to presentation development, pricing proforma generation, responses to Requests for Proposals, precall preparation, relationship reviews, and account structuresAccompany Treasury Management Sales Officers on sales callsPrepare and ensure execution of all Treasury Management on-boarding documentsMonitor implementation from beginning to end to ensure deadlines are met and client expectation is met or exceededReview first Account Analysis statement to ensure the client is invoice for all implemented servicesAssist with management of relationships including but not limited to renewals of limits for operating exposure, resolving service issues, training clients/prospects in use of Treasury Management solutions, and direct communication with clients/prospects in coordination with colleagues across LegacyTexasMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS (EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, & SKILLS):Bachelor’s degree in Business or related degree or equivalent work experienceFinancial services internship or equivalent preferredDemonstrated willingness to learn, implement feedback, and take actionAbility to develop working relationships with clients/prospects and colleaguesAbility to work independentlyExcellent verbal and written communication skillsStrong time management, organizational, and planning skillsStrategic thinking skillsAbility to use various PC and internet-based systems including but not limited to Word, PowerPoint, and ExcelStrong cultural sensitivity and awarenessUnderstanding of accounting, finance, and cash management principles and practicesStrong understanding of working capital and the cash conversion cycle including identification of their key components and driversAbility to create proformas and understand formulas involved in analysisAbility to read financial statementsExcellent presentation skills to develop customized presentations for internal and external useExcellent PC skills using spreadsheet and word processing softwareDemonstrated resourcefulness and ability to research issues and conflicts for best resolutionsOur commitment to diversity and inclusion is helping us to create not only a great place to work, but also an environment where our employees, our customers and our communities can reach their goals and connect with each other. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or protected veteran status. We are an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.Drug free work environment.

Name: Geospatial Services Analyst - Senior
Description: Job DescriptionPosition summary: Under limited supervision, in alignment with the TRWD Geospatial Services department vision, utilize advanced GIS concepts and technology to contribute to TRWD’s Enterprise GIS, supporting all TRWD departments and functions including, but not to be limited to, engineering, operations, facility management, asset management, water transmission, planning, environmental, conservation, watershed modeling, terrain/image processing, as well as other business and customer functions. Independently perform highly complex GIS projects and tasks that develop, enhance, and maintain TRWD’s Enterprise GIS. Perform database design and maintenance, application development, and apply advanced GIS concepts and principles to quickly solve multifaceted spatial problems. Qualifications required:Bachelor’s degree in GIS, Geography, Computer Science, Survey, Geomatics or related discipline or any combination equivalent of experience and education.Must have four (4) years of progressive experience with Esri ArcGIS (Desktop, Enterprise, Applications), database management in SQL Server environment.A Master’s degree in GIS or similar field with GIS-directed course work may be substituted for one (1) year of experience.Understand principles of GIS technology. Strong understanding of an Enterprise GIS.Strong critical thinking skills. The ability to quickly form your own opinion from a variety of different sources and provide results in the form of tangible deliverables.Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment and must be at a level to perform a high percentage of tasks independently.Qualifications desired:Certified Geographic Information System Professional (GISP).Experience working with Latitude Geographics’ Geocortex products, Esri ArcGIS Online, or custom web application development.Experience integrating GIS into multiple facets in an organization, such as integration with business functions (asset management, hydrology, surface modeling).Demonstrated experience with linear referencing concepts.Knowledge of programming languages.Valid Texas driver license.Essential functions and responsibilities:Assist in the administration of TRWD’s Enterprise GIS: Administer, maintain, license, and upgrade the ArcGIS Platform.Monitor server performance, troubleshoot performance and software issues.Recommend hardware needs, assist in the procurement and integration of new software.Ability to manage, maintain, and create web and mobile applications using either Latitude Geographics products, ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Online, and Esri developer tools.Identify database discrepancies and inconsistencies, recommend and implement database schema changes and design, implement and enforce database quality control and assurance.Coordinate with the TRWD Information Systems department on Enterprise GIS technology.As directed, serve as Geospatial Services project manager utilizing industry standard project management concepts and best practices; managing projects from inception to implementation.Provide oversight of projects and tasks assigned to external consultants and Geospatial Services staff. Coordinates the delivery of GIS services and products to external consultants.Utilizes ArcGIS software to visualize, manipulate, display, create, edit, query and analyze data stored in TRWD’s Enterprise GIS, and ensures GIS/GPS data is accurate, useable, and current.Advance experience in maintaining and analyzing elevations models, performing advanced spatial analysis, and integrating and using linear reference concepts.Capable of interpreting Engineering plans and related documents.Responsible for fulfilling map and data requests from District staff.Maintain proper user and system documentation.Nonessential functions, skills and experience:Working knowledge of Trimble survey equipment and the implementation of that data into GIS.Ability of automating GIS process tasks (ModelBuilder, and/or programming).Understanding of state procurement laws. Ability to review contracts and write proposals.Performs other duties as required.Success factors/job competencies:Proficient knowledge of Esri ArcGIS Desktop, ArcSDE within a Microsoft SQL Server environment, ArcGIS Enterprise, general database design, operation and maintenance, and maintaining a multi-user editing environment.Exercise sound independent judgment within established guidelines and timelines.Must have vast knowledge of and be self-sufficient with spatial analysis processes utilizing GIS, have good analytical and communication skills, and have an aptitude for brainstorming and problem solving.Thorough knowledge and ability to apply industry standard concepts and best practices to plan, organize, and complete multiple complex Geospatial Services projects and tasks efficiently.The ability to assess GIS user needs, identify geographic and information management issues and opportunities, analyze problems and assess alternative solutions, develop sound conclusions and recommendations, prioritize and carry out assigned projects to most effectively meet user needs in a timely manner.Establish and maintain effective working relationships with managers, co-workers, representatives of other departments and divisions, and professionals in other public agencies.Self-starter, strong work ethic with attention to detail in the quality control and assurance of their work.Ability to handle and prioritize multiple work demands, ability to complete all tasks assigned by given deadlines.Positive attitude with a team orientated focus.May require working long or unusual hours.Physical demands and work environment: The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Physical demands: While performing duties of job, employee is required to stand; walk; sit; use hand to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; balance; stoop; talk or hear. Employee must be able lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.Work environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee may walk on difficult terrain, climb ladders, and enter into confined spaces. This position may require outdoor work in weather conditions prevalent at the time.Equipment Use: Esri ArcGIS software, Trimble surveying equipment & software, personal computer, printer, plotter, calculator, specialized equipment (survey instruments, GPS devices, cathodic protection meters, laser range finder, etc…).

Name: IT Business Sr. Analyst
Description: Job Background/Context: This position provides information and insights to the CTI Strategic Support team. The individual in this role will be exposed to CTI’s regional and sector functions, CTI CAO/Business Operations teams, as well as Finance and HR in support of the ongoing maturation and evolution of CTI to an agile yet consistently governed organization.  This position requires strong analytical and detailed thinking, highly collaborative and open mindset, and ability to work in “ambiguity” and through iterations. Familiarity with governance models, driving technology and business process analysis/reengineering efforts is critical. Additional knowledge of SDLC and Agile concepts is beneficial. Key Responsibilities:Provides in-depth analysis and critical thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and make recommendations that influence decisions of key business partners.Utilizes multiple data sources to validate analytics and assumptions, driving conception and publication of data-driven findings, recommended actions and outputs which feed larger CTI Strategic Support activities.Utilizes assorted tools/technology (MS PowerPoint, Access, Excel) and tools to automate data gathering and analysis. Rapidly acquires knowledge of target domains (business/function as well as technology), and leverages prior experience, Citi knowledge and subject matter expertise to drive development of key insights and actions.Works independently, in small teams, or directly with Head of CTI Strategic Support to distill volume of data and analysis into actionable insights and executive-level summaries. Contributes to development of improvement/change strategies.Assists Strategic Support team to perform strategic evaluations, identify potential gaps and implement corrective actions. Possesses a good understanding of client core business functions.  About Citi  Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.  Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.  Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all. Skills:Demonstrated thought leadership in financial analysis, organizational strategy, process re-engineering (six sigma, Agile, Lean, etc.) and other transformation capabilitiesStrong ability to navigate and drive progress in challenging situations.Analytical, driven self-starter with a passion for decomposing complex problems and deliverables, obtaining and analyzing data, deriving actionable insights, and developing succinct, well-crafted summaries and recommendations suitable for publication directly to senior CTI leadership.Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet assigned deadlines.Organized, accurate and detail oriented.Motivated and a quick learner.Advanced skill and proficiency with MS PowerPoint, Excel (data acquisition, analysis, pivot tables), Access & other analysis tools.Strong Presentation skills in PowerPoint.Ability to work with multi-disciplinary teams effectively under pressure in a rapidly changing environment.Proven ability to be comfortable and adaptive with ambiguity. Ability to exchange complex information within team and with others. Knowledge/Experience:Business process, workflow, financial, business analysis and project delivery.Knowledge in one or more areas of Core Infrastructure / Data Centre Technologies.Broad-based knowledge of other functional and technical areas.Ability to exercise judgment and evaluate options under circumstances not covered by procedures or precedents.

Name: Flight Dispatcher/Records Analyst
Description: Description:Flight Operations Analyst. Responsible for a multitude of tasks as assigned by the Chief of Fighter Flight Operations and Lead Dispatcher, supporting fighter flight operations worldwide. Responsible for daily, weekly and monthly tracking of aircrew qualifications, currencies and training. Maintaining training records for all flight crew.  Completing monthly reports for distribution. Scheduling appointments for flight crew as needed (physicals, altitude chamber, etc). Providing support for visiting dignitaries and corporate aircraft. Supporting execution of the daily flight schedule to include pre-flight planning, weather briefing, scheduling airspace, real-time monitoring of weather and aircraft during flight operations, and post-flight support. Assisting the Lead Dispatcher in completion of required aircrew documentation as assigned. Executing emergency procedures in the case of aircraft mishaps and conducting mishap drills. Participating in audits on processes and record keeping. Must be capable of developing and maintaining a positive working relationship across internal and external organizations to include DCMA, FAA, LM Aero programs, and the Joint Reserve Base, Fort Worth. Attention to detail a must.  Must have a valid passport. This position will require both domestic and international travel. Basic Qualifications: Experience with Microsoft Office products.  Experience making presentations to large and small groups.  Experience organizing large amounts of data  Customer relations experience. Desired Skills: FAA licensed pilot, FAA licensed Aircraft Dispatcher, or Air Traffic Controller experience.  Familiarity with aircrew currency and training requirements.  Experience using a flight operations database such as Flight Operations Software (FOS). BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. Theyre dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Name: IT BUS SYS ANALYST
Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences. Bell has an open position for a IT Business Systems Analyst that will support Customer and Vendor Master Data Management including maintaining business processes and governance in the Master Data space. Responsibilities:Support end users and provide leadership and facilitation to the functional business owners. Exhibit good organizational and problem-solving skills to help resolve end user problems and process changes or enhancements for all of Bell’s Master data functional requirements at all locations.Analyze and model existing business processes. The goal of business process analysis is to understand and document current business procedures and identify areas for improvement. Perform analysis, scope projects, and work with the Process Lead to prioritize deliverablesInput customer request (Vendor and Customer Data)Define/extract reports for group and end users and functional ownersPerform data corrections for end users.Draft updates and releases of related Master Data policies and procedures with Process Leads for their review and acceptance when their organizations are impacted.Identifying areas of improvement to enhance efficiencies within the enterprise.Maintain data issue logs and reports; resolve business data definition issuesProvides analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation.Maintain Master Data SharePoint site and related playbooksParticipates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.Assist with the definition, documentation, maintenance, and communications of data business definitions, standards, quality rules and methods.Demonstrable experience using Microsoft products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Visio.These responsibilities will result in the following outcomes:System Data Integrity Evolved business process and procedures to meet business needs. Required EducationBachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Business Information Systems or other similar or related Bachelors degreeRequired Skills and ExperienceAt least 3 years’ experience in relevant Master Data Management area or Supply Chain / CSS experience working with Customers / Vendors in SAP managing data and technical skill set.Ability to communicate well with vendors, customers and internal Bell teams orally, visually and in written communication skills.Preferred Skills and Experience Exposure to multiple database technologies and reporting tools including SAP, SharePoint, Enovia, or CAMS.Prior Industry experience with a US Government supplier Relocation Assistance is not available for this position. Don’t miss the chance to join a diverse, inclusive environment where you feel a sense of belonging. As a member of our global workforce, you will collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where unique experiences, backgrounds and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.

Name: Principal Business and Financial Analyst Airline Solutions
Description: Req ID: 43279Job Family: ManagementSabre is the global leader in innovative technology that leads the travel industry. We are always looking for bright and driven people who have a penchant for technology and want to hone their skills. If you are interested in challenging work, being part of a global team, and solving complex problems through technology, business intelligence and analytics, and Agile practices - then Sabre is right for you!
