Name: Sr. Business Process Analyst
Description: Overview Trend Micro: Securing Your Journey to the Cloud Trend Micro, the world’s largest independent security software company, strives to make the world a safer place by protecting digital information. Our solutions for consumers, businesses and governments provide layered security to protect information on mobile devices, endpoints, gateways, servers and the cloud. Trend Micro enables the smart protection of information, with innovative technology that is simple to deploy and manage, and security that fits an evolving ecosystem. Our solutions are supported by over 5000 employees in over 50 countries and powered by the world’s most advanced cloud-based global threat intelligence, the Trend Micro™ Smart Protection Network™.  This position will be the point of contact and business partner for day to day management of CRM and PRM System (currently Saleforce.com). The Business Process Analyst will also be responsible for ongoing stakeholder management with issues, enhancements, general application direction, and guidance. Business Process Analyst will work closely with the business stakeholders and provide project management, business process analysis expertise and deliver world class support to the business.  Duties & Responsibilities The Business Process Analyst will work with business and functional teams to gather requirements, design quality solutions, and create business specificationsThe Business Process Analyst will lead the functional responsibilities & process design, implementation and administrative operational support, depending on the stage of system lifecycle.The role works closely with the Subject Matter Experts, the customer base and internal and external IT technical teams and service providers implementing application requirements and supporting business applications deployment and systems operational needs.This position will develop and conduct testing for applications, document business processes, developing test scripts and user guide, conduct training of end users and resolve problems with CRM and PRM applications.This position will Lead, manage and communicate project expectations and solutions to team members and business usersWork with the cross functional teams in helping them create quality design documents and in developing quality Products within the scheduled timelineCollaborate with business users to identify opportunities to further utilize Salesforce.com to achieve business goals, new functionality, reports & dashboardsManage solution scope, changes to requirements, and requirements conflictsIdentify stakeholders of the work effort, how they are impacted, and what their needs and roles are to effectively engage in the effortTranslate design specifications by co-working with both internal and external teams of developers and other functional analysts while ensuring all nuances of the requirements are understood and executed per requirements.Manage all aspects of assigned projects from initiating to closure following Trend Micro’s defined process and quality standard.Support users with day to day issues and be a front line support partner for issue resolution. Qualifications/Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or related field. MBA/MS preferred.com certificate is a big plus.Experience gathering and documenting system requirements and documenting system functional design for business applications package solutions and related implementation issues from a functional perspective.Experience with enterprise wide system implementation, integration, interfaces and data conversion.Demonstrated experience in business analysis on large complex projects.Demonstrated experience working with diverse set of users (Sales, Marketing, Technical Support)Strong business knowledge in Account Management/Cleanse, Opportunity/Lead management, Quote, Case Management, Partner Portal management, and BI functionalities5+ years of combined working experience in business process analysis, system analysis or project management roles5+ years of CRM experienceStrong problem solving skills, should be able to research and understand an undocumented set up and application testing of developed functionalityUse T-SQL to query data in RMDB.Previous exposure with Marketing tools (Marketo) and technologies highly desiredDemonstrated problem solving and analytical skillsAbility to work in a fast paced environment, multi-task multiple critical priorities simultaneously, and have excellent organization skillsExcellent facilitation, influencing and negotiation skills.Must be flexible to working with global teams and stakeholders across time zones during issue resolution and project execution. Trend Micro provides equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. Trend Micro does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy and childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care leave status, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation, or gender identity.

Name: SAP Business Analyst (Finance)
Description: McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payors, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. We believe in the importance of strong, vital organizations because we know that patients can only be healthy when our system is healthy.  Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—by joining McKesson you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company—and of healthcare. At McKesson, you’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.  We understand the importance of a system that works together. Your expertise, drive and passion can help us improve everything we touch, from providers to payors to pharmacies. Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career.  Wherever you contribute here at McKesson, you will have the ability to make a real impact in the lives of others.Position DescriptionAct as a core member of the integrated SAP application development SCRUM Finance team responsible for leading enhancements projects in a highly complex and integrated IT landscape in FI-GL, AR, AP, Banking, Asset Accounting, Inter-Company Reporting, Financial Analytics Reporting, Financial Consolidation with Hyperion, Special Purpose Ledger, Profit Center Accounting, Cost Center Accounting, Product Costing, Project Systems, COPA, BPC FunctionalRelies on experiences in Healthcare Industry and extensive SAP implementation experience to identify new applications opportunities, gather requirements, generate conceptual design, configure/prototype solution alternatives, author functional specifications, and work closely with the IT team and key business users to implement these solutionsLead discussions with key business users in order to understand needs, clarify and define problems, recommend and build solutions and lead the implementationAccountable to ensure that assigned projects and tasks are completed on time, on budget and are of high quality and comply with McKesson IT standardsWork directly with customers to take functional requirements & translate them in to functional specifications within multiple process areasLead IT solution and collaborate with IT team members, change management, project managers and key business users (preferably in Healthcare Industry)Collaborate across SAP teams (MM/SD/BW) as well as with 3rd party applications/vendors on various business to business integrations utilizing Hyperion and Siebel CRM and SAP BPC/BWCollaborate with migration team to ensure successful production deployment of code and configuration and early life support and provides technical assistance to operations and support staff during the early life support periodsIdentify opportunities for improving business processes to align with SAP and Industry best practicesParticipate in Regular Scrum Team Activities to support IT Agile methodology (daily Scrum Team Meetings; Design and Estimating; PI Planning Sessions; User Story Review and Demo’s; PI Retrospective Meetings)Minimum Requirements 8 years experience in designing, building, and implementing business solutions using information technology. Proven, significant experience in business analysis, requirements definition and deployment of business requirements to information systems. Critical Skills5 years in business analysis, requirements definition and building SAP systems solutionMinimum 5 years of SAP FICO Finance experienceInvolved in at least 2 full life cycle SAP implementations including requirements gathering, configure/prototype solution alternatives, implementing solutions as well as post go-live supportProficient in Agile software development methodologyDemonstrated experience supporting, developing or enhancing SAP FI Module with cross functional experience in SD (sales & distribution) /MM (materials management = P2P) /BW (business warehouse) environment (can have BPC – business planning and consolidation)Excellent verbal and written communication skillsAdditional Knowledge & SkillsDetailed knowledge of building system solutions in SAPDemonstrated process & configuration skills in multiple SAP functional areasGood understanding of SAP architecture, SAP solutions & modulesExpertise in SAP transactional navigation in one or more functional areas (e.g., OTC, PTP, FI)Proficiency in navigating SAP troubleshooting/monitoring tools (e.g., ST22, SM13, SM59) to assist in the resolution of complex business functional issuesProficiency in technical integration with non-SAP systems (e.g., IDOCs, ALE)Previous implementation experience on S/4 HANA Finance/ simple FinanceEducation 4-year degree in computer science or related field or equivalent experience Physical Requirements General Office Demands Benefits & Company Statement McKesson believes superior performance – individual and team – that helps us drive innovations and solutions to promote better health should be recognized and rewarded. We provide a competitive compensation program to attract, retain and motivate a high-performance workforce, and it’s flexible enough to meet the different needs of our diverse employee population.  We are in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payers, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting.  But we can’t do it without you. Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—whatever your title, whatever your role, you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company—and of healthcare. At McKesson, you’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.  McKesson is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer – minorities/females/veterans/persons with disabilities.  Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history. Agency Statement No agencies please.

Name: Risk Analyst II - Portfolio Forecasting
Description: Are you looking for a role building and maintaining complex Excel-based models? Do you have a background in data mining and analysis? Do you have business acumen that lets you "tell the story" rather than just deliver the data? Are you ready to take a challenging role with a company that embraces a culture of respect, integrity, innovation, and personal development? We may be looking for you! GM Financial's North American division, based at our corporate headquarters in Fort Worth, TX, is experiencing tremendous growth, and to support this growth our Risk Management team is ready to hire a key individual with the following attributes: Strong analytical skills Querying (coding) experience in a complex data warehouse environment Experience building and maintaining complex Excel-based models Data delivery and presentation experience with Excel and PowerPoint Acute attention to detail Can-do attitude If this description sounds like you, and you're ready to join a dynamic, growing company, check out the full job description below and apply now! About the Risk Management Forecasting Team The Risk Management Forecasting team is responsible for analyzing and projecting credit losses, delinquency, and outstanding receivables for the North America APR and Lease portfolios on a monthly and quarterly basis. The team supports multiple departments including Servicing, Corporate Finance, Pricing and Product Development. The forecast models and related analysis are also the primary framework for communicating portfolio performance trends and expectations to Executive and Senior leadership. The Risk Analyst II - Portfolio Forecasting is responsible for assisting in the design, development, and maintenance of complex portfolio forecasting models. The models are used to support corporate planning, financing and account servicing operations. In addition, this position is responsible for analysis and reporting on factors that affect portfolio performance such as delinquency, loss frequency, loss severity and bankruptcy, and payoffs. JOB DUTIES: Assist in the design, development, and maintenance of sophisticated portfolio forecasting models Utilize data mining and advanced spreadsheet skills to participate in complex portfolio forecasting, modeling, analysis, and reporting related to factors that affect portfolio performance such as delinquency, loss frequency, loss severity, bankruptcy, and payoffs Employ best practices of data analysis and validation to ensure data results are accurate Promote innovative ways to visualize and digest complex data Proactively monitor and report relevant changes in portfolio performance to management Effectively summarize and communicate portfolio performance trends, expectations, forecast methodology and results to management REPORTING RELATIONSHIP: Reports to: AVP - Portfolio Forecasting Direct Reports: none Skills Advanced with Microsoft Excel, particularly in building multi-tab, complex models Experience with Excel VBA is a plus Experience with respect to data analysis and spreadsheet modeling and/or reporting Experience with coding (SAS or SQL preferred) for data mining and manipulation Querying skills and knowledge in a data warehouse environment Demonstrated quantitative skills Acute attention to detail Effective written and verbal presentation skills Ability to interact collaboratively and proactively with internal customers Capable of managing multiple projects, including ability to coordinate and balance numerous tasks in a time-sensitive environment, under pressure, meeting deadlines Knowledge Demonstrated understanding and experience with the following: Data warehouses Data mining Reporting Data analysis and visualization techniques Understanding of the metrics utilized in monitoring the performance of a consumer lending portfolio is a plus Experience Bachelor's degree required and Master's degree (preferred) in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, MIS, or other quantitative field 3+ years of experience working with complex Excel models, querying large multi-table datasets, and data presentation required Experience in consumer loan portfolio forecasting and analysis preferred The qualified candidate will also be able to demonstrate proficiency with the following tools: Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and Word SAS and/or SQL (preferred) VBA (preferred) WORK CONDITION: Normal office environment ADDITIONAL DETAILS: GM Financial is the captive finance arm of General Motors, providing leasing and lending solutions to GM customers across the globe. As a Risk Analyst II you will be a key team member for one of the most well-known automotive organizations in the world, with a global reputation for excellence. Not only will you enjoy the stability of working for an established industry-leading company, but our continued dynamic growth will also provide you with exceptional career development opportunities and genuine potential for advancement. In addition to a competitive salary we offer a comprehensive, affordable, and flexible benefits package, offering you peace of mind and the opportunity to invest in your future. Read more about our company at www.gmfinancial.com Here is some of what we have to offer: Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage Health Savings Account and/or Flex Spending Account Life and Disability Insurance 401(K) with company match* Annual performance incentives* GM vehicle discounts for you and your family Generous paid time off (holidays, vacation, sick, personal, and floating holidays) Paid time off for volunteer work through GM Financial's Community Investment Program Learning and professional development programs * future payouts are not guaranteed and are based on annual Board approval - provided by DiceRisk Analyst II - Portfolio Forecasting

Name: Logistics Requirements & Release Analyst
Description: Description:Initiates and processes orders for logistics requirements based on customer demand, including review, research, creation, maintenance and delivery of Spares, Repairs, Kits and Support Equipment (S.E) orders in accordance with departmental and program procedures.  Works with cross-functional teams as needed to ensure timely and accurate order processing of logistics requirements. Reviews and researches customer requirements and contractual source documents to ensure order accuracy when entering requirements into software systems, such as schedule, quantity, and required delivery documentation for the fabrication or procurement of items. Performs Repair Action tasks, as required.  Creates, maintains, reviews or changes order, schedule, quantity, and/or required delivery documentation and dispositions the order including cancellation in accordance with departmental and program procedures. Adjusts on order quantities by coordinating with the requestor in current ordering system.  Reviews order position, including Mission Impaired Capability Awaiting Parts (MICAP)/Aircraft on Ground (AOG), outstanding requisitions and schedules to ensure delivery of logistics requirements in accordance with schedule and customer demand. Follows up and maintains visibility of potential schedule discrepancies and takes action to resolve.  Researches input data and submits request to create new Material Master in support of logistic requirements.  Creates the delivery document in the applicable software systems, including required documentation to deliver end items to customer.  Researches S.E. forms to assist in the audit and documentation of production lists, design change notice numbers, work orders, sales orders, reorder level, recommended quantity, preliminary and firm delivery schedules and other support control data. Processes Spares requirements orders and S.E. Release Authorizations utilizing supply documents, engineering analysis review data, and established department procedures.  Researches S.E. orders received from the customer and assures items being ordered are entered into the applicable software system. Initiates documentation to release items ordered, including quantity and delivery requirements, for fabrication or procurement.  Performs data entry for logistics demand to include order create, change, and research of material either electronically, telephonically, and/or in person for verification as appropriate. Basic Qualifications:Ability to operate general software systems, such as Microsoft Office suiteFamiliarity with logistics management systemsGood verbal and written communication skillsDesired Skills: SAP experience BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where were engineering a better tomorrow. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Hourly/Non-Exempt

Name: Analyst/Senior Analyst, Network and Schedule Planning
Description: Looking for a job where a passion for innovation, a culture of teamwork, and opportunities for growth are valued and rewarded? Youve come to the right place.  You dont have to be an airline aficionado to join Employer. It takes more than cool planes to keep us ahead of the curve, and thanks to our team of behind the scenes professionals, we do just that. As the largest airline in the world, Employer is in the business of serving the global travel needs of our customers. At the core of the Company is our commitment to each customer and each employee. We are dedicated to developing and delivering what our customers value and are willing to pay for. Customer-centric planning, innovative marketing, and an exceptional customer experience are supported by a cadre of talented people.  What does it take to join us? Were glad you asked! We expect exceptional skills in your discipline and a dedication to being the best as we relentlessly pursue our goal of being not just the largest airline in the world, but also the best airline in the world.  Fortunately, were building on almost a century of innovation and firsts in our industry and we plan to continue that tradition of excellence.  About The Job  Network Planning is currently hiring Analysts/Sr. Analysts for three separate teams: Extended Range (ER)/International, Strategic Schedules, and P1/P2/P3.  The ER/Intl team is responsible for the maintaining the active seasonal schedules for the AAG widebody fleet (757 and up) in addition to the selling schedule and a variety of ad hoc scenario schedules. Responsibilities include building aircraft routings, validating schedule feasibilities, and creating scenarios to meet the needs of the International Capacity Planning and Operational teams. The successful candidate should possess an understanding of Americans domestic and international route network and detailed experience with aircraft routings. The candidate should have the ability to manage multiple projects at one time. Candidates should be prepared to work collaboratively across NP in addition to Crew Planning, Operations Planning, Base & Line Maintenance Planning, and the Executive team.  The Strategic Schedules team develops various schedule scenarios 1-to-5 years out to validate profitability and operational feasibility. The team also supports the NP Schedule Analysis team on projects relating to hubs and infrastructure, as well as operational metrics and fleet deployment. The successful candidate should possess a vast understanding of airlines route networks and can apply this knowledge to contribute to Americans long-term vision and company goals. The candidate will be able to creatively link analysis and scheduling fundamentals in order to develop aircraft flows for flight scenarios. Candidates must display an ability to think dynamically and display the ability to work collaboratively on multiple projects at one time.  The P1, P2 and P3 teams build schedules based on development cycles. Schedulers take capacity inputs from Global Planning and ensure that all operational requirements are met. The analysts drive network value by finding opportunities to improve timings, increase utilization and/or optimize markets for aircraft size through creative scheduling and problem solving. Schedulers also serve as front-line contact points for all management and operational groups, including stations/hubs. Successful schedulers have knowledge of Americans worldwide network, a passion for the commercial aviation industry, and a strong aptitude for puzzle solving. Qualifications Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a quantitative discipline: Operations Research, Mathematics, Engineering or equivalent experience/training  2 years experience in airline Network Planning/Scheduling, Revenue Management or analytical field, or Masters degree in a related field  Preferred Qualifications  Graduate Degree  2 years experience in modeling, project management, and/or data manipulation at Employer  Ability to solve complex problems and puzzles in a constrained and dynamic environment  Ability to leverage understanding of the airline business and commercial goals to drive results and innovative solutions  Ability to be adaptive to new ideas and business processes in an ever-changing marketplace  Ability to challenge self and team to develop future-oriented network strategies  Ability to communicate and collaborate, work with cross-functional groups to drive outcomes which benefit the entire airline  Skilled at sharing knowledge to develop the expertise of the team as a whole  Knowledge of Microsoft Office to include Word, Excel, Outlook, etc.  Knowledge of Air Vision Schedule Manager Additional Locations: None Requisition ID: 24144

Name: Credit Analyst I, II, or Senior
Description: The Credit Analyst I, II, or Senior provides full support to the Commercial Lending Officers and is primarily responsible for underwriting financial transactions involving working capital, equipment, real estate and small company acquisitions. In addition, the credit analyst ensures that proper credit/collateral documentation is obtained, identifies any deviations to loan policy, participates in loan closings and assists in the ongoing monitoring of credits. Analyzes financial statements (including performance ratios) of all levels of quality to develop initial assessment by identifying strengths and weaknesses as pertaining to borrower’s historical operating performance.Prepares written analyses which include:Credit investigation of the borrower and guarantors;Economic and market conditions as they relate to the company, industry, and market area;In-depth historical and projected financial/cash flow analysis, including communicating with the borrower’s accountant to gain a better understanding of the company’s accounting practices;In-depth analysis of the secondary sources of repayment such as collateral;In-depth analysis of a guarantor’s financial position.Identifies borrower’s strengths and weaknessesCollects and maintains industry data; researches industry specific information from outside sources, including conversations with the borrower, industry publications, references from other banks, credit agencies, as well as accessing information through the internet.Attends weekly Loan Committee meetings and is available to answer questions regarding credit analysis as necessary; often presents the loan request to the committee.Participates in customer meetings as requested by officers (may require travel at times).Performs real estate appraisal reviews for lenders in all regions.Processes and establishes accountability pertaining to Commercial Loan Agreement requirements/covenants.Monitors periodic inspections pertaining to real estate construction projects – loan advances versus project completion.Other duties as required.Bachelor’s degree in Business related field required. Strong preference for Finance or Accounting major or concentration.Professional experience in financial, credit, or statistical analysis, and/or statement spreading and assessing companies through internships, part-time or full-time work, and/or extracurricular activities preferred.Experience in credit analysis with commercial loans strongly preferred.Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.Excellent PC skills, including word processing and spreadsheets via Microsoft Office products as well as custom applications and systems.Excellent analytical, time management, organizational and problem-solving skills with the ability to multi-task and work in a deadline-driven environment.Must be self-motivated with strong initiative, accountability, and attention to detail. At PlainsCapital Bank, we’ve always had a trailblazing spirit. PlainsCapital Bank was founded in 1988 by current Chairman and CEO Alan B. White and a group of young bankers who dreamed of bringing relationship banking to their hometown of Lubbock, Texas. With the acquisition of Plains National Bank, a Lubbock financial institution with one branch and $198.8 million, they began growing the bank one relationship at a time.  Today, PlainsCapital Bank is one of the largest banks in Texas based on deposit market share. We have a statewide presence with more than 65 locations in all major Texas markets. We are a strong and stable financial institution and a trusted community partner. We take pride in helping our customers blaze trails of their own, whether launching or expanding a business, raising a family, or moving into retirement. Our diverse range of services includes commercial banking, treasury management, private banking, and wealth management, as well as consumer banking.  To learn more, please visit us online at plainscapital.com/about.

Name: Systems Analyst
Description: Description:Our employees are the core of everything we do, and they are helping the future arrive. As a leading technology innovation company, our team of over 100,000 people works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Headquartered in Bethesda, MD, Lockheed Martin has employees based in all 50 states and more than 570 facilities that span 70 countries.  This Enterprise Operations (EO) position supports the Lockheed Martin Aeronautics division located in Fort Worth, Texas. The primary responsibility of the Multi-Function Information Systems Analyst will be responsible to provide support for the F35 Server and Desktop classified environments. This professional will ensure that the Lockheed Martin networks and IT systems are managed, controlled, and compliant with the Joint Special Access Program Implementation Guide (JSIG) specifically the Risk Management Framework (RMF) portion. This includes routine updates, major upgrades, and on-going maintenance and support to Microsoft Servers, Storage Area Networks (SAN), tape backup systems, and the Windows 7 & Windows 10 Desktop infrastructure. The Multi-Function Information Systems Analyst will also work requests for IT assistance related to desktops/laptops, software and/or hardware problems, domain accounts and password issues.  The Multi-Function Information Systems Analyst assists users with resolving technical issues with applications, network connectivity and hardware. The team member will assist with Information Assurance tasks to include performing environment vulnerability scans, remediation of vulnerabilities by applying recommended patches provided by multiple vendors on server, desktop, laptop, printer, plotter, scanner, and removable storage device deployments.  They will ensure that all Lockheed Martin assets and software are properly accounted for, managed, and controlled. All work must be performed on-site, including some off-shift hours, weekends and occasional travel. The position also supports a 24 X 7 weekly on-call rotation schedule.  Possess an active DoD Secret security clearance, based upon a National Agency Check with Local Agency Check (NAC/LC) conducted within the last five years and access eligibility for Special Access Programs.  Subject to routine government security investigations and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information throughout their employment as required by the job. Basic Qualifications:Active DoD Secret Clearance (investigation within 5 years)Experience with Windows Server and Desktop Operating SystemsExperience with Risk Management Framework (RMF)U.S. Citizenship required for this locationDesired Skills:Active DoD Top Secret Clearance (investigation within 5 years)Knowledge of the creation and administration of Group Policies and Active Directory Domain ServicesKnowledge of Virtualization (VMware, Horizon, vSphere, vCenter, vCloud, vRealize, NSX, vSAN or VXRail)Knowledge of Linux Administration (RH6.x, RH7.x) Knowledge of configuration management tools and software deployment Ability to troubleshoot issues arising from the OS and networkSetup and manage Storage Area Network (SAN)Demonstrated ability to work in a dynamic IT environmentExperience working in a teaming/collaborative environmentExperience with Windows server administration and installation (2008 R2/2012/2016) (system hardening, log management, configuration management (Nessus, McAfee, WSUS, SCCM, Shavlik, Blade Logic, Splunk, ACAS, SCAP, HBSS, etc.)) Experience with McAfee EPO configuration and administrationExperience with vulnerability remediation and security managementBASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. Theyre dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Name: IT Business Sr. Analyst
Description: Job Background/Context: This position provides information and insights to the CTI Strategic Support team. The individual in this role will be exposed to CTI’s regional and sector functions, CTI CAO/Business Operations teams, as well as Finance and HR in support of the ongoing maturation and evolution of CTI to an agile yet consistently governed organization. This position requires strong analytical and detailed thinking, highly collaborative and open mindset, and ability to work in “ambiguity” and through iterations. Familiarity with governance models, driving technology and business process analysis/reengineering efforts is critical. Additional knowledge of SDLC and Agile concepts is beneficial. Key Responsibilities: • Provides in-depth analysis and critical thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and make recommendations that influence decisions of key business partners. • Utilizes multiple data sources to validate analytics and assumptions, driving conception and publication of data-driven findings, recommended actions and outputs which feed larger CTI Strategic Support activities. • Utilizes assorted tools/technology (MS PowerPoint, Access, Excel) and tools to automate data gathering and analysis. Rapidly acquires knowledge of target domains (business/function as well as technology), and leverages prior experience, Citi knowledge and subject matter expertise to drive development of key insights and actions. • Works independently, in small teams, or directly with Head of CTI Strategic Support to distill volume of data and analysis into actionable insights and executive-level summaries. Contributes to development of improvement/change strategies. • Assists Strategic Support team to perform strategic evaluations, identify potential gaps and implement corrective actions. Possesses a good understanding of client core business functions. About Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients. Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities. Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.  Skills: 1. Demonstrated thought leadership in financial analysis, organizational strategy, process re-engineering (six sigma, Agile, Lean, etc.) and other transformation capabilities 2. Strong ability to navigate and drive progress in challenging situations. 3. Analytical, driven self-starter with a passion for decomposing complex problems and deliverables, obtaining and analyzing data, deriving actionable insights, and developing succinct, well-crafted summaries and recommendations suitable for publication directly to senior CTI leadership. 4. Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet assigned deadlines. 5. Organized, accurate and detail oriented. 6. Motivated and a quick learner. 7. Advanced skill and proficiency with MS PowerPoint, Excel (data acquisition, analysis, pivot tables), Access & other analysis tools. 8. Strong Presentation skills in PowerPoint. 9. Ability to work with multi-disciplinary teams effectively under pressure in a rapidly changing environment. 10. Proven ability to be comfortable and adaptive with ambiguity. Ability to exchange complex information within team and with others. Knowledge/Experience: • Business process, workflow, financial, business analysis and project delivery. • Knowledge in one or more areas of Core Infrastructure / Data Centre Technologies. • Broad-based knowledge of other functional and technical areas. • Ability to exercise judgment and evaluate options under circumstances not covered by procedures or precedents.

Name: Credit Analyst
Description: COMPANY Conner Industries is a manufacturer and distributor of wholesale lumber, panel goods, and industrial wood packaging. Conner has an outstanding reputation in our industry and has been supplying Forest Products and wood packaging for over 35 years.  At Conner Industries, we understand that our greatest asset is our people. Our Finance Team is an integral part of our success and we employ only the most motivated and responsible individuals to achieve rewarding careers within our company. KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES As the Credit Analyst, at our corporate office, you will be responsible for supporting the credit approval process, monitoring and maintenance by managing all customer accounts in accordance with established policies, practices and procedures in a manner that will result in maximum sales, sound receivables and the prompt conversion of receivables into cash with a minimum of past due accounts. This includes taking all necessary actions to collect on accounts that have past due balances, including making collection calls. DUTIES AND REQUIREMENTSSupport extending credit to customers in accordance with established, policy and termsDevelops and maintain positive relationships with all customer and suppliersGenerates accurate and detailed weekly reporting via established metrics for all past due balancesStrives for excellence through continuous knowledge and learningMaintains working relationships with operating personnel of other departments concerned with customer problemsKnows when to enlist Management and Sales to escalate the collection process and prevent holdsEvaluates and makes independent decisions regarding credit limit increases or decreases, credit holds and settlement negotiations within assigned authorityProactively contacts customers regarding debit and credit balances beyond due dateServes as back-up for daily cash posting in the Great Plains systemQUALIFICATION, EDUCATION & EXPERIENCEBachelors degree or equivalent experienceMinimum of 2 years of credit and financial analysis experienceBackground with credit insurance is a plusWorking knowledge of Great Plains AR preferredAnalytical skills to quickly and accurately assimilate information making sound business decisionsExcellent communicator and understanding of importance to do what you sayProficient in MS Office, including strong Excel skillsCONNER INDUSTRIES IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $40,000.00 to $45,000.00 /year  Experience: Credit and financial analysis: 2 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required)

Name: Sr. Business Analyst
Description: **Company Overview:**Flowserve is the recognized world leader in supplying pumps, valves, seals, automation, and services to the power, oil, gas, chemical, and other industries. With more than 18,000 employees in more than 55 countries, we combine our global reach with a local presence.**Position Requirements:****Position Requirements:**+ Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics & Finance, Information Technology or related discipline.+ Knowledge of SQL databases and statistical software packages is desirable+ Minimum 5 years preferably in a reporting, process improvement or analytical role+ CIP Black Belt Certification preferred**Competencies/Skills:**+ Excellent interpersonal, written/verbal communication, and leadership skills with the ability to quickly build credibility, influence and make recommendations to all levels+ Strong analytical and problem solving skills with attention to detail+ Organizational skills - ability to multi-task, prioritize, and execute on assigned deliverables+ Facilitation skills - emphasis on coordinating customer relationships with internal functions/groups; ability to solve issues by coordination across cross-functional areas+ Strong cross-functional team player+ Ability to change direction quickly based on analytic needs+ Ability to communicate complex findings and ideas in a plain language+ A strong desire to data mine and search for patterns that could create new insights+ Enjoy discovering and solving problems+ Strong organizational skills - ability to effectively manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously+ A high level of proficiency with Microsoft Office+ Knowledge of BPC and Lotus Notes databases is a plus+ Experience with real-time analytics and business intelligent platforms such as Tableau is a plus+ Ability to travel on occasion**Preferences:**+ Support and continuously evolve established reporting and analytics for FPD Supply Chain processes as well as the Monthly Operations Review process.+ Support the business with clear and insightful analysis applying advanced modeling techniques leveraging the data at hand+ Continuously enhance and implement business tools, reporting and analytics so management team can drive improved forecasting accuracy+ Conduct data mining / analytics to provide insights across products, markets and geographies for the purposes of growing the front end of the business.+ Develop other demand information and analytics for Executive Management+ Conduct various data auditing, aggregation, validation and reconciliation within the data made available+ Support the annual business planning and fiscal budgeting related to department**Position Description:**The Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for supporting and managing data analytics needs including, but not limited to the sales and operating demand forecast process, market level pricing, and product performance as required by Flowserve Pumps Division (FPD) Supply Chain Operations. He / She will work collaboratively with the Supply Chain teams in over 25 facilities Globally to align these analytics with business strategies and objectives. Superior communication and interpersonal skills, the ability to work cross-functionally with other areas of the organization, strong analytical skills, a professional demeanor and the ability to participate in and lead teams are the keys to this position. Strong organizational skills are required to be able to effectively manage multiple projects and tasks simultaneously. The incumbent must be able to work in a highly visible, dynamic and fast paced environment. They must also have a curiosity, desire and strong enjoyment of diving into available data for the purpose of developing new insights to grow the front end of our business. This position reports directly to the Director Supply Chain for Pumps Division.**Job Posting/Business Card Title:**Sr. Business Analyst**Percentage of Approximate Travel Required:**10%**Primary Posting Location:**IRVING, Texas US**Job Posting Category:**Supply Chain**Employment Type:**Full time**Relocation Eligible:**No**Country:**United States**Auto req ID:**43544BR**Preferences:**NA**43544BR**

Name: Treasury Management Sales Analyst

The individual will serve as a back-up to the Treasury Management Sales Team for issue escalation and resolution. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Requisition ID: 701  A Career in Beer:  Our purpose at MillerCoors, a Molson Coors Company, is to delight the world’s beer drinkers. We are the world’s family brewer, brewing and selling our beer for over 350 years around the world. We’re Talent Brewers - we believe in our brands and our people, we believe that a truly inspiring and diverse place to work is a must. We want you to join our team of passionate self-starters who believe the world is full of untapped opportunities. So, if you get fired up about making a real difference as part of a winning team like we do, we want to hear from you.  The Headlines:  In the role of Financial Analyst working in Fort Worth, Texas, will be part of the Brewery Finance Team. The person will provide finance support to various functions within and outside finance for budgeting, planning/forecasting, reporting, and analysis in a variety of areas.  This position reports to the Brewery Finance Manager and works closely with Technical Accounting, Performance Planning and Analysis (PP&A), Tax, and Internal Audit.  The Responsibilities: Obtain information from customers and business partners to draw conclusions about business processes, take a systematic approach to evaluating alternatives, and make recommendations to managementUse accounting principles and knowledge of internal controls to provide objective, timely, and accurate financial informationUse financial analysis techniques, tools, and concepts to provide practical counsel to business unit partners and to help drive business resultsReview, evaluate, and prioritize tasks/project assignments and communicate key issues to management The Other Qualifications: You have a relative 4-year degree and at least 3 years of financial analyst experience in a manufacturing environmentYou have solid knowledge of GAAP and cost accountingYou have strong Excel skills and experience with financial software (SAP)You love a challenge. You complete complex projects quickly and adeptly with your understanding of the business priorities.You are confident and competent. You are diplomatic, professional and exercise great judgment in developing and maintaining excellent relationships within the business Work Perks that You Need to Know About: As the world’s family brewer, we have the scale to make big things happen and still get to know colleagues on a first name basis across the globeWe play our part to make a difference – from charitable donations to hitting the streets together to build parks – giving back to the community is part of our culture and who we are.Flexible work programs that support work life balance all yearParticipation in our Total Rewards program with a competitive base salary, incentive plans, parental leave, health, dental and pension benefitsWork within a fast paced and innovative company, meeting passionate colleagues and partners with diverse backgrounds and experiences At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.  MillerCoors Fort Worth Nearest Major Market: Fort Worth Nearest Secondary Market: Dallas

Name: Specialist, Business Analyst
Description: If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra Energy family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online. Job DescriptionOverview:The Business Intelligence and Analytics team provides transactional and financial insights to management by analyzing trends in sales, gains, losses, margin and other key performance metrics to drive strategic and operational performance optimization. The team is also responsible for providing analytics support and reporting services for driving ongoing performance improvements for other business units.Within TXU Energy, the Specialist job function has lead and subject matter expert responsibility for analyzing and developing improvements to business processes, identifying and facilitating the creation of appropriate reporting and definition around each function, managing and integrating processes relating to operations, and delivering an improved customer experience.Responsibilities:Deliver key insights by uncovering root causes for trends in sales, gains, losses and swaps by transaction type, channel, campaign, product and over time. Ability to derive insights from complex data for presentation and decision making.Partner with our Marketing, Credit and Information Technology team to develop / deliver structured and ad-hoc reporting that supports analytical groups across the company utilizing tools such as SAS and SQL for data extraction and Tableau, Excel and others for visualization. Partner with our modeling team to create models which help improve customer retention, acquisition and improve customer value.Provide deep-dive analytical support for various sales channels, including campaign performance measurement. Focus on acquisition and retention performance optimization by analyzing current processes. Analyze financial impact of trends and opportunities leveraging business metrics of success such as NPV, PV/I etc. to develop financially justifiable recommendations.Partner with Pricing and Performance Management teams to build and further improve relevant business cases. Perform sensitivity analyses for key assumptions and market scenarios, as necessary.Partner with business functions across the company and with acquisition, retention and service channels, including reactive and targeted call centers, Door to door, DM, Online and others to provide relevant, insightful, timely and accurate views of performance and incentive reportingRequirements:Bachelors with 5+ years or Masters plus 2+ years of relevant industry experienceExcellent business, financial and analytical acumenPrior experience in extracting and analyzing large volume of data using SAS / SQL or other large data analysis tools. Very strong Microsoft Excel & Power-point skillsExperience in a customer-focused and/or relationship building roleProject Management / Planning & Leadership SkillsStrong problem solving and analytical skills•Prior experience in creating visual dashboards using tools like Tableau is highly preferredExcellent inter-personal, communication skill and Presentation skillsPrior experience in big data technologies like Hadoop/HANA, Voice Analytics desirablePrior experience in Web technologies desirablePrior experience with data modeling desirable Very high level of initiative in terms of learning the business and designing valuable analysesOn-time production of analyses and results of the highest integrity and qualityAbility to adapt and work in complex and ever changing environmentDevelopment of clear, concise, and effective executive level reporting and presentationsJob FamilyGeneral ServicesCompanyTXU Retail Services CompanyLocationsIrving, TexasTexasWe are a company of people committed to: Exceeding Customer Expectations, Great People, Teamwork, Competitive Spirit and Effective Communication. If this describes you, then you will have a good career here!If you currently work for Vistra Energy, TXU or Luminant please apply via the internal career site.

Name: Intermediate Business Intelligence Specialist
Description: JPS Health Network is a $950 million, tax-supported health care system for Tarrant County in North Texas. Licensed for 578 beds, the network includes an acute care hospital and more than 40 community-based clinics, including 19 school-based clinics. John Peter Smith Hospital is home to Tarrant County's first and only Level 1 Trauma Center, its only psychiatric emergency services site and has the largest hospital-based family medicine residency program in the nation. Our network employs more than 6,500 people.  Acclaim is our multispecialty medical practice group. Acclaim has over 300 providers serving the JPS Health Network in specialties ranging from primary care to general surgery and trauma. The Acclaim group has been formed around a common set of incentives and expectations supporting the operational, financial and clinical performance  outcomes of the network. Our goal is to provide high quality, compassionate clinical care for every patient, every time.  For more information, visit www.jpshealthnet.org.  To view all job vacancies, visit www.jobs.jpshealthnet.org/ or www.teamacclaim.org. Job Title: Intermediate Business Intelligence Specialist Requisition Number:8657Employment Type: Full Time Division: Information Technology Compensation Type: Salaried Job Category: Information Technology Hours Worked:Location:JPOC 1400Shift Worked: Day Job Description: Description: The Intermediate Business Intelligence Specialist has in-depth knowledge of Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, Data Integration, ETL, Relational Database Systems, SQL, SAP Web Intelligence, SAP Xcelcius, Epic Radar Dashboards, Microsoft Power BI and Stored Procedures including acquiring and maintaining an in-depth knowledge of the Epic Clarity Database and Cogito Data Warehouse. This role is also responsible for combining Hospital and ambulatory clinical and operational knowledge with information technology experience to develop complex business intelligence reports and dashboards for customers. Responsible for gathering requirements, specifications, designing and developing solutions, testing, validating, implementing and providing ongoing support of business intelligence solutions and dashboard for hospital and ambulatory executives. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: At Exeter Finance, we are committed to helping customers find the right financing for their next vehicle purchase. By building strong relationships with our customers and network of dealer partners we are able to give options that make sense, getting customers behind the wheel of their car.  Every team member is integral to our success. Whether you’re at a servicing center helping customers with their loans, in the field building relationships with dealers, or supporting the company from its corporate offices, you'll enjoy a nurturing, invigorating and positive work environment.  Our vision is to be a premier finance company and lender of choice known for its People, Performance and Service.  Assists in the development, modification and maintenance of analysis related to loan origination, performance and forecasting.  Manages individual projects as assigned to ensure adherence to schedule, as well as quality and accuracy of delivered results.  Performs ad hoc projects related to the entire function of credit risk, and summarize results using verbal, written, and formal presentation techniques.  Analyzes business intelligence data. Assesses data extraction, report generation and bugs appearing in operations involving the data warehouse or applicable reporting applications. Synthesizes current business intelligence or trend data to support recommendations for action. Documents specifications for business intelligence or information technology (IT) reports, dashboards, or other outputs.  Collects business intelligence data from various resources. Generates standard or custom reports summarizing business, financial, or economic data for review by executives, managers, clients, and other stakeholders. Maintains and updates business intelligence tools, databases, dashboards, systems, or methods.  Validates system applications. Programs the user interface and application side of business intelligence solutions.  Creates reports in SSRS.  Other duties as assigned.  Exeter Finance LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: F-35 Sustainment Performance Metric Analyst
Description: Description:This individual will perform as an integral technical team member of the F-35 Performance & Data Analytics (P&DA) Operations Team for F-35 Performance Metric Analysis and Reporting. The position will interface directly with both internal and external F-35 Customers at all levels. Applicant will be required to interpret F-35 field data with regards to Performance Based Logistics (PBL) metrics and determine specific degraders negatively impacting the overall performance of the F-35 Fleet. F-35 Sustainment System Performance Degraders include knowledge base in following areas: in depth knowledge of aircraft systems, Sustainment Integrated Product Support (IPS) elements, maintenance procedures and common engineering practices.  Primary responsibilities will consist of data capture and analysis for PBL metric reporting, analyzing performance data to identify critical items degrading fleet performance, and converting the information into presentable format to required stakeholders. Additional responsibilities include: analyzing field performance data to drive decisions for solution alternatives; developing solutions to complex problems consistent with F-35 Sustainment performance metrics and reporting; analysis of F-35 sustainment system performance degraders and trends experienced in the field; attend meetings/debriefings, as required, to aid in the rapid identification of emerging issues that would require company intervention to avoid aircraft downtime; analyze Action Request (AR) and Supply Chain Management (SCM) Mission Impaired Capability Awaiting Parts (MICAP) trends to identify unique operational problems that require technical, procedural, or quality assurance actions to improve system performance.  Candidate will address sustainment improvement initiatives identified by JSFPO, Services and Lockheed Martin F-35 Stakeholders at a systems level, analyzing impacts to air system performance conducting lower level root cause analysis where appropriate to determine actionable solution sets. This position will execute system change implementation through monitoring and analysis of system changes and modification planning impacts to performance outcomes.  Candidate will maintain open lines of communication to provide proactive interface with stakeholders on performance metric reporting. Candidate will be a self-starter, manage time appropriately and have the ability to establish and maintain a library of technical performance reporting.  Must be a US Citizen; this position will require a government security clearance. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Basic Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Aerospace Engineering (including Aeronautical or Astronautical) or Mechanical Engineering or technical related disciplineDesired Skills: Experience with aircraft (pilot, aircraft maintainer, etc.) Coursework or experience with PowerPoint, MS Excel, and/or AccessCoursework or experience in formal presentation development, PowerPoint construct and delivery, and working in a team environmentCoursework or experience with major air vehicle and/or support systems, and knowledge of aircraft readiness degraders.Experience in presentation, data processing, spreadsheet, and database developmentCoursework or experience with systems engineering approaches and configuration managementKnowledge/experience with F-35 Sustainment Performance Based Logistics (PBL)Excellent written and verbal communication skills with an ability to address diverse audiences.Advanced skills with MS Office products (Access, Excel, Project, PowerPoint) with VBA (Visual Basic for Applications) a plus.SharePoint experience.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  Join us at Lockheed Martin, where were engineering a better tomorrow. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: 4 yr and up College

Name: Analyst, Sales Production Technology
Description: Location: AA Headquarters 1 (DFW-HDQ1)  Additional Locations: None  Requisition ID: 24106OverviewJoin us for a career with endless possibilities. Looking for a job where a passion for innovation, a culture of teamwork, and opportunities for growth are valued and rewarded? You’ve come to the right place.  You don’t have to be an airline aficionado to join American Airlines. It takes more than cool planes to keep us ahead of the curve, and thanks to our team of behind the scenes professionals, we do just that. As the largest airline in the world, American Airlines is in the business of serving the global travel needs of our customers. At the core of the Company is our commitment to each customer and each employee. We are dedicated to developing and delivering what our customers value and are willing to pay for. Customer-centric planning, innovative marketing, and an exceptional customer experience are supported by a cadre of talented people.  What does it take to join us? We’re glad you asked! We expect exceptional skills in your discipline and a dedication to being the best as we relentlessly pursue our goal of being not just the largest airline in the world, but also the best airline in the world.  Fortunately, we’re building on almost a century of innovation and firsts in our industry – and we plan to continue that tradition of excellence. 5 years experienceExperience in analyzing system and business processes, improving customer satisfaction, reducing cost and inreasing revenueSkilled at driving organizational change through the integration of people, process and technologyDemonstrated expertise in any CRM platform such as Microsoft Dynamics 365Ability to assemble information, extract pertinent facts, draw logical conclusions and present recommendations aligning with tools used in Global SalesStrong aptitude for problem solving and analytics, and the ability to transform requirements into process flows and to analyze data for problem solving using tools such as Visio and ExcelAbility to take ownership of role by exercising good judgement and making decisions with limited supervisionExceptional collaboration skills with sales team members, end users, IT, Tech providers and other corporate stakeholdersPreferred QualificationsBachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, MIS or any Engineering fieldExperience with project and technical defect tracking tools such as RallyAdditional Locations: None  Requisition ID: 24106 Nearest Major Market: Fort Worth Nearest Secondary Market: Dallas Job Segment: Engineer, Testing, Computer Science, Quality Assurance, Sales, Engineering, Technology24106

Name: Credit Review Buyback Analyst I
Description: Overview  The Credit Review Buyback Analyst I is responsible for facilitating the buyback process on the behalf of GM Financial. The buyback process is initiated when Credit Review documents a violation of the dealer agreement and escalates it to the business unit. The Buyback Analyst I works in conjunction with the business unit as they attempt to reach a positive resolution with the business source. This position requires sound judgment, excellent interpersonal and communication skills, initiative, resourcefulness, and the ability to multitask. ResponsibilitiesJOB DUTIES Build effective working relationships with other departments and external parties to accomplish departmental and corporate strategic business goals and objectives.  Educate internal and external parties on the GM Financial Dealer Agreement and violations of the dealer agreement.  Prepare clear and concise legal documentation on the behalf of GM Financial.  Recognize and recommend improvements to the buyback process.  Host regularly scheduled meetings with the Dealer Services' RSMs to discuss buyback resolution strategy.  Provide payment posting instructions when buyback monies are received.  Manage collateral on repossession hold; including but not limited to, coordinating the return of the collateral to the dealership or wholesaling the unit.  Manage the recourse process by monitoring accounts placed on recourse and escalating them as buybacks when a trigger is breached.  Represent Credit Review in business segment meetings, as needed. Qualifications Knowledge  Detailed understanding of the auto finance industry, including funding and/or underwriting of originations  Working knowledge of consumer credit  Competency with Microsoft Office, focusing on Access and Excel  Knowledge of Provenir, Auto IMS, SalesForce, and CPW  Working knowledge of company policies and procedures  Ability to plan, execute, and improve work processes to ensure achievement of business objectives  Ability to understand GM Financials business, apply knowledge and critical thinking skills in day-to-day problems and solutions  Knowledge of company policies and procedures Skills Excellent interpersonal skills  Excellent verbal, written and communication skills  Ability to multitask with minimal supervision  Ability to use appropriate analysis, judgment and logic when solving issues  Detailed oriented  Ability to coach, lead, motivate, and influence others to support departmental goals and objectives  Ability to proactively achieve goals and objectives, which positively impact GM Financials overall business results  Ability to work discreetly with confidential information and situations  Able to supervise multiple tasks with minimal supervision and be self-motivated  Strong problem solving skills  Ability to provide recommendations and making decisions Education Bachelor?s Degree preferred

Name: SAP Supply Chain Master Data Analyst
Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA's first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences.  Bell has an open position for a SAP Supply Chain Master Data Analyst that will support Customer and Vendor Master Data Management including maintaining business processes and governance in the Master Data space. Responsibilities:Support end users and provide leadership and facilitation to the functional business owners.Exhibit good organizational and problem-solving skills to help resolve end user problems and process changes or enhancements for all of Bell's Master data functional requirements at all locations.Analyze and model existing business processes. The goal of business process analysis is to understand and document current business procedures and identify areas for improvement.Perform analysis, scope projects, and work with the Process Lead to prioritize deliverablesInput customer request (Vendor and Customer Data)Define/extract reports for group and end users and functional ownersPerform data corrections for end users.Draft updates and releases of related Master Data policies and procedures with Process Leads for their review and acceptance when their organizations are impacted.Identifying areas of improvement to enhance efficiencies within the enterprise.Maintain data issue logs and reports; resolve business data definition issuesProvides analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation.Maintain Master Data SharePoint site and related playbooksParticipates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.Assist with the definition, documentation, maintenance, and communications of data business definitions, standards, quality rules and methods.Demonstrable experience using Microsoft products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Visio. These responsibilities will result in the following outcomes: System Data IntegrityEvolved business process and procedures to meet business needs. Required Education Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Business Information Systems or other similar or related Bachelors degree. Relevant experience in Supply Chain or MDM or CSS in working with data for SAP may be considered in lieu of degree. Required Skills and Experience At least 3 years' experience in relevant Master Data Management area or Supply Chain / CSS experience working with Customers / Vendors in SAP managing data and technical skill set.Ability to communicate well with vendors, customers and internal Bell teams orally, visually and in written communication skills. Preferred Skills and Experience Exposure to multiple database technologies and reporting tools including SAP, SharePoint, Enovia, or CAMS.Prior Industry experience with a US Government supplier Relocation Assistance is not available for this position.  Don't miss the chance to join a diverse, inclusive environment where you feel a sense of belonging. As a member of our global workforce, you will collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where unique experiences, backgrounds and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.SDL2017

We partner with payors, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. We believe in the importance of strong, vital organizations because we know that patients can only be healthy when our system is healthy.  Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—by joining McKesson you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company—and of healthcare. At McKesson, you’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.  We understand the importance of a system that works together. Your expertise, drive and passion can help us improve everything we touch, from providers to payors to pharmacies. Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career. We provide a competitive compensation program to attract, retain and motivate a high-performance workforce, and it’s flexible enough to meet the different needs of our diverse employee population.  We are in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payers, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting.  But we can’t do it without you. Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—whatever your title, whatever your role, you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company—and of healthcare. At McKesson, you’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.  McKesson is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer – minorities/females/veterans/persons with disabilities.  Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history. Agency Statement No agencies please.

Name: Salesforce Business Systems Analyst Sr
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a Senior Salesforce Business Analyst for the Enterprise CRM Program team to contribute to the success of implementation and evolution of the bank?s Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platforms. The Senior Salesforce Business Analyst will play a vital role supporting a large-scale CRM program to ensure the timely delivery of innovative solutions to address complex business objectives across the enterprise. The position will collaborate between business groups and technology teams and will be responsible for working with cross-functional teams to assess and design business models, gather business requirements, integrate technology, develop training and implementation materials, and provide post-implementation support. *Responsibilities:** + Provide program management and conduct business and systems analysis on a variety of projects and initiatives in the Enterprise CRM Program  + Collaborate with business partners, subject matter experts and other team members to define and document high-level business needs and detailed requirements  + Define and implement improvements to business process and ad-hoc projects in the face of ever-changing marketplace and consumers.  + Create and maintain business process flow maps and diagrams to facilitate understanding of business needs and translate to technology solutions  + Define scope of projects and timelines associated with the completion of initiatives  + Develop and maintain relationships and communications with other team members and internal partners  + Conduct meetings and facilitate collaborative discussions to develop requirements and new functionality needs  + Serve as point of contact for user support and problem solving  + Lead efforts to investigate, analyze, and resolve application issues related to system functionality  + Review and validate test plan approaches as well as participate in system testing *Qualifications:***Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience  + 6-8 years business analyst experience with utilizing program management methodology  + 3-5 years? experience working with CRM systems  + 3-5 years? experience with system testing *Preferred Qualifications** + Excellent analytical, quantitative, and problem solving skills with the proven ability to communicate and influence effectively at various levels of the organization  + Proven leadership skills and ability to lead others in defining requirements and identifying solutions  + In depth knowledge of business operations and processes for multiple businesses  + Sharp focus on achieving results; persists at completing tasks despite challenges; ability to achieve results and navigate through ambiguity  + Well-organized; plans activities and consistently follows up  + Ability to work in a fast paced and dynamic environment  + Proficient in MS Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint  + Salesforce Administrator Certification (or ability to obtain within one year)  + Project management  + Agile methodology  + Sales processes and methodologies  + Six Sigma or other process improvement methodologies  + Financial services industry experience *Job:** Information Technology*Primary Location:** United States*Shift:** 1st - Daytime*Average Hours Per Week:** 40*Requisition ID:** 180038418*Other Locations:** Minnesota-MN-Richfield U.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.  U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.
