Name: Business Support Analyst
Description: Description:Westlake - TX, TX2050R, 2050 Roanoke Road, 76262-9616  Douglas Andrew Vess  0910-43416 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of ‘own your tomorrow’ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.  As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. Our Opportunity: Please note: This job posting is for future opportunities we are anticipating within the Supervision & Controls team of Schwab's Investor Services Enterprise. What you’ll do: The Business Support Analyst for the Branch Network will review various reporting outputs in effort to identify trends, patterns and/or issues evident within a region, branch location or in relation to a Registered Representative (FC, AFC, FCP). The Business Support Analyst will be responsible for completing portions of PBS for their assigned Branches in relation to sales practice, operational analysis and Registered Representative reviews. They will partner with Relationship Managers and strive to improve business outcomes by providing and applying practical, consistent, effective and unbiased risk guidance that is grounded in a deep understanding of business goals as well as the regulatory and industry environment. Work includes monthly reviews of various branch activities and registered representatives. Secondary responsibilities will be to investigate activities as warranted, partner with other teams across Supervision and Controls, SME responsibilities, and collaborate with other team members. Performing data and risk analysis and synthesizing that information for follow up and reportingConsistently identifying, escalating and addressing issues and potential trends and outlier indicatorsCompletion and reporting of multiple branch PBS assigned to their review on a monthly basisWork in close partnership to provide consistent, effective and objective risk guidance based on a deep understanding of regulatory and firm policy.Developing and maintaining strong internal relationships with key partners: Compliance, Legal, Partner Support, CAT and othersProvide ongoing feedback on reporting to assist with identification of sales practice issues and creation of efficienciesDelivering outstanding business resultsWhat you have:Minimum of 3 years of experience in financial services—supervision and controls, service and operations. Prior supervision and controls experience strongly preferredAbility to gain the respect, trust, and support of leadership, partners, and peersStrong ability to multi-task, adhere to intensive deadlines and easily adapt to changeProven analytical skills with a level of attention to detail in order to adhere to policies, procedures and guidelinesSuperior written and verbal communication skills, including being able to synthesize data, develop recommendations, and influence partnersAbility to work with minimal oversight of day to day responsibilitiesAdvanced technical skills, including proficiency in MS Office and the aptitude to learn new programs, as well as easily utilize multiple applications simultaneously.Familiarity with pattern based supervision expectations & execution and related supervisory resources; including but not limited to eBar, SASR, MARS, SABI, iConsole, and InsightPreferred working knowledge of Schwab internal systems, tools, and resources; including but not limited to Client Central, MARS, and IWINFull commitment and passion to serving the needs of clients, employees, and shareholdersActive FINRA Series 7 & 63 (or 66) required /Active FINRA Series 8 (9/10) requiredWhat you’ll get:Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits packageFinancial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discountsWork/Life Balance: Sabbatical, Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee Matching Gifts ProgramEveryday Wellness: Health and Lifestyle Wellness Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Food Choices, Wellness ChampionsInclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnershipsNot just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life Learn more about Life@Schwab.  Charles Schwab & Co., Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversifying its workforce. It is Schwab's policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, legally protected medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, military status, citizenship status or any other status that is protected by law. Schwab also does not discriminate against applicants or employees because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. At Schwab, we believe that every employee, through their diverse abilities and experiences, can contribute to our growth, innovation and client loyalty. We embrace diversity and are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants. If you have a disability, and require reasonable accommodations in the application process, call Human Resources at 800-725-3535. We will be happy to assist you. Schwab will only share your accommodation request with those individuals who have a specific need to know. The request for an accommodation will not affect Schwab's hiring decisions. All other submissions should be performed online.Job Specifications  Relocation Offered?: No Work Schedule: Days Languages: English - spoken Current Licenses / Certifications: FINRA Series 63, FINRA Series 10, FINRA Series 7, FINRA Series 9, FINRA Series 65 Relevant Work Experience: Analyst/Strategy-less than 2 yrs, Customer Service-2-5 yrs, Regulatory, Financial Services-2-5 yrs, Brokerage Operations-6+ yrs, Risk Analysis Position Located In: TX - Austin, IL - Chicago, AZ - Phoenix, FL - Orlando, IN - Indianapolis, TX - Westlake Education: HS/GED Job Type: Full Time Category:Compliance/Legal/Regulatory  Activation Date: Monday, September 10, 2018  Expiration Date: Saturday, December 1, 2018  Apply Here

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Become Part of Our TeamAs an industry leader Balfour Beatty offers employees a comprehensive benefits package that includes competitive salaries, comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefits, paid time off and volunteer hours, education assistance and much more including: Medical, Dental, Vision and Life InsuranceHealth Savings Account401(k) with company matchFlexible Spending Accounts (Dependent & Medical Reimbursement)Vacation TimeSick TimeHolidaysPaid Personal DaysPaid Volunteer timeTuition AssistanceEmployee Referral BonusSummary At Balfour Beatty Construction in Dallas, Texas, we are seeking a Financial Analyst to join the Risk Management team. Key roles and activities include the following: provide financial analysis, evaluate the physical and financial performance of individual sub contracts, implementation and follow up on risk mitigation requirements, prepare risk reports and assist in training and mentoring personnel responsible for implementing risk mitigation plans. Essential FunctionsReviews and analyzes subcontractor and vendor billings and performance.Interviews subcontractor management and reviews/analyzes Subcontractor Financial Statements.Establishes lines of communication with lower tier vendors to support review findings.Provides input in establishing Risk Mitigation packages for newly awarded subcontracts and purchase orders.Documents construction progress through communication with field staff.Documents billing status for all subcontractors and vendors reviewed.Ensures compliance with required risk mitigation plans.Ensures compliance with accounting policies and procedures and internal controls.Reviews retainage requests prior to release to subs.Minimum RequirementsBachelor s degree in Accounting or Finance required.2 or more years experience in an Accounting or Finance position.Strong computer skills in word processing, spreadsheets, Microsoft access, and database management systems.Ability to understand financial statements, credit analysis, and banking arrangements.Preferred RequirementsExperience in the construction industry is helpful.Experience working in Finance/Accounting for a subcontractor or general contractor, is favorable.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Demonstrated ability in document proofreading skills.Able to organize people, tools, equipment and other resources and orchestrate multiple activities at once to accomplish desired results.Able to effectively manage a team of administrators.Able to use time effectively based on key priorities; pursues work with energy and a need to finish.Show personal commitment to improving skills and compensating for weaknesses and limitations.Act in a manner of integrity that shows support for the company, it values and the employees while maintaining a constant focus on meeting/exceeding customer requirements and expectations.About UsBalfour Beatty US is an industry-leading provider of general contracting, at-risk construction management and design-build services for public and private sector clients across the nation. Performing heavy civil and vertical construction, our teams build the unique structures and infrastructure that play an important role in how people live, work, learn and play in our communities. Our teammates have an instinctive passion for innovating that is fueled by a relentless curiosity, a drive to employ lean practices and processes and the determination to find a better way. Through Zero Harm®, we are challenging the construction industry s assumptions about safety. We believe that no level of harm should come to anyone as a result of our business.  Consistently ranked among the nation s largest building contractors, by Engineering News-Record, our US business is a subsidiary of London-based Balfour Beatty plc (LSE: BBY).  Balfour Beatty is an equal opportunity employer that recognizes the value of a diverse workforce. All qualified individuals will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by federal, state or local law.

Name: SAP FI AR Business Systems Analyst
Description: SAP FI AR Business Systems Analyst  12 months+ contract  Location: Irving, Texas  IMMEDIATE new job opening for an SAP FI AR BSA focused in AR. This individual will join our global client's team at their North American headquarters in Irving, Texas. This is a great opportunity to join a fantastic company that is number one in its industry and become part of a dynamic IT team that is integral to the that company's operations and success. This role will be 70-80% functional and 30-20% technical. This individual will work with the business to solve SAP system processing problems and create new configuration to solve business problems. This role will require knowledge of AR, cash application (high radius) and credit management (get paid), specifically using these 3rd party tools.  This is primary an SAP support role but there will be some development that will consist of creating templates and assisting with tests as well as tweaking existing functionality as needed. Additionally, this individual will assist with migrations. Primary responsibilities will include providing user support, gathering user requirements, and configuring the system for new functionality.  RESPONSIBILITIES  o Provides 2nd and 3rd level SAP support to end users  o Works with developers to create and test new system functionality  o Partners with business users to coordinate application and testing of system enhancements  o Creates technical specifications for developers  o Installs and configures applications  o Acts as a liaison with vendors and consultants to address support activities  o Develops documentation to improve the use and availability of applications  o Provides expert level support and maintenance of core software functionality and technology components  o Works cross-functionally to solve problems and implement changes  o Up to 10% travel may be required  REQUIREMENTS  o 7+ years of functional SAP BSA  o FI and AR senior level experience  o Experience working with cash applications and credit management  o Experience tweaking existing functionality  o Experience with migrations  o Knowledge of AR, contracts, pricing, and invoicing  o Experience with project System, AR and Fixed Assets is a Plus!  o Expertise in both business and configuration knowledge for functional areas  o Requires project management skills; designs solutions for internal/external clients  o Considered a subject matter expert resource for others  o Proven experience in troubleshooting, testing and quality assurance techniques  o Proficient in the development of documentation to support functional specifications, data flows, etc.  o Bachelor's degree in Information MIS, Information Technology, Engineering, or another related field  *Must be a U.S. Citizen, Green Card Holder, or hold other status that allows you to be employed in the United States on a W2 basis without having to be sponsored by your employer.  **To view all of our open positions, please visit: http://www.alleareconsulting.com/job-openings.

Name: Business Analyst, Sr - IS
Description: SCOPE The Sr. Business Analyst works with and establishes solid relationships with the Department Management, IS Managers, Mouser Executives, and other “key” individuals. The Business Analyst will analyze department processes, requirements, and user requirements; develop functional design; be the functional subject matter expert (SME); document business and technical requirements; establish priorities for requirements; identify process improvements; develop test plans; prepare workflow documentation; develop and gain approvals on Project Charters; and maintain clear, timely communications with all interested parties. ACCOUNTABILITIES This position functions at a Sr. level in all aspects of the position including being a ‘go to’ person for the other Business Analysts within the department.  Expected to learn, develop and maintain a strong Mouser business acumen and use it with each assignment.  Meet with Company Executives to learn strategy, tactical approaches, priorities, requirements, and business process.  Document business requirements, may develop and oversee project plans, oversee and coordinate the development of technical specifications.  Establish open, fluid and timely communications with all interested parties, stakeholders and the project team. This could include all levels of participants from Company Executives to individual contributors.  Expected to utilize organizational skills to document, categorize, prioritize, provide easy access to information, ask questions, follow up, and maintain communications.  Must take initiative to spend time with all levels of users (formal meetings, informal meetings, observing work, etc.)  Collaborate with developers, quality assurance, business teams and technical support to provide a mix of business and technical direction on systems, design, development, testing and deployment.  Is required to develop and maintain project schedules with appropriate input, including all necessary activities and dependencies.  Develop and maintain all Project Documentation as defined by Mouser’s IS Policies and Procedures.  Represents the company and IS in a professional manner.  Mentor associates and foster a learning and growth environment.  Establishes and maintains effective relationships with internal and external contacts.  Team-player/leader.  Works with minimum supervision and makes independent judgments.  Arrives on time to work hours needed to fulfill assigned responsibilities. QUALIFICATIONSEDUCATION & EXPERIENCE Bachelor's degree in a technical discipline or equivalent required.  At least 2 years’ experience as a Business Analyst or Associate Business Analyst role. SKILLS & CERTIFICATIONS • Demonstrated skills with project management tools and methodologies, software development lifecycle, and software methodologies (waterfall, agile, prototyping, JAD, SCRUM)  • Working knowledge of databases (SQL, Oracle, Sybase, Access, PICK, UV) and experienced with data mining, gap analysis and business models  • Ability to define functional (specific business goals) and non-functional (performance, external interfaces, security, training) requirements and develop a business hypothesis based on analyzed data  • Exhibits strong analytical, problem solving, negotiation, organizational and teaching skills  • Interacts effectively with individuals and groups inside and outside the organization  • Excellent verbal and non-verbal communication skills with the ability to clearly describe business problems or processes to technical and non-technical audiences  • Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and priorities with a strong attention to detail  • Demonstrated success in leading cross-functional teams  • Strong ability to work in teams with a collaborative interpersonal style.  • Demonstrates a positive attitude toward self and others  • Ability to set and track goals  • Available to work early, late and weekends when needed to fulfill assigned responsibilities  • PC experience in a Microsoft Windows environment, proficient with internet e-mail, Microsoft Visio, Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook and other software  • Able to use, read, and interpret spreadsheets, printed reports, and terminal screen  • Ability to analyze business processes and workflows  • Strong skills in Process Mapping and Business Process Reengineering  • Lean Six Sigma experience a plus This is a summary of the primary accountabilities and requirements for this position. The company reserves the right to modify or amend accountabilities and requirements at any time at its sole discretion based on business needs. Any part of this job description is subject to possible modification to reasonably accommodate individuals with disabilities.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA's first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences.  The Senior Financial Analyst position is responsible for providing financial consultation and actionable information to the Integrated Operations (IO) organization at the Bell headquarters in Fort Worth, Texas. The IO organization is comprised of several functions including Manufacturing & Assembly, Production Support, Procurement, Logistics, Facilities, Security, and Environmental Health & Safety. Primary Position Responsibilities:Annual Budget development and maintenance for Overhead, Capital, SET (Sustaining, Engineering, & Tooling)Work with IO organizations to develop, monitor, and analyze operation plans to achieve company performance objectives and financial goalsWeekly / monthly cost analysis and forecastingWeekly / monthly manpower reporting, analysis and forecasting including trends related to labor utilization and overtimeProvide Finance & IO leadership with actionable information to assist in cost managementSupport IO organizations in preparing business cases for Capital Acquisition Requests (CARs) and Expense Projects, managing the CAR process, and forecasting spend for projects.Maintain working knowledge of Bell cost accounting practices and CAS Disclosure statement Each IA will acquire the knowledge to fully utilize the F-22 program and company legacy systems to accomplish TAV in support of company and customer operational requirements. Name: IT Business Sr. Analyst
Description: Job Background/Context: This position provides information and insights to the CTI Strategic Support team. The individual in this role will be exposed to CTI’s regional and sector functions, CTI CAO/Business Operations teams, as well as Finance and HR in support of the ongoing maturation and evolution of CTI to an agile yet consistently governed organization. This position requires strong analytical and detailed thinking, highly collaborative and open mindset, and ability to work in “ambiguity” and through iterations. Familiarity with governance models, driving technology and business process analysis/reengineering efforts is critical. Additional knowledge of SDLC and Agile concepts is beneficial. Key Responsibilities: • Provides in-depth analysis and critical thinking to define problems, develop innovative solutions and make recommendations that influence decisions of key business partners. • Utilizes multiple data sources to validate analytics and assumptions, driving conception and publication of data-driven findings, recommended actions and outputs which feed larger CTI Strategic Support activities. • Utilizes assorted tools/technology (MS PowerPoint, Access, Excel) and tools to automate data gathering and analysis. Rapidly acquires knowledge of target domains (business/function as well as technology), and leverages prior experience, Citi knowledge and subject matter expertise to drive development of key insights and actions. • Works independently, in small teams, or directly with Head of CTI Strategic Support to distill volume of data and analysis into actionable insights and executive-level summaries. Contributes to development of improvement/change strategies. • Assists Strategic Support team to perform strategic evaluations, identify potential gaps and implement corrective actions. Possesses a good understanding of client core business functions. About Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients. Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities. Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.  Skills: 1. Demonstrated thought leadership in financial analysis, organizational strategy, process re-engineering (six sigma, Agile, Lean, etc.) and other transformation capabilities 2. Strong ability to navigate and drive progress in challenging situations. 3. Analytical, driven self-starter with a passion for decomposing complex problems and deliverables, obtaining and analyzing data, deriving actionable insights, and developing succinct, well-crafted summaries and recommendations suitable for publication directly to senior CTI leadership. 4. Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet assigned deadlines. 5. Organized, accurate and detail oriented. 6. Motivated and a quick learner. 7. Advanced skill and proficiency with MS PowerPoint, Excel (data acquisition, analysis, pivot tables), Access & other analysis tools. 8. Strong Presentation skills in PowerPoint. 9. Ability to work with multi-disciplinary teams effectively under pressure in a rapidly changing environment. 10. Proven ability to be comfortable and adaptive with ambiguity. Ability to exchange complex information within team and with others. Knowledge/Experience: • Business process, workflow, financial, business analysis and project delivery. • Knowledge in one or more areas of Core Infrastructure / Data Centre Technologies. • Broad-based knowledge of other functional and technical areas. • Ability to exercise judgment and evaluate options under circumstances not covered by procedures or precedents.

Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011). Name: Operation Business Analyst
Description: Position Overview If crunching numbers, analyzing sales patterns and identifying opportunities is your set of skills then this is the right job position for you. This is a hands-on positing that will dedicate its efforts to support the Direct Store Delivery Program manager in determining the amount of product to be delivered to our end client. By analyzing point of sale patterns, you will determine the appropriate replenishment cycle to maintain the right amount of stock at each point of sale. You will work jointly with the DSD program manager to meet monthly sales goals and program profitability that depends directly on quantities shipped to our end client. Responsibilities and expectations Ensure profitability of Falcons DSD business within the assigned region. Liaise with Falcon Farms support and operations teams as required. Maintain contact with customers regional management teams and respond to inquiries pertaining to the region. Optimize cut-flower returns by creating complex sales forecast modelsDesign, operate and execute operational workflows for the Direct Store Delivery programDetermine sales patterns at convenience store level, assigns order quantities to be delivered in a daily basisDesign, operate, coordinate and execute DSD program delivery RoutesAnalyze and communicate farm production forecasts within the operations departmentDirects all incoming and outgoing cut-flower shipments and ensures that product inventory in the warehouse is organized and maintained in an effective mannerMaintain administrative matters such as expense tracking, maintenance schedules and cost controlsEngage with field operations at least 20% of the timeDemonstrated ability to perform and adapt in a changing environment as necessary.Design of complex replenishment models to fulfill clients sales demandsRequired SkillsMust be bilingual (English Spanish) written and spokenBasic accounting knowledge and awareness of financial performance figuresStrong analytical skillStrong leadership and collaboration skillsFlexible schedule Able to work variable schedules especially during floral holidaysStrong selfmanagement skills Ability to complete daily procedures and responsibilities without direct supervisionWillingness to travel approximately once every three months to the Dallas area retailersQualificationsExcellent Microsoft excel skillsExcellent VBA, SQL, PYTHON skillsCollege degreeMinimum 2 years of experience in an analytical roleReports to: Sr. Operations Analyst Hours: Monday - Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. About Us Falcon Farms is one of the leading fresh cut-flower distributors in the United States. Since 1987, the company has grown in production and commercialization, to 10 flower production farms in Colombia and Ecuador, with more than 700 acres of land and a team of over 5,000 people. The organizations commercial and distribution footprint in Miami, Atlanta, Phoenix, Dallas and Long Beach allows us to service national wholesale and mass market accounts. Current business prospects, and the incorporation of new clients have embarked Falcon on an aggressive path to deepen our regional footprint in the Texas region.  Falcon thrives on a highly entrepreneurial culture and a flat organization that fosters strong collaboration and calculated risk-taking. The nature of an agricultural product like flowers, with high seasonality and subject to variability in factors affecting production, requires high flexibility and the ability to make decisions and adapt to changing circumstances in very short term, while remaining firm on strategy execution.  Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $20.00 /hour  Experience: business analyst: 2 years (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required) Seasonal job: No

Name: Department Data Analyst - Ft. Worth - Moncrief Cancer Institute
Description: SecurityThis position is security-sensitive and subject to Texas Education Code 51.215, which authorizes UT Southwestern to obtain criminal history record information Experience and EducationBachelor's degree in Science, Information Management, Healthcare Information, Statistics, Business or closely related field and three (3) years data management/analyst work in a clinical or healthcare related field. Familiarity with scientific terms (in biology, biochemistry, chemistry, etc.) preferred.  SQL highly preferred.  SAS or R preferred. Job Duties1. Abstracts data, reconciles data inconsistencies and performs analysis. Interprets numerical data and relates to Manager.  2. Creates data reports from existing databases based on needs analysis leadership and/or clinicians/researchers. Shares vital information with department management team for dissemination across all division.  3. Prepares and submits documents to federal agencies, state agencies, private research funding agencies and other organizations as required by law and contractual vehicle. Monitors existing compliance documents with the terms of contractual vehicle with the university.  4. Monitors data gained from department information services and creates useful downloads for distribution among division directors.  5. Designs and creates merges data files and/or warehouse data sets; determines best methods for efficient capture and merging of information from various data resources and access to tools to generate reports. Facilitates efficient distribution of information gleaned from departmental billing downloads.  6. Partners with senior leadership and/or clinicians/researchers to design and perform complex analyses and report creation, including identifying and interpreting of trends, patterns of variations and implications for improvement initiatives. Focus on patient satisfaction outcomes and scores as noted in quarterly department data downloads.  7. May provide education/training to team members on generation and/or interpretation of data, statistical analysis and application to decision making to improve organization efficiency and outcomes. Provides essential and informative feedback to department manager/director as to how well their area functions within parameters measured.  8. Develops and maintains protocol for maintain department wide volunteer faculty credentialing.  9. Designs and creates tools to capture data, run/build reports and conducts analysis for purpose of measuring productivity and identifying trends/patterns that represent opportunities to improve and increase operational efficiency. Partners with senior leadership for review and data interpretation and then participate in plan development and implementation. *Other Duties: Performs other duties as assigned. Name: Sr. Financial Business Analyst
Description: Established, Entrepreneurial, Empowered…Explore the Opportunities!NCH Corporation – Sr. Financial Business Analyst    NCH is currently looking for a Sr. Financial Business Analyst to support NCH China. The individual will assist Finance in FP&A (Financial, Planning & Analysis) for the China division.  We offer opportunities for career advancement, and a culture that recognizes results, while embracing the importance of work/life balance. Join our team as a Sr. Financial Business Analyst, where our future begins with you!    Responsibilities:Lead the annual planning process for the China division, including income statement, balance sheet and cash flows. Analyze historical performance and industrial trends to set up financial targets for the regions, and assist regions in formulating business plans.Manage monthly forecast, consolidate and present forecast to China management to facilitate executive-level business decisions.Develop and maintain financial models/tools for planning/forecast and analysis, and roll out the models/tools.Coordinate monthly financial reviews to analyze financial results, review variances vs. plan and prior year, and develop action plans to meet financial targets.Assist management in preparing presentations to the Executive Committee for quarterly meetings, the annual plan meeting, and other executive events.Perform in-depth analysis to identify issues and opportunities; recommend strategies and solutions to increase revenue, reduce cost, and improve profitability.Update and maintain a Balanced Scorecard reporting system, deliver monthly balanced scorecards for business performance tracking and benchmarking.Create queries with Business Objects, Oracle Discoverer and other business database querying tools, analyze and provide input for performance evaluation and business decisions.Use NPV, IRR, ROI and other financial techniques to analyze business initiatives, including but not limited to capital investment, variable contribution, pricing, and product launches.   Requirements:Undergraduate degree in Finance or Business disciplines, preferably accounting.5+ years of experience in financial and business analysis, with proven ability to dissect business issues, present data in a simple and compelling way, and present to higher level managementBilingual fluency in Mandarin Chinese (preferred) and EnglishInternational business experience preferred. Experience with China highly desiredDemonstrated advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and Power Point, Visual Basic, Access and Business Object preferredAdvanced knowledge of business concepts and tools (NPV, ROI, Break-even, cost-benchmarking, pricing, sensitivity analysis, etc.)Advanced understanding of common financial reports and financial metrics (Income statement, Cash Flow Statement, Balance Sheet)Experience with Oracle or similar ERP software preferredHighly motivated, self-directed, flexible team player with demonstrated ability to thrive in a business-critical high stress environmentAbility to work collaboratively with management level and executive personnelSelf motivated, organized and goal oriented with a keen attention to detailSolid communication skills; ability to develop a method for presenting information in a simple yet impactful wayMust be willing to relocate to Dalian China    Equal Opportunity Employer  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Credit Analyst I, II, or Senior
Description: Job SummaryThe Credit Analyst I, II, or Senior provides full support to the Commercial Lending Officers and is primarily responsible for underwriting financial transactions involving working capital, equipment, real estate and small company acquisitions. In addition, the credit analyst ensures that proper credit/collateral documentation is obtained, identifies any deviations to loan policy, participates in loan closings and assists in the ongoing monitoring of credits.Essential FunctionsAnalyzes financial statements (including performance ratios) of all levels of quality to develop initial assessment by identifying strengths and weaknesses as pertaining to borrower’s historical operating performance.Prepares written analyses which include:Credit investigation of the borrower and guarantors;Economic and market conditions as they relate to the company, industry, and market area;In-depth historical and projected financial/cash flow analysis, including communicating with the borrower’s accountant to gain a better understanding of the company’s accounting practices;In-depth analysis of the secondary sources of repayment such as collateral;In-depth analysis of a guarantor’s financial position.Identifies borrower’s strengths and weaknessesCollects and maintains industry data; researches industry specific information from outside sources, including conversations with the borrower, industry publications, references from other banks, credit agencies, as well as accessing information through the internet.Attends weekly Loan Committee meetings and is available to answer questions regarding credit analysis as necessary; often presents the loan request to the committee.Participates in customer meetings as requested by officers (may require travel at times).Performs real estate appraisal reviews for lenders in all regions.Processes and establishes accountability pertaining to Commercial Loan Agreement requirements/covenants.Monitors periodic inspections pertaining to real estate construction projects – loan advances versus project completion.Other duties as required. Job RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Business related field required. Strong preference for Finance or Accounting major or concentration.Professional experience in financial, credit, or statistical analysis, and/or statement spreading and assessing companies through internships, part-time or full-time work, and/or extracurricular activities preferred.Experience in credit analysis with commercial loans strongly preferred.Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.Excellent PC skills, including word processing and spreadsheets via Microsoft Office products as well as custom applications and systems.Excellent analytical, time management, organizational and problem-solving skills with the ability to multi-task and work in a deadline-driven environment.Must be self-motivated with strong initiative, accountability, and attention to detail. About the CompanyAt PlainsCapital Bank, we’ve always had a trailblazing spirit. PlainsCapital Bank was founded in 1988 by current Chairman and CEO Alan B. White and a group of young bankers who dreamed of bringing relationship banking to their hometown of Lubbock, Texas. With the acquisition of Plains National Bank, a Lubbock financial institution with one branch and $198.8 million, they began growing the bank one relationship at a time.  Today, PlainsCapital Bank is one of the largest banks in Texas based on deposit market share. We have a statewide presence with more than 65 locations in all major Texas markets. We are a strong and stable financial institution and a trusted community partner. We take pride in helping our customers blaze trails of their own, whether launching or expanding a business, raising a family, or moving into retirement. Our diverse range of services includes commercial banking, treasury management, private banking, and wealth management, as well as consumer banking.  To learn more, please visit us online at plainscapital.com/about.

Name: Business Analyst (Irving, TX)
Description: Where good people build rewarding careers.  Think that working in the insurance field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You'll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers' lives. We'll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life. Job Description Job Summary Business Analyst  The Business Analyst (BA) Consultant II assists with analyzing requirements and requests of the business, operations, and other users of IT services. Serves as the contact for business divisions and technology solution providers for all aspects of solution identification. A BA Consultant II supports projects of low complexity.  Key Responsibilities  Participate in information sessions to provide expertise to multiple business areas by analyzing data and leveraging business knowledge to create or contribute to functional designs  Use appropriate tools and techniques to elicit and define requirements that address relatively simple business processes or projects of low to moderate complexity  Assist with project initiation or planning for projects of low to moderate complexity  Consult on the functional test plans and conditions for applications / projects of low to moderate complexity to ensure test plans cover the testing of all defined functional requirements; support data analysis and validation from functional tests  Execute change control process to alter base-line deliverables and scope for projects of low to moderate complexity; escalate requests for deviations from process when necessary  Collaborate with partners in test plan reviews to ensure plans address the testing of defined functional requirements; support data analysis and validation from functional tests  May lead information gathering sessions  Job Qualifications  Education: College degree or equivalent experience  2-4 years experience in insurance, project management, or technology  Insurance industry knowledge preferred  The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.  Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands.  As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary - but that's just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you'll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.  Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.  Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.  Effective July 1, 2014, under Indiana House Enrolled Act (HEA) 1242, it is against public policy of the State of Indiana and a discriminatory practice for an employer to discriminate against a prospective employee on the basis of status as a veteran by refusing to employ an applicant on the basis that they are a veteran of the armed forces of the United States, a member of the Indiana National Guard or a member of a reserve component.  For jobs in San Francisco, please click 'here' for information regarding the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  For jobs in Los Angeles, please click 'here' for information regarding the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.  It is the policy of Allstate to employ the best qualified individuals available for all jobs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, disability, and citizenship status as a veteran with a disability or veteran of the Vietnam Era.  Apply on Company Website  Job ID: US*1743_******  For your privacy and protection, when applying to a job online, never give your social security number to a prospective employer, provide credit card or bank account information, or perform any sort of monetary transaction. Learn more.  Allstate Insurance Company  The Allstate Corporation is the largest publicly held personal lines property and casualty insurer in America, serving more than 16 million households nationwide. Founded in 1931, Allstate has been dedicated to protecting our customers from life's uncertainties and preparing them for the future for more than 85 years. Allstate became a publicly traded company in 1993, and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the trading symbol ALL. As of year-end 2015, Allstate had nearly $104.7 billion in total assets. Contact Info Irving, TX 75015

Name: Program Scheduler/Analyst
Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences.  Bell is seeking an experienced Integrated Program Scheduler / Analyst to join the team in Fort Worth, TX. This role will support the H-1 military program.  Working in the Project Management Office (PMO), this role will provide direct support to Program and Business Management in relation to Earned Value Management (EVM) to manage project performance and progress of programs related to aircraft design, development, production, procurement or assembly.  This role is responsible for the scheduling for aircraft development programs and supports creation and maintenance of resource loaded schedules for Integrated Product Teams (IPT) and helps ensure integration and synchronization between all IPT schedules in support of program requirements.Responsibilities Include:Support schedule analysis and reporting including program critical path and Schedule Risk Assessments (SRA).Review, correct, and report schedule performance against plans and provide alternatives and corrective actions as appropriate.Support development of proposal schedules with limited information to support company business capture initiatives.Present stakeholders with timely status and anticipate future challenges.Education Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Engineering, Finance, Business Administration or other applicable disciplineRequirements:At least 3 years combined experience in using project management / scheduling software such as Primavera ANDprevious work experience in Earned Value Management (EVM)This position requires strong initiative and willingness to develop solutions to a variety of schedule requests in a team environmentMust be able to work with ambiguityExcellent organizational, communication and analytical skillsMust have strong computer skills including Windows and Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)Preferred Educations, Certification, Skills and Experience:Basic understanding of aircraft design/development/production/procurement/assembly processesDon’t miss the chance to join a diverse, inclusive environment where you feel a sense of belonging. As a member of our global workforce, you will collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where unique experiences, backgrounds and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.

Name: Inventory Analyst (Data Entry)
Description: Position Title: Inventory Analyst (Data Entry) Location: Irving, TX 75062 Position Status: 3 month contract w/ possible extension Compensation: negotiable Shift: Monday Friday (8am to 5pm) Job Description:Conducts analysis on current and new inventory impacting the supply chain network and end to end replenishment strategies.Use historical trend data and future commitments to determine volumes and shifts to ensure necessary capacity requirements meet customer needs.Use large amounts of data and convert it into meaningful data sets that can be used to help stakeholders make decisions on process improvements.Creates reporting and dashboards to monitors current and future inventory, analyzes root causes of variance from plan while keeping stakeholders informed.Creates and manages inventory Supply Chains, continuously optimizing for enhanced results to bottom line.Uses analysis and business intelligence to conduct process improvement and efficiencies.Manages and issues all sample requests.Facilitates and tracks a given inventory through the testing process while working with necessary stakeholders and 3rd Party labs.Qualifications & Skills:Ability to work independently with little directionAbility to think strategically, innovatively and creatively using sound business judgment and quantitative skillsProven track record of taking ownership and driving resultsAttention to detailExcellent computer skills and proficient in Excel

implementation of process improvements that significantly improve quality across the functionAnalyze and observe processes to understand process steps, interdependencies, and applications used to complete transactionsIdentify processes that are suitable for automation, and provide recommendations to reengineer processes to improve automation potentialSupport and/or participate in project planning and communication for RPA initiativesEssential Qualifications, Knowledge, Abilities and SkillsBachelors degree or equivalent experience1-2 years experience working with at least one of the top 3 RPA platforms (UiPath, BluePrism or Automation Anywhere)Experience in Automation (RPA or BPM) tools implementationCompetent user of at least 1 of the following flowchart & process-mapping software (Bizagi, Visio, LucidChart, SmartDrow, Gliffy)Knowledge of markup standards (UML, BPMN 2)Profound understanding of RPA Deployment Methodology and opportunity identification / process optimization is requiredFamiliar with collating info and preparing Business Requirement Documents (BRD) and Robotic Feasibility Assessments (RFA), including business questionnaires and assessment matricesServes as a key filtration/prioritization resource on complex and / or critical automation projectsAbility to perform complex conceptual analysisExperience in process evaluation, process deconstruction, process improvement, solutioning, testing, and / or remediationThe aptitude to contribute to the evolution of methodologies and procedures in a controlled manner to continually improve a rapid and repeatable delivery channelThe ability to think about the creative process/practical process and understand how things work and whyUnderstanding of workflow based logic and the ability to both understand a business process from a workflow diagram and to conceptualize it as an automated solutionExcellent communication skills to influence positive outcomes with the ability to present technical details to a non-technical audience.Excellent written skills with the ability to produce clear and concise documentationThe ability to work with a structured and methodical approach, combined with an enquiring mind.An understanding of, and a willingness to adhere to, formal change control procedures and disciplines.An aptitude for problem solving, with the ability to take a logical route to the source of an error.A self-starter who delivers high quality work and can adapt to new challengesUsed to working collaboratively and with a diverse group of people and culturesIs creates a fun, yet professional team spirit. Name: 2019 Associate Financial Analyst
Description: At Bell, thinking above and beyond is what we do best. For more than 80 years, we’ve been reimagining the experience of flight – and where it can take us.We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and to certify a commercial helicopter. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. And today, we’re defining the future of on demand mobility.A Day in the Life of an Associate Financial Analyst:Bell has several opportunities for early career Financial Analysts interested in pursuing a rewarding and challenging career. Our early career employees may find opportunities in the following areas:AccountingAssists in the preparation of Bell Helicopter’s financial statements to ensure that they present fairly the company’s financial position and results of operations.Business Process ControlsProvides support to Textron operating units with military contracts to ensure compliance with the DFARS Business Systems Clause and Sarbanes Oxley section 404 requirements.Military Programs (H-1 and Spares)Provides performance and cost reporting for military program contracts. Part of team responsible for negotiating, contracting, invoicing, collecting and ensuring financial management of large portfolio of contracts.Customer Support and ServicesAssists with demand forecasting, spares inventory management & pricing , warranties, mission critical support (MCS), Bell Training Academy, A/C customizingCommercial Programs (525, 505)Analyses necessary to control and manage cost and schedule, develops budgets and forecasts, and maintains the business case for Bell Helicopter's 525 or 505 helicopter program. Key part of team bringing a new platform to market.Integrated OperationsThrough actionable information, provides essential counsel to the Integrated Operations (I/O) organization to drive improvements across Bell’s manufacturing operations (transmissions, blades, composites, etc.). Responsibilities May Include:Act as Business Partner to program or functionDrive and influence outcomes (not simply report information)Analyze data and provide solutionsInteract with internal and external customersEducation Requirements:Bachelor’s degree is required.Degree in Accounting, Finance, or closely related field required3.0 minimum overall, undergraduate GPA.Minimum Requirements for an Associate Financial Analyst at Bell:0-2 years experience in Accounting, Finance, or related fieldAbility to analyze and interpret program financial dataPC proficiency required in Microsoft Office with a strong emphasis on ExcelAbility to communicate effectively (verbal and written)Must work well in a team environmentMust have the ability to be a self-starter and work with minimal supervisionCollaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where differences in experiences, backgrounds, and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.

Name: Desktop Support Analyst
Description: Overview About ApexApex has been one of the strongest brands in financial services for the transportation industry since 1995, primarily because we’re really good at freight factoring. We manage our clients’ accounts receivable, credit lines, customer relationships, and financial transactions by leveraging our relationships and technical know-how.Why Work for Apex?Apex has been voted one of the best mid-sized companies to work for in Texas since 2009. We’re committed to employee empowerment, team building, and a good work/life balance, and we do our best to make sure that all Apexers have the tools, knowledge, and support they need to enjoy a rewarding career with us. Comfortably nestled just off I-30 and 10 minutes west of downtown Fort Worth, we offer a long list of benefits that make us a premier work location. Some of the highlights:Competitive compensation plans plus profit sharing and regular salary reviews.A high-quality health care plan with a short waiting period.Dental, vision, life, short-term disability, and long-term disability coverage.401(k) plan with matching contributions.Tuition reimbursement for college, plus plenty of Apex managed training classes.360⁰ feedback, leadership training, and a culture that empowers individuality.On-site fitness facilities and a reward driven wellness program.Fun, friendly work environment. We celebrate our accomplishments (and birthdays). Win or lose as a TeamAll Apexers are encouraged to collaborate in an effort to continuously improve our processes and customer service. Everyone on the team is responsible for presenting new ideas and perspectives. In addition to base salary, all employees enjoy quarterly profit sharing bonuses as a thank you for their contributions.Responsibilities What We’re Looking ForWe have an opportunity for a Desktop Support Analyst to join our team. This role involves providing technical and troubleshooting support to internal customers across the company. This position is full time Monday through Friday.Opportunity to ExcelOur Desktop Support Team plays a significant role in our internal user experience. They ensure that all Apexers have access to the technology they need to perform their jobs and provide prompt, friendly service when issues arise.  Our most successful Desktop Support Specialists enjoy working in a team environment, communicating daily with our user base, and learning continuously to stay on top of the latest technologies. They love working with our user groups to improve processes and ensure a smooth day-to-day working experience.Qualifications Desired QualificationsWe want individuals with experience troubleshooting a variety of technological issues in an enterprise environment who are customer service oriented. Experience with Windows, Linux, MS Office Suite, Exchange, and Skype for Business is preferred.

Name: Systems Analyst
Company: XPO Logistics Supply Chain LLC of Texas
Description: Logistics done differently. Join XPO Logistics, a company named among the worlds most loved by Fortune and one of Americas best employers by Forbes. At XPO, we know that technology drives our success. As the Field Systems Administrator, you will configure and implement warehouse and transportation start-up projects using technology and process design specifications. On our team, youll have the support to excel at work, and the resources to build a career you can be proud of. Pay, benefits and more. We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more. What youll do on a typical day:Provide consistent administration and support of the systems applications, including handling users, profiles, and roles; customization of objects, fields, record types, and page layoutsWrite, manage, test, and implement workflow triggers, validation rules, alerts, automated email responses; manage and build reports; write configurations and logical queries with advanced Excel spreadsheetsSolve problems and handle ongoing support requests of all staffManage the systems security including roles, profiles, sharing rules, workflows, and groupsDevelop and maintain documentation of system configuration and customizationOversee and lead user onboarding, ongoing training sessions, and supportCraft internal how-to guides and meaningful trainingsDesign, develop, and deliver reports to measure systems uses and impactProactively seek opportunities for technological solutions to improve process efficiency and solve organizational challengesIdentify, develop, and implement continuous improvement solutionsDocument business requirements for systems solutionsStay up-to-date with new releasesDevelop relationship and serve as the liaison with XPOs systems implementation and support consultantWhat you need to succeed at XPO: At a minimum, youll need: Bachelors degree or equivalent experience2 years of experience in transportation or warehouse operations management1 year of experience migrating data with Data Loader or equivalent, building and maintaining automation processes including validation, workflow rules, and process builder1 year of project management of complex solutionsAdvanced proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel), JAVA and HTML Itd be great if you also have: Masters degreeHighly-organized and efficient; excellent time management skillsStrong teaching and instructing skills, with the ability to design engaging workshops for learning professionalsBe part of something big. #LI-AH1 XPO provides cutting-edge supply chain solutions to the world's most successful companies, including Disney, Pepsi, L'Oréal, Toyota and many others. Were the fastest-growing transportation company on the Fortune 500 list and were just getting started.  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, disability, veteran, or other protected status.  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

Name: Sr. Financial Business Analyst
Description: Established, Entrepreneurial, Empowered…Explore the Opportunities!NCH Corporation – Sr. Financial Business Analyst    NCH is currently looking for a Sr. Financial Business Analyst to support NCH China. The individual will assist Finance in FP&A (Financial, Planning & Analysis) for the China division.  We offer opportunities for career advancement, and a culture that recognizes results, while embracing the importance of work/life balance. Join our team as a Sr. Financial Business Analyst, where our future begins with you!    Responsibilities:Lead the annual planning process for the China division, including income statement, balance sheet and cash flows. Analyze historical performance and industrial trends to set up financial targets for the regions, and assist regions in formulating business plans.Manage monthly forecast, consolidate and present forecast to China management to facilitate executive-level business decisions.Develop and maintain financial models/tools for planning/forecast and analysis, and roll out the models/tools.Coordinate monthly financial reviews to analyze financial results, review variances vs. plan and prior year, and develop action plans to meet financial targets.Assist management in preparing presentations to the Executive Committee for quarterly meetings, the annual plan meeting, and other executive events.Perform in-depth analysis to identify issues and opportunities; recommend strategies and solutions to increase revenue, reduce cost, and improve profitability.Update and maintain a Balanced Scorecard reporting system, deliver monthly balanced scorecards for business performance tracking and benchmarking.Create queries with Business Objects, Oracle Discoverer and other business database querying tools, analyze and provide input for performance evaluation and business decisions.Use NPV, IRR, ROI and other financial techniques to analyze business initiatives, including but not limited to capital investment, variable contribution, pricing, and product launches.   Requirements:Undergraduate degree in Finance or Business disciplines, preferably accounting.5+ years of experience in financial and business analysis, with proven ability to dissect business issues, present data in a simple and compelling way, and present to higher level managementBilingual fluency in Mandarin Chinese (preferred) and EnglishInternational business experience preferred. Experience with China highly desiredDemonstrated advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and Power Point, Visual Basic, Access and Business Object preferredAdvanced knowledge of business concepts and tools (NPV, ROI, Break-even, cost-benchmarking, pricing, sensitivity analysis, etc.)Advanced understanding of common financial reports and financial metrics (Income statement, Cash Flow Statement, Balance Sheet)Experience with Oracle or similar ERP software preferredHighly motivated, self-directed, flexible team player with demonstrated ability to thrive in a business-critical high stress environmentAbility to work collaboratively with management level and executive personnelSelf motivated, organized and goal oriented with a keen attention to detailSolid communication skills; ability to develop a method for presenting information in a simple yet impactful wayMust be willing to relocate to Dalian China    Equal Opportunity Employer  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Financial/ Business Analyst
Description: Job Description Global Financial Firm located in Irving, TX has an immediate contract opportunity for an experienced Analyst  The Cyber Security & Network Services (CS&NS) organization is responsible for the management of critical security & network infrastructure, services, and monitoring across the enterprise on a global level.  The CS&NS Business Operations & Shared Services organization aims at allowing CS&N to maintain its focus on strategic initiatives and key programs related to improving the experience of customers and employees, increased productivity, and strengthened controls.  Program/Project Management The Cyber Security & Network Services Business Management Analyst reports directly to the CS&NS Global Business Manager, and is responsible for supporting the centralized management of Investments, Financials and Commercial Transactions. Key Responsibilities: " Oversee, centralize and manage Commercial Transactions for Cyber Security & Network investments; responsible for obtaining business and financial approval for all transactions  " Assess global financial impact for Network and Security purchases  " Accountability for tracking end-to-end procurement process from initial engagement to procurement system processing for purchase orders, etc.  " Invoice management to ensure timely and accurate payments; ensure accruals and taxes are appropriately handled  " MIS Reporting for Senior Management, status updates on investments, financial recognition, commercials, etc.  " Liaise with regional finance teams to ensure proper financial tracking and reporting based off regional/country regulatory or internal requirements  " Provide inputs to investment plan and outlook process  " Create financial presentations for senior management around the current and upcoming years' strategies  " Create and support Initiative Expenditure Proposals (IEPs) for capital purchases greater than $100M outlining the business and financial impact, project milestones, risks and savings.  " Build and maintain relationships with internal and external customers, and business partners  " Develop an inventory system to reconcile purchases with actual devices live on Client's internal network to align actual financial impact with purchases and budgets " Qualifications: " Min. 3-5 years of experience in financial analysis, understanding of Capital Expenditure, depreciation of assets  " Strong analytical and mathematical skills  " Experience with excel formulas and formatting  " Knowledge of basic financial accounting principles  " Experience with MIS reporting, creating management reporting and metrics  " Knowledge and experience in tracking investment expenditures
