Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Summary: The Business Analyst serves as a liaison between the IT and business operations functional areas within Triumph Business Capital. Works closely with product subject matter experts to define and detail business requirements and prioritize feature development. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Consult with business subject matter experts on a regular basis to define and document business and customer needsDevelop system acceptance test plans, objectives, and cases/scriptsIn partnership with the business departments and technical teams, develop detailed systems design specifications and components (e.g., user screens, program logic, calculations, formats, reports, interfaces, etc.)Manage projects using Agile methodologiesParticipate in priority setting for IT initiatives by facilitating discussions with business product managers and development teamsWork closely with development teams to manage the execution of projects on time and within budgetDevelop and manage user communications regarding new functionalityCreate weekly, monthly, and quarterly status reports and provide Supervisor with additional updates as neededTrack and manage issues and risksMaintain awareness of additional stakeholders beyond your project specific activities to identify additional Triumph needs and prioritiesParticipate in systems acceptance testing activities as neededManage vendor relationships and/or resources as neededProvide problem resolution and enhancement support for production applicationsProvide assistance with user training and documentation activitiesSupport M&A integration strategy and planningOther duties are included, as assigned by the manager, according to the needs of the sales group and management.POSITION TYPE AND EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK This is full-time position, and work days are Monday through Friday; at minimum, work hours are 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, however the position may require the employee to travel to attend vendor selection/meetings, potential product conferences, etc. outside of business hours. Work schedule will include evenings and weekends as needed. WORK ENVIRONMENT This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; sit; stoop; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. TRAVEL This position requires up to 10% travel. Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected. OTHER DUTIES Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCEBachelors degree in Business, Management Information Systems or related field or equivalent work experience2+ years project management experience or 4+ years Business Analyst experience in a professional environmentExperience with agile implementation methodologiesDevelopment experience a plusSKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED The successful candidate will possess business operations experience and skills, leadership and management expertise, analytical and critical thinking skills, and attention to detail. Additionally, the ideal candidate should possess the following: Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to flex communication style with technical and non-technical usersStrong project management and organizational skills, with ability to work on multiple projects simultaneouslyAbility to make decisions in a fast paced environmentMust be able to act as liaison between team members and department leadersAbility to work well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experienceSALARY AND EMPLOYMENTCompensation commensurate with experience, skills, position responsibilities;Company benefits including Medical, Vision, Dental, 401K and others. Company DescriptionTriumph Business Capital: Built to Serve Your Unique Needs!  Since 2004, Advance Business Capital has provided invoice factoring for over 7,000 small to mid-size businesses. Our name has changed to Triumph Business Capital, but our success is still measured by the value we bring to each and every client relationship. The strength of our commitment is reflected in product innovation and the strategic partnerships we've established.  TBK Bank, SSB, a subsidiary of Triumph Bancorp, Inc. (Nasdaq: TBK), is a Texas-state savings bank headquartered in Dallas, Texas that offers consumer and commercial banking products from our 61 branches throughout Iowa, Illinois, Colorado, Kansas, New Mexico, and Texas. We also serve a national client base through our Triumph Commercial Finance division, which offers factoring, equipment lending, asset based lending, and premium finance solutions for independent insurance agents. We offer discount factoring through our Advance Business Capital LLC, d/b/a Triumph Business Capital subsidiary and insurance through our Triumph Insurance Group, Inc. subsidiary.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  With minimal supervision and working at the highest technical level of most phases of business analysis, this position collaborates with others to develop new products and enhance existing products. This includes project definition and solution design for requested product and operational enhancements for existing products and internal systems.  REPORTING STRUCTURE & WORK SETTING  This position typically performs work at a WageWorks location with significant technical resources and reports to a Director or VP level with enterprise-wide product development responsibility.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES & PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES  NOTE: The essential duties and primary accountabilities below are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Incumbents may perform all or most of the primary accountabilities listed below. Specific tasks, responsibilities or competencies may be documented in the incumbent’s performance objectives as outlined by the incumbent’s immediate supervisor or manager.  1. Work closely with internal teams (service teams, technical staff, sales, marketing, and operations) and external teams (clients, partners and service vendors) to enhance current products and develop new ones.  2. Provide input into and oversight of project definition and solution design for requested new products, product features, and operational enhancements for internal systems.  3. Act as the liaison between the business units and the technology organization, to manage business priorities, communicate changes in scope or schedule, and call out risks.  2. Perform impact assessment and define the scope of requested product changes, enhancements, new products and new systems.  3. Adhere to and assist product management and other project requestors in adhering to the appropriate software product development process.  4. Define the scope of projects including all internal and external user touch points and processes.  5. Create detailed functional requirement specifications based on defined business requirements.  6. Identify tasks and work with the development team to estimate development costs for proposed projects.  7. Drive and project manage product development projects from inception to customer delivery.  MARGINAL DUTIES & ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS  1. May provide assistance with product development efforts to test products and ensure that systems provide the result or perform as intended.  2. May develop training materials and provide product training to staff and users of product enhancements for which functional requirements have been created.  3. Performs other duties as assigned or apparent.  ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS  WageWorks believes that our success is achieved by its People. Values describe how we work together to achieve our success. It is our employees that drive results through living our Company Values. Every employee at WageWorks is expected to uphold and demonstrate the eight Company Values listed below as an additional component of the job description and as a standard of individual performance.  Clients and Participants Come First: Exceeding client and participant expectations is our highest priority  Integrity: We are open, honest, ethical and conscientious  Passion: A will to win and a relentless drive for excellence  Accountability: Deliver on commitments and take ownership for solving problems and creating solutions  Leadership and Influence: Our actions inspire vision and clarity of purpose  Continuous Improvement and Innovation: We embrace change and drive new ideas into business solutions  Dignity and Respect: We value the diversity of our people, encourage their development and reward their performance  Creating Value for Shareholders: Deliver consistent growth and premium returns  SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY  NOTE: WageWorks leadership will strive to uphold the mission, vision, and values of the organization. They will serve as role models for staff and act in a people-centered and results oriented manner with a focus on customer service.  No formal supervisory authority entailed. This position will act as a resource to less-experienced Business Analysts and may provide matrixed leadership for assigned projects.  ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES  EDUCATION:  Knowledge of software development and/or business management as normally obtained through completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science/engineering, Business, or a related degree. Certified Employee Benefits Specialist (CEBS) certification is desirable.  WORK EXPERIENCE OR RELATED EXPERIENCE:  The knowledge, skill and ability to create detailed functional requirements for software development projects as described as normally obtained through a minimum of 10 or more years progressively responsible business analysis experience.  SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:  Requires the highest level of understanding of the business, technology strategy and platforms, and functional transactions to perform business analysis as described.  Consumer marketing or product management experience in the consumer or financial services industry including:  • Familiarity with Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Health Savings Account (HSA) and Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) programs.  • Direct contact with both employers and employees in an HR or employee benefits-related capacity.  • Project management experience.  • Familiarity with financial services, general accounting principles, bank account reconciliation practices, and operational processes.  A high level of employee benefits knowledge and significant experience as a service or account manager for a group health plan provider, broker agency or benefits consultant, including a keen understanding of benefits administration from an employer’s perspective (the employer/vendor relationship as well as the employer/employee relationship, is strongly preferred.  Must have a high level of interpersonal and communication skills and an exceptional ability to work well with others to effectively interact with internal and external customers and department staff, as described above. The ability to build relationships, influence key decision-makers, and collaborate on a cross-functional team comprised of diverse personalities, skill sets, and levels of experience is required.  The ability to work in a fast-paced, high energy environment that requires flexibility and the capacity to quickly learn and assimilate information/new skills is essential. Must possess the ability to prioritize and perform multiple tasks simultaneously. Outstanding organizational skills, follow-up skills, focus and attention to detail.  Incumbents must have the ability to use initiative and work independently as well as collaboratively with a team.  EQUIPMENT:  A high level of proficiency with business and communications software (preferably Word, Excel, PowerPoint, common Windows operating systems, and Outlook) is required. Knowledge and familiarity with standard project management tools is required.  TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS & CONDITIONS  Travel may be required as necessary to meet with internal and external clients.  WORK ENVIRONMENT CONDITIONS & DEMANDS  Work is generally performed in an office environment in which there is only minimal exposure to unpleasant and/or hazardous working conditions.  PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & DEMANDS  Work requires normal range of hearing and eyesight. Incumbent must be able to use a telephone or headset equipment and operate a keyboard and other office equipment. The ability to perform work at a computer terminal for 6-8 hours a day and function in an environment with constant interruptions is required. At times, incumbents are subject to sitting for prolonged periods. Infrequently, incumbent must be able to lift and move material weighing up to 20 lbs. Incumbent may experience elevated levels of stress during periods of increased activity and with work entailing multiple deadlines.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions as described.

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: JPS Health Network is a $950 million, tax-supported health care system for Tarrant County in North Texas. Licensed for 578 beds, the network includes an acute care hospital and more than 40 community-based clinics, including 19 school-based clinics. John Peter Smith Hospital is home to Tarrant County's first and only Level 1 Trauma Center, its only psychiatric emergency services site and has the largest hospital-based family medicine residency program in the nation. Our network employs more than 6,500 people.  Acclaim is our multispecialty medical practice group. Acclaim has over 300 providers serving the JPS Health Network in specialties ranging from primary care to general surgery and trauma. The Acclaim group has been formed around a common set of incentives and expectations supporting the operational, financial and clinical performance  outcomes of the network. Our goal is to provide high quality, compassionate clinical care for every patient, every time.  For more information, visit www.jpshealthnet.org.  To view all job vacancies, visit www.jobs.jpshealthnet.org/ or www.teamacclaim.org. Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst Requisition Number:8620Employment Type: Full Time Division: Finance Compensation Type: Salaried Job Category: Business / Professional Hours Worked:Location:JPOC 1350Shift Worked: Day Job Description: Description: The Sr. Financial Analyst is responsible for preparing the annual budgets, monthly financial reports, developing forecasting procedures and creating and managing cyclical and special reports timely with accuracy. The Sr. Financial Analyst functions at a more complex level while also supporting the Director of Budget and Financial Analysis with scheduled and non-routine reporting functions. Typical Duties:Acts in a consultative manner to insure effective provision and analysis of departmental issues.Collaborates with management and department leaders to prepare and assemble the Network's operating budgets.Prepares "divisional" budgets which include but are not limited to Depreciation, Fringe Benefits, Insurance, Third Party Allowances, Bad Debt, Charity Care, Interest Expense, and Investment Income.Reviews and analyzes monthly comparative departmental budget reports by comparing actuals to budget, using standards of measurement developed to evaluate performance. Coordinates with managers to explain variances.Prepares written and oral presentations of financial results in both written and graphical formats.?Develops and reviews monthly flex budget results.Maintains and analyzes rolling forecast for system.Assists departmental leadership to identify opportunities for improvement in order to reach financial goals of the organization.Produces monthly statistical report and KPIs.Creates, develops, prepares, and analyzes financial, operational, and quality reports.Performs other job related duties as assigned.Qualifications:Required Education and Experience:Bachelor's Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Information Technology, or related field from an accredited college or university.5 plus years of work experience performing a broad range of planning and analysis activities related to financial reports, budgeting, and strategic planning.Preferred Education and Experience:Master's Degree in Business Administration (MBA) from an accredited college or university.Preferred Licensure/Certification:Certified Professional Accountant (CPA).Location Address: 1350 S. Main Street  Fort Worth, Texas, 76104  United States

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: FleetPride is the largest after-market distributor of heavy-duty truck and trailer parts in the U.S. with some of the best and brightest people in the business! Partner with the best in the heavy-duty industry and apply today!  Plan, design, develop, and launch efficient business, financial, and operational systems in support of core business processes. Gather and analyze data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. Responsible for generating and compiling reports based on their findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues. This position will be primary support for Salesforce.com (SFDC) implementation, administration, enhancement, and integration with other systems.  Essential Tasks Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirements and systems goals.Lead efforts to elicit, review and secure sign-off of business requirements, functional requirements, (SFDC application) functional use cases, functional integration use cases, data migration requirements and reporting requirements through engagement with the business stakeholders and subject matter experts (SMEs).Design, develop, and maintain complex workflows rules, validation rules and custom workflows in salesforce.com.Evaluate new tools and Salesforce updates as they become available and implement where appropriate. Strong technical and functional proficiency in Salesforce.com, performing tasks such as: security settings, workflow rules, custom object creation, reports, and dashboardsCoordinate with technical team members (onsite and potentially offshore) to hand-off requirements in all of the aforementioned areas and to convey a complete understanding of the business’ needs for the same.Suggest design options and provide feedback on feasibility of solution designs proposed by technical team members. Ensure the proposed design meets all of the requirements and identify where gaps may exist and proactively work to close these.Identify and document relevant functional test cases and related testing scripts as a part of the quality assurance process. If necessary, participate in the execution testing and quality assurance related activities.Drive, support and if necessary formally lead a User Acceptance Testing (UAT) effort that culminates in an explicit business approval to use the application in a production environment.As necessary, employing communication skills such as persuasion and negotiation with key business stakeholders and SMEs to obtain this approval.Play a key role in the support enhancements, upgrades and new system deployments for SFDC and potentially EDI, B2B portals, eCommerce and other customer impacting applications.Develop and deliver relevant training directly to the end users of the system, or in a train the trainer format. Coordinate and perform other post-implementation support.Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.When necessary, lead design sessions in prototyping new systems for the purpose of enhancing business processes, operations, and information process flow.Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in the assigned business processes. Perform in the role of Project Manager on technology enabled business projects.Work with FP&A to perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.Create systems models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to system programmers. Conduct research on software and hardware products to justify recommendations and to support business needs. Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members Skills Troubleshooting:Determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it. Equipment Selection:Determining the kinds of tools and equipment needed to do a job. Technology Design: Generating or adapting equipment and technology to serve user needs. Learning Strategies: Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things. Judgment & Decision making: Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one. Communicating:Conveying information to others in an effective manner. Active Learning: Understanding the implication of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making. Time Management: Managing one's own time and the time of others. Mathematics: Ability to use mathematics to solve problems. Critical Thinking: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems. Coordination: Adjusting actions in relation to others’ actions. Service orientation: Actively looking for ways to help people.  Attributes Oral Expression: The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand. Oral Comprehension: The ability to understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Written Comprehension: The ability to understand information and ideas presented in writing. Written Expression: The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.  Originality: The ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem. Complex Problem Solving: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions. Problem Sensitivity: The ability to determine when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It involves recognizing there is a problem and resolving it. Deductive Reasoning: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense. Inductive Reasoning: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).  Physical Demands  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Reaching above shoulder heights, below the waist or lifting as required to file documents and store materials.  Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard or mouse, and to handle other computer components.  Occasional lifting of moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals.  Sitting for extended periods of time.  Environmental / Atmospheric Conditions  The primary environment is characterized by ambient room temperatures, lighting and traditional office equipment found in a typical office environment.  Qualifications Education A Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science, or Management Information Systems.Consideration will be given to an equivalent combination of related education and required work experience. Professional Experience/CompetenciesMinimum of 8+ years of related work experience.5 to 7 years of experience implementing Salesforce.com technology based applications preferably in industrial distribution industry.Proven experience in overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software and hardware solutions that support business processes and transactions.Demonstrated project management principles and skills.Knowledge and experience with both waterfall and agile project methodologiesExcellent understanding of a Sales and Distribution oriented organization’s goals and objectives.Ability to conduct research into systems issues and products as required.Highly self motivated and directed.Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.Exceptional analytical skills and attention to detailsAbility to create meeting presentations that are clear and easy to comprehendAble to document meeting minutes accurately and effectively in an efficient manner to allow meeting members to review in a reasonable timeframe once a meeting has occurred.Able to work independently with minimal supervision This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. He or she will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties requested by his or her supervisor.  FleetPride is the leader in the industry comprised of retail, service, distribution and wholesale divisions.

Name: HRIS Analyst/Ceridian
Description: Wise Foods Inc. is a leading producer of salty snacks with a long heritage. Founded in 1921, Wise is a brand of tradition and authenticity that consumers have come to know and trust over the last 90 years. Since our inception, our iconic brand has symbolized great tasting snacks for many generations of consumers including potato chips; cheese flavored baked and fried corn snacks, tortilla chips, pretzels, popcorn, corn chips, onion rings and other assorted snacks. Wise Foods is fully owned by Arca Continental, the second largest Coca-Cola bottler in Latin America and one of the largest in the world. We invite you to explore growing your career with Wise!  The position will focus on development, support, configuration and maintenance of the human resource information systems (HRIS), to include Workforce Management, Benefits, Performance Management, Compensation, Recruiting, On-Boarding, and Document Management. The position will also be responsible for maintenance of the organizational structure, process enhancements, testing of system changes, HRIS analytics and HR Metrics and reporting. ResponsibilitiesTake a leadership role in the continued evolution of the HRIS - Ceridian Dayforce system.Lead the review, testing and implementation of HR system upgrades and patches. Collaborate with functional and technical staff to coordinate application of upgrades, enhancements, and fixes.Develop and maintain HR system tables, and document processes and results in a quick and efficient manner.Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions, policy changes and/or major variations from established policy, which must be approved by appropriate leadership prior to implementing. Understand and use qualitative and quantitative measurement and data collection design principles.Create, monitor, update and maintain human resources information systems, including hiring systemsPartner with Ceridian Dayforce Manage Services for benefits and payroll, to include data feedsEnsures HR governance model is being followed for all systems: intake, change control, enhancements, break fix, CI, security, change/release calendar and budgetingTroubleshoot, analyze and resolve HRIS issuesAssign and update the various security roles among system administrators and users; create new roles and security access as needed; ensure segregation of dutiesProvide training and support to end usersDevelop user procedures, guidelines, process maps, training materials and documentation. Train users on new functionality.Develop, test, and monitor dashboards, metrics, applicationsReview quantitative and qualitative data to identify trends, propose solutions and take action to ensure integrity in system data and processes.Develop standard and custom reports that meet reporting requirements and can be used by HR Team members in the field. Prepare weekly and monthly HR Metric reports.Work closely with Talent Acquisition for new hire reporting and data tracking.Collaborate with HR and Operational Leaders to define business requirements and build appropriate reporting and metrics.Provide advice and guidance to management regarding system requirements based on company needs.Partner with Payroll on shared structures within Workforce Management.Perform monthly audits for the Affordable Care Act (ACA) process, and assists in the annual ACA IRS filing efforts.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Human Resources, IT, or other related degrees.Minimum of 6 years' experience with enterprise wide systems and implementations, preferably with Ceridian Dayforce or similar systems such as Workday, SAP, Oracle or ADP; for multiple locations.HRIS configuration expertise, Ceridian, Dayforce, Bi Reporting, or SQL experience a plus.Thorough knowledge of MS Excel, Word, Visio, PowerPoint and screen capture tool such as SnagItAbility to troubleshoot systems.Understanding of HR policies and processes.Strong verbal and written communication skills; must be able to effectively communicate sensitive and confidential information.Must be detail-oriented & able to work independently as well as within a team.Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Business Systems Analyst Sr
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Senior Business Systems Analyst with on-line and mobile experience in an agile environment to contribute toward the success of our digital technology initiatives with the overall goal of allowing our Servicing customers to self-serve using a variety of channels. Specific responsibilities include: * Support in the development and delivery of the CBSS servicing digital roadmap with a focus on mobile while including online, text/email, telephony and emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence. * Analysis, design, and testing in support of business and technology improvements from planning through implementation in an agile environment to support the following capabilities: customer communications, payments, statements & documents, default, and portal solutions. * Develops and maintains detailed knowledge of business's current technology and USB on-line capabilities and roadmap along with supporting and leading future technology capabilities. * Develops an on-going support model to ensure on-going availability and support for the digital solution(s) * Frequently interfaces with business lines, including management, and/or internal resources to ensure quality, timeliness, and testing of all project/release work. * Works with technology and application development teams to design or select solutions that appropriately meet the business needs for large and complex projects. * Reviews and coordinates execution of automated test plans while looking for opportunities to improve testing process. Position is responsible for supporting the implementation of the digital strategy to support CBSS Servicing. The digital strategic roadmap for CBSS Servicing focuses on mobile while including online, text/email, telephony and emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence. Overall capabilities covered include: customer communications, account management, payments, default, and Responsive Web solutions. Technical scope spans technology platforms ranging from Mainframe systems, Mobile Technologies, On-line, imaging, middleware, and ETL toolsets. Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship. Basic Qualifications * Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience * At least 6 years experience with activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications. Preferred Skills/Experience Extensive experience in: * On-line and mobile implementations * Information management * Agile software development * IT project management * System analysis * System testing with experience in test automation * IT standards, procedures, policy * Business assessment * Mortgage and Consumer Servicing experience a plus Subject matter expert in: * Requirements analysis with knowledge of test driven requirements * Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with various levels of management and within technology and business * Excellent facilitation skills with business users, business leaders, technology peers and outsourced resources * Self-motivated and takes ownership and accountability for results * Excellent analytical, interpersonal, organizational, and problem-solving skills preferred * Must be an independent, self-starting team player and have the ability to perform in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment * Provide leadership and mentoring to less experienced analysts and collaborate with internal and external teams * Ability to work in a matrix environment across multiple projects and technologies * Knowledge of Six Sigma and Lean concepts a plus * Knowledge of the TFS system and agile backlog and tracking a plusSDL2017

Name: Durablity and Damage Tolerance Analyst Associate
Description: Description:--ENTRY LEVEL--This position is for a Structural Analyst with Lockheed Martin's F-35 Joint Strike Fighter Program. This position requires an Airframe Structural Analyst to use their technical expertise to analyze aircraft structure and subsystems installations. The candidate will apply his or her understanding of the technical principles of structural analysis toward the solution of technical problems. The candidate will have thorough knowledge in the field of aircraft structural analysis and will have a broad knowledge of all related disciplines. The candidate will be responsible for preliminary and detailed durability and damage tolerance analysis of Material Review Board (MRB) findings, aircraft structures, structural assemblies, participation in trade studies, support of durability test and correlation, and coordination with other Integrated Product Teams. Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Selected applicant will not require a secret clearance to begin employment, but will be submitted for a secret clearance afterwards.Basic Qualifications:Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in an Engineering Technical Discipline such as Mechanical, Aerospace, Aeronautical, or Civil Engineering.Desired Skills:Entry Level Knowledge of --Structural analysis hand calculation methods- Stress Analysis --Durability and Damage Tolerance--Familiar with fatigue & fracture--Finite Element Analysis (FEA)--ABAQUS--MSC NASTRAN/PATRAN--Metallic and composite analysis--Familiarity with CATIA V5--Understanding of drawing practices, material properties, and manufacturing processes--Excellent writing and communication skills- Microsoft OfficeBASIC QUALIFICATIONS:job.QualificationsLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.Join us at Lockheed Martin, where were engineering a better tomorrow.EXPERIENCE LEVEL:4 yr and up College

Name: Information Systems Security Risk Analyst
Description: Description:The selected candidate will join the LMA Classified Cybersecurity Team as an Information System Security Officer (ISSO) supporting Special Access Programs (SAPs) to ensure classified information systems (IS) meet cybersecurity requirements and government directives.  Interpret the Joint Special Access Program (SAP) Implementation Guide (JSIG) to assist in determining technical Information Assurance (IA) requirements and facilitate proper security implementation of the Risk Management Framework (RMF).  Develop system documentation for information system authorization, security management, and continuous monitoring of both networked and standalone classified systems. Perform system auditing, vulnerability risk assessments, Assured File Transfers, hardware/software configuration management, data integrity containments and investigations on IA related security violations/incidents.  Assist with providing cybersecurity education and training for all system users on appropriate risk mitigation strategies.  Interface with internal/external customers to identify requirements and provide problem resolution. Perform other associated duties as required.  Possess an active DoD Secret security clearance, based upon a National Agency Check with Local Agency Check (NAC/LC) conducted within the last five years and access eligibility for Special Access Programs.  Subject to routine government security investigations and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information throughout their employment as required by the job.  MUST BE A U.S. CITIZEN - This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Basic Qualifications: Experience in at least one of the following: system administration, information assurance, and/or cybersecurity  Possess DoD 8570 IAM Level I certification (i.e. Security+ CE, CAP) Desired Skills: Experience as an Information System Security Officer (ISSO)  Experience with Risk Managed Framework (RMF) or Joint Special Access Program (SAP) Implementation Guide (JSIG) requirements  Experience supporting Special Access Required (SAR) security environments  Familiar with STIG Viewer, SCAP, Retina, SPLUNK, Nessus Security Center, and ACAS BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  Join us at Lockheed Martin, where were engineering a better tomorrow. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Name: ATO Fraud Strategy Analyst III/II
Description: Job Description: Responsible for developing account takeover fraud detection strategies by performing more complex analysis and modeling with a focus on Small Business and Debit Card activity or Credit Card Electronic Balance Transfers and ACH activity. Uses multiple databases to acquire statistical, financial, transactional, and non-monetary event data to identify fraud patterns and activity for the creation of optimal fraud detection strategy rules. Utilizes portfolio trends to propose strategy/policy/procedural changes within assigned segmentation structure to produce optimal results as well as to provide updates for senior management. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Builds relationships with external agencies. Participates in the rollout of company-wide pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models. Duties primarily include the regular use of discretion, independent judgment, the ability to communicate with multiple levels of management and the utilization of core leadership behaviors. Proficiency with SAS, SQL, and/or other statistical and analytical tools preferred; knowledge of fraud strategy management preferred; 2-5 years' experience preferred.  May be filled as an Analyst II or III depending on experience and skill set. Job Description:Responsible for establishing and maintaining account takeover fraud detection rules and strategies for Small Business and Debit Card activity or Credit Card Electronic Balance Transfer and ACH activity.Defines the criteria to systematically impact customer transactions and to determine which accounts need to be alerted to the detection operations teams for review and customer contact.Responds to suspicious activity across the enterprise by interdicting and/or alerting suspicious activity while balancing customer experience, fraud risk, operations capacity, and regulations.Monitors incoming fraud claims and overdraft activity for trends.Performs fraud strategy/rule definition, implementation, and performance monitoring.Prepares regular management updates of strategy performance, trends, and key issues.Performs data analysis of operations capacity, performance and alert prioritization.Serves as expert with regards to assigned fraud detection systems in order to determine how to best leverage the technology.Required Skills and Experience:2+ years of proficiency with SAS and/or other statistical and analytical tools2+ years of proficiency with SQL, specifically the ability to write, interpret, and data mine the results of queries in large data environments i.e. SQL Server, Teradata, Oracle, or similar enterprise database platformsAnalytical, logical reasoning, and problem solving skillsIntermediate level skills in Microsoft Office Suite, specifically ExcelStrong intellectual curiosity and passion for innovationAbility to communicate effectively and influence others to drive results Desired Skills and Experience:2-5 years fraud strategy creation and/or management experienceKnowledge of SFM, Brainiac, and/or FLASH fraud detection systemsKnowledge of TSYS, ICDP card and processing systemsKnowledge of data platforms such as BACARDI, W, HULC/Hadoop, and/or FRPRExperience in operational and fraud risk in Financial institutionsKnowledge of fraud schemes with a focus on account takeover fraudExperience with credit and/or debit card transaction processing including balance transfers and ACHExperience with small business banking relationships and activity a plusAbility to gather, arrange, process, and model data to support fraud detection strategy developmentCollege degree in quantitative discipline, statistics, math, economics, or computer scienceSix Sigma Enterprise Role Overview:  Responsible for performing more complex analysis and modeling for multiple products with the goal of maximizing profits and asset growth and minimizing risk and operating losses and/or other financial and marketing exposures. Develops complex program models to extract data and uses multiple databases to acquire statistical and financial data. Utilizes portfolio trends to propose policy/procedural changes within segmentation structure to produce optimal results. Excels at risk/reward trade off. Build relationships with external agencies. Participates in the rollout of company-wide pilot programs developed as a result of programmed models. Duties primarily include the regular use of discretion, independent judgment, the ability to communicate with multiple levels of management and the utilization of core leadership behaviors. SAS and/or MicroStrategy experience preferred; 2-5 years experience preferred. Shift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40

Name: Fraud Analyst (Level II)
Description: Job Description The Fraud Analyst II reviews customer accounts for the prevention and detection of possible Fraud. Responsible for more involved research and analysis of account activity to assess levels of risk and fraud type. The incumbent will complete inbound and outbound calls and take appropriate action based on transaction characteristics of greater complexity. Name: 2019 Associate Financial Analyst
Description: At Bell, thinking above and beyond is what we do best. For more than 80 years, we’ve been reimagining the experience of flight – and where it can take us.  We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and to certify a commercial helicopter. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. And today, we’re defining the future of on demand mobility. A Day in the Life of an Associate Financial Analyst: Bell has several opportunities for early career Financial Analysts interested in pursuing a rewarding and challenging career. Our early career employees may find opportunities in the following areas: AccountingAssists in the preparation of Bell Helicopter’s financial statements to ensure that they present fairly the company’s financial position and results of operations.Business Process ControlsProvides support to Textron operating units with military contracts to ensure compliance with the DFARS Business Systems Clause and Sarbanes Oxley section 404 requirements.Military Programs (H-1 and Spares)Provides performance and cost reporting for military program contracts. Part of team responsible for negotiating, contracting, invoicing, collecting and ensuring financial management of large portfolio of contracts.Customer Support and ServicesAssists with demand forecasting, spares inventory management & pricing , warranties, mission critical support (MCS), Bell Training Academy, A/C customizingCommercial Programs (525, 505)Analyses necessary to control and manage cost and schedule, develops budgets and forecasts, and maintains the business case for Bell Helicopter's 525 or 505 helicopter program. Key part of team bringing a new platform to market.Integrated OperationsThrough actionable information, provides essential counsel to the Integrated Operations (I/O) organization to drive improvements across Bell’s manufacturing operations (transmissions, blades, composites, etc.).Responsibilities May Include:Act as Business Partner to program or functionDrive and influence outcomes (not simply report information)Analyze data and provide solutionsInteract with internal and external customersEducation Requirements:Bachelor’s degree is required.Degree in Accounting, Finance, or closely related field required3.0 minimum overall, undergraduate GPA.Minimum Requirements for an Associate Financial Analyst at Bell:0-2 years experience in Accounting, Finance, or related fieldAbility to analyze and interpret program financial dataPC proficiency required in Microsoft Office with a strong emphasis on ExcelAbility to communicate effectively (verbal and written)Must work well in a team environmentMust have the ability to be a self-starter and work with minimal supervision Collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where differences in experiences, backgrounds, and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.

The IA will coordinate the day-to-day efforts in support of F-22 program requirements. Each IA will acquire the knowledge to fully utilize the F-22 program and company legacy systems to accomplish TAV in support of company and customer operational requirements. In doing so, the IA will coordinate with the Technical Lead the actions to direct, redistribute, re-order and coordinate asset movement within the pool of program assets that will best support immediate and forecasted needs. In fulfilling this responsibility, the IA is specifically responsible for development of provisioning data, cataloging, requirements determination, and the associated ordering of initial and replenishment spares. The IA will work with the engineering design authority and Technical Lead to understand change activity and the impact engineering changes have on the hardware he/she manages. Candidate should have technical commodity knowledge specifically to Part H/Supplier knowledge. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter and have demonstrated leadership and good organizational skills.  Must be a US Citizen, this position will require a government security clearance. Name: Business Analyst - AVP
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: NoJob ID: 18071577 DescriptionAbout  CitiCiti,  the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and  does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides  consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of  financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit,  corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services,  and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding  assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on  behalf of our clients.  Citis  Mission  and Value Propositionexplains what we do and Citi  Leadership Standardsexplain  how we do it. Our missionis to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by  responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic  progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by  constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive  impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of  skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work  every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our  strategic priorities.  Diversity is a  key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from  every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our  workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a  priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where  individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for  others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.  Job Overview:The Core Infrastructure Shared Services (CISS) Business Analyst and TPM Support role provides support, guidance and oversight for strategic programs and projects within the organization, including focused management, third party management and reporting for any efforts that are behind schedule or not meeting requirements.In this role, you will focus on producing the Monthly Operations Review (MOR) for the organization, reporting on projects, financials, workforce, and goals. Partnering with representatives from each core function in CISS, Finance, Controllers Office, and Workforce Management, the Analyst will deep dive areas of focus, collecting and analyzing data sources, to gain understanding and knowledge critical to successful reporting and presentations.The TPM Support or BAO Support role is part of Citis Third Party Management (TPM) program. The BAO Support role is designed to help BAOs manage their relationships with third parties and mitigate risk for Citis businesses. The person in this role will collaborate across the business office and operations teams to help Core Infrastructure Shared Services (CISS) BAOs ensure that our third parties deliver products/services in a safe and sound manner that is in compliance with Citis policies and standards as well as applicable laws and regulations.In addition to these reporting responsibilities, the resource will also produce other daily, weekly, monthly or quarterly reports, as well as additional ad hoc reports as needed. The Analyst will contribute to or develop business operations models, Senior Leader updates, and other presentations as needed by management or other Business Office personnel.Key Responsibilities:Provide support to all functions of CISS, administrative and TPM support as well as operational analysis of current projects and initiativesCISS Monthly Operations Review (MOR) communications and creation of executive level presentation decksData analytics for the organization, including but not limited to, reporting on financials, workforce management, service quality, Risks & Controls, and project goalsWorking in conjunction with functional heads to summarize and capture the performance of operations pertaining to CISS focuses and objectivesBuilding samples of charts, figures, graphical representations, etc. to include in analytical tools, executive reports, and technologies dashboardsWriting, drafting, and editing of documents and publications produced by the business office for internal and external useManaging ad hoc requests for investigative work and unique reports to support a CISS sponsored objectiveProduce agendas for weekly/monthly meetings that are attended by functional teams as well as senior level managersExecute BAO activities (as defined in the BAO Handbook) throughout the phases of the Relationship Lifecycle: Planning, Due Diligence/ Third-Party Selection, Contracting, Ongoing Monitoring, and Relationship TerminationComplete initial Risk Assessment for third party and reevaluate as required; identify any significant changes in relationship to trigger update of Risk AssessmentVerify and complete all on-going monitoring tasks to insure third partys compliance to required policies and controlsMonitor third party performance and SLAs; either directly or through coordination with other Citi stakeholdersReview, assess and act on results of Risk Management Assessments/AnalysisLead remediation of any issues or gaps identified from ongoing monitoringDraft and present high-level metrics to applicable senior management and stakeholdersAdditional administrative tasks and team organization/planningQualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent work experienceExcellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to articulate complex and sensitive issues to senior management in a confident mannerAnalytical capabilities with large data setsExperience with reporting toolsExperience in Supply Chain Management, risk management and/or regulatory compliance in one or more of the following risk disciplines: technology risk, business continuity, operational risk, supplier risk, or audit and controls.Understanding of supplier or third-party risk impact in a financial services company preferredExposure to regional / sector risk management teams and an understanding of the sensitivity of the dynamic relationships cross-sectors and regionsAbility to organize and prioritize multiple deliverables while working independently and effectively in a large, global corporate environmentStrong MS PowerPoint and Excel skills

Name: Supermarket Technical Analyst
Description: Position: Supermarket Technical Analyst  As a Technical Analyst, you will be responsible for configuring networked servers, terminals and peripherals, testing and researching new technologies and providing technical support for customers and other staff. Our customers are located across the northeastern US, so some travel will be involved  You should have some practical networking and technical experience along with a strong desire to learn new technologies in the supermarket industry  Job Description: Coordinates and completes the implementation and support of cutting-edge and legacy supermarket applications; ensures all facets of system (hardware, software, networking, etc.) are functioning prior to turning system over to training team  Reports to: Supermarket Implementation Manager  General Duties Configures hardware/software/firmware to match customer specificationsAssists in the installation of hardware at customer's siteFollows-up and supports existing customersPerforms PC and peripheral repairs in-house and on-site including loading of operating systems and software applicationsProvides technical advice and resolves project problemsCoordinates with groups involved in projectsPerforms set-up/configuration and/or training for projects assigned or helps out others performing the same when requestedTrains customers and/or coworkers on the use, set-up and maintenance of software applicationsWorks with minimal supervision and is able to handle most situations on their own.Works with customers and DUMAC employees to resolve support calls while working on other projects; multi-tasking required Special Skills Must possess the ability to maintain appropriate communication with customers via face-to-face, over the phone or in writing an emailSharp listening, creative questioning and good note-taking skills to gain a clear understanding of the software application and needs, in order to provide an effective solutionAbility to work quickly and efficiently to meet deadlinesAbility to learn quickly and retain knowledgeGood creative problem-solving skills, an independent thinker, and a dedication to customer satisfactionPositive 'can-do' attitude, energy and enthusiasm with professional business-like appearance Requirements Needed to Perform Ability to set up and configure various types of point-of-sale and computer systems by setting parameters in the software. Thorough testing and debugging of the parameter settings.Ability to set-up, troubleshoot and test Ethernet networks that utilize Windows 7, Windows 10, Windows 2012 & 2016 Server. Physical Requirements In excellent health, able to lift and transport multiple terminals and computers (approximately up to 50+ lbs.) to various customer sites for an installation.Able to drive long distances on occasion, as some field sites are over 200 miles away.Requires a valid driver's license with good driving record Availability to Work Grocery stores require overnight hours and weekends during an installation or upgrade and may require one or several twelve-hour (or more) days.Generally working regular business hours when not installing a system.Out of town travel to perform installations, to attend seminars and classes or address remote site installation may sometimes be required.Must be able to work until project is completed.Must be willing to be on-call via pager rotation (1 week at a time) Training Needed A college degree is recommended.Practical, on the job, experience in TCP/IP networking is required. Knowledge Needed Understanding of the elements, functions, and inter-dependence of all parts of the systemUnderstanding of computer software and networkingA+ certification and/or Network+ certification desirableKnowledge of Windows 7/10, Windows Server, Microsoft SQL, general PC experience, networks/VLANs, TCP/IP is a plusPractical experience working with computers, hard drives, memory and Windows OSSDL2017

Name: Geospatial Services Analyst – Senior
Description: Geospatial Services Analyst – SeniorLocation: Fort Worth, TX Type Of Employment: Full Time Position summary: Under limited supervision, in alignment with the TRWD Geospatial Services department vision, utilize advanced GIS concepts and technology to contribute to TRWD’s Enterprise GIS, supporting all TRWD departments and functions including, but not to be limited to, engineering, operations, facility management, asset management, water transmission, planning, environmental, conservation, watershed modeling, terrain/image processing, as well as other business and customer functions. Independently perform highly complex GIS projects and tasks that develop, enhance, and maintain TRWD’s Enterprise GIS. Perform database design and maintenance, application development, and apply advanced GIS concepts and principles to quickly solve multifaceted spatial problems. Qualifications required:Bachelor’s degree in GIS, Geography, Computer Science, Survey, Geomatics or related discipline or any combination equivalent of experience and education.Must have four (4) years of progressive experience with Esri ArcGIS (Desktop, Enterprise, Applications), database management in SQL Server environment.A Master’s degree in GIS or similar field with GIS-directed course work may be substituted for one (1) year of experience.Understand principles of GIS technology. Strong understanding of an Enterprise GIS.Strong critical thinking skills. The ability to quickly form your own opinion from a variety of different sources and provide results in the form of tangible deliverables.Proven ability to work effectively in a team environment and must be at a level to perform a high percentage of tasks independently.Qualifications desired:Certified Geographic Information System Professional (GISP).Experience working with Latitude Geographics’ Geocortex products, Esri ArcGIS Online, or custom web application development.Experience integrating GIS into multiple facets in an organization, such as integration with business functions (asset management, hydrology, surface modeling).Demonstrated experience with linear referencing concepts.Knowledge of programming languages.Valid Texas driver license.Essential functions and responsibilities:Assist in the administration of TRWD’s Enterprise GIS: Administer, maintain, license, and upgrade the ArcGIS Platform.Monitor server performance, troubleshoot performance and software issues.Recommend hardware needs, assist in the procurement and integration of new software.Ability to manage, maintain, and create web and mobile applications using either Latitude Geographics products, ArcGIS Enterprise, ArcGIS Online, and Esri developer tools.Identify database discrepancies and inconsistencies, recommend and implement database schema changes and design, implement and enforce database quality control and assurance.Coordinate with the TRWD Information Systems department on Enterprise GIS technology.As directed, serve as Geospatial Services project manager utilizing industry standard project management concepts and best practices; managing projects from inception to implementation.Provide oversight of projects and tasks assigned to external consultants and Geospatial Services staff. Coordinates the delivery of GIS services and products to external consultants.Utilizes ArcGIS software to visualize, manipulate, display, create, edit, query and analyze data stored in TRWD’s Enterprise GIS, and ensures GIS/GPS data is accurate, useable, and current.Advance experience in maintaining and analyzing elevations models, performing advanced spatial analysis, and integrating and using linear reference concepts.Capable of interpreting Engineering plans and related documents.Responsible for fulfilling map and data requests from District staff.Maintain proper user and system documentation.Nonessential functions, skills and experience:Working knowledge of Trimble survey equipment and the implementation of that data into GIS.Ability of automating GIS process tasks (ModelBuilder, and/or programming).Understanding of state procurement laws. Ability to review contracts and write proposals.Performs other duties as required.Success factors/job competencies:Proficient knowledge of Esri ArcGIS Desktop, ArcSDE within a Microsoft SQL Server environment, ArcGIS Enterprise, general database design, operation and maintenance, and maintaining a multi-user editing environment.Exercise sound independent judgment within established guidelines and timelines.Must have vast knowledge of and be self-sufficient with spatial analysis processes utilizing GIS, have good analytical and communication skills, and have an aptitude for brainstorming and problem solving.Thorough knowledge and ability to apply industry standard concepts and best practices to plan, organize, and complete multiple complex Geospatial Services projects and tasks efficiently.The ability to assess GIS user needs, identify geographic and information management issues and opportunities, analyze problems and assess alternative solutions, develop sound conclusions and recommendations, prioritize and carry out assigned projects to most effectively meet user needs in a timely manner.Establish and maintain effective working relationships with managers, co-workers, representatives of other departments and divisions, and professionals in other public agencies.Self-starter, strong work ethic with attention to detail in the quality control and assurance of their work.Ability to handle and prioritize multiple work demands, ability to complete all tasks assigned by given deadlines.Positive attitude with a team orientated focus.May require working long or unusual hours.Physical demands and work environment: The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Physical demands: While performing duties of job, employee is required to stand; walk; sit; use hand to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; balance; stoop; talk or hear. Employee must be able lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.Work environment: While performing the duties of this job, the employee may walk on difficult terrain, climb ladders, and enter into confined spaces. This position may require outdoor work in weather conditions prevalent at the time.Equipment Use: Esri ArcGIS software, Trimble surveying equipment & software, personal computer, printer, plotter, calculator, specialized equipment (survey instruments, GPS devices, cathodic protection meters, laser range finder, etc…).

Name: Commercial Bank- Senior Associate - Business Analysis & Reporting Analyst (Wholesale Lending Service
Description: *Senior Associate ?** **Business Analysis & Reporting Analyst** **(Wholesale Lending Services)** Commercial Banking (CB) delivers extensive industry knowledge, local expertise and dedicated service to more than 24,000 global clients, including corporations, municipalities, financial institutions and not-for-profit organizations along with nearly 35,000 real estate investors/owners.  Wholesale Lending Services (WLS) manages the booking & servicing of loan products for firmwide wholesale businesses. With more than 2,000 global employees, 300,000 loans and $2T+ in commitments under management, WLS is a mission-critical operations function for the firm.  The successful candidate will join a global Data, Analytics and Tools (DAT) group, supporting the WLS Middle Office in CB. The Middle Office consists of a variety of functions, including Construction Management, Loan Coordination and Loan Trading. He/she will learn core business processes and partner with Middle Office Operations teams, Technology teams, and DAT team resources to lead both strategy and execution of a comprehensive operational metrics reporting & analytics program. *Primary Responsibilities** + Define, monitor, and report key management metrics; implement and manage scorecards and dashboards at the employee, team, and department levels  + Engage with stakeholders to understand diverse reporting requirements and serve as a thought leader in simplifying the execution of data management and reporting processes, as well as metrics definitions  + Conduct time studies for each key process to understand organizational and activity-level effort requirements. Manage ongoing time study refresh in response to material process changes  + Develop a headcount capacity and forecasting model to ensure appropriate staffing levels in anticipation of expected volume patterns; refresh based on actually observed monthly volumes  + Provide a high level of responsiveness to executive ad-hoc requests related to process improvement analysis and ?what-if? scenario modeling  + 7+ years of total experience within MIS, Operations, Finance, and/or Management Consulting roles. The successful candidate will have a unique mix of technical data skills and business acumen, with strong past experience in operational process monitoring & management.  + Proven experience delivering timely, high quality, senior manager-level reporting and analysis from diverse, complex data sources. Attention to detail a must with focus on executive quality presentation  + Excellent communication, project management, and client partnership ability  + Advanced-level ability expected in all MS Office tools (Excel, Pivot Tables, Access, VBA, PowerPoint)  + Proficiency with data analysis toolset required: databases, SQL and data visualization. E.g., Qlik Sense preferred  + Experience in banking  + BS/BA required; quantitative focus strongly preferred  JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.
