This individual will help to ensure world-class support is provided by F-35 Sustainment Support group to their respective systems. The responsibilities will include initiating stock transfer orders and movements of assigned parts / reparable parts between various JSF locations. This position will be working with large amounts of metadata to help make decisions for management of spares and repairs, establishing spares levels at the bases, lateral support, Mission Impaired Capability Awaiting Parts (MICAP) and ad hoc field reports/metrics, buyer/supplier management, and wholesale inventory management. These tasks will be accomplished by using data mining and data analysis and desktop tools as well as through the development and maintenance of databases to accurately track requirements. This position will also review data loaded for accuracy. This position will require the ability to work with a team and / or independently to produce reporting requirements.Basic Qualifications:-Experienced in SAP to perform daily requirements-Advanced experience with Excel and Access-Procurement / Supply chain experience-Able to brief small or large groups-Strong written and verbal communication skills- Candidate must be able to obtain & maintain a secret security clearance. This requires US citizenship.Desired Skills:-Experience working with military customer-F-35 program knowledge / experience-Degree in Supply Chain Management or Business-Warehouse ExperienceBASIC QUALIFICATIONS:job.QualificationsLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. Theyre dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.EXPERIENCE LEVEL:Experienced Professional

Name: Program Scheduler/Analyst
Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences.  Bell is seeking an experienced Integrated Program Scheduler / Analyst to join the team in Fort Worth, TX. This role will support the H-1 military program.  Working in the Project Management Office (PMO), this role will provide direct support to Program and Business Management in relation to Earned Value Management (EVM) to manage project performance and progress of programs related to aircraft design, development, production, procurement or assembly.  This role is responsible for the scheduling for aircraft development programs and supports creation and maintenance of resource loaded schedules for Integrated Product Teams (IPT) and helps ensure integration and synchronization between all IPT schedules in support of program requirements.Responsibilities Include:Support schedule analysis and reporting including program critical path and Schedule Risk Assessments (SRA).Review, correct, and report schedule performance against plans and provide alternatives and corrective actions as appropriate.Support development of proposal schedules with limited information to support company business capture initiatives.Present stakeholders with timely status and anticipate future challenges.Education Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Engineering, Finance, Business Administration or other applicable disciplineRequirements:At least 3 years combined experience in using project management / scheduling software such as Primavera ANDprevious work experience in Earned Value Management (EVM)This position requires strong initiative and willingness to develop solutions to a variety of schedule requests in a team environmentMust be able to work with ambiguityExcellent organizational, communication and analytical skillsMust have strong computer skills including Windows and Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)Preferred Educations, Certification, Skills and Experience:Basic understanding of aircraft design/development/production/procurement/assembly processesDon’t miss the chance to join a diverse, inclusive environment where you feel a sense of belonging. As a member of our global workforce, you will collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where unique experiences, backgrounds and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.

Name: Business Analyst (Irving, TX)
Description: Where good people build rewarding careers.  Think that working in the insurance field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You'll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers' lives. We'll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life. Job Description Job Summary Business Analyst  The Business Analyst (BA) Consultant II assists with analyzing requirements and requests of the business, operations, and other users of IT services. Serves as the contact for business divisions and technology solution providers for all aspects of solution identification. A BA Consultant II supports projects of low complexity.  Key Responsibilities  Participate in information sessions to provide expertise to multiple business areas by analyzing data and leveraging business knowledge to create or contribute to functional designs  Use appropriate tools and techniques to elicit and define requirements that address relatively simple business processes or projects of low to moderate complexity  Assist with project initiation or planning for projects of low to moderate complexity  Consult on the functional test plans and conditions for applications / projects of low to moderate complexity to ensure test plans cover the testing of all defined functional requirements; support data analysis and validation from functional tests  Execute change control process to alter base-line deliverables and scope for projects of low to moderate complexity; escalate requests for deviations from process when necessary  Collaborate with partners in test plan reviews to ensure plans address the testing of defined functional requirements; support data analysis and validation from functional tests  May lead information gathering sessions  Job Qualifications  Education: College degree or equivalent experience  2-4 years experience in insurance, project management, or technology  Insurance industry knowledge preferred  The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.  Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands.  As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary - but that's just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you'll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.  Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.  Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.  Effective July 1, 2014, under Indiana House Enrolled Act (HEA) 1242, it is against public policy of the State of Indiana and a discriminatory practice for an employer to discriminate against a prospective employee on the basis of status as a veteran by refusing to employ an applicant on the basis that they are a veteran of the armed forces of the United States, a member of the Indiana National Guard or a member of a reserve component.  For jobs in San Francisco, please click 'here' for information regarding the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  For jobs in Los Angeles, please click 'here' for information regarding the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.  It is the policy of Allstate to employ the best qualified individuals available for all jobs without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity/gender expression, disability, and citizenship status as a veteran with a disability or veteran of the Vietnam Era.  Apply on Company Website  Job ID: US*1743_******  For your privacy and protection, when applying to a job online, never give your social security number to a prospective employer, provide credit card or bank account information, or perform any sort of monetary transaction. Learn more.  Allstate Insurance Company  The Allstate Corporation is the largest publicly held personal lines property and casualty insurer in America, serving more than 16 million households nationwide. Founded in 1931, Allstate has been dedicated to protecting our customers from life's uncertainties and preparing them for the future for more than 85 years. Allstate became a publicly traded company in 1993, and is listed on the New York Stock Exchange under the trading symbol ALL. As of year-end 2015, Allstate had nearly $104.7 billion in total assets. Contact Info Irving, TX 75015

deconstruction, process improvement, solutioning, testing, and / or remediationThe aptitude to contribute to the evolution of methodologies and procedures in a controlled manner to continually improve a rapid and repeatable delivery channelThe ability to think about the creative process/practical process and understand how things work and whyUnderstanding of workflow based logic and the ability to Name: Quality Analyst II (UAT) - Chase Auto - Ft.
Description: As a Quality Analyst II, you will be a part of the Chase Auto Shared Services team and be primarily responsible for coordination and execution of various User Acceptance Testing (UAT) within various originations, servicing, collections, financial and data warehouse systems. The Chase Auto Shared Services Team consists of Project Managers, Business Analysts and the Testing team and is responsible for executing all business projects and business priorities.Responsibilities include but are not limited to:Creation and execution of detailed test strategies/plans Identification, creation, and execution of User Acceptance scripts which includes business end- to-end processesParticipation and representation of testing team on project team meetingsParticipation or managing project defect callsProvide progress reporting, defect tracking and risk assessments on assigned projectsCoordinate and validate production implementations for assigned projectsAssess risk to quality based on results of verification and validation and making appropriate recommendations. Coordination with other Quality Assurance Leads on projects that have downstream or cross lines of business impactsIntermediate to advanced experience with test planning, test execution and defect management 2 years of software quality assurance testing experience with minimum intermediate knowledge of software development lifecycle principles and quality assurance methodology 2 year of experience working with developers, project and/or release managers Solid understanding of Project Management methodologies and deliverables Experience with testing tools such as HP ALM, Mercury's Test Director, Winrunner or Loadrunner is preferredAuto Finance experience is a plus Knowledge of Chase Auto Origination systems (ACAPS) is a plus Intermediate to advanced MS Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Project skills Strong verbal and written communication skills as well as effective meeting facilitation skills Outstanding in-person and virtual team skills are a must while also being able to work independently Strong relationship and/or client management skills Ability to multi task and handle multiple key projects at the same time Able to manage time effectively, prioritize and escalate appropriately Strong attention to detail, follow-through and results oriented

Name: 2019 Associate Financial Analyst
Description: At Bell, thinking above and beyond is what we do best. For more than 80 years, we’ve been reimagining the experience of flight – and where it can take us.We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and to certify a commercial helicopter. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. And today, we’re defining the future of on demand mobility.A Day in the Life of an Associate Financial Analyst:Bell has several opportunities for early career Financial Analysts interested in pursuing a rewarding and challenging career. Our early career employees may find opportunities in the following areas:AccountingAssists in the preparation of Bell Helicopter’s financial statements to ensure that they present fairly the company’s financial position and results of operations.Business Process ControlsProvides support to Textron operating units with military contracts to ensure compliance with the DFARS Business Systems Clause and Sarbanes Oxley section 404 requirements.Military Programs (H-1 and Spares)Provides performance and cost reporting for military program contracts. Part of team responsible for negotiating, contracting, invoicing, collecting and ensuring financial management of large portfolio of contracts.Customer Support and ServicesAssists with demand forecasting, spares inventory management & pricing , warranties, mission critical support (MCS), Bell Training Academy, A/C customizingCommercial Programs (525, 505)Analyses necessary to control and manage cost and schedule, develops budgets and forecasts, and maintains the business case for Bell Helicopter's 525 or 505 helicopter program. Key part of team bringing a new platform to market.Integrated OperationsThrough actionable information, provides essential counsel to the Integrated Operations (I/O) organization to drive improvements across Bell’s manufacturing operations (transmissions, blades, composites, etc.). Responsibilities May Include:Act as Business Partner to program or functionDrive and influence outcomes (not simply report information)Analyze data and provide solutionsInteract with internal and external customersEducation Requirements:Bachelor’s degree is required.Degree in Accounting, Finance, or closely related field required3.0 minimum overall, undergraduate GPA.Minimum Requirements for an Associate Financial Analyst at Bell:0-2 years experience in Accounting, Finance, or related fieldAbility to analyze and interpret program financial dataPC proficiency required in Microsoft Office with a strong emphasis on ExcelAbility to communicate effectively (verbal and written)Must work well in a team environmentMust have the ability to be a self-starter and work with minimal supervisionCollaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where differences in experiences, backgrounds, and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.

Name: Sr. Financial Business Analyst
Description: Established, Entrepreneurial, Empowered…Explore the Opportunities!NCH Corporation – Sr. Financial Business Analyst    NCH is currently looking for a Sr. Financial Business Analyst to support NCH China. The individual will assist Finance in FP&A (Financial, Planning & Analysis) for the China division.  We offer opportunities for career advancement, and a culture that recognizes results, while embracing the importance of work/life balance. Join our team as a Sr. Financial Business Analyst, where our future begins with you!    Responsibilities:Lead the annual planning process for the China division, including income statement, balance sheet and cash flows. Analyze historical performance and industrial trends to set up financial targets for the regions, and assist regions in formulating business plans.Manage monthly forecast, consolidate and present forecast to China management to facilitate executive-level business decisions.Develop and maintain financial models/tools for planning/forecast and analysis, and roll out the models/tools.Coordinate monthly financial reviews to analyze financial results, review variances vs. plan and prior year, and develop action plans to meet financial targets.Assist management in preparing presentations to the Executive Committee for quarterly meetings, the annual plan meeting, and other executive events.Perform in-depth analysis to identify issues and opportunities; recommend strategies and solutions to increase revenue, reduce cost, and improve profitability.Update and maintain a Balanced Scorecard reporting system, deliver monthly balanced scorecards for business performance tracking and benchmarking.Create queries with Business Objects, Oracle Discoverer and other business database querying tools, analyze and provide input for performance evaluation and business decisions.Use NPV, IRR, ROI and other financial techniques to analyze business initiatives, including but not limited to capital investment, variable contribution, pricing, and product launches.   Requirements:Undergraduate degree in Finance or Business disciplines, preferably accounting.5+ years of experience in financial and business analysis, with proven ability to dissect business issues, present data in a simple and compelling way, and present to higher level managementBilingual fluency in Mandarin Chinese (preferred) and EnglishInternational business experience preferred. Experience with China highly desiredDemonstrated advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and Power Point, Visual Basic, Access and Business Object preferredAdvanced knowledge of business concepts and tools (NPV, ROI, Break-even, cost-benchmarking, pricing, sensitivity analysis, etc.)Advanced understanding of common financial reports and financial metrics (Income statement, Cash Flow Statement, Balance Sheet)Experience with Oracle or similar ERP software preferredHighly motivated, self-directed, flexible team player with demonstrated ability to thrive in a business-critical high stress environmentAbility to work collaboratively with management level and executive personnelSelf motivated, organized and goal oriented with a keen attention to detailSolid communication skills; ability to develop a method for presenting information in a simple yet impactful wayMust be willing to relocate to Dalian China    Equal Opportunity Employer  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Name: Desktop Support Analyst
Description: Overview About ApexApex has been one of the strongest brands in financial services for the transportation industry since 1995, primarily because we’re really good at freight factoring. We manage our clients’ accounts receivable, credit lines, customer relationships, and financial transactions by leveraging our relationships and technical know-how.Why Work for Apex?Apex has been voted one of the best mid-sized companies to work for in Texas since 2009. We’re committed to employee empowerment, team building, and a good work/life balance, and we do our best to make sure that all Apexers have the tools, knowledge, and support they need to enjoy a rewarding career with us. Comfortably nestled just off I-30 and 10 minutes west of downtown Fort Worth, we offer a long list of benefits that make us a premier work location. Some of the highlights:Competitive compensation plans plus profit sharing and regular salary reviews.A high-quality health care plan with a short waiting period.Dental, vision, life, short-term disability, and long-term disability coverage.401(k) plan with matching contributions.Tuition reimbursement for college, plus plenty of Apex managed training classes.360⁰ feedback, leadership training, and a culture that empowers individuality.On-site fitness facilities and a reward driven wellness program.Fun, friendly work environment. We celebrate our accomplishments (and birthdays). Win or lose as a TeamAll Apexers are encouraged to collaborate in an effort to continuously improve our processes and customer service. Everyone on the team is responsible for presenting new ideas and perspectives. In addition to base salary, all employees enjoy quarterly profit sharing bonuses as a thank you for their contributions.Responsibilities What We’re Looking ForWe have an opportunity for a Desktop Support Analyst to join our team. This role involves providing technical and troubleshooting support to internal customers across the company. This position is full time Monday through Friday.Opportunity to ExcelOur Desktop Support Team plays a significant role in our internal user experience. They ensure that all Apexers have access to the technology they need to perform their jobs and provide prompt, friendly service when issues arise.  Our most successful Desktop Support Specialists enjoy working in a team environment, communicating daily with our user base, and learning continuously to stay on top of the latest technologies. They love working with our user groups to improve processes and ensure a smooth day-to-day working experience.Qualifications Desired QualificationsWe want individuals with experience troubleshooting a variety of technological issues in an enterprise environment who are customer service oriented. Experience with Windows, Linux, MS Office Suite, Exchange, and Skype for Business is preferred.

Name: Business Analyst - AVP
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: NoJob ID: 18071577 DescriptionAbout  CitiCiti,  the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and  does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides  consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of  financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit,  corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services,  and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding  assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on  behalf of our clients.  Citis  Mission  and Value Propositionexplains what we do and Citi  Leadership Standardsexplain  how we do it. Our missionis to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by  responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic  progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by  constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive  impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of  skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work  every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our  strategic priorities.  Diversity is a  key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from  every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our  workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a  priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where  individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for  others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.  Job Overview:The Core Infrastructure Shared Services (CISS) Business Analyst and TPM Support role provides support, guidance and oversight for strategic programs and projects within the organization, including focused management, third party management and reporting for any efforts that are behind schedule or not meeting requirements.In this role, you will focus on producing the Monthly Operations Review (MOR) for the organization, reporting on projects, financials, workforce, and goals. Partnering with representatives from each core function in CISS, Finance, Controllers Office, and Workforce Management, the Analyst will deep dive areas of focus, collecting and analyzing data sources, to gain understanding and knowledge critical to successful reporting and presentations.The TPM Support or BAO Support role is part of Citis Third Party Management (TPM) program. The BAO Support role is designed to help BAOs manage their relationships with third parties and mitigate risk for Citis businesses. The person in this role will collaborate across the business office and operations teams to help Core Infrastructure Shared Services (CISS) BAOs ensure that our third parties deliver products/services in a safe and sound manner that is in compliance with Citis policies and standards as well as applicable laws and regulations.In addition to these reporting responsibilities, the resource will also produce other daily, weekly, monthly or quarterly reports, as well as additional ad hoc reports as needed. The Analyst will contribute to or develop business operations models, Senior Leader updates, and other presentations as needed by management or other Business Office personnel.Key Responsibilities:Provide support to all functions of CISS, administrative and TPM support as well as operational analysis of current projects and initiativesCISS Monthly Operations Review (MOR) communications and creation of executive level presentation decksData analytics for the organization, including but not limited to, reporting on financials, workforce management, service quality, Risks & Controls, and project goalsWorking in conjunction with functional heads to summarize and capture the performance of operations pertaining to CISS focuses and objectivesBuilding samples of charts, figures, graphical representations, etc. to include in analytical tools, executive reports, and technologies dashboardsWriting, drafting, and editing of documents and publications produced by the business office for internal and external useManaging ad hoc requests for investigative work and unique reports to support a CISS sponsored objectiveProduce agendas for weekly/monthly meetings that are attended by functional teams as well as senior level managersExecute BAO activities (as defined in the BAO Handbook) throughout the phases of the Relationship Lifecycle: Planning, Due Diligence/ Third-Party Selection, Contracting, Ongoing Monitoring, and Relationship TerminationComplete initial Risk Assessment for third party and reevaluate as required; identify any significant changes in relationship to trigger update of Risk AssessmentVerify and complete all on-going monitoring tasks to insure third partys compliance to required policies and controlsMonitor third party performance and SLAs; either directly or through coordination with other Citi stakeholdersReview, assess and act on results of Risk Management Assessments/AnalysisLead remediation of any issues or gaps identified from ongoing monitoringDraft and present high-level metrics to applicable senior management and stakeholdersAdditional administrative tasks and team organization/planningQualificationsBachelor's degree or equivalent work experienceExcellent communication skills, both oral and written, with the ability to articulate complex and sensitive issues to senior management in a confident mannerAnalytical capabilities with large data setsExperience with reporting toolsExperience in Supply Chain Management, risk management and/or regulatory compliance in one or more of the following risk disciplines: technology risk, business continuity, operational risk, supplier risk, or audit and controls.Understanding of supplier or third-party risk impact in a financial services company preferredExposure to regional / sector risk management teams and an understanding of the sensitivity of the dynamic relationships cross-sectors and regionsAbility to organize and prioritize multiple deliverables while working independently and effectively in a large, global corporate environmentStrong MS PowerPoint and Excel skills

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Summary: The Business Analyst serves as a liaison between the IT and business operations functional areas within Triumph Business Capital. Works closely with product subject matter experts to define and detail business requirements and prioritize feature development. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Consult with business subject matter experts on a regular basis to define and document business and customer needsDevelop system acceptance test plans, objectives, and cases/scriptsIn partnership with the business departments and technical teams, develop detailed systems design specifications and components (e.g., user screens, program logic, calculations, formats, reports, interfaces, etc.)Manage projects using Agile methodologiesParticipate in priority setting for IT initiatives by facilitating discussions with business product managers and development teamsWork closely with development teams to manage the execution of projects on time and within budgetDevelop and manage user communications regarding new functionalityCreate weekly, monthly, and quarterly status reports and provide Supervisor with additional updates as neededTrack and manage issues and risksMaintain awareness of additional stakeholders beyond your project specific activities to identify additional Triumph needs and prioritiesParticipate in systems acceptance testing activities as neededManage vendor relationships and/or resources as neededProvide problem resolution and enhancement support for production applicationsProvide assistance with user training and documentation activitiesSupport M&A integration strategy and planningOther duties are included, as assigned by the manager, according to the needs of the sales group and management.POSITION TYPE AND EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK This is full-time position, and work days are Monday through Friday; at minimum, work hours are 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, however the position may require the employee to travel to attend vendor selection/meetings, potential product conferences, etc. outside of business hours. Work schedule will include evenings and weekends as needed. WORK ENVIRONMENT This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. PHYSICAL DEMANDS The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; sit; stoop; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. TRAVEL This position requires up to 10% travel. Travel is primarily local during the business day, although some out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected. OTHER DUTIES Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCEBachelors degree in Business, Management Information Systems or related field or equivalent work experience2+ years project management experience or 4+ years Business Analyst experience in a professional environmentExperience with agile implementation methodologiesDevelopment experience a plusSKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED The successful candidate will possess business operations experience and skills, leadership and management expertise, analytical and critical thinking skills, and attention to detail. Additionally, the ideal candidate should possess the following: Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to flex communication style with technical and non-technical usersStrong project management and organizational skills, with ability to work on multiple projects simultaneouslyAbility to make decisions in a fast paced environmentMust be able to act as liaison between team members and department leadersAbility to work well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experienceSALARY AND EMPLOYMENTCompensation commensurate with experience, skills, position responsibilities;Company benefits including Medical, Vision, Dental, 401K and others. Company DescriptionTriumph Business Capital: Built to Serve Your Unique Needs!  Since 2004, Advance Business Capital has provided invoice factoring for over 7,000 small to mid-size businesses. Our name has changed to Triumph Business Capital, but our success is still measured by the value we bring to each and every client relationship. The strength of our commitment is reflected in product innovation and the strategic partnerships we've established.  TBK Bank, SSB, a subsidiary of Triumph Bancorp, Inc. (Nasdaq: TBK), is a Texas-state savings bank headquartered in Dallas, Texas that offers consumer and commercial banking products from our 61 branches throughout Iowa, Illinois, Colorado, Kansas, New Mexico, and Texas. We also serve a national client base through our Triumph Commercial Finance division, which offers factoring, equipment lending, asset based lending, and premium finance solutions for independent insurance agents. We offer discount factoring through our Advance Business Capital LLC, d/b/a Triumph Business Capital subsidiary and insurance through our Triumph Insurance Group, Inc. subsidiary.

Name: Financial/ Business Analyst
Description: Job Description Global Financial Firm located in Irving, TX has an immediate contract opportunity for an experienced Analyst  The Cyber Security & Network Services (CS&NS) organization is responsible for the management of critical security & network infrastructure, services, and monitoring across the enterprise on a global level.  The CS&NS Business Operations & Shared Services organization aims at allowing CS&N to maintain its focus on strategic initiatives and key programs related to improving the experience of customers and employees, increased productivity, and strengthened controls.  Program/Project Management The Cyber Security & Network Services Business Management Analyst reports directly to the CS&NS Global Business Manager, and is responsible for supporting the centralized management of Investments, Financials and Commercial Transactions. Key Responsibilities: " Oversee, centralize and manage Commercial Transactions for Cyber Security & Network investments; responsible for obtaining business and financial approval for all transactions  " Assess global financial impact for Network and Security purchases  " Accountability for tracking end-to-end procurement process from initial engagement to procurement system processing for purchase orders, etc.  " Invoice management to ensure timely and accurate payments; ensure accruals and taxes are appropriately handled  " MIS Reporting for Senior Management, status updates on investments, financial recognition, commercials, etc.  " Liaise with regional finance teams to ensure proper financial tracking and reporting based off regional/country regulatory or internal requirements  " Provide inputs to investment plan and outlook process  " Create financial presentations for senior management around the current and upcoming years' strategies  " Create and support Initiative Expenditure Proposals (IEPs) for capital purchases greater than $100M outlining the business and financial impact, project milestones, risks and savings.  " Build and maintain relationships with internal and external customers, and business partners  " Develop an inventory system to reconcile purchases with actual devices live on Client's internal network to align actual financial impact with purchases and budgets " Qualifications: " Min. 3-5 years of experience in financial analysis, understanding of Capital Expenditure, depreciation of assets  " Strong analytical and mathematical skills  " Experience with excel formulas and formatting  " Knowledge of basic financial accounting principles  " Experience with MIS reporting, creating management reporting and metrics  " Knowledge and experience in tracking investment expenditures

Name: Sr. Integrated Program Scheduler/Analyst
Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences.The Senior Integrated Program Scheduler Analyst role is in the PMO and provides direct support to Program and Business Management in relation to Earned Value Management (EVM) Scheduling for aircraft development programs.This position is located in Fort Worth, TX headquarters for Bell. Responsibilities Include:Lead in creation and maintenance of resource loaded schedules for Integrated Product Teams (IPT) and help ensure integration and synchronization between all IPT schedules in support of program requirements.Lead schedule analysis and reporting efforts including program critical path and Schedule Risk Assessments (SRA). Review, correct, and report schedule performance against plans and provide alternatives and corrective actions as appropriate.Lead in development of proposal schedules with limited information to support company business capture initiatives. Present stakeholders with timely status and anticipate future challenges.Act as subject matter expert in scheduling practices and provide training and guidance to program personnelEducation Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Engineering, Finance, Business Administration or other applicable disciplineSkills and Experience Requirements:At least 5 years’ experience with project management/scheduling software (preferably Primavera) required.At least 3 years of experience in Earned Value Management (EVM)Must have strong computer skills including Windows and Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)Advanced understanding of aircraft design / development / production / procurement / assembly processesThis position requires strong initiative and willingness to develop solutions to a variety of schedule requests in a team environment; must be able to work with ambiguityExcellent organizational, communication and analytical skills required Preferred Certification:PMP certification Don’t miss the chance to join a diverse, inclusive environment where you feel a sense of belonging. As a member of our global workforce, you will collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where unique experiences, backgrounds and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  With minimal supervision and working at the highest technical level of most phases of business analysis, this position collaborates with others to develop new products and enhance existing products. This includes project definition and solution design for requested product and operational enhancements for existing products and internal systems.  REPORTING STRUCTURE & WORK SETTING  This position typically performs work at a WageWorks location with significant technical resources and reports to a Director or VP level with enterprise-wide product development responsibility.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES & PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES  NOTE: The essential duties and primary accountabilities below are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Incumbents may perform all or most of the primary accountabilities listed below. Specific tasks, responsibilities or competencies may be documented in the incumbent’s performance objectives as outlined by the incumbent’s immediate supervisor or manager.  1. Work closely with internal teams (service teams, technical staff, sales, marketing, and operations) and external teams (clients, partners and service vendors) to enhance current products and develop new ones.  2. Provide input into and oversight of project definition and solution design for requested new products, product features, and operational enhancements for internal systems.  3. Act as the liaison between the business units and the technology organization, to manage business priorities, communicate changes in scope or schedule, and call out risks.  2. Perform impact assessment and define the scope of requested product changes, enhancements, new products and new systems.  3. Adhere to and assist product management and other project requestors in adhering to the appropriate software product development process.  4. Define the scope of projects including all internal and external user touch points and processes.  5. Create detailed functional requirement specifications based on defined business requirements.  6. Identify tasks and work with the development team to estimate development costs for proposed projects.  7. Drive and project manage product development projects from inception to customer delivery.  MARGINAL DUTIES & ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS  1. May provide assistance with product development efforts to test products and ensure that systems provide the result or perform as intended.  2. May develop training materials and provide product training to staff and users of product enhancements for which functional requirements have been created.  3. Performs other duties as assigned or apparent.  ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS  WageWorks believes that our success is achieved by its People. Values describe how we work together to achieve our success. It is our employees that drive results through living our Company Values. Every employee at WageWorks is expected to uphold and demonstrate the eight Company Values listed below as an additional component of the job description and as a standard of individual performance.  Clients and Participants Come First: Exceeding client and participant expectations is our highest priority  Integrity: We are open, honest, ethical and conscientious  Passion: A will to win and a relentless drive for excellence  Accountability: Deliver on commitments and take ownership for solving problems and creating solutions  Leadership and Influence: Our actions inspire vision and clarity of purpose  Continuous Improvement and Innovation: We embrace change and drive new ideas into business solutions  Dignity and Respect: We value the diversity of our people, encourage their development and reward their performance  Creating Value for Shareholders: Deliver consistent growth and premium returns  SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY  NOTE: WageWorks leadership will strive to uphold the mission, vision, and values of the organization. They will serve as role models for staff and act in a people-centered and results oriented manner with a focus on customer service.  No formal supervisory authority entailed. This position will act as a resource to less-experienced Business Analysts and may provide matrixed leadership for assigned projects.  ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES  EDUCATION:  Knowledge of software development and/or business management as normally obtained through completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science/engineering, Business, or a related degree. Certified Employee Benefits Specialist (CEBS) certification is desirable.  WORK EXPERIENCE OR RELATED EXPERIENCE:  The knowledge, skill and ability to create detailed functional requirements for software development projects as described as normally obtained through a minimum of 10 or more years progressively responsible business analysis experience.  SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:  Requires the highest level of understanding of the business, technology strategy and platforms, and functional transactions to perform business analysis as described.  Consumer marketing or product management experience in the consumer or financial services industry including:  • Familiarity with Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Health Savings Account (HSA) and Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) programs.  • Direct contact with both employers and employees in an HR or employee benefits-related capacity.  • Project management experience.  • Familiarity with financial services, general accounting principles, bank account reconciliation practices, and operational processes.  A high level of employee benefits knowledge and significant experience as a service or account manager for a group health plan provider, broker agency or benefits consultant, including a keen understanding of benefits administration from an employer’s perspective (the employer/vendor relationship as well as the employer/employee relationship, is strongly preferred.  Must have a high level of interpersonal and communication skills and an exceptional ability to work well with others to effectively interact with internal and external customers and department staff, as described above. The ability to build relationships, influence key decision-makers, and collaborate on a cross-functional team comprised of diverse personalities, skill sets, and levels of experience is required.  The ability to work in a fast-paced, high energy environment that requires flexibility and the capacity to quickly learn and assimilate information/new skills is essential. Must possess the ability to prioritize and perform multiple tasks simultaneously. Outstanding organizational skills, follow-up skills, focus and attention to detail.  Incumbents must have the ability to use initiative and work independently as well as collaboratively with a team.  EQUIPMENT:  A high level of proficiency with business and communications software (preferably Word, Excel, PowerPoint, common Windows operating systems, and Outlook) is required. Knowledge and familiarity with standard project management tools is required.  TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS & CONDITIONS  Travel may be required as necessary to meet with internal and external clients.  WORK ENVIRONMENT CONDITIONS & DEMANDS  Work is generally performed in an office environment in which there is only minimal exposure to unpleasant and/or hazardous working conditions.  PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & DEMANDS  Work requires normal range of hearing and eyesight. Incumbent must be able to use a telephone or headset equipment and operate a keyboard and other office equipment. The ability to perform work at a computer terminal for 6-8 hours a day and function in an environment with constant interruptions is required. At times, incumbents are subject to sitting for prolonged periods. Infrequently, incumbent must be able to lift and move material weighing up to 20 lbs. Incumbent may experience elevated levels of stress during periods of increased activity and with work entailing multiple deadlines.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions as described.

Name: HRIS Analyst/Ceridian
Description: Wise Foods Inc. is a leading producer of salty snacks with a long heritage. Founded in 1921, Wise is a brand of tradition and authenticity that consumers have come to know and trust over the last 90 years. Since our inception, our iconic brand has symbolized great tasting snacks for many generations of consumers including potato chips; cheese flavored baked and fried corn snacks, tortilla chips, pretzels, popcorn, corn chips, onion rings and other assorted snacks. Wise Foods is fully owned by Arca Continental, the second largest Coca-Cola bottler in Latin America and one of the largest in the world. We invite you to explore growing your career with Wise!  The position will focus on development, support, configuration and maintenance of the human resource information systems (HRIS), to include Workforce Management, Benefits, Performance Management, Compensation, Recruiting, On-Boarding, and Document Management. The position will also be responsible for maintenance of the organizational structure, process enhancements, testing of system changes, HRIS analytics and HR Metrics and reporting. ResponsibilitiesTake a leadership role in the continued evolution of the HRIS - Ceridian Dayforce system.Lead the review, testing and implementation of HR system upgrades and patches. Collaborate with functional and technical staff to coordinate application of upgrades, enhancements, and fixes.Develop and maintain HR system tables, and document processes and results in a quick and efficient manner.Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions, policy changes and/or major variations from established policy, which must be approved by appropriate leadership prior to implementing. Train users on new functionality.Develop, test, and monitor dashboards, metrics, applicationsReview quantitative and qualitative data to identify trends, propose solutions and take action to ensure integrity in system data and processes.Develop standard and custom reports that meet reporting requirements and can be used by HR Team members in the field. Name: E1355:Operations Analyst Sr Stf
Description: E1355:Operations Analyst Sr Stf  27-Jun-2018 Req ID439134BRLMCareers Business UnitESS0343 AERONAUTICS COMPANYWork Schedule FLEX9x80A-Friday off in 2nd week w/flex hrs/day Security Clearance Top Secret Shift First Direct/Indirect Direct Business Area Aeronautics Company Department1AD100:FW ADP OPERATIONS ANALYSISRelocation/Housing Stipend Available Yes Job Code/Title E1355:Operations Analyst Sr Stf Job Class Systems Engineering: Other Job Category Experienced Professional Industry Job Title Operational Concept Senior Analyst / Air Superiority Pilot Req Type Full-Time Job Description-Lockheed Martin Advanced Development Program-- This position is with our Advanced Development Program (ADP), known as the historic Skunk Works, in Ft Worth, Texas. We are looking for world-class talent for this position to join the 70 year tradition of creating advanced aircraft. Two primary areas of responsibilities: supporting analysis of current and future LM Aeronautics combat platforms as an Operational Concepts Subject Matter Expert (SME) and acting as one of the following: F-35 simulation “Instructor Pilot”, pilot expertise during an ADP Human-In-the-Loop (HITL) event, or event lead for business development and contractual events.  Lockheed Martin Aeronautics Operational Analysis requires an individual to provide operational concept (OpCon), concept of operations (CONOPS), and concept of employment (CONEMP) development for future air-to-air and air-to-surface warfare to include but not limited to Expeditionary Operations; Forcible Entry; Amphibious and Air Assault; Strike; Close Air Support; Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance; and Electronic Warfare across the electromagnetic spectrum, including suppression and destruction of enemy air defenses.  This individual shall be considered by his/her peers a subject matter expert in USAF Air Superiority fighter tactics and employment doctrine over a range of military operations. This individual shall have a working understanding of current and planned technologies for USAF aviation systems, to include communication networks, command and control systems, weapons, and sensors.  Near-term tasking includes acting as the Operations Analysis liaison into several Air Superiority mission effectiveness assessments and creation of new tactical employment concepts for new platforms and technologies in a net-enabled, system-of-systems environment. This activity includes development of appropriate OpCon, CONOPS, CONEMP documents; development of presentation materials; and leading internal and external meetings associated with the development, presentation and delivery of materials to Lockheed Martin, DoD, and international customers.  This individual will also be involved in additional OpCon, CONOPS, and CONEMP development activities relevant to LM product lines across the corporation. Requiring them to drive advanced and innovative operational concepts to support ADP virtual and constructive operational analysis in a system of systems environment. The individual selected will interface internally across the LM Aero Operational Analysis teams including Experimentation, Implementation, and Modeling & Simulation, as well as other Lockheed Martin Aeronautics programs. Externally, the individual will interface across other Lockheed Martin Business Areas, as well as DoD and international customers.  The individual shall have: a TOP SECRET security clearance to start; meet the minimum related experience with an extensive operational military aviation background in multi-role fighter aircraft in joint and coalition operations; the ability to comfortably interface with civilian government, DoD and industry leaders; and a solid understanding of basic systems engineering processes and principles. The individual should also have experience in airborne networking and operational-level command and control concepts. A fighter weapons school graduate with recent combat experience and futuristic visionary thinking is highly desired.  Travel on occasion (approximately 6 - 12 times a year). **Must be a US Citizen. This position is located at a facility that requires special access. Must have an Active Top Secret clearance with the ability to obtain higher level clearances as needed.***Basic QualificationsBachelors or higher level degree from an accredited college in a related discipline; Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Aerospace, with appropriate years of professional experience.Experience in Air Superiority combat military aviation (i.e., Instructor Pilot on one of the following platforms: F-15C, F-22, F-35).Experience with of basic systems engineering processes and principlesExperience in airborne networking and operational-level command and control concepts Must have Top Secret Clearance Desired skillsExtensive operational military aviation background in Air Superiority fighter aircraft in joint and coalition operationsHigher level Military education and training (e.g. Intermediate Developmental Education (IDE), Senior Developmental Education (SDE), or School of Advanced Air and Space Studies (SAASS))Fighter weapons school graduate with recent combat experienceFuturistic visionary thinking is highly desiredF-22, F-35 and ADP Program Clearances/SAP Capability knowledgeExperience working in a Virtual Simulation environmentStrong oral and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to interface with senior civilian government, DoD and industry leaders.Demonstrated ability as an independent, proactive leader who works well within a team, with strong oral and written communication skills.Ability to communicate and coordinate effectively with team members, internal & external customers, and senior leadership.State Texas Virtual no City Fort Worth Zip76108EEOLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.* As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  Join us at Lockheed Martin, where we’re engineering a better tomorrow.

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: FleetPride is the largest after-market distributor of heavy-duty truck and trailer parts in the U.S. with some of the best and brightest people in the business! Partner with the best in the heavy-duty industry and apply today!  Plan, design, develop, and launch efficient business, financial, and operational systems in support of core business processes. Gather and analyze data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements. Responsible for generating and compiling reports based on their findings, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues. This position will be primary support for Salesforce.com (SFDC) implementation, administration, enhancement, and integration with other systems.  Essential Tasks Meet with decision makers, systems owners, and end users to define business, financial, and operations requirements and systems goals.Lead efforts to elicit, review and secure sign-off of business requirements, functional requirements, (SFDC application) functional use cases, functional integration use cases, data migration requirements and reporting requirements through engagement with the business stakeholders and subject matter experts (SMEs).Design, develop, and maintain complex workflows rules, validation rules and custom workflows in salesforce.com.Evaluate new tools and Salesforce updates as they become available and implement where appropriate. Strong technical and functional proficiency in Salesforce.com, performing tasks such as: security settings, workflow rules, custom object creation, reports, and dashboardsCoordinate with technical team members (onsite and potentially offshore) to hand-off requirements in all of the aforementioned areas and to convey a complete understanding of the business’ needs for the same.Suggest design options and provide feedback on feasibility of solution designs proposed by technical team members. Ensure the proposed design meets all of the requirements and identify where gaps may exist and proactively work to close these.Identify and document relevant functional test cases and related testing scripts as a part of the quality assurance process. If necessary, participate in the execution testing and quality assurance related activities.Drive, support and if necessary formally lead a User Acceptance Testing (UAT) effort that culminates in an explicit business approval to use the application in a production environment.As necessary, employing communication skills such as persuasion and negotiation with key business stakeholders and SMEs to obtain this approval.Play a key role in the support enhancements, upgrades and new system deployments for SFDC and potentially EDI, B2B portals, eCommerce and other customer impacting applications.Develop and deliver relevant training directly to the end users of the system, or in a train the trainer format. Coordinate and perform other post-implementation support.Review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.When necessary, lead design sessions in prototyping new systems for the purpose of enhancing business processes, operations, and information process flow.Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in the assigned business processes. Perform in the role of Project Manager on technology enabled business projects.Work with FP&A to perform cost-benefit and return on investment analyses for proposed systems to aid management in making implementation decisions.Create systems models, specifications, diagrams and charts to provide direction to system programmers. Conduct research on software and hardware products to justify recommendations and to support business needs. Provide guidance and/or instruction to junior staff members Skills Troubleshooting:Determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it. Equipment Selection:Determining the kinds of tools and equipment needed to do a job. Technology Design: Generating or adapting equipment and technology to serve user needs. Learning Strategies: Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things. Judgment & Decision making: Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one. Communicating:Conveying information to others in an effective manner. Active Learning: Understanding the implication of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making. Time Management: Managing one's own time and the time of others. Mathematics: Ability to use mathematics to solve problems. Critical Thinking: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems. Coordination: Adjusting actions in relation to others’ actions. Service orientation: Actively looking for ways to help people.  Attributes Oral Expression: The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand. Oral Comprehension: The ability to understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences. Written Comprehension: The ability to understand information and ideas presented in writing. Written Expression: The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.  Originality: The ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem. Complex Problem Solving: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions. Problem Sensitivity: The ability to determine when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It involves recognizing there is a problem and resolving it. Deductive Reasoning: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense. Inductive Reasoning: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).  Physical Demands  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Reaching above shoulder heights, below the waist or lifting as required to file documents and store materials.  Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard or mouse, and to handle other computer components.  Occasional lifting of moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals.  Sitting for extended periods of time.  Environmental / Atmospheric Conditions  The primary environment is characterized by ambient room temperatures, lighting and traditional office equipment found in a typical office environment.  Qualifications Education A Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business Administration, Computer Science, or Management Information Systems.Consideration will be given to an equivalent combination of related education and required work experience. Professional Experience/CompetenciesMinimum of 8+ years of related work experience.5 to 7 years of experience implementing Salesforce.com technology based applications preferably in industrial distribution industry.Proven experience in overseeing the design, development, and implementation of software and hardware solutions that support business processes and transactions.Demonstrated project management principles and skills.Knowledge and experience with both waterfall and agile project methodologiesExcellent understanding of a Sales and Distribution oriented organization’s goals and objectives.Ability to conduct research into systems issues and products as required.Highly self motivated and directed.Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.Exceptional analytical skills and attention to detailsAbility to create meeting presentations that are clear and easy to comprehendAble to document meeting minutes accurately and effectively in an efficient manner to allow meeting members to review in a reasonable timeframe once a meeting has occurred.Able to work independently with minimal supervision This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. He or she will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other duties requested by his or her supervisor.  FleetPride is the leader in the industry comprised of retail, service, distribution and wholesale divisions.

Name: Financial Assurance Analyst II
Description: Overview  The Financial Assurance Analyst II is primarily responsible for facilitating the various aspects of compliance with Sarbanes-Oxley and/or Regulation AB requirements. This is achieved by assessing process risks, documenting business processes, and identifying and evaluating the design of controls, as well as assessing compliance with applicable Regulation AB servicing criteria. The Analyst II will complete work in accordance with applicable methodology (including considerations for the parent company approach where applicable) and standards, defined plans, budgets, and schedules. ResponsibilitiesJOB DUTIES Develop and execute testing and documentation for SOX and/or Regulation AB compliance with supervision.  Assist with periodic Sarbanes-Oxley and/or Regulation AB planning and scoping measures.  Assist management in review and approval of SOX control documentation as needed.  Assist Financial Assurance management with quarterly follow-up on the status of action plans through interaction with management.  Assist Financial Assurance management with data and reporting requests to support GM and/or GMF management .  Perform ongoing research for Sarbanes-Oxley and/or Regulation AB to ensure that the compliance program is current.  Perform leadership roles and other duties as needed to accomplish departmental objectives.  Demonstrate the ability to get along with others and build effective working relationships with team members, all levels of management, and the external audit team. Qualifications Knowledge  Working knowledge of finance/lending operations  Working knowledge of COSO framework  Knowledge of risks and controls  Knowledge of federal, state, and provincial regulations  Working knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles  Knowledge of workpaper software and data mining tools  Working knowledge in analysis and presentation of data  Knowledge of generally accepted auditing standards  Knowledge of fraud risk factors and schemes  Knowledge of Sarbanes-Oxley and/or Regulation AB  General understanding of information technology processes Skills Ability to execute test programs and other tasks with supervision  Self motivated  Able to work independently and as a member of a team  Knowledge of computer skills, Microsoft Office and related software  Deadline oriented  Detail oriented  Good communication , written and verbal skills  Analytical skills  Ability to exercise judgment  Ability to offer knowledgeable advice to management that is specific and practical for the GM Financial environment  Good Business Acumen  Professional skepticism  Leadership skills Education Bachelor?s Degree in Accounting or Finance required  Experience  2-4 years experience preferred  CPA, CIA preferred  Work Condition  Seasonal overtime may be required  Fast-paced office environment  Strong focus on providing quality service to internal and external customers  Flexible schedule with possibility of working long hours  Limited travel may be required to support business needs  Must be able to deal with stressful office conditions while troubleshooting problems

Name: Business Systems Analyst Sr
Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Senior Business Systems Analyst with on-line and mobile experience in an agile environment to contribute toward the success of our digital technology initiatives with the overall goal of allowing our Servicing customers to self-serve using a variety of channels. Specific responsibilities include: * Support in the development and delivery of the CBSS servicing digital roadmap with a focus on mobile while including online, text/email, telephony and emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence. * Analysis, design, and testing in support of business and technology improvements from planning through implementation in an agile environment to support the following capabilities: customer communications, payments, statements & documents, default, and portal solutions. * Develops and maintains detailed knowledge of business's current technology and USB on-line capabilities and roadmap along with supporting and leading future technology capabilities. * Develops an on-going support model to ensure on-going availability and support for the digital solution(s) * Frequently interfaces with business lines, including management, and/or internal resources to ensure quality, timeliness, and testing of all project/release work. * Works with technology and application development teams to design or select solutions that appropriately meet the business needs for large and complex projects. * Reviews and coordinates execution of automated test plans while looking for opportunities to improve testing process. Position is responsible for supporting the implementation of the digital strategy to support CBSS Servicing. The digital strategic roadmap for CBSS Servicing focuses on mobile while including online, text/email, telephony and emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence. Overall capabilities covered include: customer communications, account management, payments, default, and Responsive Web solutions. Technical scope spans technology platforms ranging from Mainframe systems, Mobile Technologies, On-line, imaging, middleware, and ETL toolsets. Successful applicants will exemplify US Bank's ethical principles of uncompromising integrity, respect for others, accountability for decisions and actions, and good citizenship. Basic Qualifications * Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience * At least 6 years experience with activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applications. Preferred Skills/Experience Extensive experience in: * On-line and mobile implementations * Information management * Agile software development * IT project management * System analysis * System testing with experience in test automation * IT standards, procedures, policy * Business assessment * Mortgage and Consumer Servicing experience a plus Subject matter expert in: * Requirements analysis with knowledge of test driven requirements * Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with various levels of management and within technology and business * Excellent facilitation skills with business users, business leaders, technology peers and outsourced resources * Self-motivated and takes ownership and accountability for results * Excellent analytical, interpersonal, organizational, and problem-solving skills preferred * Must be an independent, self-starting team player and have the ability to perform in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment * Provide leadership and mentoring to less experienced analysts and collaborate with internal and external teams * Ability to work in a matrix environment across multiple projects and technologies * Knowledge of Six Sigma and Lean concepts a plus * Knowledge of the TFS system and agile backlog and tracking a plusSDL2017

Name: Durablity and Damage Tolerance Analyst Associate
Description: Description:--ENTRY LEVEL--This position is for a Structural Analyst with Lockheed Martin's F-35 Joint Strike Fighter Program. This position requires an Airframe Structural Analyst to use their technical expertise to analyze aircraft structure and subsystems installations. The candidate will apply his or her understanding of the technical principles of structural analysis toward the solution of technical problems. The candidate will have thorough knowledge in the field of aircraft structural analysis and will have a broad knowledge of all related disciplines. The candidate will be responsible for preliminary and detailed durability and damage tolerance analysis of Material Review Board (MRB) findings, aircraft structures, structural assemblies, participation in trade studies, support of durability test and correlation, and coordination with other Integrated Product Teams. Name: Business Analyst - 2019 Summer Intern
Description: *Req ID:** 43626*Job Family:** Intern Sabre is the global leader in innovative technology that leads the travel industry. We are always looking for bright and driven people who have a penchant for technology and want to hone their skills. If you are interested in challenging work, being part of a global team, and solving complex problems through technology, business intelligence and analytics, and Agile practices - then Sabre is right for you! It is our people who develop and deliver powerful solutions that meet the current and future needs for our airline, hotel, and travel agency customers. *Job Description** Under general supervision with latitude for independent actions, works in a Scrum Team to solve moderately to complex business problems and implements process improvement initiatives, in one or more assigned functional areas and across domains. Name: Associate Analyst - Operations
Description: Position DescriptionPerforms data analytics for Customer Care to identify issues, root cause solutions, and plans to assure compliance to processes and reviews call processing accuracy and for Walmart. Enhances customer engagement and collects customer feedback by researching agent CSAT survey data for Walmart and communicating findings to Management with recommendations for improvement.  Completes work assignments and priorities by using policies, data, and resources; calibrating with managers, co-workers, customers, and other business partners; identifying priorities, deadlines, and expectations; carrying out tasks; communicating progress and information; determining and recommending ways to address improvement opportunities; and adapting to and learning from change, difficulties, and feedback. Responsibilities:Demonstrates up-to-date expertise in operational data analysis and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of processes and customer experienceModels compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrityProvides and supports the implementation of business solutionsIdentifies issues and Solves complex operational and financial problems/issuesProvides support and ensures consistency with the implementation of analytical processes within the teamDevelops key strategies and initiatives for assisting the team in understanding how to identify, develop and analyze relevant data for process, compliance and customer experience improvement.Develops and manages the process for project recommendation workflow Supports and executes complex and multi-variable recurring and ad-hoc requests for data or data set-upMinimum QualificationsBachelors degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Business, or related field and 1 years experience in data analytics, statistics, or related field OR 3 years experience in data analytics, statistics, or related field.
