Name: Credit Review Buyback Analyst I
Description: Overview  The Credit Review Buyback Analyst I is responsible for facilitating the buyback process on the behalf of GM Financial. The buyback process is initiated when Credit Review documents a violation of the dealer agreement and escalates it to the business unit. The Buyback Analyst I works in conjunction with the business unit as they attempt to reach a positive resolution with the business source. This position requires sound judgment, excellent interpersonal and communication skills, initiative, resourcefulness, and the ability to multitask. ResponsibilitiesJOB DUTIES Build effective working relationships with other departments and external parties to accomplish departmental and corporate strategic business goals and objectives.  Educate internal and external parties on the GM Financial Dealer Agreement and violations of the dealer agreement.  Prepare clear and concise legal documentation on the behalf of GM Financial.  Recognize and recommend improvements to the buyback process.  Host regularly scheduled meetings with the Dealer Services' RSMs to discuss buyback resolution strategy.  Provide payment posting instructions when buyback monies are received.  Manage collateral on repossession hold; including but not limited to, coordinating the return of the collateral to the dealership or wholesaling the unit.  Manage the recourse process by monitoring accounts placed on recourse and escalating them as buybacks when a trigger is breached.  Represent Credit Review in business segment meetings, as needed. Qualifications Knowledge  Detailed understanding of the auto finance industry, including funding and/or underwriting of originations  Working knowledge of consumer credit  Competency with Microsoft Office, focusing on Access and Excel  Knowledge of Provenir, Auto IMS, SalesForce, and CPW  Working knowledge of company policies and procedures  Ability to plan, execute, and improve work processes to ensure achievement of business objectives  Ability to understand GM Financials business, apply knowledge and critical thinking skills in day-to-day problems and solutions  Knowledge of company policies and procedures Skills Excellent interpersonal skills  Excellent verbal, written and communication skills  Ability to multitask with minimal supervision  Ability to use appropriate analysis, judgment and logic when solving issues  Detailed oriented  Ability to coach, lead, motivate, and influence others to support departmental goals and objectives  Ability to proactively achieve goals and objectives, which positively impact GM Financials overall business results  Ability to work discreetly with confidential information and situations  Able to supervise multiple tasks with minimal supervision and be self-motivated  Strong problem solving skills  Ability to provide recommendations and making decisions Education Bachelor?s Degree preferred

Name: Credit Analyst I, II, or Senior
Description: Job SummaryThe Credit Analyst I, II, or Senior provides full support to the Commercial Lending Officers and is primarily responsible for underwriting financial transactions involving working capital, equipment, real estate and small company acquisitions. In addition, the credit analyst ensures that proper credit/collateral documentation is obtained, identifies any deviations to loan policy, participates in loan closings and assists in the ongoing monitoring of credits.Essential FunctionsAnalyzes financial statements (including performance ratios) of all levels of quality to develop initial assessment by identifying strengths and weaknesses as pertaining to borrower’s historical operating performance.Prepares written analyses which include:Credit investigation of the borrower and guarantors;Economic and market conditions as they relate to the company, industry, and market area;In-depth historical and projected financial/cash flow analysis, including communicating with the borrower’s accountant to gain a better understanding of the company’s accounting practices;In-depth analysis of the secondary sources of repayment such as collateral;In-depth analysis of a guarantor’s financial position.Identifies borrower’s strengths and weaknessesCollects and maintains industry data; researches industry specific information from outside sources, including conversations with the borrower, industry publications, references from other banks, credit agencies, as well as accessing information through the internet.Attends weekly Loan Committee meetings and is available to answer questions regarding credit analysis as necessary; often presents the loan request to the committee.Participates in customer meetings as requested by officers (may require travel at times).Performs real estate appraisal reviews for lenders in all regions.Processes and establishes accountability pertaining to Commercial Loan Agreement requirements/covenants.Monitors periodic inspections pertaining to real estate construction projects – loan advances versus project completion.Other duties as required. Job RequirementsBachelor’s degree in Business related field required. Strong preference for Finance or Accounting major or concentration.Professional experience in financial, credit, or statistical analysis, and/or statement spreading and assessing companies through internships, part-time or full-time work, and/or extracurricular activities preferred.Experience in credit analysis with commercial loans strongly preferred.Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.Excellent PC skills, including word processing and spreadsheets via Microsoft Office products as well as custom applications and systems.Excellent analytical, time management, organizational and problem-solving skills with the ability to multi-task and work in a deadline-driven environment.Must be self-motivated with strong initiative, accountability, and attention to detail. About the CompanyAt PlainsCapital Bank, we’ve always had a trailblazing spirit. PlainsCapital Bank was founded in 1988 by current Chairman and CEO Alan B. White and a group of young bankers who dreamed of bringing relationship banking to their hometown of Lubbock, Texas. With the acquisition of Plains National Bank, a Lubbock financial institution with one branch and $198.8 million, they began growing the bank one relationship at a time.  Today, PlainsCapital Bank is one of the largest banks in Texas based on deposit market share. We have a statewide presence with more than 65 locations in all major Texas markets. We are a strong and stable financial institution and a trusted community partner. We take pride in helping our customers blaze trails of their own, whether launching or expanding a business, raising a family, or moving into retirement. Our diverse range of services includes commercial banking, treasury management, private banking, and wealth management, as well as consumer banking.  To learn more, please visit us online at plainscapital.com/about.

Name: Risk Analyst II - Portfolio Analytics
Description: Overview  Do you have experience using Excel for data presentation and analysis? Do you have business acumen that lets you "tell the story" rather than just deliver the data? Are you ready to take a challenging role with a company that embraces a culture of respect, integrity, innovation, and personal development? We may be looking for you!  GM Financial's North American division, based at our corporate headquarters in Fort Worth, TX, is experiencing tremendous growth, and to support this growth our Risk Management team is ready to hire a key individual with the following attributes: Strong analytical skillsQuerying (coding) experience in a complex data warehouse environmentExperience building and maintaining complex Excel-based modelsData delivery and presentation experience with Excel and PowerPointAcute attention to detailCan-do attitude About the Risk Management Portfolio Analytics Team  Top of Form  The Risk Management Portfolio Analytics team creates and maintains a robust suite of reporting and analytical tools to assist with interpreting and communicating portfolio performance both internally and externally. The extreme growth GM Financial is experiencing to become the captive finance arm of General Motors has greatly increased the need for innovative portfolio performance monitoring techniques. The areas of the business we support include Corporate Finance, Pricing & Profitability, Servicing, Accounting, and the Executive Team.  Bottom of Form  Basic Function  The Risk Analyst II - Portfolio Analytics will be a key member of the team responsible for analytics and reporting on GM Financial's portfolio performance. Responsibilities Job Duties Contribute to the portfolio performance reporting efforts on an auto finance portfolioUtilize data mining and advanced spreadsheet skills to monitor portfolio performanceEmploy best practices of data analysis and validation to ensure data results are accuratePromote innovative ways to visualize and digest complex dataCreate and maintain organized, efficient, and repeatable processes for monitoring portfolio performanceProactively monitor and report relevant changes in portfolio performance to managementConduct ad hoc research projects incorporating project design, data collection and analysis, summarization of findings, and presentation of resultsSummarize findings, develop recommendations and present analyses to management in a clear, concise, convincing, and actionable formatWork directly with internal customers (management) to create/adjust reports to effectively communicate portfolio performanceQualifications Knowledge Good knowledge of SAS, Excel, Word and PowerPointKnowledge of quantitative, analytical and data miningUnderstanding of the metrics utilized in monitoring a consumer lending portfolio is a plusSkillsAbility to coordinate and balance numerous tasks under pressure and meet deadlinesAbility to design and implement model documentationAbility to identify and understand business issues and map these issues into quantitative questionsAbility to interact collaboratively with internal customersAbility to work with minimal supervisionCapable of managing multiple and varied projectsData analysis, good spreadsheet modeling, and credit risk techniques skillsEffective written and verbal presentation skills with an ability to communicate well with managementEducationBachelor's Degree Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, MIS, or other quantitative field requiredMaster's Degree Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, MIS, or other quantitative field preferred Experience 2+ years experience querying large multi-table datasets and data analysis/presentation required Work Conditions Normal office environmentFast-paced office environmentStrong focus on providing quality service to internal and external customersFlexible schedule with possibility of working long hoursMust be able to deal with stressful office conditions while troubleshooting problemsSDL2017

An Alliance Data* company, Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in 70 offices worldwide. Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: Position Title Senior IT Business Analyst  16-Oct-2018 Department Information Technology Primary Location Irving-TX Job PostingThe Company and the Role: Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, the two essential raw materials in concrete. Lehigh Hanson companies also produce ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.  Lehigh Hanson is part of the HeidelbergCement Group, a global leader in aggregates, cement, concrete, and other downstream activities. The Group employs over 60,000 people at more than 3,000 locations in 60 countries.  Lehigh Hanson is seeking a qualified and proven IT Senior Business Analyst (Sr. BA). As part of the Project Management Office, the Sr. BA develops expertise in several business areas and is primarily responsible for translating business requirements into functional specifications and ensuring projects deliver on the objectives and benefits.  This position will reside at the corporate office in Irving, Texas.  This position is perfect for a proven Business Analyst who would like to align themselves with a progressive and growing company to enhance their skills and career. While working in a fast paced, performance culture, you will begin your career with a proven leader in the cement and construction materials supply.  Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled What you’ll get to do:Involved in requirements gathering and analysis to identify problems and suggest solutions using a systematic, multi-step approach.Work cross-functionally to solve problems and recommend changes to technology solutions and/or business processes.Collaborate within the project team and other external departments to lead the assessment and selection of technology solutions and vendors, including the documentation and management of proposal requests.Understand project objectives and benefits, documents the business case and project charter, including scope, resources and initial budget. Share technical and administrative knowledge to others.Drive project success via formal requirements definition, solution design facilitation, and work with business and technical teams to build detailed test scripts.Leverage several project management methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, and Hybrid) to ensure predictable project success.Lead small projects and/or system enhancements.Provide support to junior staff.Perform other job-related duties as assigned.Who we are looking for:Minimally requires education and/or experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree.Minimum 6-8 years of experience in an information technology environment.Minimum 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst.An energetic passion for continuous improvement.Strong analytical abilityExperience working in IT and cross-functional project teams.Knowledge of prevalent IT and project management methodologies, system development lifecycles and best practices.Prefer Business Analyst or Project Management certification.Prefer industry knowledge of construction materials business processes.Excellent communication and organization skills, verbally and written. Our corporate office supports the Lehigh Hanson plants in North America and offers a competitive benefits package that includes a 401(k) savings plan with company match, tuition reimbursement, and employee purchase program. Amenities include an on-site deli, free covered parking, and free fitness center.  No search firms please. Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: JPS Health Network is a $950 million, tax-supported health care system for Tarrant County in North Texas. Licensed for 578 beds, the network includes an acute care hospital and more than 40 community-based clinics, including 19 school-based clinics. John Peter Smith Hospital is home to Tarrant County's first and only Level 1 Trauma Center, its only psychiatric emergency services site and has the largest hospital-based family medicine residency program in the nation. Our network employs more than 6,500 people.  Acclaim is our multispecialty medical practice group. Acclaim has over 300 providers serving the JPS Health Network in specialties ranging from primary care to general surgery and trauma. The Acclaim group has been formed around a common set of incentives and expectations supporting the operational, financial and clinical performance  outcomes of the network. Our goal is to provide high quality, compassionate clinical care for every patient, every time.  For more information, visit www.jpshealthnet.org.  To view all job vacancies, visit www.jobs.jpshealthnet.org/ or www.teamacclaim.org. Main Street  Fort Worth, Texas, 76104  United States

Name: Business Analyst (CRM / Customer)
Description: JOB SCOPE & PURPOSE The Business Analyst creates solution roadmaps and participates in the development of CRM platforms. They will be highly engaged with the client focusing on requirements definition and conceptual solution design. Name: IS Sr. Business Analyst, Global Finance
Description: This position is open to our Michigan, New Jersey and Texas locations.  The Information Services Global Finance Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for understanding business needs and processes and to act as a partnered liaison between the business and the technical team with special focus on the Corporate Reporting team using Hyperion (HFM) application. The Sr. Business Analyst will be responsible for providing knowledge and expertise to IS (Information Services), the business teams, and process owners in identifying opportunities for technology and supporting prioritization.  The Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for building strong collaborative relationships with our Corporate teams such as Finance and Human Resources. This role is responsible for understanding business processes, eliciting and documenting requirements, and coordinating communication among various business groups and IS technical teams; building and maintaining strong relationship with the Corporate teams and functional teams; and partnering with business and technical teams to drive consensus on the best solution to business problems and the delivery of new solutions and enhancements. Additional responsibilities include:  + Working with a diverse business community to document as-is and to-be business processes.  + Documenting clear and testable requirements which describe a system which will be implemented.  + Recommending business process and system changes to improve efficiency and business outcomes.  + Ensuring clear communication between business stakeholders and IT technical teams.  + Improving the business analysis function through best practices, process management, and mentoring. Minimum Education, Experience & Qualifications: + Bachelor?s degree in Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent required.  + Minimum 5 years of professional experience required.  + Experience in Hyperion (HFM) is a strong plus.  + Ability to work effectively in a matrix organization structure with significant emphasis on collaboration and persuasion, rather than relying entirely on command and control is required.  + Experience with process mapping is required.  + Experience documenting complex processes and presenting them in a clear and understandable format is required.  + Demonstrated ability to understand, evaluate and recommend changes to business processes is required.  + Experience working with high level business stakeholders is required.  + Experience working in a regulated environment is preferred.  + Knowledge of Agile Development methodologies is preferred.  + Demonstrated strong communication and relationship-building skills.  + Demonstrated ability to partner with business representatives at all levels to identify needs, define and document requirements, and drive solutions.  + Demonstrated ability to develop detailed project requests or charters which include project objectives, success criteria, and requirements.  + Experience in identifying opportunities for process optimization, process redesign, or development of new process/policies.  + Demonstrated ability to maintain clear communication channels with IS and business stakeholders.  + Demonstrated ability to explain complex technical concepts to a non-technical audience.  + Demonstrated ability to convert complex business functions into technical specifications.  Work From Home: No  Travel Percentage: Up to 25%  Stryker Corporation is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. Stryker is an EO employer ? M/F/Veteran/Disability.  Stryker Corporation will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor?s legal duty to furnish information.  Stryker is one of the world?s leading medical technology companies and, together with its customers, is driven to make healthcare better. The company offers innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical, and Neurotechnology and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes. More information is available at www.stryker.com

Name: Brokerage Operations Analyst
Description: Tracking Code  NX08  Job DescriptionPosition Summary The Brokerage Operations Analyst is expected to have both mastered the responsibilities of and met all of the knowledge, skill, and ability requirements of the Brokerage Operations Specialist. The Brokerage Operations Analyst is responsible for providing operations and service support in the resolution of some of the most challenging/complex account research situations. Through strong communication skills the Analyst is able to effectively respond to client and Advisor issues through independent actions as well as by collaborating with First Command partners and vendors. They are also counted upon to participate both individually and collaboratively in divisional projects of varying service and operations nature, including but not limited to account adjustments, report monitoring, relationship development, training, documentation, and process improvement. In addition, the ideal candidate is proficient in the following functions: cashiering, trading, cost basis / tax reporting, and trade corrections. Competencies An Analyst must demonstrate a high operational competency specific to mutual funds, managed accounts, brokerage accounts, separately managed accounts, alternative investments, , and annuity products. To be successful in this role, one must be highly motivated with a strong work ethic, achieve success through working independently and a passion for serving others. Analysts are expected to build solid relationships through excellent listening and problem solving skills while maintaining the integrity of the Transfer Agency. Ownership and accountability are second nature traits of a successful Analyst. All associates are expected to foster a positive workplace environment and demonstrate a strong commitment to teamwork, respect and the shared success of the Transfer Agency. ResponsibilitiesApplying detailed industry/product knowledge and functional expertise, a Brokerage Operations Analyst will:Research, resolve and respond to advanced advisor/client inquiries demonstrating a masterful ability to communicate concepts and strategies.Employ strong decision making skills to ensure the client’s best interest is protected with minimal corporate exposure.Demonstrate the ability to make time sensitive risk management decisions within the scope of duties and level of empowerment.Initiate, monitor, report and act upon ACAT, non-NSCC, and direct mutual fund transfers.Process a variety of highly complex financial transactions accurately and timely within departmental standards and regulatory required timeframes.Enhance and grow relationships with Advisors, Home Office Employees, Clients and Fund Partners. departmental procedures and user guides.Develop and implement training to improve overall departmental production and quality.Compile, organize and report on production and quality information to identify trends and collaborate to improve processes.Monitor the regulatory landscape to identify potential issues that may impact First Command's clients and advisors as they relate to changing industry rules and procedures.See Brokerage Operations Associate and Specialist Job Descriptions for more expectations.Knowledge, Skills and AbilitiesAdvanced industry knowledge regarding investment operations and products (including but not limited to separately managed accounts/SMAs and alternative investments).Excellent working knowledge of regulatory (FRB, SEC, FINRA) requirements imposed upon First Command specific to business operations.Continued pursuit of industry knowledge specific to products, services, features, developments and benefits.Accurately decipher, interpret and troubleshoot data provided by internal and external business partners.Superior customer service skills and the ability to collaboratively work with Clients, Advisors, and internal/external business partners, as needed, to resolve highly complex inquiries and issues.Advanced analytical, data-mining and problem solving skills with the ability to analyze trends and identify and communicate problems or concerns.Demonstrate confidence, skill and professionalism demanded in this role to resolve critical issues in a manner that strengthens the client relationship and mitigates risk for the firm.See Brokerage Operations Associate and Specialist Job Descriptions for more expectations.EducationBachelor’s degree in finance, economics, business administration, or related area or equivalent Description: Description:Fort Worth - TX, TX4700A, 4700 Alliance Gateway Freeway, 76177  Christine Marie Hill  20180828-5577 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. to help raise awareness of Information Security issues and concerns affecting the corporationEstablish close relationships with business stakeholders outside of the security and compliance disciplines, working closely with physical security, fraud, legal, and senior leadershipProvide support and assists in the training of junior security staff to increase their understanding of complex security analysis methodologies and issues.Assist in supporting, mentoring, and development of other analystsWe need someone who is forward thinking, has strong presentation skills and solid teamwork skillsWhat you have:Bachelor’s degree (BS preferred) or equivalent experienceExperience using and supporting commercial vulnerability and compliance scanning products (e.g. Qualys, Rapid7, TripWire, Foundstone, nCircle, Nessus)Working knowledge and experience with diverse IT architectures and enterprise IT data centers, external hosted services and cloud computing environments.Experience with configuration management, change control processes, problem determination, root cause analysis, risk assessment, & exception management.2+ years technical operations providing vulnerability system/platform supportAnalytical security certification or demonstrable equilivent experience requiredYou demonstrate these behaviors:Curious: Constantly learns more about our clients, competitors, industry and the broader market to drive insights and decisions Innovative: Defines a compelling vision of the future, and develops breakthrough ideas, whether big or small, that support that vision Overcomes Barriers: Takes responsibility for addressing obstacles that hinder our people and our business Delivers Results: Delivers positive results regardless of circumstances, utilizing the right mix of analysis, judgment, agility and urgency What you’ll get:Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits packageFinancial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discountsWork/Life Balance: Sabbatical, Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee diversity, Strategic partnershipsNot just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life Learn more about Life@Schwab.  Charles Schwab & Co., Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer committed to diversifying its workforce. It is Schwab's policy to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), gender identity or expression, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, legally protected medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, military status, citizenship status or any other status that is protected by law. Schwab also does not discriminate against applicants or employees because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Name: Junior Data Analyst
Description: Paladin Consulting is currently hiring a Junior Data Analyst to join our team working onsite at our client's office located in Arlington, TX.  We work with companies that offer environments for our employees to contribute, learn, and advance their career. We treat you like you are part of the family.  Job Title: Junior Data Analyst  Work Location: Arlington, TX.  Duration: Direct Hire Education/Experience Required: Bachelor's degree in Data Science & Analytics, Management Information Systems or equivalent work experience (mortgage and/or real-estate highly preferred) Job Description & Responsibilities: The Junior Data Analyst is located within the Data & Analytics team. Our Client is concentrated on the understanding and application of data to make decisions for management and improvement of its client's operations and the businesses it serves. The Client primarily specializes in working with data from the Capital Markets, Real Estate and Mortgage Servicing verticals. Their mission is to deliver transparent and effective analytical output to produce insight that will allow our customers to make healthier and more informed decisions about their data that impacts the success of their overall business. As a Junior Data Analyst, you will help in exploring and examining data from disparate source with the goal of discovering patterns and insights that can address business problems. You will assist with analyzing business level data to produce actionable insights utilizing analytics tools and languages such as R, Python, SQL, etc.  Write query to fetch data from relational and non-relational databases Validate machine learning model and conduct quality control  Use regular expressions for text processing  Write python script to automate data transformation pipeline  Data Analysis extracting, comparing and profiling large data sets  Learn and use program languages such as R, Python, or SQL to provide support for data analysis, statistical analysis, root-cause analysis, structured/unstructured predictive analytics, predictive modeling, optimization, and forecasting to produce actionable data-drive insights and outcomes for both time-sensitive and long-term business questions  Skills & Qualifications: Knowledge of database and SQL query  Hands on experience with object-oriented programming language (Java, C#, etc.)  Experience working with Microsoft Excel including its full array of formulas, VBA macros, pivot tables, graphs, etc.  Familiarity with R programming or Python scripting is preferred  Experience developing algorithms is preferred  Excellence in communication and a "get-the-job done " attitude  Self-starter with ability to manage multiple tasks/responsibilities simultaneously  Ability to work as part of a team and ability to work with clients and peers in a respectful and professional manner  Desire to work in a changing environment  For more information or to view other opportunities, visit us at www.paladininc.com.  Paladin is an EEOC employer. We drug test and background check!

Name: Supply Chain Analyst

Weir is an inclusive and innovative organisation where you can be your authentic self. Master’s, MBA, APICS or other related certifications are a plus.1 - 5 years of inventory planning, inventory analysis, inventory forecasting, supply chain analysis or planning, distribution planning, or a similar functionThorough understanding of supply chain operationsStrong analytical skills specifically around analyzing historical trends, data mining and handling large datasets using Microsoft Excel and AccessHigh-energy, detail-oriented professional with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment under pressureStrong team play / participation with the ability to work in a self-directed, dynamic work environmentAbility to work with team members on all levels of the organization and tailor communication and message to audienceLanguage Skills Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. Mathematical Skills Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry. Reasoning Ability Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Computer SkillsExtensive knowledge and experience in Microsoft Excel and PowerPointExperience in Microsoft Access and SQL is preferredExperience with SAP is preferredPhysical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Personal Protective equipment including safety glasses and / or face shield and steel toe safety shoes must be worn in certain areas of the facility.Core CompetenciesTo perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies: Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics. Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Participates in meetings. Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed. Managing People - Includes staff in planning, decision-making, facilitating and process improvement; Takes responsibility for subordinates' activities; Makes self-available to staff; Provides regular performance feedback; Develops subordinates' skills and encourages growth; Solicits and applies customer feedback (internal and external); Fosters quality focus in others; Improves processes, products and services. Continually works to improve supervisory skills. Strategic Thinking - Develops strategies to achieve organizational goals; Understands organization's strengths & weaknesses; Analyzes market and competition; Identifies external threats and opportunities; Adapts strategy to changing conditions.

Name: Risk Analyst (Portfolio Forecasting)
Description: GM Financial' s North American division, based at our corporate headquarters in Fort Worth, TX, is experiencing tremendous growth, and to support this growth our Risk Management team is ready to hire a key individual with the following attributes: Strong analytical skillsQuerying (coding) experience in a complex data warehouse environmentExperience building and maintaining complex Excel-based modelsData delivery and presentation experience with Excel and PowerPointAcute attention to detailCan-do attitude If this description sounds like you, and you are ready to join a dynamic, growing company, check out the full job description below and apply now! About the Risk Management Forecasting Team The Risk Management Forecasting team is responsible for analyzing and projecting credit losses, delinquency, and outstanding receivables for the North America APR and Lease portfolios on a monthly and quarterly basis. The team supports multiple departments including Servicing, Corporate Finance, Pricing and Product Development. The forecast models and related analysis are also the primary framework for communicating portfolio performance trends and expectations to Executive and Senior leadership. The Risk Analyst II - Portfolio Forecasting is responsible for assisting in the design, development, and maintenance of complex portfolio forecasting models. The models are used to support corporate planning, financing and account servicing operations. In addition, this position is responsible for analysis and reporting on factors that affect portfolio performance such as delinquency, loss frequency, loss severity and bankruptcy, and payoffs. JOB DUTIES:Assist in the design, development, and maintenance of sophisticated portfolio forecasting modelsUtilize data mining and advanced spreadsheet skills to participate in complex portfolio forecasting, modeling, analysis, and reporting related to factors that affect portfolio performance such as delinquency, loss frequency, loss severity, bankruptcy, and payoffsEmploy best practices of data analysis and validation to ensure data results are accuratePromote innovative ways to visualize and digest complex dataProactively monitor and report relevant changes in portfolio performance to managementEffectively summarize and communicate portfolio performance trends, expectations, forecast methodology and results to managementQualificationsAdvanced with Microsoft Excel, particularly in building multi-tab, complex modelsExperience with Excel VBA is a plusExperience with respect to data analysis and spreadsheet modeling and/or reportingExperience with coding (SAS or SQL preferred) for data mining and manipulationQuerying skills and knowledge in a data warehouse environmentDemonstrated quantitative skillsAcute attention to detailEffective written and verbal presentation skillsAbility to interact collaboratively and proactively with internal customersCapable of managing multiple projects, including ability to coordinate and balance numerous tasks in a time-sensitive environment, under pressure, meeting deadlinesKnowledgeDemonstrated understanding and experience with the following: Data warehousesData miningReportingData analysis and visualization techniquesUnderstanding of the metrics utilized in monitoring the performance of a consumer lending portfolio is a plusExperienceBachelor's degree required and Master's degree (preferred) in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, MIS, or other quantitative field3+ years of experience working with complex Excel models, querying large multi-table datasets, and data presentation requiredExperience in consumer loan portfolio forecasting and analysis preferredThe qualified candidate will also be able to demonstrate proficiency with the following tools: Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and WordSAS and/or SQL (preferred)VBA (preferred)ADDITIONAL DETAILS: GM Financial is the captive finance arm of General Motors, providing leasing and lending solutions to GM customers across the globe. As a Risk Analyst II, you will be a key team member for one of the most well-known automotive organizations in the world, with a global reputation for excellence. Not only will you enjoy the stability of working for an established industry-leading company, but our continued dynamic growth will also provide you with exceptional career development opportunities and genuine potential for advancement. In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive, affordable, and flexible benefits package, offering you peace of mind and the opportunity to invest in your future.  Here is some of what we have to offer: Medical, Dental, and Vision coverageHealth Savings Account and/or Flex Spending AccountLife and Disability Insurance401(K) with company match*Annual performance incentives*GM vehicle discounts for you and your familyGenerous paid time off (holidays, vacation, sick, personal, and floating holidays)Paid time off for volunteer work through GM Financial' s Community Investment ProgramLearning and professional development programs

Name: Senior Supply Chain Analyst Logistics Services
Description: What you’ll be doing...Description - The Sr Analyst will support the Manager and work with the 3PL and cross functional teams to drive operational efficiency including a renewed focus on the customer experience around returns. This position will be supporting the cross functional teams around programs related to Trade and Device Payment to drive improvements in accuracy, customer experience, and ease of return for an overall best in class return process. This person will be responsible for supporting the end to end operations across the 3PL to drive down costs and continue to support customers including customer service in responding to trouble tickets, identifying root cause analysis and driving change that will improve and drive efficiency and cost savings. As a result, this person will be responsible for coordinating efforts for a cross function team both internal and external to Verizon which includes Supply Chain Management personnel, Retail Store Operations, Finance, Compliance, Inventory and our 3rd Party Logistics provider at the CRTC. Responsibilities - Manage customer support for 6M customer trade in units and coordinate associated support to Device Marketing, Retail Channel, Online, Customer Care, Finance, Compliance, and Area Inventory Teams.  Optimize the Device Recycle program by coordinating with Device Marketing and other internal cross functional teams. As a result this person will work with the manager to drive performance metrics, monitor programs, analyze multi-sets of data to identify gaps, and implement of improvements.  Drive cost savings initiatives for the Device Recycle returns, to support a target of generating $1.5B revenue, by identifying solutions for returns optimization with our 3PL provider at the CRTC.  Responsible to ensure tracking for trends to identify opportunities and gaps.  Coordinate program changes with the 3PL at the CRTC by monitoring changes to the program and ensuring that we have a solution to support changes and enhancements in the program.  Proactively manage and drive strategies to ensure improvements of Key Performance Indicators such as receipt accuracy, turnaround time, Direct Recycle CPU and RPU, velocity to Bid Sale and additional metrics that are estimated as programs continue to grow.  Support the Manager on executing the program recommendations and improvements to drive returns optimization and the best in customer experience across the device recycle program. Decision Making Authority - The Senior Analyst will provide direction on revenue generating initiatives and Device Recycle strategies. This person will be the point of contact from Verizon and will coordinate a cross functional team which includes Device Marketing, Retail Operations, Customer Service, and the 3rd Party Logistics provider at the CRTC. Knowledge & Skills -  •Strong organizational, communication, problem solving, and data analytical skills  •Proficient working with large amounts of data to synthesize a picture  •Proven ability to independently organize and prioritize multiple complex assignments and projects, and successfully driving them to completion within the required timeframe  •Aggressive self-starter; proven success working in a highly dynamic, deadline-driven environment  •Ability to cultivate strong collaborative working relationships and contacts within work group, across the company, and with external organizations  •Demonstrated competency in communication and presentation skills; able to interact effectively with internal and external audiences at all levels What we’re looking for... You’ll need to have: Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of experience.Three or more years of relevant work experience.Strong, working knowledge of Excel. Even better if you have: Strong organizational, communication, problem solving, and data analytical skills.Warehouse, distribution, fulfillment center, or supply chain experience.Ability to query multiple sources of data and analyze results.End-to-end Supply Chain experience with demonstrated ability to manage inventory improvement initiatives.When you join Verizon... You’ll be doing work that matters alongside other talented people, transforming the way people, businesses and things connect with each other. Beyond powering America’s fastest and most reliable network, we’re leading the way in broadband, cloud and security solutions, Internet of Things and innovating in areas such as, video entertainment. Of course, we will offer you great pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. Verizon is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at Verizon. Equal Employment Opportunity We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences,including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

Name: SAP Supply Chain Master Data Analyst
Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA's first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences.  Bell has an open position for a SAP Supply Chain Master Data Analyst that will support Customer and Vendor Master Data Management including maintaining business processes and governance in the Master Data space. Responsibilities:Support end users and provide leadership and facilitation to the functional business owners.Exhibit good organizational and problem-solving skills to help resolve end user problems and process changes or enhancements for all of Bell's Master data functional requirements at all locations.Analyze and model existing business processes. The goal of business process analysis is to understand and document current business procedures and identify areas for improvement.Perform analysis, scope projects, and work with the Process Lead to prioritize deliverablesInput customer request (Vendor and Customer Data)Define/extract reports for group and end users and functional ownersPerform data corrections for end users.Draft updates and releases of related Master Data policies and procedures with Process Leads for their review and acceptance when their organizations are impacted.Identifying areas of improvement to enhance efficiencies within the enterprise.Maintain data issue logs and reports; resolve business data definition issuesProvides analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation.Maintain Master Data SharePoint site and related playbooksParticipates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.Assist with the definition, documentation, maintenance, and communications of data business definitions, standards, quality rules and methods.Demonstrable experience using Microsoft products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Visio. These responsibilities will result in the following outcomes: System Data IntegrityEvolved business process and procedures to meet business needs. Required Education Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Business Information Systems or other similar or related Bachelors degree. Relevant experience in Supply Chain or MDM or CSS in working with data for SAP may be considered in lieu of degree. Required Skills and Experience At least 3 years' experience in relevant Master Data Management area or Supply Chain / CSS experience working with Customers / Vendors in SAP managing data and technical skill set.Ability to communicate well with vendors, customers and internal Bell teams orally, visually and in written communication skills. Preferred Skills and Experience Exposure to multiple database technologies and reporting tools including SAP, SharePoint, Enovia, or CAMS.Prior Industry experience with a US Government supplier Relocation Assistance is not available for this position.  Don't miss the chance to join a diverse, inclusive environment where you feel a sense of belonging. As a member of our global workforce, you will collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where unique experiences, backgrounds and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight.SDL2017

Name: Department Data Analyst - Ft. Worth - Moncrief Cancer Institute
Description: SecurityThis position is security-sensitive and subject to Texas Education Code 51.215, which authorizes UT Southwestern to obtain criminal history record information Experience and EducationBachelor's degree in Science, Information Management, Healthcare Information, Statistics, Business or closely related field and three (3) years data management/analyst work in a clinical or healthcare related field. Familiarity with scientific terms (in biology, biochemistry, chemistry, etc.) preferred.  SQL highly preferred.  SAS or R preferred. Job Duties1. Abstracts data, reconciles data inconsistencies and performs analysis. Interprets numerical data and relates to Manager.  2. Creates data reports from existing databases based on needs analysis leadership and/or clinicians/researchers. Shares vital information with department management team for dissemination across all division.  3. Prepares and submits documents to federal agencies, state agencies, private research funding agencies and other organizations as required by law and contractual vehicle. Monitors existing compliance documents with the terms of contractual vehicle with the university.  4. Monitors data gained from department information services and creates useful downloads for distribution among division directors.  5. Designs and creates merges data files and/or warehouse data sets; determines best methods for efficient capture and merging of information from various data resources and access to tools to generate reports. Facilitates efficient distribution of information gleaned from departmental billing downloads.  6. Partners with senior leadership and/or clinicians/researchers to design and perform complex analyses and report creation, including identifying and interpreting of trends, patterns of variations and implications for improvement initiatives. Focus on patient satisfaction outcomes and scores as noted in quarterly department data downloads.  7. May provide education/training to team members on generation and/or interpretation of data, statistical analysis and application to decision making to improve organization efficiency and outcomes. Provides essential and informative feedback to department manager/director as to how well their area functions within parameters measured.  8. Develops and maintains protocol for maintain department wide volunteer faculty credentialing.  9. Designs and creates tools to capture data, run/build reports and conducts analysis for purpose of measuring productivity and identifying trends/patterns that represent opportunities to improve and increase operational efficiency. Partners with senior leadership for review and data interpretation and then participate in plan development and implementation. *Other Duties: Performs other duties as assigned. UTSouthwestern Medical Center is committed to an educational and working environment that provides equal opportunity to all members of the University community. In accordance with federal and state law, the University prohibits unlawful discrimination, including harassment, on the basis of: race; color; religion; national origin; sex; including sexual harassment; age; disability; genetic information; citizenship status; and protected veteran status. In addition, it is UTSouthwestern policy to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression.

Name: Data Scientist (V-22 Solutions Analyst)
Description: Sr Solution Analyst - V-22 Strategic Readiness  The V-22 Sr Solution Analyst is accountable for the integration, interpretation and transformation of data analysis supporting successful non-material/material solutions towards improved V-22 fleet readiness. This position will support the goal of growing the sustainment business and develop data-driven improvements for sustainment strategies on the V-22 Program. This position will utilize data analytics to perform statistical analysis, model complex business problems, and identify opportunities while guiding & supporting corrective action implementation. Ensures the proper implementation of statistical analysis, value added graphics/interpretation, and continuous improvement methodology towards proposed solutions to increase V-22 Fleet Readiness. Works with various functions within V-22 ILS and Engineering to integrate and prepare large & varied datasets, build specialized databases and computational algorithms in support of valid V-22 fleet readiness solutions. This position is based at Bell Helicopter's headquarters facility in Ft. Worth, TX. Position Responsibilities:Apply mathematical formulas and graphing programs to accurately portray the validity, correlation and impact of existing issues and proposed solutions.Develop and refine analytical approaches to aircraft fleet readiness decisionsPerform analysis using predictive modeling, data/text mining, and statistical toolsUtilize data mining/predictive modeling tools to create meaningful models for fleet readiness strategy & initiative developmentUtilize/create data visualization tools for both internal leadership and external customer reviewMathematically analyze the impact of process steps in current and future state environments toward improved fleet maintenance capabilities and solutionsUse DMAIC methodology to ensure identified process changes are properly quantified, provide measurable improvement, and are sustainable.Assist cross functional teams in data interpretation and process development improvement to include engineering, ILS, and finance organizations.Develop and manage corrective actions/data-driven mitigation plans and brief updates to program leadership.Develop and implement mathematical formulas and graphical representations for V-22 fleet solutions.Provide statistical analysis/justification in support of USG/Industry partnership towards current and future BBPO readiness solutions. Education Requirements Bachelor's Degree in finance or a scientific field is requireMasters Degree is preferred.Position Requirements:8 years of related analytical experience is preferred. 5 years of Aerospace experience is preferredBlack Belt certification is preferredExperience with data preparation, rationalization, and process requiredMust be highly proficient in statistical analysis, formulas and graphingMust be proficient with data mining tools and data visualization toolsExcellent written and oral communication skills are requiredExcellent critical thinking skills are requiredMust be able to gain access to required DoD information systemsSDL2017

Name: Systems Analyst (ATAC, Alliance Field
Description: About Textron: Textron Inc. is a multi-industry company that leverages its global network of aircraft, defense, industrial and finance businesses to provide customers with innovative solutions and services. Textron is known around the world for its powerful brands such as Bell, Cessna, Beechcraft, Hawker, Jacobsen, Kautex, Lycoming, E-Z-GO, and Textron Systems. For more information visit: www.textron.com. About ATAC: Textron Airborne Solutions provides training opportunities for military customers. Within this company is Airborne Tactical Advantage Company (ATAC), which provides tactical flight training and adversary services. Textron's extensive global reach makes for an incomparable training resource. ATAC provides tactical flight training and adversary aggressor services for U.S. Navy, Marine and Air Force pilots, and is the only organization certified to train the Navy's TOPGUN program. ATAC operates simultaneously across five sites and two continents and comprises the world's largest outsourced civilian, tactical airborne training organization and proudly provides the highest quality live training to Squadrons, Air Wings, and Battle Groups. ATAC was the first civilian organization authorized to train the USAF's F-22 Raptors. Summary: The Systems Analyst has the overall responsibility to serve as the interface with assigned functional areas for the purpose of business technology strategy development, solution discovery, service management, risk management, and relationship management. The Systems Analyst serves as the business relationship link between the business and IT and provides highly valued consulting level support and guidance through key IT initiatives. They participate in the following: Communication of decisions, priorities, and relevant project information to appropriate levels of staff regarding operating unit requests and projects and initiativesSharing of knowledge of technology risks and opportunities to build competitive advantage and improve efficiency and effectiveness of operating unitsPartnerships with business leadership and other key stakeholders to define opportunities and identify and prioritize projects based on predefined criteria (e.g. return on investment, productivity, compliance) The Systems Analyst proactively serves as a "trusted advisor" and is the primary IT point of contact to business line leaders and managers. They operate as the key business contact representing IT in promoting IT services and capabilities, provide support in delivering technology products that meet the needs of the business, and focus on strategic initiatives and planning activities for their business area. They strive to understand market challenges, including customer priorities and competitive issues. They are proactive and anticipatory in their thinking. They are, by nature, driven and provide significant value to business units. They serve a role in enabling the business to achieve their objectives through the effective use of technology. Job Responsibilities:Lead, implement, administer and maintain Business Intelligence (BI) projects and support for various BI platforms.Participate in architecture, implementation, design, administration, maintenance, documentation and support of all dashboards, data models, and analytic solutions and ensure continuous 24x7 operations.Assist in the development and implementation of new or revised dashboards, including working on legacy dashboards for migration to the strategic business intelligence toolset.Perform Ad-Hoc Reporting and troubleshooting when dashboards, data models, and analytic solutions are not operational and follow through on resolution and root cause.Provide technical support, direction, and guidance to peers, leadership and associates on the overall business intelligence process and strategy as it relates to the IT and business strategies.Communicate and coordinate with the department and the business to minimize impact during maintenance and upgrade windows. Ensure thorough planning, testing and approval from the business before any transition or implementation.Research, evaluate, monitor and recommend emerging technology and leads investigation and adaptation of beneficial data technologies.Develop guidelines and upgrade techniques for the operational procedure, support and recovery of dashboards, data models, and analytic solutions. Maintain updated documentation as required.Partner with vendors and customers to ensure requirements are gathered and documented.Lead implementations, upgrades, and provide user support for all modules within our Oracle ERP system.Advise on integrations between applications and data transfer between platforms.Understand business processes and configure applications to properly support the needs of the business.Follow the IT Project Management Office (PMO) process when partnering and guiding the user community in new process or procedure implementation.Lead projects using PMO and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) principles.Take accountability for managing schedule, budget, and scope for a given project and follow it through to completion.Effectively contribute to and participate as member of large cross functional teams striving to improve processes.Research, evaluate, monitor and recommend emerging technologies that will improve business performance.Provide on call support to resolve incidents and support users with business critical needs.Qualifications:Bachelors in Computer Science, MIS or equivalent.Two (2) plus years of IT experience preferred.Experience leading small or big projects. Some Project Management essentials preferred but not required.Must exhibit the ability to effectively interface with peers, employees, management and customers within the organization.Must exhibit the ability to understand a wide range of business processes.Must exhibit a high proficiency in analytical and problem solving skills.Must communicate effectively both orally and in writing.SQL or PL/SQL intermediate to advanced experience, specifically with querying and reporting.Knowledge of ETL tools, ERP applications, assorted languages, data standards and protocols such as ASP.NET, XML, Oracle EBS, SAP, eNovia/eMatrix, COLTS, JIRA, SalesForce, and Clover, SAP PI Informatica are a plus.Experience leading projects and working in a team environment.SDL2017

Work Location County: 1162 W Pioneer Pkwy, Arlington TX 76013  Other Work Locations: Various unanticipated locations throughout the U.S.  Job Duties:Perform complex analysis, including planning, program design, development, testing, programming tasks, documentation by applying programming techniques.Apply broad knowledge of Java, J2EE, JAX-WS, Axis2 (web services), JMS, Hibernate, Oracle, DB2, Spring, Drools rules, XML and other related technologies to implement design.Writes new applications of moderate complexity and utilizing standard procedures and techniques.Formulate plans outlining steps required to develop solutions, using structured analysis & design.Develop web services, XML authoring & business rule management solutions for finance and insurance customers.Writing test cases, plans and performing unit, system and regression testing.Regular application maintenance, resolve defects, changed implementation due to new requirement or scope change in production.Evaluate & analyze customer requirement requests for new and modified system functionality.Write design documents, user manuals, and operational guidance to describe program development, logic, coding, and corrections.Prepare flowcharts, use case, sequence and class diagrams to illustrate sequence of steps program must follow & to describe logical operations involved.Estimate development time, ensure timely project milestones and submit plans to project manager. Name: Inventory Data Analyst II
Company: WESTMOOR MFG CO | Panhandle |Rock & Roll Denim
Description: Westmoor Mfg. Co. in Fort Worth, TX seeks an Inventory Data Analyst with advanced MS Excel skills to manage the availability of products and information necessary to meet the needs of Westmoor’s customers and employees. Regular business hours = first shift / day shift. Casual dress code. Include resume in PDF or MS Word format with the application. No phone calls, please.
