Name: Revenue Integrity Senior Analyst RN
Description: Job DescriptionTexas Health Resource is seeking to hire an RN/Registered Nurse Senior Revenue Integrity Analyst. The address is Chase Building, 500 East Border Street, Arlington TX 76010. Salary range is $35.44/hour Max $50.93/hour based on relevant experience. Work Schedule • Full Time: 40 hours per week, Monday-Friday 8:00am-5:00pm Revenue Integrity takes a multidisciplinary approach in the revenue cycle to aid in properly capturing charges and correctly billing for services performed. Revenue Integrity minimizes department rework, reprocessing of multiple claims from misaligned coding, and tracks and trends repeated missed opportunities for compliant charging, gives input for corporate charging policies and proactively finds and/or invents tools to streamline and/or improve charging processes. The essential job duties for this position are: • Analyze daily financial exceptions, for complex service lines, using charge capture reports to determine areas of leakage and partner with THR' HIM department, CBO, Compliance, Chargemaster Services, and clinical service lines to rectify charge capture issues by assisting service lines to improve their ability to capture compliant charges. • Mentors entry-level and moderate-level staff using less complex cases.• Perform root cause analyses, when warranted by continuous trends, to pinpoint areas of service line process gaps and continue to monitor and remediate any trends of leakage or overcharges. Root cause analyses are shared with the service line management team and the EFO for aids in improving charging processes. Attends entity revenue cycle meetings on a monthly basis, participate in recurring HIM conference calls, and attend ad hoc meetings at the discretion of management. • Prepares weekly, monthly and annual net revenue reports for THR's Corporate management team, entity financial officers, and specific service line directors. Ad hoc reports are generated when requested by management.Mandatory attendance to webinars, classes, lectures, internal meetings, etc. to maintain current knowledge regarding CMS reimbursement, commercial payer contracts, THR charging policies and changes that impact revenue, such as CPT and coding changes.Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein including reviewing entity emergency departments? E/M calculators having access to full ED nurse audit functionality. • Perform other duties as assigned.The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Nursing or Associates Degree in Nursing and Bachelor's Degree in Business or related field required.5 years of hospital clinical experience and finance/business including billing audits or utilization management or case management or accounting or decision support required.RN - Registered Nurse required upon hire Skills• Familiarity with analyzing Medicare fiscal intermediary bulletins, CMS memorandums and have the ability to understand payer reimbursement methodologies (commercial and government).Prefer an ability to recognize and respond to diverse thinking styles, learning styles and cultural qualities while attending meetings with senior management levels, such as, a Chief Financial Officer. Why Texas Health Resources? Texas Health Resources is one of the largest faith-based, nonprofit health care delivery systems in the United States and the largest in North Texas in terms of patients served. Texas Health has 25 acute-care and short-stay hospitals that are owned, operated, joint-ventured or affiliated with the system. It has more than 3,800 licensed beds, more than 21,100 employees of fully-owned/operated facilities plus 1,400 employees of consolidated joint ventures, and counts more than 5,500 physicians with active staff privileges at its hospitals. At Texas Health, we strive to create an atmosphere of respect, integrity, compassion and excellence for all who come in contact with us, be they patients or our employees. We are committed to diversity in our workforce, and our mission to serve spreads across ethnic, cultural, economic and generational boundaries. We invite you to join us in furthering your career and our accomplishments and philosophy of excellence. Texas Health Highlights• 2018 FORTUNE Magazine's 100 Best Companies to Work For® (4th year in a row)• 2018 Becker's Healthcare "150 Great Places to Work in Healthcare" (4th year in a row)• 2018 Employees' Choice Best Places to Work by Glassdoor PI105857637

Name: Sr. Integrated Program Scheduler/Analyst
Description: We are pioneers. We were the first to break the sound barrier and design the first functional jetpack. We were aboard NASA’s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market. Today, we are defining the future of on-demand mobility. At Bell, we are proud to be an iconic company with superb talent, rapidly creating novel and coveted vertical lift experiences. The Senior Integrated Program Scheduler Analyst role is in the PMO and provides direct support to Program and Business Management in relation to Earned Value Management (EVM) Scheduling for aircraft development programs.This position is located in Fort Worth, TX headquarters for Bell. Responsibilities Include: Lead in creation and maintenance of resource loaded schedules for Integrated Product Teams (IPT) and help ensure integration and synchronization between all IPT schedules in support of program requirements. Lead schedule analysis and reporting efforts including program critical path and Schedule Risk Assessments (SRA). Review, correct, and report schedule performance against plans and provide alternatives and corrective actions as appropriate. Lead in development of proposal schedules with limited information to support company business capture initiatives. Present stakeholders with timely status and anticipate future challenges. Act as subject matter expert in scheduling practices and provide training and guidance to program personnelEducation Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in Industrial Engineering, Finance, Business Administration or other applicable discipline Skills and Experience Requirements:At least 5 years’ experience with project management/scheduling software (preferably Primavera) required.At least 3 years of experience in Earned Value Management (EVM)Must have strong computer skills including Windows and Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook) Advanced understanding of aircraft design / development / production / procurement / assembly processes This position requires strong initiative and willingness to develop solutions to a variety of schedule requests in a team environment; must be able to work with ambiguity Excellent organizational, communication and analytical skills required Preferred Certification: PMP certification Don’t miss the chance to join a diverse, inclusive environment where you feel a sense of belonging. As a member of our global workforce, you will collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where unique experiences, backgrounds and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight

Name: Application Systems Analyst Beacon
Description: Job Details  Summary: Jobs in this family are responsible for developing, testing, maintaining, installing, and/or deploying of applications and related information technologies. In addition, they are responsible for the establishment, development, and promotion of standard architectures, as well as hardware and software components. This role provides consulting services regarding how to integrate information technologies into clinical and business processes and the effective application of industry and organizational technology standards.  This position is an emerging information technology professional within the Systems Analyst family. This position participates in the implementation, testing, installation and support of clinical and business applications. Expected activities include but are not limited to: Modification of applications as needed to meet user requirements.Definition and development of reports.Participation in application upgrades.Participation in the resolution of problems and issues associated with installed applications and related information technologies.Diagnosis of failures encountered in application software and related technologies.Quality control of all application implementations/enhancements prior to release to customers.Maintains an awareness of vendor and industry developments/plans in area(s) of responsibility, communication and documentation of all relevant items and activities.Qualifications:Position requires at least 3 years of direct experience and a high school diploma or equivalent.Epic Beacon certification preferred.A BA/BS degree in IS or Business is preferred.May have an equivalent combination of education and/or experience in lieu of education and/or experience stated above.Licensure, Registration, and/or Certification:If not currently Epic certified, candidates will be required to pass an Epic pre-certification exam in order to be considered.Candidates will be required to become Epic certified within 6 months of employment including 2 retakes. Cook Children's is an EOE/AA - Minority/Females/Disability/VetSDL2017

Name: V-22 Solutions Sr Analyst
Description: Sr Solution Analyst - V-22 Strategic ReadinessThe V-22 Sr Solution Analyst is accountable for the integration, interpretation and transformation of data analysis supporting successful non-material/material solutions towards improved V-22 fleet readiness. This position will support the goal of growing the sustainment business and develop data-driven improvements for sustainment strategies on the V-22 Program. This position will utilize data analytics to perform statistical analysis, model complex business problems, and identify opportunities while guiding & supporting corrective action implementation. Ensures the proper implementation of statistical analysis, value added graphics/interpretation, and continuous improvement methodology towards proposed solutions to increase V-22 Fleet Readiness. Works with various functions within V-22 ILS and Engineering to integrate and prepare large & varied datasets, build specialized databases and computational algorithms in support of valid V-22 fleet readiness solutions. This position is based at Bell Helicopter’s headquarters facility in Ft. Worth, TX.Position Responsibilities:Apply mathematical formulas and graphing programs to accurately portray the validity, correlation and impact of existing issues and proposed solutions.Develop and refine analytical approaches to aircraft fleet readiness decisionsPerform analysis using predictive modeling, data/text mining, and statistical toolsUtilize data mining/predictive modeling tools to create meaningful models for fleet readiness strategy & initiative developmentUtilize/create data visualization tools for both internal leadership and external customer reviewMathematically analyze the impact of process steps in current and future state environments toward improved fleet maintenance capabilities and solutionsUse DMAIC methodology to ensure identified process changes are properly quantified, provide measurable improvement, and are sustainable.Assist cross functional teams in data interpretation and process development improvement to include engineering, ILS, and finance organizations.Develop and manage corrective actions/data-driven mitigation plans and brief updates to program leadership.Develop and implement mathematical formulas and graphical representations for V-22 fleet solutions.Provide statistical analysis/justification in support of USG/Industry partnership towards current and future BBPO readiness solutions.Education RequirementsBachelor’s Degree in finance or a scientific field is requireMasters Degree is preferred.Position Requirements:8 years of related analytical experience is preferred. 5 years of Aerospace experience is preferredBlack Belt certification is preferredExperience with data preparation, rationalization, and process requiredMust be highly proficient in statistical analysis, formulas and graphing Must be proficient with data mining tools and data visualization toolsExcellent written and oral communication skills are requiredExcellent critical thinking skills are requiredMust be able to gain access to required DoD information systems

Name: Business Analyst, Child Support - Frankfort, KY
Description: Req ID: 36738 At NTT DATA Services, we know that with the right people on board, anything is possible. The quality, integrity, and commitment of our employees are key factors in our company’s growth, market presence and our ability to help our clients stay a step ahead of the competition. By hiring the best people and helping them grow both professionally and personally, we ensure a bright future for NTT DATA Services and for the people who work here.NTT DATA Services currently seeks a Business Analyst, Child Support - Frankfort, KY to join our team in Frankfort, Kentucky (US-KY), United States (US).We are currently seeking knowledgeable Business Analyst to work with Kentucky's Child Support Modernization and Kentucky Automated Support Enforcement System (KASES) Maintenance and Operations.The ideal candidate will possess 3+ years of Kentucky Child Support experience. Knowledge of Kentucky's Health Benefits Exchange (KY HBE) is a plus. This selected candidate will work with Child Support Enforcement (CSE) and KASES staff to analyze and document the KASES II modernization and any change requests received by CSE. This person will also work with the KASES technical staff to design and document any technical solutions, and will also work with business stakeholders, subject matter experts and the KASES team to improve business operation and data integrity.Basic Qualifications:3+ years of Business Analysis experienceOther Required Qualifications:Knowledge of Software Development Life cycle (SDLC).Experience facilitating and/or participating in JAD sessions with end users to define and document business requirements and use cases.Must be willing to regularly work under deadlines and should be capable of working in teams and acting independently, with only general directions.Candidates must be skillful in Microsoft product suite.Additional Duties/Skills Needed:Demonstrate a working knowledge of the System Development Life Cycle and Change Management process.Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to facilitate, lead, mentor, and interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers and subject matter experts.Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.Lead, facilitate, and participate in JAD and design sessions.Facilitate business and functional requirement review, approval, and sign-off sessions.Document system and user interface requirements, data requirements and report formats.Prepare and review project documents and deliverables as necessaryAssisting the project manager with project tasks, estimates, schedules, etc.Conduct and direct end-user testing responsibilities.This position will require someone with business analysis and testing skills, and an in-depth knowledge of Kentucky's CSE is highly desired.This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Please note, 1099 or corp-2-corp contractors or the equivalent will NOT be considered. We offer a full comprehensive benefits package that starts from your first day of employment. About NTT DATA ServicesNTT DATA Services partners with clients to navigate and simplify the modern complexities of business and technology, delivering the insights, solutions and outcomes that matter most. We deliver tangible business results by combining deep industry expertise with applied innovations in digital, cloud and automation across a comprehensive portfolio of consulting, applications, infrastructure and business process services.NTT DATA Services, headquartered in Plano, Texas, is a division of NTT DATA Corporation, a top 10 global business and IT services provider with 118,000+ professionals in more than 50 countries, and NTT Group, a partner to 88 percent of the Fortune 100. Visit nttdataservices.com to learn more.NTT DATA, Inc. (the “Company”) is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs. The Company will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religious creed, citizenship, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, physical or mental disability, veteran or marital status, or any other class protected by law. To comply with applicable laws ensuring equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with a disability, the Company will make reasonable accommodations for the known physical or mental limitations of an otherwise qualified individual with a disability who is an applicant or an employee unless undue hardship to the Company would result.Nearest Major Market: Frankfort Job Segment:  Consulting, Business Analyst, Cloud, Testing, User Experience, Technology

Name: Program Analyst
Description: Position Summary: The individual will play a role in providing Program Management support to the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). He/she will support all aspects of planning, scheduling, tracking, analyzing, reporting, and coordinating a variety of technical, cost, and schedule performance and administrative support functions related to program management. The successful candidate will have demonstrated exceptional oral and written communication skills, critical thinking and analysis, and interpersonal interactions. He/she will apply the methods, tools, and techniques that are appropriate for the work requirements and assure that the technical quality of work products meet quality standards. Responsibilities: Individual will develop standard procedures, analysis, and report formats to help develop budgets, cost and resource estimates, schedules, plans, and Earned Value Management (EVM) reports for acquisition programs. Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to: Analysis of technical, financial, and schedule program plans and requirements.Developing strategic plans and integrating implementation schedules.Monthly analysis and reporting of cost and schedule performance, status, historical trends, and related metrics.Participating in creating site specific cost estimates for planning purposes, acquisition activities, and performance tracking.Assisting program teams in the execution of projects through scheduling, variance analysis, and what-if scenarios. Developing detailed project schedules.Incorporating data into the Earned Value Management System (EVMS) from a variety of sources including Control Account Plans, Baseline Change Requests, monthly Schedule Updates, Actual Costs, Estimates at Completion (EAC), and Variance Analysis Reports.Preparing communications plans and presentations.Generating Funding, Financial, and EVM Status Reports.Work with internal client staff, other analysts, external contractor support, and management to evaluate current data and process improvements.Complete project deliverables on time at highest level of quality.Perform other job-related responsibilities as assigned.Education: Bachelor of Arts/Sciences Degree in Management, Business, Economics, Finance, or related disciplines Knowledge and Skills: ** Individual should possess a minimum of 5 years related experience in program management.Specialized experience should include business/financial operations, scheduling or implementation of strategic business initiatives that define/increase organizational effectiveness and efficiencies. * Experience with the FAA in support of strategic plans and program performance analysis highly preferred.Experience with program management software packages (e.g., Deltek wInsight or similar).Familiarity with business productivity software packages (e.g., Microsoft Office Word, Excel, Project PowerPoint, and SharePoint).Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.Ability to employ problem-solving techniques to unique situations.Ability to use information technology to solve business problems.Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks.Prior experience in a management consulting or business advisory position.Strong data analysis, program evaluation and critical thinking skills.Excellent presentation and written communication skills. Job Type: Full-time  Experience: program management: 5 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Location: Fort Worth, TX (Required) Work authorization: United States (Required)

Name: SAP IT Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSummary of Job Purpose: - The SAP IT Analyst role is both a strategic and hands on role using analytical, consulting, business knowledge, and application solution expertise to effectively integrate and implement technology solutions into the business environment. The SIA is responsible for all aspects of our SAP application, including (and not limited to) fully understanding the capabilities and limitations of the currently implemented SAP ERP (ECC 6.0) functional solution in Costa Mesa, CA as well as providing configuration and analysis support. This position will be integral for the implementation of SAP ERP (ECC 6.0) at our Grand Prairie, TX location. This position will work closely with business subject matter experts as well as others within the Safran Support Teams (in France) to ensure strong alignment between the business requirements/needs and the application solutions/services. The candidate for the SIA role is responsible for developing and delivering effective SAP specific solutions for our business including Business Intelligence gathering and reporting solutions. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: - Functional support:  o Provide configuration expertise and support for various modules of SAP focusing mainly in SAP OTC, PTP, STC modules for existing Costa Mesa, CA SAP solution.  o Work collaboratively with the SAP implementation team for the Grand Prairie, TX SAP implementation.  o Work with Business Process Owners and end users to ensure these processes are accounted for in the SAP implementation in Grand Prairie, TX.  o Hands-on problem identification, problem resolution and problem documentation and communication.  o Provide SAP expertise for functionality to support the organization business processes in combination with strong Business Process knowledge  o Work with Business users across locations – collaborating closely to become a primary escalation point and local go to person for SAP  o Assist team members and business users with problem solving related to the software application, performance and usage; lead support effort to ensure business operations are not interrupted or delayed.  o Provide functional specifications for enhancements, interfaces, forms, and reports (RICEF) to support business requirements and/or legacy applications. Assist others to complete specifications with all aspects of SAP integration.  o Facilitate business process and master data redesign ensuring alignment with SAP best practices.  o Develop strong SAP user community through super-user development and knowledge sharing to keep applications aligned with the business.  o Work closely and effectively with super-users and end-users.  o Manage business software application issues escalation through IT tracking tools to enlist support from Safran / Safran Electronics & Defense / third parties.  o Must communicate with Safran, Safran Electronics & Defense (France).  o Work with the business to drive requirements into SAP, Kronos and other application/module/solution interface, installation, implementation, upgrades and maintenance  o Perform user management and implementation of permissions and security policies  o Desire to expand skills in non-SAP platform applications such as new SharePoint Forms, BI Crystal Reports, Power BI, and Analysis for Office reports  - General:  o Briefs leadership as appropriate on situations requiring changes in resources, impacts on established policies, broad project milestones, goals, or projected timetables.  o Must be flexible with work hours as French support personnel may only be available during early PST and/or CST times  o Is responsible for work that involves the design, documentation, modification, testing, installation, implementation, and support of new or existing application solutions  o Evaluates new applications and other niche software technologies.  o Establish and execute test plans to ensure applications are performing expected results.  o Works with vendors and inside/outside resources  o Produce weekly status report in area of ownership, taking accountability and ownership for deliverables and commitments aligned with weekly IT meetings, change requests, projects  o Must exercise good judgement, will have access to sensitive information  o Must keep an organized and presentable work area  o Must present a professional appearance and approach to customer support Required Competencies:Education / Experience: Required Qualifications  - BS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, or work/military experience.  - Minimum of 5-10 years of IT / Business Analyst experience  - Minimum of 5-10 years of SAP ERP functional/Hands-on experience.  Preferred Qualifications  - Knowledge of SAP HANA BI reporting is plus.  - Ability to triage and prioritize work.  - French language is a Plus Skills and Abilities: Position Criteria  - Manage business software application projects  - Proficient with Microsoft: Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Project, Visio  - Thorough attention to detail and accuracy  - Ability to work independently and in a team environment  - Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Exhibits clear and concise written and verbal communication.  - Capacity to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment with multiple concurrent assignments  - Works and communicates effectively at all organizational levels and across functional areas  - The employee maybe required to work beyond normal working hours from time to time as the workload dictates.  - Excellent communication and client liaison skills  - Ability read and follow instructions in English  - Travel (25%) Physical Requirements: Office  - While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk.  - The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision.Company DescriptionSafran Electronics & Defense, a Safran high-tech company, holds world or European leadership positions in optronics, avionics, electronics and critical software for both civil and military markets. Safran Electronics & Defense is the No. 1 company in Europe and No. 3 worldwide for inertial navigation systems (INS) used in air, land and naval applications. It is also the world leader in helicopter flight controls and the European leader in optronics and tactical UAV systems. Operating across the globe through the Safran international network, Safran Electronics & Defense and its subsidiaries employ 7,850 people in Europe, Africa, Asia-Pacific, North America and South America.

Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: Position Title Senior IT Business Analyst  16-Oct-2018 Department Information Technology Primary Location Irving-TX Job PostingThe Company and the Role: Lehigh Hanson is one of the largest construction materials companies in North America with more than 550 active operations in the U.S. and Canada. Our core activities include the production and distribution of cement and aggregates, the two essential raw materials in concrete. Lehigh Hanson companies also produce ready-mixed concrete, asphalt and other concrete products.  Lehigh Hanson is part of the HeidelbergCement Group, a global leader in aggregates, cement, concrete, and other downstream activities. The Group employs over 60,000 people at more than 3,000 locations in 60 countries.  Lehigh Hanson is seeking a qualified and proven IT Senior Business Analyst (Sr. BA). As part of the Project Management Office, the Sr. BA develops expertise in several business areas and is primarily responsible for translating business requirements into functional specifications and ensuring projects deliver on the objectives and benefits.  This position will reside at the corporate office in Irving, Texas.  This position is perfect for a proven Business Analyst who would like to align themselves with a progressive and growing company to enhance their skills and career. While working in a fast paced, performance culture, you will begin your career with a proven leader in the cement and construction materials supply.  Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled What you’ll get to do:Involved in requirements gathering and analysis to identify problems and suggest solutions using a systematic, multi-step approach.Work cross-functionally to solve problems and recommend changes to technology solutions and/or business processes.Collaborate within the project team and other external departments to lead the assessment and selection of technology solutions and vendors, including the documentation and management of proposal requests.Understand project objectives and benefits, documents the business case and project charter, including scope, resources and initial budget. Share technical and administrative knowledge to others.Drive project success via formal requirements definition, solution design facilitation, and work with business and technical teams to build detailed test scripts.Leverage several project management methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum, and Hybrid) to ensure predictable project success.Lead small projects and/or system enhancements.Provide support to junior staff.Perform other job-related duties as assigned.Who we are looking for:Minimally requires education and/or experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree.Minimum 6-8 years of experience in an information technology environment.Minimum 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst.An energetic passion for continuous improvement.Strong analytical abilityExperience working in IT and cross-functional project teams.Knowledge of prevalent IT and project management methodologies, system development lifecycles and best practices.Prefer Business Analyst or Project Management certification.Prefer industry knowledge of construction materials business processes.Excellent communication and organization skills, verbally and written. Our corporate office supports the Lehigh Hanson plants in North America and offers a competitive benefits package that includes a 401(k) savings plan with company match, tuition reimbursement, and employee purchase program. Amenities include an on-site deli, free covered parking, and free fitness center.  No search firms please. Name: Sr. Oracle EBS - Tecnical Business Systems Analyst

This includes, but is not limited to, gathering business report requirements, assisting business partners with user acceptance testing, communication, documentation, training, report testing and end-user production support. The Senior Oracle Application Functional/Technical Specialist resource will work with Cognos developers to support all aspects of business analytics and reporting. This employee has heavy contact with other business departments, as well as, outside vendors in support of international IT operations. Document the requirements, help coordinate reporting solutions following the Company Software Development Lifecycle methodology Investigate and resolve data issues and analyze all business requirements and perform interview with all stakeholders Coordinate with all customers and analyze test queries and analyze client issues and assist all application analysts to translate all workflow requirements to efficient data points Assist with the creation, documentation and execution of report test scripts for supported systems; Research, implement and document solutions to issues identified during testing Develop and perform tests on various enterprises and provide dashboard solutions with help of Cognos software and assist all end usersREQUIREMENTS: Knowledge of relational database structures, start schema structures, models, and diagrams Understanding of enterprise data integration and data architecture Advanced knowledge of business processes for supported business groups Advanced knowledge of information technology systems, infrastructure and operations Advanced working knowledge of information systems and operations systems for supported business groups Knowledge of business processes for supported business groups Knowledge of the company core business functions, policies and procedures Knowledge of information technology systems, infrastructure and operations Knowledge of security methodologies, policies, standards and best practices Knowledgeable of best practices in information technology governance and regulatory landscape for financial institutions Significant experience in a large and complex business environment Working knowledge of information systems and operations systems for supported business groups Working knowledge of the Corporate Business solution environment Ability to analyze data using Excel for reporting and data mining purposes Ability to effectively lead, organize, and supervise Ability to interact with staff at all levels Ability to meet expected delivery dates and the tasks necessary to achieve objectives Ability to work directly with senior level management Advanced computer skills and conversance in information technology issues Advanced experience with data visualization concepts and tools Deadline oriented Excellent writing and speaking skills Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Flight Dispatcher/Records Analyst
Description: Description:Flight Operations Analyst. Responsible for a multitude of tasks as assigned by the Chief of Fighter Flight Operations and Lead Dispatcher, supporting fighter flight operations worldwide. Responsible for daily, weekly and monthly tracking of aircrew qualifications, currencies and training. Maintaining training records for all flight crew.  Completing monthly reports for distribution. Scheduling appointments for flight crew as needed (physicals, altitude chamber, etc). Providing support for visiting dignitaries and corporate aircraft. Supporting execution of the daily flight schedule to include pre-flight planning, weather briefing, scheduling airspace, real-time monitoring of weather and aircraft during flight operations, and post-flight support. Assisting the Lead Dispatcher in completion of required aircrew documentation as assigned. Executing emergency procedures in the case of aircraft mishaps and conducting mishap drills. Participating in audits on processes and record keeping. Must be capable of developing and maintaining a positive working relationship across internal and external organizations to include DCMA, FAA, LM Aero programs, and the Joint Reserve Base, Fort Worth. Attention to detail a must.  Must have a valid passport. This position will require both domestic and international travel. Basic Qualifications: Experience with Microsoft Office products.  Experience making presentations to large and small groups.  Experience organizing large amounts of data  Customer relations experience. Desired Skills: FAA licensed pilot, FAA licensed Aircraft Dispatcher, or Air Traffic Controller experience.  Familiarity with aircrew currency and training requirements.  Experience using a flight operations database such as Flight Operations Software (FOS). BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Join us at Lockheed Martin, where your mission is ours. Our customers tackle the hardest missions. Those that demand extraordinary amounts of courage, resilience and precision. Theyre dangerous. Critical. Sometimes they even provide an opportunity to change the world and save lives. Those are the missions we care about.  As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: Experienced Professional

Name: Stress Analyst Lead
Description: POSITION SUMMARY: Responsible for planning, coordinating, and managing all stress activities on an assigned project. Ensures that Engineering activities are timely and completed in accordance with established quality standards and procedures. Supports Project Engineer in completing project deliverables pertaining to stress. Directs team of resources to achieve timely completion of project tasks. Coordinates closely with related departments to maintain schedules and effect necessary changes and revisions. Have knowledge of and follows engineering and applicable Quality Operating Procedures. Supports the quality management system and quality objectivesESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:•Leads team of stress resources in performing finite element modeling and generating structural substantiation reports.•Supports design engineers in developing, documenting, creating, and improving new/existing products and more efficient processes.•Evaluates opportunities to improve performance, increase yields, and minimize product cost and weight.•Identifies and documents capabilities and limitations of processes.•Evaluates manufacturing and installation discrepancies and assists in determining effective solutions.•Performs finite element modeling and/or classical hand analysis on selected components in order to accurately determine external and internal loads.•Performs static stress analyses on components using PATRAN or FEMAP software to determine structural integrity of design of interior monuments, and aircraft structure•Maintains appropriate documentation for process, unit, and company reports.•Assumes responsibility for establishing and maintaining effective communication, coordination, and working relationships with area staff, clients, and management.•Assumes responsibility for related duties as required or assigned.•Stays informed of developments and changes in engineering technologies.•Performs production duties and special projects as assigned.•Attends and conducts meetings as needed.REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: •M.S. or B.S. in Engineering.•Extensive design and management experience in specific field considered as an alternative.•Excellent understanding of Company operations. •Strong understanding of engineering principles, procedures, and standards. •Thorough knowledge of current requirements and regulations. •Business development and project management experience. •Six or more years of progressive engineering experience with MS. •Eight or more years of progressive engineering experience with BSPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: •Previous aircraft stress experience helpful.SUCCESS FACTORS/JOB COMPETENCIES: •Well organized with strong planning and management skills. •Attention to detail.•Quality orientation. •Able to organize multiple projects. •Strong problem solving abilities. •Strong PC computing skills, including MS Office and engineering software. •Strong leadership skills. •Able to fill in for Engineering Director when needed.WORK ENVIRONMENT: This job operates in indoor and outdoor settings. The indoor settings include office and warehouse environments which require the use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines, as well as safety gear. The outdoor settings include parking lots and airplane runways. The noise level in the work environment is occasionally loud. Occasionally subject to varying inside and/or outside temperatures, which may include extreme heat (temperatures above 100 degrees) or extreme cold (temperatures below 32 degrees).While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to fumes or airborne particles, moving mechanical parts and vibration. The employee is occasionally exposed to a variety of extreme conditions. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit. The employee frequently is required use the fingers to make small movements such as typing, picking up small objects. Medium work; exerts up to 50 lbs. occasionally and/or up to 20 lbs. frequently , and 10 lbs. constantly. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. TRAVEL: Travel may occasionally be required for this position (10% or less).WORK AUTHORIZATION/SECURITY CLEARANCE: Must be able to legally work in the US without sponsorship. Must be able to pass a post offer DOT drug test upon hire. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY AND AFFIRMATIVE ACTION PLAN: GDC Technics provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. GDC will also take affirmative action as called for by applicable laws and Executive Orders to ensure that minority group individuals, females, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, other protected veterans, Armed Forces service medal veterans, and qualified disabled persons are introduced into our workforce and considered for promotional opportunities.

Name: Specialist, Business Analyst
Description: If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra Energy family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online. Job DescriptionOverview: The Business Intelligence and Analytics team provides transactional and financial insights to management by analyzing trends in sales, gains, losses, margin and other key performance metrics to drive strategic and operational performance optimization. The team is also responsible for providing analytics support and reporting services for driving ongoing performance improvements for other business units.  Within TXU Energy, the Specialist job function has lead and subject matter expert responsibility for analyzing and developing improvements to business processes, identifying and facilitating the creation of appropriate reporting and definition around each function, managing and integrating processes relating to operations, and delivering an improved customer experience. Responsibilities:Deliver key insights by uncovering root causes for trends in sales, gains, losses and swaps by transaction type, channel, campaign, product and over time. Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: JPS Health Network is a $950 million, tax-supported health care system for Tarrant County in North Texas. Licensed for 578 beds, the network includes an acute care hospital and more than 40 community-based clinics, including 19 school-based clinics. John Peter Smith Hospital is home to Tarrant County's first and only Level 1 Trauma Center, its only psychiatric emergency services site and has the largest hospital-based family medicine residency program in the nation. Our network employs more than 6,500 people.  Acclaim is our multispecialty medical practice group. Acclaim has over 300 providers serving the JPS Health Network in specialties ranging from primary care to general surgery and trauma. The Acclaim group has been formed around a common set of incentives and expectations supporting the operational, financial and clinical performance  outcomes of the network. Our goal is to provide high quality, compassionate clinical care for every patient, every time.  For more information, visit www.jpshealthnet.org.  To view all job vacancies, visit www.jobs.jpshealthnet.org/ or www.teamacclaim.org. Name: Data Scientist (V-22 Solutions Analyst)
Description: Sr Solution Analyst - V-22 Strategic Readiness  The V-22 Sr Solution Analyst is accountable for the integration, interpretation and transformation of data analysis supporting successful non-material/material solutions towards improved V-22 fleet readiness. This position will support the goal of growing the sustainment business and develop data-driven improvements for sustainment strategies on the V-22 Program. This position will utilize data analytics to perform statistical analysis, model complex business problems, and identify opportunities while guiding & supporting corrective action implementation. Ensures the proper implementation of statistical analysis, value added graphics/interpretation, and continuous improvement methodology towards proposed solutions to increase V-22 Fleet Readiness. Works with various functions within V-22 ILS and Engineering to integrate and prepare large & varied datasets, build specialized databases and computational algorithms in support of valid V-22 fleet readiness solutions. This position is based at Bell Helicopter's headquarters facility in Ft. Worth, TX. Position Responsibilities:Apply mathematical formulas and graphing programs to accurately portray the validity, correlation and impact of existing issues and proposed solutions.Develop and refine analytical approaches to aircraft fleet readiness decisionsPerform analysis using predictive modeling, data/text mining, and statistical toolsUtilize data mining/predictive modeling tools to create meaningful models for fleet readiness strategy & initiative developmentUtilize/create data visualization tools for both internal leadership and external customer reviewMathematically analyze the impact of process steps in current and future state environments toward improved fleet maintenance capabilities and solutionsUse DMAIC methodology to ensure identified process changes are properly quantified, provide measurable improvement, and are sustainable.Assist cross functional teams in data interpretation and process development improvement to include engineering, ILS, and finance organizations.Develop and manage corrective actions/data-driven mitigation plans and brief updates to program leadership.Develop and implement mathematical formulas and graphical representations for V-22 fleet solutions.Provide statistical analysis/justification in support of USG/Industry partnership towards current and future BBPO readiness solutions. Education Requirements Bachelor's Degree in finance or a scientific field is requireMasters Degree is preferred.Position Requirements:8 years of related analytical experience is preferred. 5 years of Aerospace experience is preferredBlack Belt certification is preferredExperience with data preparation, rationalization, and process requiredMust be highly proficient in statistical analysis, formulas and graphingMust be proficient with data mining tools and data visualization toolsExcellent written and oral communication skills are requiredExcellent critical thinking skills are requiredMust be able to gain access to required DoD information systemsSDL2017

Name: FSARC Intelligence analyst
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at http://www.jpmorganchase.com/. The Financial Systemic Risk and Analysis Center (FSARC) proactively identifies, analyzes, assesses and coordinates activities to mitigate systemic risk to the US financial system from cyber security threats and emerging trends through focused operations and enhanced collaboration between participating firms, industry partners and the US Government. The FSARC is a subsidiary of the Financial Services Information Sharing and Analysis Center (FS-ISAC), a member-driven organization whose mission is to help assure the resilience and continuity of the global financial services infrastructure and individual firms.The individual selected for this position will part of the FSARC Improve Intelligence This is a full time position located in the Washington DC region. Occasional travel may be required.Primary Duties and ResponsibilitiesThe FSARC Intelligence analyst is focused on contributing to joint analysis for improved government and financial industry awareness. The analyst, working side by side with US government partners, will monitor information sources to identify and assess indicators of cyber attacks against financial sector assets. The analyst will play an active part in developing and maintaining intelligence requirements, and collection plans that enable better analysis for US government awareness of threat activity observed by the financial services sector. The analyst will work with other FSARC elements to measure the effectiveness in countering the identified systemic threats.Responsibilities· Work with the FSARC-member threat intelligence centers to share information and build a strong eco-system for defending financial system assets · Drive collection plans, and research cyber intelligence feeds, based on the intelligence needs of financial sector operations· Prioritize analysis and contextualize findings in relation to FSARC intelligence requirements, in collaboration with US government partners· Contextualize threat activity in relation to financial loss of the target institutions· Track cybercrime and advanced threat activity and report on imminent and emerging threats as well as changes to the threat landscape· Maintain detailed threat actor profiles on adversaries of interest/relevance to the firm, covering tactics, techniques and procedures, intents, goals and strategic objectives· Provide a forward-looking view of the threats, predicting shifts in adversarial intents, goals and strategic objectives· Identify and collect metrics on the effectiveness of FSARC and partner operationsQualifications· Undergraduate degree and at least 5 years combined cyber security analysis experience· Experience determining source information accuracy· Experience with link analysis, data visualization tools such as Palantir, Analyst’s Notebook, or Maltego· Experience leveraging Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) in intelligence collection and analysis· Excellent understanding of networking concepts and Information Security, including emerging threats and attack methodologies· Significant and detailed threat actor knowledge· Specialist training or skills in one or more of the following: · Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) gathering and/or analysis· Social Media Intelligence (SMI/SOCMINT) gathering and/or analysis· Human Intelligence (HUMINT) analysis· Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) analysis· Strong knowledge or experience in one or more of the following: · Investment banking· Asset management· Consumer and/or Commercial banking· Excellent written and verbal communication skills· Must possess a high degree of initiative, motivation and problem-solving skills· Demonstrated experience in critical and strategic thinkingHighly Desired· 3 years Intelligence Community experience and/or 3 years’ experience at an international institution conducting cyber or security/intelligence related work· Working knowledge of global threats to international cyber security, and conversant in the tactics, techniques and procedures used by cyber adversaries· Significant malware analysis, virus exploitation and mitigation techniques experience· Coding (scripting) experience e.g. Perl, VB Script, Python etc.· Experience briefing technical and non-technical audiences on threat activity· Knowledge of financial sector business operating models and attack surfaces· Ability to gain a government security clearance· Experience building professional presentations and products using standard office software applications · Strong collaboration, negotiation and mediation skills among internal and external stakeholders

Name: Security Operations Center (SOC) Cyber Fraud Analyst
Description: The Security Operations Center Cyber Fraud Analyst will be part of the SOC Team. The team monitors, analyzes and responds to cyber fraud threats on a 24x7 basis.Principle Responsibilities:The analyst performs monitoring, research, assessment and analysis of Digital Fraud Attacks leveraging various Security Event Monitoring platforms including Web Threat Detection, Real Time Fraud Risk Assessment, Big Data and Digital Application Monitoring tools (ArcSight, Splunk, SAS, Teradata, and enterprise real time fraud detection tools.). Previous experience in cyber security operations or incident response is required.Follow pre-defined actions to handle BAU and High severity issues including escalating to other support groups.Execute daily ad hoc tasks or lead small projects as needed.Create and maintain operational reports for Key Performance Indicators and weekly and monthly metrics.Perform assessment as well as troubleshooting to help isolate technical issues with the integration of fraud monitoring technologiesParticipate in daily and ad hoc conference calls to manage quality assurance and documentation related tasks.Identify areas for tuning use cases to enhance monitoring value.Engage with Fraud Policy, Operations, Strategy and other teams for early detection, prevention and mitigation of detected fraudulent activities.About Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.  Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.  Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.Job Skills/Qualifications:4 years working in the security & operations fields.Bachelor's Degree or higher preferred.Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.Strong knowledge of current Cyber Fraud trends including common Account Takeover techniques and banking malware.Deep understanding of Intrusion Detection analysis (TCP/IP, packet level analysis) as well as Application Layer Protocols (HTTP). Advanced understanding of various operating systems (Windows/UNIX), and web technologies (focusing on Internet security).Knowledge of cutting-edge threats and technologies affecting Web Applications.Experience with Big Data Technologies, ETL Tools, Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence technologies is preferred.Experience with any scripting language (Python, Perl, VBScript) is a plus.Experience with vulnerability assessment as well as penetration testing or forensic analysis fields is a plusCertifications from EC-Council, GIAC, (ISC)² are preferred [CISSP, C|EH, GCIA, CCNA].

Name: Purchasing & Material Administration Analyst Associate - Grand Prairie, TX
Description: Description:Lockheed Martin is seeking a Purchasing & Material  Administration Analyst Associate for a position in  Grand Prairie, TX. This position supports PAC-3  program material requirements by managing  shortage reports, metrics, and supplier issues. This  position will interface with a cross functional team  including Engineering, Quality, Production Operations  and PP&C for resource planning.  This position requires someone who has the ability to  multi-task and is comfortable working in a team  environment. Effective communication is a  requirement due to extensive communication  between SEMAC, Program Supply Chain and various customers. Duties include: Drive mitigation activities across the PAC-3 Program  Supply Chain  Prepare shortage reports and metrics will be  managed daily and report to program management.  Manage supplier issues daily in order to support  production and various customers.  Various projects will be assigned as needed. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Supply Chain Management, Industrial Engineering or Business or related discipline from an accredited college  Ability to obtain security clearance  Ability to travel to supplier sites if needed. Desired Skills: Minimum 3.0 GPA requirement  Basic understanding of the procurement processes  Basic SAP/MRP knowledge  Basic knowledge of scheduling principles and  performance metrics  Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite  Strong verbal and written communications and  effective presentation skills  Working understanding of line of balance  Ability to multi-task in a dynamic environment BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martins vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers toughest challenges. Lockheed Martin has employees based in many states throughout the U.S., and Internationally, with business locations in many nations and territories.  Join us at Lockheed Martin, where were engineering a better tomorrow. EXPERIENCE LEVEL: 4 yr and up College

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst  With minimal supervision and working at the highest technical level of most phases of business analysis, this position collaborates with others to develop new products and enhance existing products. This includes project definition and solution design for requested product and operational enhancements for existing products and internal systems.  REPORTING STRUCTURE & WORK SETTING  This position typically performs work at a WageWorks location with significant technical resources and reports to a Director or VP level with enterprise-wide product development responsibility.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES & PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES  NOTE: The essential duties and primary accountabilities below are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Incumbents may perform all or most of the primary accountabilities listed below. Specific tasks, responsibilities or competencies may be documented in the incumbent’s performance objectives as outlined by the incumbent’s immediate supervisor or manager.  1. Work closely with internal teams (service teams, technical staff, sales, marketing, and operations) and external teams (clients, partners and service vendors) to enhance current products and develop new ones.  2. Provide input into and oversight of project definition and solution design for requested new products, product features, and operational enhancements for internal systems.  3. Act as the liaison between the business units and the technology organization, to manage business priorities, communicate changes in scope or schedule, and call out risks.  2. Perform impact assessment and define the scope of requested product changes, enhancements, new products and new systems.  3. Adhere to and assist product management and other project requestors in adhering to the appropriate software product development process.  4. Define the scope of projects including all internal and external user touch points and processes.  5. Create detailed functional requirement specifications based on defined business requirements.  6. Identify tasks and work with the development team to estimate development costs for proposed projects.  7. Drive and project manage product development projects from inception to customer delivery.  MARGINAL DUTIES & ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS  1. May provide assistance with product development efforts to test products and ensure that systems provide the result or perform as intended.  2. May develop training materials and provide product training to staff and users of product enhancements for which functional requirements have been created.  3. Performs other duties as assigned or apparent.  ADDITIONAL PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS  WageWorks believes that our success is achieved by its People. Values describe how we work together to achieve our success. It is our employees that drive results through living our Company Values. Every employee at WageWorks is expected to uphold and demonstrate the eight Company Values listed below as an additional component of the job description and as a standard of individual performance.  Clients and Participants Come First: Exceeding client and participant expectations is our highest priority  Integrity: We are open, honest, ethical and conscientious  Passion: A will to win and a relentless drive for excellence  Accountability: Deliver on commitments and take ownership for solving problems and creating solutions  Leadership and Influence: Our actions inspire vision and clarity of purpose  Continuous Improvement and Innovation: We embrace change and drive new ideas into business solutions  Dignity and Respect: We value the diversity of our people, encourage their development and reward their performance  Creating Value for Shareholders: Deliver consistent growth and premium returns  SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY  NOTE: WageWorks leadership will strive to uphold the mission, vision, and values of the organization. They will serve as role models for staff and act in a people-centered and results oriented manner with a focus on customer service.  No formal supervisory authority entailed. This position will act as a resource to less-experienced Business Analysts and may provide matrixed leadership for assigned projects.  ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES  EDUCATION:  Knowledge of software development and/or business management as normally obtained through completion of a Bachelor’s Degree in computer science/engineering, Business, or a related degree. Certified Employee Benefits Specialist (CEBS) certification is desirable.  WORK EXPERIENCE OR RELATED EXPERIENCE:  The knowledge, skill and ability to create detailed functional requirements for software development projects as described as normally obtained through a minimum of 10 or more years progressively responsible business analysis experience.  SPECIALIZED KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES:  Requires the highest level of understanding of the business, technology strategy and platforms, and functional transactions to perform business analysis as described.  Consumer marketing or product management experience in the consumer or financial services industry including:  • Familiarity with Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Health Savings Account (HSA) and Health Reimbursement Account (HRA) programs.  • Direct contact with both employers and employees in an HR or employee benefits-related capacity.  • Project management experience.  • Familiarity with financial services, general accounting principles, bank account reconciliation practices, and operational processes.  A high level of employee benefits knowledge and significant experience as a service or account manager for a group health plan provider, broker agency or benefits consultant, including a keen understanding of benefits administration from an employer’s perspective (the employer/vendor relationship as well as the employer/employee relationship, is strongly preferred.  Must have a high level of interpersonal and communication skills and an exceptional ability to work well with others to effectively interact with internal and external customers and department staff, as described above. The ability to build relationships, influence key decision-makers, and collaborate on a cross-functional team comprised of diverse personalities, skill sets, and levels of experience is required.  The ability to work in a fast-paced, high energy environment that requires flexibility and the capacity to quickly learn and assimilate information/new skills is essential. Must possess the ability to prioritize and perform multiple tasks simultaneously. Outstanding organizational skills, follow-up skills, focus and attention to detail.  Incumbents must have the ability to use initiative and work independently as well as collaboratively with a team.  EQUIPMENT:  A high level of proficiency with business and communications software (preferably Word, Excel, PowerPoint, common Windows operating systems, and Outlook) is required. Knowledge and familiarity with standard project management tools is required.  TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS & CONDITIONS  Travel may be required as necessary to meet with internal and external clients.  WORK ENVIRONMENT CONDITIONS & DEMANDS  Work is generally performed in an office environment in which there is only minimal exposure to unpleasant and/or hazardous working conditions.  PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & DEMANDS  Work requires normal range of hearing and eyesight. Incumbent must be able to use a telephone or headset equipment and operate a keyboard and other office equipment. The ability to perform work at a computer terminal for 6-8 hours a day and function in an environment with constant interruptions is required. At times, incumbents are subject to sitting for prolonged periods. Infrequently, incumbent must be able to lift and move material weighing up to 20 lbs. Incumbent may experience elevated levels of stress during periods of increased activity and with work entailing multiple deadlines.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions as described.

Name: Systems Analyst (ATAC, Alliance Field
Description: About Textron: Textron Inc. is a multi-industry company that leverages its global network of aircraft, defense, industrial and finance businesses to provide customers with innovative solutions and services. Textron is known around the world for its powerful brands such as Bell, Cessna, Beechcraft, Hawker, Jacobsen, Kautex, Lycoming, E-Z-GO, and Textron Systems. For more information visit: www.textron.com. About ATAC: Textron Airborne Solutions provides training opportunities for military customers. Within this company is Airborne Tactical Advantage Company (ATAC), which provides tactical flight training and adversary services. Textron's extensive global reach makes for an incomparable training resource. ATAC provides tactical flight training and adversary aggressor services for U.S. Navy, Marine and Air Force pilots, and is the only organization certified to train the Navy's TOPGUN program. ATAC operates simultaneously across five sites and two continents and comprises the world's largest outsourced civilian, tactical airborne training organization and proudly provides the highest quality live training to Squadrons, Air Wings, and Battle Groups. ATAC was the first civilian organization authorized to train the USAF's F-22 Raptors. Summary: The Systems Analyst has the overall responsibility to serve as the interface with assigned functional areas for the purpose of business technology strategy development, solution discovery, service management, risk management, and relationship management. The Systems Analyst serves as the business relationship link between the business and IT and provides highly valued consulting level support and guidance through key IT initiatives. They participate in the following: Communication of decisions, priorities, and relevant project information to appropriate levels of staff regarding operating unit requests and projects and initiativesSharing of knowledge of technology risks and opportunities to build competitive advantage and improve efficiency and effectiveness of operating unitsPartnerships with business leadership and other key stakeholders to define opportunities and identify and prioritize projects based on predefined criteria (e.g. return on investment, productivity, compliance) The Systems Analyst proactively serves as a "trusted advisor" and is the primary IT point of contact to business line leaders and managers. They operate as the key business contact representing IT in promoting IT services and capabilities, provide support in delivering technology products that meet the needs of the business, and focus on strategic initiatives and planning activities for their business area. They strive to understand market challenges, including customer priorities and competitive issues. They are proactive and anticipatory in their thinking. They are, by nature, driven and provide significant value to business units. They serve a role in enabling the business to achieve their objectives through the effective use of technology. Job Responsibilities:Lead, implement, administer and maintain Business Intelligence (BI) projects and support for various BI platforms.Participate in architecture, implementation, design, administration, maintenance, documentation and support of all dashboards, data models, and analytic solutions and ensure continuous 24x7 operations.Assist in the development and implementation of new or revised dashboards, including working on legacy dashboards for migration to the strategic business intelligence toolset.Perform Ad-Hoc Reporting and troubleshooting when dashboards, data models, and analytic solutions are not operational and follow through on resolution and root cause.Provide technical support, direction, and guidance to peers, leadership and associates on the overall business intelligence process and strategy as it relates to the IT and business strategies.Communicate and coordinate with the department and the business to minimize impact during maintenance and upgrade windows. Ensure thorough planning, testing and approval from the business before any transition or implementation.Research, evaluate, monitor and recommend emerging technology and leads investigation and adaptation of beneficial data technologies.Develop guidelines and upgrade techniques for the operational procedure, support and recovery of dashboards, data models, and analytic solutions. Maintain updated documentation as required.Partner with vendors and customers to ensure requirements are gathered and documented.Lead implementations, upgrades, and provide user support for all modules within our Oracle ERP system.Advise on integrations between applications and data transfer between platforms.Understand business processes and configure applications to properly support the needs of the business.Follow the IT Project Management Office (PMO) process when partnering and guiding the user community in new process or procedure implementation.Lead projects using PMO and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) principles.Take accountability for managing schedule, budget, and scope for a given project and follow it through to completion.Effectively contribute to and participate as member of large cross functional teams striving to improve processes.Research, evaluate, monitor and recommend emerging technologies that will improve business performance.Provide on call support to resolve incidents and support users with business critical needs.Qualifications:Bachelors in Computer Science, MIS or equivalent.Two (2) plus years of IT experience preferred.Experience leading small or big projects. Some Project Management essentials preferred but not required.Must exhibit the ability to effectively interface with peers, employees, management and customers within the organization.Must exhibit the ability to understand a wide range of business processes.Must exhibit a high proficiency in analytical and problem solving skills.Must communicate effectively both orally and in writing.SQL or PL/SQL intermediate to advanced experience, specifically with querying and reporting.Knowledge of ETL tools, ERP applications, assorted languages, data standards and protocols such as ASP.NET, XML, Oracle EBS, SAP, eNovia/eMatrix, COLTS, JIRA, SalesForce, and Clover, SAP PI Informatica are a plus.Experience leading projects and working in a team environment.SDL2017

Create and provide weekly status and data reports to management. Assist in the development and revision of evaluation forms, guidelines and reports as needed. quality assurance reviews of work product, policies and procedures;The ability to work well under pressure, face challenges, and to negotiate in a diplomatic manner in order to resolve issues;Ability to establish and maintain working relationships with co-workers, staff and external contacts, and to work effectively in a professional team environment.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:Preferred experience with Speech analytics or a firm grasp of conversational English techniques and technologies, specifically Noble, but others such as Nice, Witness, etc.;Knowledge of Contact Center processes;Demonstrated strong analytical skills, adept at identifying patterns, and hypothesis-driven problem-solving;Using advanced reporting and analysis tools such as SQL, Excel, etc.;Innovative mindset, aptitude for learning new technologies / software and dexterity to adjust to changing priorities within an emerging business;Self-starter who is able to act independently and work collaboratively;Exceptional written and oral communication skills, including an ability to communicate across business areas;Excellent listening& communication skills and a positive attitude are required for frequent interaction with stakeholders;Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university;Minimum 3-5 years Mortgage industry experience (loan administration, servicing or default Name: SQL Server Analyst

Experience writing custom/complex queries for reporting perspectiveExperience with ODBC, JDBC and TCPExperience with Transact-SQL, replication, DTS/SSIS packages, SQL Agent jobs, SQL Reporting Services, and VB scripting.Experience with design and deploy SSIS packages for data load, reports, etc.    Desired Skills:  Mongo DB and/or Splunk experience a plusAdvanced knowledge of Compliance, Data integrity and Security.Performance tuning using various SQL Server tools and application migrationITIL and/or LEAN process and best practicesExcellent written, verbal and inter-personal skills.   This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries.
