Name: Supplier Management Analyst
Description: This position will support the Supplier Management group by working with Buyers, Administrators and Management in various Supplier Management functions. Duties will include locating & expediting parts in support of critical requirements, working within the MRP system to gather information, utilizing Excel to create visibility & provide status on performance, and working cross functionally to meet deadlines. This position will support Supplier Management in effectively representing and leading the relationship with the company’s suppliers for material requirements to support the operation. Duties & Responsibilities • Coordinate directly with outside vendors to expedite orders and the return of aircraft components to support the company’s day to day material objectives  • Communicate overdue orders to suppliers  • Read maintenance schedules & inventory reports to determine priority of materials required  • Provide shipping and delivery information to all necessary workgroups  • Develop and update Excel based reports, status and charts  • Maintain appropriate purchasing files and data within purchasing software programs  • Assist Buyers to obtain quotations and Purchase Order status  • Work with internal departments as well as suppliers to correct any discrepancies in shipping, invoicing, quality, and part number & quantity mismatches

Name: Programmer Analyst
Description: Job Title: Programmer Analyst Employer Name: SilverXis, Inc.  Work Location County: 1162 W Pioneer Pkwy, Arlington TX 76013  Other Work Locations: Various unanticipated locations throughout the U.S.  Job Duties:Perform complex analysis, including planning, program design, development, testing, programming tasks, documentation by applying programming techniques.Apply broad knowledge of Java, J2EE, JAX-WS, Axis2 (web services), JMS, Hibernate, Oracle, DB2, Spring, Drools rules, XML and other related technologies to implement design.Writes new applications of moderate complexity and utilizing standard procedures and techniques.Formulate plans outlining steps required to develop solutions, using structured analysis & design.Develop web services, XML authoring & business rule management solutions for finance and insurance customers.Writing test cases, plans and performing unit, system and regression testing.Regular application maintenance, resolve defects, changed implementation due to new requirement or scope change in production.Evaluate & analyze customer requirement requests for new and modified system functionality.Write design documents, user manuals, and operational guidance to describe program development, logic, coding, and corrections.Prepare flowcharts, use case, sequence and class diagrams to illustrate sequence of steps program must follow & to describe logical operations involved.Estimate development time, ensure timely project milestones and submit plans to project manager. Develops domain expertise in specific technical skills Java/J2EE, web services, messaging services, Drools rules, XML and web technologies.  Make technical recommendations on designs as well as technical improvements.  Education Required: Masters or its foreign equivalent in Computer Science or related subject.  Experience: 2 years of experience in the job offered or Programmer Analyst, or as Software Engineer or related occupation. Experience to include experience in making technical recommendation on designs, developing domain expertise in Java/J2EE, web services, messaging services, Drools rules and XML.

Name: Application Support Analyst - III
Description: Description: Works on problems of moderate and varied complexity where analysis of data may require adaptation of standardized practices. Should be capable of working independently with minimal supervision. Receives general instructions on non-routine work assignments and guidance on new assignments. Will be working with IT and business contacts.  The candidate will be responsible for the tasks including but not limited to:  · Responsible for operational support activities for Order Management application production support including trouble shooting, monitoring and providing resolutions to meet SLAs.  · Participate in daily operational activities by supporting Centers, provide solutions to trouble tickets coming from various channels including online support.  · Participate in day to day activities involving production operational activity monitoring to support the Order Management application.  · Work with internal IT teams and external teams including the biz clients on various issues and resolutions thereof to provide best customer experience.  · Monitor and debug production issues, generate and monitor supporting reports.  · Support the strategic initiatives of the Organization. Requirements: · Bachelors degree in computer science or equivalent.  · 5+ years experience in related discipline, 2+ years in support activity preferred.  · Problem solving skills to develop quick yet sound solutions to resolve complex issues.  · Teamwork & collaboration skills to work across organizations and lead cross-functional teams.  · Good Communication & stakeholder management skills  · Programming Language(s): Competency in Oracle SQL/PL-SQL, working knowledge of-Java  · Application(s): DB tool Sql Developer or Toad, SoapUI, XML spy.

Name: Reporting Analyst
Description: Effective Date: 11/29/2018 Business Title: Reporting Analyst Division/Business Unit: Shared Services Center Reports To: Business Analytics Manager Work Location: SSC, Irving, TX Position Summary: The Reporting Analysts focus is to support the SSC and Dealerships by preparing predefined reports from a project list and creating new, basic reports from the appropriate database views and tables. Organizational Relationships: Interacts with internal and external customers at various levels. Job Responsibilities: Develop an understanding of the data fields in AutoNations most common NDD views. Utilize systems (NDD, MS Excel, MS Access, ADP and Fortis) to develop simple reports to fulfil customer requests. Prepare and distribute reports on a specified timetable (daily, weekly, monthly) to support the SSC, Corporate, Dealerships and AutoNation Finance Transformation Team (FTT). Play an active role in the SSC month-end close process, workbook preparation and journal entry generation when required. Compile entries for posting by the SSC designated personnel. Qualifications: College degree or equivalent experience. Basic proficiency in MS Excel (formulas, pivots, v-lookups, graphs, etc.). Ability to manage and meet assignment deadlines through personal initiative on several simultaneously assigned tasks. Detail-oriented and organized. Strong analytical and independent problem solving skills. Highly motivated, self-starter, with internal drive to learn and accomplish more. Automotive Accounting experience required. CDK experience required. Next Possible Position: Sr. Reporting Analyst Physical Requirements: Normal office environment. Prolonged periods of personal computer usage and data entry.

Name: In-Business Risk and Control Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingOther Location: United States,Delaware,Wilmington; United States,Florida,JacksonvilleEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: Compliance and ControlSchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: Yes, 10 % of the TimeJob ID: 18071033 DescriptionAbout CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citis Mission and Value Propositionexplains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.Position SummaryCitis Global Analytics & Information Management (AIM) organizations goal is to build information and insight-driven customer decisions and experiences strategically to further our customer-centric approach. It is not only focused on providing a standardized supply chain of data, tools, and platforms for decision making, but also on creating mechanisms for knowledge and best practice sharing across product lines and geographies. The In-Business Risk and Control Analyst is a position within the Marketing Information Management team (MIM) of AIM. The In-Business Risk & Control Analyst is considered a subject matter expert and responsible for ensuring MIM is in compliance with all Citibank and regulatory policies and procedures. This position evaluates the risk and control environment by ensuring appropriate controls are in place. Individual will be responsible for coordinating monitoring activities, managing issues, managing the MIM Budget, and coordinating audits and examinations by internal and external reviewers by supporting activities and obtaining requested deliverables. This position will work with the business and other stakeholders to identify improvements of more complex processes to enhance the customer experience. This role will also complete projects, assignments and other activities as directed.Key ResponsibilitiesEnsures monitoring activities are well documented, can be replicated, and results are clearly communicated.Supports issues management processes including closing and retarget documentation and updates to the issue repository (iCAPS).Responsible for preparing and validating deliverables supporting various reviews.Partners with other lines of business to ensure consistency and to leverage best practices.Responsible for Management of the MIM BudgetPreparing all monthly Control reportingManaging Change Management Process QualificationsMinimum of 3-5 years of work experience in either Marketing, Campaign Execution, Digital Banking, Risk Management, or similar functionsInterpersonal skills and ability to work well in a team environment collaborating across diverse groupsRequires broad business knowledge serving as subject matter expert for processes and accuracy of risk and control documentation.Solutions-focused, able to sort through information and develop concise and clear solutions quicklyDetail-oriented with a logical and methodical approach to problem solvingExcellent written and verbal skillsAbility to conduct high quality researchHigh degree of attention to detailCustomer focusedAbility to support/manage multiple projects simultaneouslyExcellent analytical thinking, problem solving, and time management skillsSuperior execution skills with a focus on clear, realistic action steps and timelinessFlexible and easily adapts to changeSuccessful experience in a fast-paced environmentInnovative. Well versed in developing new ideas and improving current processesAbility to present a case for ideas and initiatives through listening and articulating a convincing point of viewPreferred experience with risk and control self-assessment frameworks (e.g. MCA, RCSA, etc.) risk identification and control design

Name: TAR-Data Analyst
Description: Overview:Under general supervision, this position is responsible for ongoing analysis of data and information, obtained from a variety of sources to ensure management and staff has actionable information to ensure quality data entry and integrity and contribute to meeting contracted performance measures.Essential Duties and Responsibilities · Oversees, collects, compiles, analyzes, and interprets workforce data and information data for the workforce system, management and staff.  · Uses all reports generating methods and information technologies to extract, compile and analyze data; uses TWIST & WIT Web, ad-hoc and related methods to develop reports, review the information and provide meaningful feedback to management and staff.  · Provides detailed analysis of the data in support of the workforce system goals and provides staff with the tools to monitor and achieve performance targets.  · Participates in strategy development to meet/exceed performance measures.  · Provides quality analysis & workforce planning.  · Prepares and provide presentations for staff to individual or in a group setting.  · Provides technical assistance to staff regarding workforce programs, performance measures, and/or related policies and procedures.  · Runs ad hoc reports to meet requests and needs and utilizes external software to collect and analyze data.  · Apply proven principles of theory and design to build and manage a database.  · Implement best practices in information technology management.  · Determine significant features, advantages and disadvantages of various database systems.  · Provides monthly scorecards to gauge career center and staff performance.  · Monitors center staff caseloads and shares information with management.  · Reviews and processes data integrity (DINT) requests.  · Reviews and processes deletion requests.  · Reviews and processes merge of customer records requests and change of customer social security number requests.  · Performs other related duties as required.Skills/Qualifications: · Bachelor degree from an accredited university or college in a relevant field of study and 2 years of experience working in the public or private sector, preferably in a field of workforce development, or  · Associate Degree from accredited college with 4 years of experience working in the public or private sector, preferably in a field of workforce development, or  · High School Diploma or equivalent from an accredited educational institution with 6 years of experience working in the public or private sector, preferably in a field of workforce development.  · Prefer knowledge of workforce development programs, economic development, business intelligence, business trends and project management experience.  · Prefer work experience in a performance based environment, public or private, the ability to analyze and interpret information and data and provide relevant feedback for action.  · Strong leadership skills, ability to motivate and provide guidance to staff and management.  · Strong interpersonal skills; ability to communicate effectively and interact with all stakeholders; ability to develop solutions.  · Strong knowledge of effective management techniques and practices, including planning, developing and implementing strategies and assessing results.  · Analytical and problem solving skills.  · Must have a working knowledge of, and be familiar with Windows operating systems and client/server hosted and on-premise applications.  · Scripting languages (VBScript, JavaScript, etc.)  · Microsoft SQL database querying, scripting, and administration.  · Time management skills to stay on target with goals.  · Detail orientated and strong organizational skills.  · Excellent computer software skills for database and spreadsheet; advanced skills in Microsoft office suite, including Excel.  · Strong documentation skills.  · Extensive knowledge of workforce information systems, TWIST, WIT, and other relevant management information systems.  · The position is in the Workforce Solutions service delivery area. A Data Analyst must be able to relocate anywhere in the service delivery area.  · Ability to develop and maintain professional working relationships with management, coworkers, workers from other programs as well as the public.  · Bilingual English and Spanish preferred.Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, sit, use hands for finger coordination, reach with arms and hands, pulling standard file cabinet and vertical file drawers, lift/carry 10 pounds of paper, drive a vehicle, stoop, kneel, talk and hear. Occasional travel required.

Name: Stress Analyst Lead
Description: POSITION SUMMARY: Responsible for planning, coordinating, and managing all stress activities on an assigned project. Ensures that Engineering activities are timely and completed in accordance with established quality standards and procedures. Supports Project Engineer in completing project deliverables pertaining to stress. Directs team of resources to achieve timely completion of project tasks. Coordinates closely with related departments to maintain schedules and effect necessary changes and revisions. Have knowledge of and follows engineering and applicable Quality Operating Procedures. Supports the quality management system and quality objectivesESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES:•Leads team of stress resources in performing finite element modeling and generating structural substantiation reports.•Supports design engineers in developing, documenting, creating, and improving new/existing products and more efficient processes.•Evaluates opportunities to improve performance, increase yields, and minimize product cost and weight.•Identifies and documents capabilities and limitations of processes.•Evaluates manufacturing and installation discrepancies and assists in determining effective solutions.•Performs finite element modeling and/or classical hand analysis on selected components in order to accurately determine external and internal loads.•Performs static stress analyses on components using PATRAN or FEMAP software to determine structural integrity of design of interior monuments, and aircraft structure•Maintains appropriate documentation for process, unit, and company reports.•Assumes responsibility for establishing and maintaining effective communication, coordination, and working relationships with area staff, clients, and management.•Assumes responsibility for related duties as required or assigned.•Stays informed of developments and changes in engineering technologies.•Performs production duties and special projects as assigned.•Attends and conducts meetings as needed.REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: •M.S. or B.S. in Engineering.•Extensive design and management experience in specific field considered as an alternative.•Excellent understanding of Company operations. •Strong understanding of engineering principles, procedures, and standards. •Thorough knowledge of current requirements and regulations. •Business development and project management experience. •Six or more years of progressive engineering experience with MS. •Eight or more years of progressive engineering experience with BSPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: •Previous aircraft stress experience helpful.SUCCESS FACTORS/JOB COMPETENCIES: •Well organized with strong planning and management skills. •Attention to detail.•Quality orientation. •Able to organize multiple projects. •Strong problem solving abilities. •Strong PC computing skills, including MS Office and engineering software. •Strong leadership skills. •Able to fill in for Engineering Director when needed.WORK ENVIRONMENT: This job operates in indoor and outdoor settings. The indoor settings include office and warehouse environments which require the use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines, as well as safety gear. The outdoor settings include parking lots and airplane runways. The noise level in the work environment is occasionally loud. Occasionally subject to varying inside and/or outside temperatures, which may include extreme heat (temperatures above 100 degrees) or extreme cold (temperatures below 32 degrees).While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to fumes or airborne particles, moving mechanical parts and vibration. The employee is occasionally exposed to a variety of extreme conditions. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit. The employee frequently is required use the fingers to make small movements such as typing, picking up small objects. Medium work; exerts up to 50 lbs. occasionally and/or up to 20 lbs. frequently , and 10 lbs. constantly. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus. TRAVEL: Travel may occasionally be required for this position (10% or less).WORK AUTHORIZATION/SECURITY CLEARANCE: Must be able to legally work in the US without sponsorship. Must be able to pass a post offer DOT drug test upon hire. EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY AND AFFIRMATIVE ACTION PLAN: GDC Technics provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. GDC will also take affirmative action as called for by applicable laws and Executive Orders to ensure that minority group individuals, females, disabled veterans, recently separated veterans, other protected veterans, Armed Forces service medal veterans, and qualified disabled persons are introduced into our workforce and considered for promotional opportunities.

Name: Associate Credit Analyst
Description: Associate Credit Analyst FOR03545 Cargill provides food, agriculture, financial and industrial products and services to the world.  Together with farmers, customers, governments and communities, we help people thrive by applying our insights and over 150 years of experience.  We have 155,000 employees in 70 countries who are committed to feeding the world in a responsible way,  reducing environmental impact and improving the communities where  we live and work.  Position Purpose & SummaryThe Associate Credit Analyst will coordinate all A/R and credit related activities for the assigned protein businesses. The Analyst will work closely with the business and Sr Credit Analyst to continue to build a best in class credit function. Primary accountabilities include review, oversight and partnering with the Sr Analyst on order/hold release functions; helping to develop effective collections techniques; review and approval of credit underwriting files. Additionally, the analyst will have oversight of the A/R and will work with the OTSC Analyst to ensure collection metrics are met.  Principal Accountabilities40% Analytical A/R Management Identify payment concerns or slowing, and successfully resolve the concern via root cause analysis and working with customer and commercial teamAnalyze A/R trends for the portfolio and ensure working capital metrics are metLead the work to maintain and improve SOP's for effective collections strategies 35% Portfolio Management and Risk Mitigation Facilitate discussion and provide guidance to the Sr Analyst for credit granting and establishing limits on external customersApprove limits on accounts where there is limited financial information and there is a need to make business decision in evaluating risk / reward for the customerProvide oversight of approved credit limits and ensure compliance to the credit policyBuild and sustain relationships with business leadership, commercial teams, and customersAssist in the completion of Cargill Financial Risk Committee credit assessments 10% Order/Release Resolution Work with OTSC Sr Analyst and business to resolve any customer order hold concernsLead the work to maintain and improve SOP's for effective order hold/release process 10% Customer Setup Facilitate new customer setup requests between commercial and master data teams 5% EDI Resolution Work with the business, IT and customers to resolve EDI transmission failures Relocation will not be provided for this position.A strong candidate has been identified for this position. However we will consider all candidates who meet the requirements.  Required Qualifications** High School or GED equivalent. ** Minimum of 2 years in commercial credit and collections** Minimum of 2 months of experience in accounts receivable application.** Minimum travel (up to 10% of the time)** Minimum of 2 months of experience in Microsoft Suite Office Suite (Outlook, Excel...) Preferred Qualifications** Bachelor's Degree in Business or equivalent degree** Experience in Syspro** Experience in JD Edwards Financial System, AS400 based systems, and SAP.  Success factors ** Ability to influence customers and suppliers to obtain payment commitments or sensitive financial information** Ability to work collaboratively across businesses and shared service sites  Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.  Finance/Accounting  US-TX-Fort Worth  Full-time  Standard  Day Job

Name: Supplier Management Systems Analyst
Description: Job Description  Supplier Management Systems Analyst  Fort Worth, TX  6 Month Contract  Job Description:  This position will support the Supplier Management group by working with Buyers, Administrators and Management in various Supplier Management functions.  Duties will include  locating & expediting parts in support of critical requirements, working within the MRP system to gather information, utilizing Excel to create visibility & provide status on performance, and working cross functionally to meet deadlines  .  This position will support Supplier Management  in effectively representing the client, and lead the relationship with the company's suppliers for material requirements to support the operation.  Duties & Responsibilities:  Coordinate directly with outside vendors to expedite orders and the return of aircraft components to support the company's day to day material objectives  Communicate overdue orders to suppliers  Read maintenance schedules & inventory reports to determine priority of materials required  Provide shipping and delivery information to all necessary workgroups  Develop and update Excel based reports, status and charts  Maintain appropriate purchasing files and data within purchasing software programs  Assist Buyers to obtain quotations and Purchase Order status  Work with internal departments as well as suppliers to correct any discrepancies in shipping, invoicing, quality, and part number & quantity mismatches

Name: Systems Analyst (ATAC, Alliance Field, Fort Worth, TX)
Description: About Textron: Textron Inc. is a multi-industry company that leverages its global network of aircraft, defense, industrial and finance businesses to provide customers with innovative solutions and services. Textron is known around the world for its powerful brands such as Bell, Cessna, Beechcraft, Hawker, Jacobsen, Kautex, Lycoming, E-Z-GO, and Textron Systems. For more information visit: www.textron.com. About ATAC: Textron Airborne Solutions provides training opportunities for military customers. Within this company is Airborne Tactical Advantage Company (ATAC), which provides tactical flight training and adversary services. Textron’s extensive global reach – makes for an incomparable training resource. ATAC provides tactical flight training and adversary aggressor services for U.S. Navy, Marine and Air Force pilots, and is the only organization certified to train the Navy’s TOPGUN program. ATAC operates simultaneously across five sites and two continents and comprises the world’s largest outsourced civilian, tactical airborne training organization and proudly provides the highest quality live training to Squadrons, Air Wings, and Battle Groups. ATAC was the first civilian organization authorized to train the USAF’s F-22 Raptors. Summary: The Systems Analyst has the overall responsibility to serve as the interface with assigned functional areas for the purpose of business technology strategy development, solution discovery, service management, risk management, and relationship management. The Systems Analyst serves as the business relationship link between the business and IT and provides highly valued consulting level support and guidance through key IT initiatives. They participate in the following: Communication of decisions, priorities, and relevant project information to appropriate levels of staff regarding operating unit requests and projects and initiativesSharing of knowledge of technology risks and opportunities to build competitive advantage and improve efficiency and effectiveness of operating unitsPartnerships with business leadership and other key stakeholders to define opportunities and identify and prioritize projects based on predefined criteria (e.g. return on investment, productivity, compliance) The Systems Analyst proactively serves as a “trusted advisor” and is the primary IT point of contact to business line leaders and managers. They operate as the key business contact representing IT in promoting IT services and capabilities, provide support in delivering technology products that meet the needs of the business, and focus on strategic initiatives and planning activities for their business area. They strive to understand market challenges, including customer priorities and competitive issues. They are proactive and anticipatory in their thinking. They are, by nature, driven and provide significant value to business units. They serve a role in enabling the business to achieve their objectives through the effective use of technology. Job Responsibilities:Lead, implement, administer and maintain Business Intelligence (BI) projects and support for various BI platforms.Participate in architecture, implementation, design, administration, maintenance, documentation and support of all dashboards, data models, and analytic solutions and ensure continuous 24x7 operations.Assist in the development and implementation of new or revised dashboards, including working on legacy dashboards for migration to the strategic business intelligence toolset.Perform Ad-Hoc Reporting and troubleshooting when dashboards, data models, and analytic solutions are not operational and follow through on resolution and root cause.Provide technical support, direction, and guidance to peers, leadership and associates on the overall business intelligence process and strategy as it relates to the IT and business strategies.Communicate and coordinate with the department and the business to minimize impact during maintenance and upgrade windows. Ensure thorough planning, testing and approval from the business before any transition or implementation.Research, evaluate, monitor and recommend emerging technology and leads investigation and adaptation of beneficial data technologies.Develop guidelines and upgrade techniques for the operational procedure, support and recovery of dashboards, data models, and analytic solutions. Maintain updated documentation as required.Partner with vendors and customers to ensure requirements are gathered and documented.Lead implementations, upgrades, and provide user support for all modules within our Oracle ERP system.Advise on integrations between applications and data transfer between platforms.Understand business processes and configure applications to properly support the needs of the business.Follow the IT Project Management Office (PMO) process when partnering and guiding the user community in new process or procedure implementation.Lead projects using PMO and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) principles.Take accountability for managing schedule, budget, and scope for a given project and follow it through to completion.Effectively contribute to and participate as member of large cross functional teams striving to improve processes.Research, evaluate, monitor and recommend emerging technologies that will improve business performance.Provide on call support to resolve incidents and support users with business critical needs.Qualifications:Bachelors in Computer Science, MIS or equivalent.Two (2) plus years of IT experience preferred.Experience leading small or big projects. Some Project Management essentials preferred but not required.Must exhibit the ability to effectively interface with peers, employees, management and customers within the organization.Must exhibit the ability to understand a wide range of business processes.Must exhibit a high proficiency in analytical and problem solving skills.Must communicate effectively both orally and in writing.SQL or PL/SQL intermediate to advanced experience, specifically with querying and reporting.Knowledge of ETL tools, ERP applications, assorted languages, data standards and protocols such as ASP.NET, XML, Oracle EBS, SAP, eNovia/eMatrix, COLTS, JIRA, SalesForce, and Clover, SAP PI Informatica are a plus.Experience leading projects and working in a team environment.

Description: Responsibilities include development and management of complex strategies to drive business decisions for our organization. Ability to analyze trends and suggest solutions to challenges.Achieve Successful Results– Takes the initiative to get things done.Demonstrates Adaptability– Works effectively in the faces of stress, ambiguity, difficult situations and shifting priorities.Innovates– Challenges the status quo thinking to generate new ideas; takes open minded approach to situations.Communication Skills - Refined written and verbal communication skills. Ability to foster open communications, listen effectively and build strong partnership networks.Technological Competence– Knowledge of SAS, R, Python as well as their corresponding predictive techniques to improve the organization’s decision making criteria.

Name: Reimbursement Financial Analyst, Sr
Description: Job DescriptionSummary:This position will work closely with the Director of Government Reimbursement and the CCMC and CCHS accounting departments. They will be responsible for the management and preparation of the Medicare/Medicaid annual cost reports for the Medical Center and for the Health System. They will conduct research on Federal and State regulations/laws. They will prepare utilization and financial data for other Health System employees/departments, complete Federal and State surveys, and assist with the company's financial audit as required. In addition, they will accumulate and maintain proper statistics for the cost reporting system and the cost accounting system. They will obtain from other regional hospitals, information on our interns and residents to ensure CCMC's Federal reimbursement. They must possess expertise in both government reporting and information technology. Word, Excel, Power Point and ten-key.Excellent interpersonal and communication skills are essential.Must possess proficient organizational skills and be able to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines.Accuracy and timeliness are key attributes. Based in Fort Worth, Texas, we're proud of our long and rich tradition of serving the community. Our not-for-profit organization is comprised of eight companies, including our Medical Center, Physician Network, Home Health Company, Northeast Hospital, Pediatric Surgery Center, Health Plan, Health Services Inc., and Health Foundation. With more than 60 primary, specialty and urgent care locations throughout Texas, families can access our top-ranked specialty programs and network of services to meet the unique needs of their child.

Name: Epic Bridges Integration Analyst - 5 months
Description: Title: Epic Bridges Integration Analyst - 5 months  Location: United States  Job Number: 18210817  CTG is seeking Epic Bridges Integration Analysts assist with an implementation and upcoming go-live for a client in TN. CTG also provides strategic staffing services for major technology companies and large corporations. Backed by more than 50 years of experience and proprietary methodologies, CTG has a proven track record of reliably delivering high-value, industry-specific staffing services and solutions to its clients. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India.  CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers. This commitment is reflected by CTG being named a Best Places to Work in Healthcare company by Modern Healthcare (2013-2016) in North America, and a Best Workplace in the United Kingdom (2013), Belgium (since 2007), and Luxembourg (since 2011). Name: Lead Application Programmer Analyst, Sap Finance (fico) - Itd
Description: Summary Benefits Supplemental Questions  The Lead Application Programmer Analyst is responsible for the planning, architecture, development, maintenance and support of the most complex applications for the enterprise delivered via the web, Internet and Intranet, and/or client-server. The incumbent is responsible for applying Object Oriented Programming best practices, architectures, and patterns, assists developers in programming, and aids in planning, architecting, securing, unit testing, and deploying applications. Responsible for adhering to Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) best practices, change control policies, and service level agreement (SLA) compliance. Keeps current on legal and technical issues that impact the County. This position normally supervises the work of other lower-level developers. level within a given functional area to provide 24-hour support.Communicates with end-users and third-party vendors to obtain requirements for projects and application updates for major/complex applications.Leads the design, programming (development), maintenance and execution of testing of new and changed functionality for complex/major applications.Writes advanced programs for complex specific applications and designs special reports and forms as requested by various County departments in compliance with County and IT department policy and procedures.Updates system end-user and training documentation.Leads the effort of actively partnering with business units to identify improvements that will increase efficiency of the systems.Provides second-level end-user support.Conducts statistical reporting to management relating to application performance, usability and upgrade requirements to properly support County departments.Manages interface and associate error logs.Maintains business process procedures in conjunction with the process owners.Resolves Request/Incident tickets from users and provides telephone and onsite technical support to troubleshoot and fix the most complex customer department end-user problems.Creates Request/Incident tickets from users and generates Requests for Change to the production environment to troubleshoot and fix the most complex customer department end-user problems.Works closely with vendors to resolve issues and manage deployments.Analyzes and resolves the most complex application and data problems.Performs all other related duties as required.Minimum Requirements: NOTE: You must fill out the work history and education sections of application to show you have years of experience/education as required by hiring department or be disqualified.  Bachelor's degree + Four (4) full-time years of experience in information technology including experience or training in systems analysis, design and computer programming. ~OR~ Associate's degree + Six (6) full-time years of experience in information technology including experience or training in systems analysis, design and computer programming. ~OR~ High School Diploma or GED + Eight (8) full-time years of experience in information technology including experience or training in systems analysis, design and computer programming.  Experience in SAP Financial Accounting & SAP Controlling preferred.  Current relevant experience with Mobile Application development tools, Visual Studio, OLAP, ODBC; .NET programming languages including VB.NET, C#, AJAX along with HTML, CSS, XML, XSLT, and JavaScript; UML; and SharePoint, TFS, SQL Server and other contemporary programming languages preferred.  Licensure or certification not required but considered a plus.  Must possess extensive knowledge of systems analysis, program design and specification, coding, testing, debugging, and documentation.  Must be able to multi-task and work independently on the most complex assignments using independent discretion and judgment as well as transition quickly between projects/issues with minimal supervision.  Must have the ability to gather requirements, analyze systems, develop solutions, test and document changes working in collaboration with other developers in a team environment.  Must have the ability to gather, understand and translate business requirements into system solutions.  Must have strong interpersonal skills with the ability to easily and effectively interact with technical, non-technical, support, and business staff at all levels.  Position requires the ability to consistently meet deadlines.  Must be able to work and communicate effectively with both team members and customers.  Position requires the ability to understand the concepts, best practices, and execution of business analysis and project management principles.  Must have the ability to verify that the product meets the requirements.  Position requires the ability to follow standards and system development methodology.  Must be able to display a courteous and professional demeanor.  Driving may be required. Must have a valid and current driver's license.  If hired, must provide proof of educational attainment at new hire processing  Tarrant County will conduct background checks on new hires that will include a criminal background check related to convictions and deferred adjudications since the age of seventeen (17) and may include credit reports, motor vehicle records, employment records, and educational attainment. A conviction or deferred adjudication is not an automatic bar to employment. Each case is considered individually. Incumbent must hold a valid Driver's License or State Issued ID card. Name: Junior Data Analyst
Description: The Junior Data Analyst is located within the Data Analytics team. Our company is concentrated on the understanding and application of data to make decisions for management and improvement of its clients operations and the businesses it serves. We primarily specialize in working with data from the Capital Markets, Real Estate and Mortgage Servicing verticals. Our mission is to deliver transparent and effective analytical output to produce insight that will allow our customers to make healthier and more informed decisions about their data that impacts the success of their overall business.  As a Junior Data Analyst, you will help in exploring and examining data from disparate source with the goal of discovering patterns and insights that can address business problems. You will assist with analyzing business level data to produce actionable insights utilizing analytics tools and languages such as R, Python, SQL, etc. The Role: You will contribute to the advancement of analytical projects from inception to delivery and beyond. Key responsibilities include:Write query to fetch data from relational and non-relational databasesValidate machine learning model and conduct quality controlUse regular expressions for text processingWrite python script to automate data transformation pipelineData Analysis extracting, comparing and profiling large data setsLearn and use program languages such as R, Python, or SQL to provide support for data analysis, statistical analysis, root-cause analysis, structured/unstructured predictive analytics, predictive modeling, optimization, and forecasting to produce actionable data- drive insights and outcomes for both time-sensitive and long-term business questionsThe Requirements:Bachelors degree in Data Science Analytics, Management Information Systems or equivalent work experience (mortgage and/or real-estate highly preferred) Knowledge of database and SQL queryHands on experience with object-oriented programming language (Java, C#, etc.)Experience working with Microsoft Excel including its full array of formulas, VBA macros, pivot tables, graphs, etc. Familiarity with R programming or Python scripting is preferredExperience developing algorithms is preferredExcellence in communication and a "get-the-job done" attitudeSelf-starter with ability to manage multiple tasks/responsibilities simultaneouslyAbility to work as part of a team and ability to work with clients and peers in a respectful and professional manner Desire to work in a changing environment

Name: Marketing Data Analyst
Description: RumbleOn is seeking a highly motivated, self-starter to be our next MarketingData Analyst! This position will handle analytics for our fast-paced, cutting edge company with regards to marketing initiatives, sales, and overall company goals; including the areas of list strategy, development and segmentation, list aggregation, campaign performance analysis, and forecasting and reporting as it relates to business planning. Do you have a deep understanding of quantitative and qualitative market analysis?Do you have experience writing SQL Queries and creating visualizations of key data points?Are you experienced in the Digital Marketing landscape? If yes, join our growing e-Commerce company that is taking the powersports industry by storm! We are a group passionate, driven, hard-working people who like to have fun! We offer a laid back environment where your ideas are heard, your talents are valued, and you are surrounded by amazingly supportive people!  The ideal candidate will have a demonstrated ability to use data to advise the Marketing Director and Stakeholders on how best to drive business results and maximize and optimize lead acquisition through our Digital Advertising Channels. This candidate must blend a high proficiency in accessing and manipulating data with a strong ability to turn data into strategic insights and recommendations. The role requires knowledge of customer acquisition, marketing automation, and list segmentation in order to identify effective lead segments at the right time, to deliver maximum ROI, as well as match-back customer journeys that are tied to company goals.  Key Responsibilities: Provide data-driven analysis to uncover and articulate key insights and recommendations to various stakeholders in the organizationFocus on segmentation, data quality and enrichment, and reporting while identifying a high volume of quality contacts (prospects) that ultimately drive sales leads.Perform universe segmentation; use data to advise marketing managers and director, sales and leadership team on how best to drive business results and maximize lead acquisition and conversionDetermine more cost-effective means to deliver on marketing objectives through use of marketing automation, by identifying most effective segments and channelsContinually monitor leads based on engagement levels, sales cycle length, deal source, and other criteriaMonitor and track effectiveness of all campaign efforts and channel attributionRequirementsBachelor’s degree Preferred but not Required if you have proven experience.3+ Years’ Experience in Data Analysis (specializing in Marketing Data Analysis)3+ Years Experience working with Digital Marketing teams and campaignsMust be proficient in utilizing, visualizing and building dashboarding toolsMust be able to write SQL Queries and Join Data TablesGoogle Analytics Certification preferred, Google Analytics Experience a MustBackground in, or have worked in Digital Focused Marketing Teams PreferredExperience with business data analysis and forecasting, universe segmentation, customer acquisition, email marketing, marketing automation, CRM and campaign analysisReport creation experience with business intelligence tools a must1-2 Years Experience with Domo (preferred)Experience with Hubspot (a plus)Must live local to the DFW area (we need someone to start soon and will not be able to wait for relocation)BenefitsWhat RumbleOn Offers You:A fun, relaxed, and casual work environment with awesome people by your side working as a team to ensure the entire group's success! Plus...Healthcare, Dental, & Vision Insurance (RumbleOn pays 100% of employees medical premium!!!)Competitive compensation packages based on experience and skillsCompetitive Vacation/PTO (12 PTO days year 1, plus 7 Paid Holidays for a total of 19 days year 1!)Close knit, open, inviting startup environment where you can make your mark and where your ideas are heard!Employee discounts on purchasesFully stocked kitchen with drinks and snacks all dayFun company eventsThe opportunity for growth and a solid long term career...we promote from within!!And more… *All applicants must pass pre-employment testing to include: background checks, MVR, and drug testing in order to qualify for employment*·

Monitor databases for integrity, quality, and security; write SQL queries to import/export data. Complete physical inventories, cycle counts, movements, and adjustments. Supervise daily entry and seasonal purchase orders and correct existing orders when necessary. Update inventory records from previous seasons. Other duties as assigned.Requirements: Advanced Excel skills (V-Lookups, Pivot Tables, Macros, etc.) and experience with other Microsoft Office products. Proficiency in SQL / Database Query. Well-developed ability to use computer and software applications, and databases. Working independently and with a team. Simultaneously managing multiple projects. Experience with inventory control. Experience with Warehouse Management Systems (WMS). Demonstrates knowledge of system when determining the type of discrepancy. Ensures systems are adjusted on a daily basis to ensure correct information. Uses very good attention to detail to verify the accuracy of inventory.Environment/Benefits: Fast-paced environment at one of the apparel industry’s leading manufacturers of western wear. 401(k), vacation, health, employee discount + other benefits. Regular business hours = first shift / day shift. Casual dress code. Include resume in PDF or MS Word format with the application. No phone calls, please.

Current Department of Army Civilian Employees  In order to qualify, you must meet the education and/or experience requirements described below. OR Combination of Education and Experience: A combination of education and experience may be used to qualify for this position as long as the computed percentage of the requirements is at least 100%. To compute the percentage of the requirements, divide your total months of experience by 12. Then divide the total number of completed graduate semester hours (or equivalent) beyond the second year (total graduate semester hours minus 36) by 18. Add the two percentages. Name: Human Resource Operations Analyst
Description: Epsilon is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. With over 40 years in the market, we help Fortune 500 companies across numerous industries better connect with their consumers, online and offline, and improve their marketing, day in and day out. We have been recognized by Forbes as one of "America's Best Employers to Work For," a top company by Fortune Magazine as one of the "100 Best Places to Work for Millennials," and have earned the Ad Age accolade of "#1 U.S. Agency Across all Disciplines" for multiple years.  Epsilon is seeking a Human Resources Operations Analyst to support the HR Operations team. As an HR Analyst, you will primarily support the reporting functionality of the HR Operations team, which encompasses areas such as HRIS, Reporting, Compliance and Audit, and special programs.  Responsibilities May Include (All or Some) Tasks Below: Build, schedule and maintain reports across various HR platformsDevelop and maintain dashboards using data visualization tools such as TableauPartner with HR team members to ensure data integrity in our HRIS tools, making recommendations as necessary to support the accurate entry and maintenance of HR related dataGather business requirements for HR tools from various HR teamsAnalyze requirements and partner with technical SMEs to recommend solutions that enable the needs the HR team through technologyServe as the system administrator for any Epsilon owned HR toolsLead UAT efforts for any new technology roll out or existing system upgradePartner with vendors such as People Doc and Hyphen to enhance our use of the systemsWork on large scale projects such as system implementationsAssist with other projects that arise within HR Operations team as neededQualifications:Bachelor's degree in Technical and/or Human Resources concentration preferredPrevious HR experience is a plus, but not requiredExposure to data visualization tools and/or reporting software (Tableau, SQL, Oracle Business Intelligence)Advanced Excel skills including V-lookup, Macros, and pivot tablesStrong critical thinking skills & inquisitive/analytically-mindedExcellent listening and communication skills, both written and verbalDetail oriented, able to multi-task and prioritize in a fast paced environmentAble to work in a team and build effective relationshipsDemonstrated leadership skillsSelf-starter, with strong initiative Conditions of Employment  All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.  Great People, Deserve Great Benefits  We know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly. If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career. From tuition reimbursement to scholarship programs to employee stock purchase plans and 401(k)s, we offer associates a variety of benefits that work as hard for them as they work for us.  About Epsilon  Epsilon® is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. Epsilon's digital media arm, Conversant, is a leader in personalized digital advertising and insights through its proprietary technology and trove of consumer marketing data, delivering digital marketing with unprecedented scale, accuracy and reach through personalized media programs and through CJ Affiliate, one of the world's largest affiliate marketing networks. Together, we bring personalized marketing to consumers across offline and online channels, at moments of interest, that help drive business growth for brands. An Alliance Data* company, Epsilon employs over 8,000 associates in 70 offices worldwide. For more information, visit www.epsilon.com and follow us on Twitter @EpsilonMktg.  Alliance Data provides equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. For San Francisco Bay Area: Alliance Data will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance  Alliance Data is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Alliance Data will provide accommodations to applicants needing accommodations to complete the application process.  Any applicant offered employment will be required to establish that they are legally authorized to work in the United States for Alliance Data.  Alliance Data participates in E-Verify.  Alliance Data will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal and credit histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.  #LI-TM1SDL2017

Name: Supplier Management Analyst
Description: This position will support the Supplier Management group by working with Buyers, Administrators and Management in various Supplier Management functions. Duties will include locating & expediting parts in support of critical requirements, working within the MRP system to gather information, utilizing Excel to create visibility & provide status on performance, and working cross functionally to meet deadlines. This position will support Supplier Management in effectively representing and leading the relationship with the company’s suppliers for material requirements to support the operation. Duties & Responsibilities • Coordinate directly with outside vendors to expedite orders and the return of aircraft components to support the company’s day to day material objectives  • Communicate overdue orders to suppliers  • Read maintenance schedules & inventory reports to determine priority of materials required  • Provide shipping and delivery information to all necessary workgroups  • Develop and update Excel based reports, status and charts  • Maintain appropriate purchasing files and data within purchasing software programs  • Assist Buyers to obtain quotations and Purchase Order status  • Work with internal departments as well as suppliers to correct any discrepancies in shipping, invoicing, quality, and part number & quantity mismatches

Name: 2019 Associate IT Analyst - PLM
Description: *2019 Associate IT Analyst \- PLM***Description** At Bell, thinking above and beyond is what we do best\. For more than 80 years, we?ve been reimagining the experience of flight ? and where it can take us\.  We are pioneers\. We were the first to break the sound barrier and to certify a commercial helicopter\. We were aboard NASA?s first lunar mission and brought advanced tiltrotor systems to market\. And today, we?re defining the future of on demand mobility\.  A Day in the Life of an Associate IT Analyst ? PLM  As anAssociate IT Analyst ? PLMyou will be a part of the Technology team at our Global Headquarters in Fort Worth, TX\. Bell is in the process of a significant business process transformation activity\. The selected candidate is expected to support development and delivery of business critical technology solutions\. You will:  + Provide development, testing, and support for one or more enterprise applications including, but not limited to SAP, Enovia, CATIA, Kronos, SAP, CAMS\.  + Analyze, design, and test enhancements to new and existing custom applications\.  + Work with customers and development team to gather and interpret user/system requirements into design specifications\.  + Provide infrastructure support for servers, network, SAN, and end\-user devices\.  + Identify, track and resolve issues and risks affecting tasks/assignments\.  + Design system specifications and interfaces for interacting components\.  + Design and develop apps to functional and technical standards\.  + Provide support toward deployment of application releases into production\.  + Create operational documentation\.  + Meet service commitments for assigned deliverables and proactively provide work status\.  + Proactively resolve production problems quickly and effectively\. *Qualifications**Education Requirements: + Bachelor?s degree is required\.  + Degree inComputer Science, Information Systems, or Businessstrongly preferred\.  + 3\.0 minimum overall, undergraduate GPA\.  Minimum Requirements foran Associate IT Analyst ? PLMat Bell: + Working knowledge of at least: + 1 Database Management System  + 1 Operating System  + 1 Programming Language  + Microsoft Office Suite \(Excel, PowerPoint, Word\)  + Must have demonstrated teamwork and collaboration in a professional setting\.  + Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills  + Must be articulate, detail\-oriented, dedicated and conscientious\.  + Must have the ability to work independently and as a team member\.  + Good communication \(written and oral\) and interpersonal skills  + Good organizational, multi\-tasking, and time\-management skills Ideal Candidates Also Have: + Any work experience demonstrating responsibility, work ethic, customer experience\.  + Personal discipline, interpersonal communication, leadership skills\.  + Passion for their role\.  + Professional associations\.  + Interest in the manufacturing industry\.  Collaborate with dedicated, enthusiastic teams where differences in experiences, backgrounds, and ideas combined with a strong passion for our products take us above and beyond flight\. *EEO Statement** Textron is committed to providing Equal Opportunity in Employment, to all applicants and employees regardless of, race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, military status, veteran status, handicap, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by law\. *Pay Transparency Policy Statement** The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant\. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise, have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is \(a\) in response to a formal complaint or charge, \(b\) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or \(c\) consistent with the contractor?s legal duty to furnish information\. *Job** Information Technology*Primary Location** US\-Texas\-Fort Worth*Recruiting Company** Bell Flight*Schedule** Full\-time*Job Level** Individual Contributor*Shift** First Shift*Req ID:** 265604

Name: Business intelligence analyst- F2F mandatory
Description: Position Summary:  The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst for Connected Vehicle Reporting will be responsible for gathering business requirements that pertain to reporting on the client Connected Vehicle organization's marketing activities and key performance indicators. This person will be required to develop an in depth knowledge of CV marketing business processes and corresponding information needs. The analyst will interview users in order to establish reporting requirements, define key performance indicators and their attributes, assess needs for training, and determine user acceptance criteria for development projects. Business requirements need to be captured in technical documents for development teams, including screen mockups and visualizations. The analyst will also be the primary person testing report and dashboard outputs.  Duties and Responsibilities: Assist business staff in the development of business requirements documents, including owning authorship of business requirements when called for.Help identify and assess potential data sources, and analyze existing enterprise data warehouse structures to determine relevance to CV marketing reporting.Participate in generating high-level solution concepts in consultation with development and quality assurance teams.Write functional requirements documents, participate in document reviews with business users and development teams.Create dashboard design mockups, using creative methods for visualizing results.Document test strategies for report and dashboard outputs, and review test results.Maintain an understanding of how the data in the enterprise data warehouse relates to important CV marketing business processes, events and measurements.Work cooperatively with analysts and developers to ensure that business requirements guide the development life cycle. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in information technology or related field or equivalent, relevant experience.At least 8 years of working experience in a variety of technical roles within information technology.5 or more years of experience in business analysis or data analysis roles in a BI environment. Technical Skills: Experience using BI tools; experience with Cognos and Qlikview highly desirable.Development experience with at least one business intelligence tool such as Qlikview, Tableau, Cognos, or Microstrategy highly desired.Experience authoring technical documents such as business requirements, functional requirements, business rules, KPI definitions, database design representations, data and systems flow diagrams.Knowledge of data warehouse architectures and processes.Understanding of the features and capabilities of one more DBMS's commonly used in data warehousing such as Oracle, Teradata, SQL Server.Expertise developing or applying relational and dimensional data models.Thorough knowledge of MS-Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access).provided by Dice BI tools; experience with Cognos and Qlikview highly desirable.

Name: IT Business Analyst with First Data experience
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: NoJob ID: 18071211 Description  About Citi  Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.  Citi's Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients' and the public's trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.  Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.  This individual must have demonstrated ability to lead and manage across technology disciplines in a matrix organization. Candidate must have prior experience using the First Data card issuing platform and ideally have knowledge of distributed applications. This role will have accountability for multiple projects including scope, schedule, audit and financials. Specific responsibilities include:Lead small and medium sized technology projects in a diverse organization.Serves as a liaison between the business community, IT and First Data.Coordinates with IT PM's and First Data to ensure appropriate integration of functions to meet goals.Provides technical knowledge to ensure requirements and designs integrate between vendors and Citi IT.Resolve problems concerning the projects; contact vendors for support when necessary; facilitate resolution to risks/issues and resolve problems involving clients with optimum speed and efficiency.Acts as a technical resource and may provide system support for requirements, testing, and project management tools.Formulates and incorporates successes and lessons into best practices.Contact with users, external service providers, and other technical specialists as neededWork with business and technology to research and resolve issuesQualifications Candidate must be able to demonstrate the following: Strong customer focus and management of client expectations; ability to establish and maintain a high level of user trust and confidence in the IT group's knowledge of and concern for users' business needs.Experience with mobile/internet based applications and processing systems.At least five (5) years of experience with First Data in a technology focused project management and/or technical environment.Knowledge of FDR Icasubby Account RangeExcellent oral and written communication skills.Strong interpersonal skills at all levels of management; excellent teamwork skills.Ability to present and explain technical information to diverse audiences.Demonstrated commitment to cost effectiveness, quality customer service and operational efficiency.Ability to weigh various suggested technical solutions against the original business needs and choose the most cost-effective solution. Ability to gain credibility to influence decision makers and influencers.Ability to influence within and across boundariesPrivate Label or bankcard conversion experience desired.Demonstrated professional project management skills including prior implementation experience in a complex, high tech environment. Name: Sr Lease Admin Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY Under limited supervision, upholds the integrity of real estate portfolio data for large, complex portfolio of clients. Inputs, maintains, organizes and reports on information regarding lease dates, dollar values and financial accounting transactions into a lease management software database. Prepares, processes and reconciles AR & AP transactions to ensure accurate and current lease information is maintained. Acts as lead for lease administration team. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Resolves critical issues for clients by researching and gathering information about payment transactions, lease terms and other relevant items. Establishes and maintains working relationship with clients and/or landlords.  Acts as a team lead including providing work flow direction to co-workers and providing account supervision. Ensures data integrity and accuracy by performing quality control review of work completed by team members.  Prepares lease abstracts and edits them for accuracy. Writes narratives for monthly variance reports, providing analysis and interpretation of lease information to clients.  Tracks payables and receivables associated with the leases in portfolio. Processes client rent rolls utilizing the database. Prepares export files and sends to accounting for payables processing.  Prepares invoices for subtenants, reconciles subtenant accounts, reviews incoming invoices for errors/accuracy with lease document and ensures correct coding. Reviews profit center reports for accuracy.  Prepares and distributes periodic and ad hoc reports in a timely, accurate manner. Designs reports utilizing various report writers, Excel, Word, and/or Access. Reviews standard reports prepared by team members for accuracy.  Prepares and distributes critical date reports; maintains tickler system for tracking important dates and tasks.  Performs annual operating expense reconciliations, monitors audit windows and audit requirements contained in the lease documents.  Creates and maintains client lease files ensuring they contain current, accurate information.  Serves as a member of a transition team, if needed, to get a new account set up and operating quickly and efficiently.  Cross-checks and reviews work of peers to ensure quality and accuracy of data.  May provide and/or assist with budgeting and forecasting activities.  May conduct financial analysis/accounting as appropriate, including AR/AP, rent rolls, and budgets in accordance with required accounting principles (GAAP, Tax, Cash, etc.).  Performs other duties as assigned. SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position. Provides informal assistance such as technical guidance, and/or training to coworkers. Coordinates and assigns tasks to co-workers within a work unit and/or project.  \n\nQUALIFICATIONS  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE  High school degree or general education degree required plus a minimum of four years related work experience, preferably including property management or accounting. Bachelor's degree from a four-year college or university with Accounting, Finance or Real Estate preferred.  CERTIFICATES and/or LICENSES  None COMMUNICATION SKILLS Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to effectively present information. FINANCIAL KNOWLEDGE Requires in-depth knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate complex figures and conduct financial/business analysis including the preparation of reports. REASONING ABILITY Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.  OTHER SKILLS and ABILITIES  Intermediate knowledge of computer software and hardware (i.e. Microsoft Office Suite Products). Ability to work well under pressure. Advanced organizational skills. SCOPE OF RESPONSIBILITY Decisions made with thorough knowledge of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Responsible for setting own project deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers, supervisor and clients.

Name: Application Programmer Analyst
Description: A reputable company in need of a Programmer Analyst has partnered with Robert Half Technology to find someone with a passion for formulating and defining systems scope and objectives who also has a strong understanding of software and applications programming and industry requirements. You would provide guidance on developing or altering applications or databases, employing research and fact-finding techniques. This full-time Programmer Analyst opportunity is found in Fort Worth, Texas. How you will make an impact - Assembles and maintains dictionaries for applications and systems support by the analyst - Build and evaluate programming changes prior to implementation for each systems development phase. Record test cases and expected outcomes. Ensure that requirements are met. May create simple tests or a defined subset of a larger system test. May suggest acceptance/rejection in cases where not all requirements are met - Assesses and logs issues. Works alongside other programmers to correct problems with code - Provides guidance for internal clients on applications, systems and/or processes for identifying and resolving, processing/reporting problems with programming. Consultation can include troubleshooting and/or education - Reviews methods of processing and recommends improvements - Reviews user requests for changes or improvements to systems. Records functional requirements and analyzes cost, feasibility and utility. Backed by more than 65 years of experience, Robert Half Technology is a leader among IT staffing agencies. Whether you're looking to hire experienced technology talent or find the best technology jobs, we are your IT expert to call.  We understand not only the art of matching people, but also the science of technology. We use a proprietary matching tool that helps our staffing professionals connect just the right person to just the right job. And our network of industry connections and strategic partners remains unmatched.  Apply for this job now or contact our branch office at 888.674.2094 to learn more about this position.
