Name: Research Data Analyst
Description: Who We Are  Solera is a global leader in digital technologies that connect and secure life's most important assets: our cars, homes and identities. Since its inception in 2005 as a garage-based startup, Solera has grown aggressively with over 50 acquisitions across its platforms. The company's current product solutions include Audatex, Autodata, AutoPoint, CAP/HPI, Colimbra, Digidentity, Enservio, Explore Data, Hollander, Identifix, Inpart, LYNX and TitleTec, as well as the company's flagship Digital Garage application. Today, Solera processes over 300 million transactions annually for approximately 235,000 partners and customers in over 80 countries. Unified by a strong culture that values uncommon entrepreneurial thinking and continuous "do-it-different" innovation, Solera's global workforce of 6,700+ associates come from diverse forward-thinking industries that include automotive technology, artificial intelligence, software development, data sciences, cybersecurity, cognitive design, and digital identity protection. For more information, please visit solera.com.  The Solera Way  Solera's uncommon culture is based on three simple principles: Think 80/20 (Focus), Act 30/30 (Efficiency), and Live 90/10 (Accountability). We define our mindset using Our 3H's: Humility, a Hunger to succeed, and a desire to Hunt for opportunities to win. We train our volunteers to engage with each other modulating between their intellect (IQ) and emotional intelligence (EQ) using our 3Fs: Facts, Finesse, and Force. Solera has become a global technology leader that is constantly growing in the double digits. The principles, drills, and values associated with the Solera Way have been fundamental to Solera's success and our ability to grow, continuously change, and innovate.  Are You Uncommon?  We're on the hunt for an experienced Research Data Analyst who ranks in the top quartile among their peers. Someone who has a highly competitive and entrepreneurial mindset that is wired with a team-first attitude, has no problem rolling up their sleeves to execute their missions, and can modulate between leading and following as needed. You will serve as a Business Analyst within the RFR (Request For Review) department.  What You'll Be Doing  At Solera, we believe in providing clarity and focus to what our volunteers are responsible for their mission. The 80's, as we call them at Solera, are the employee's priorities associated with their role or mission. The mission 80's for this role, are: Internal and External Client Support including but not limited to chat, email, and face to face interaction to ensure client satisfactionDrive Improvement in all associated Solera products through 30/30 opportunity recognition as well as cross-functional collaboration with peers.Employ a 90/10 attitude by taking ownership of additional projects (20's) as necessary to exceed project objectives.Additional responsibilities of the role include:Analyze internal and external system inquiries and create/open tickets in the tracker system.Research solutions, then create and attach inquiry data packages to all tickets while ensuring the requests are clear and concise for data technicians in order to solve them.Close tickets in a timely fashion and directly communicate all resolution outcomes to customers via emailed resolution letters.Follow the product release schedule and contribute to monthly release timeline fulfilment.Provide technical support to the Tier 1 level helpdesk when necessary via live chat, email, and/or phone.Maintain the highest degree of customer satisfaction by fostering clear, professional communication and exceeding client expectations.Active participation and collaboration with fellow GDC team members on different projects and industry relations activities.Provide input for the preparation of plans and forecasts.Analyze data output reports and initiate both preventive and corrective actions.Participation in Ownership of DBRM (Database Reference Manual) Updates. Are You Qualified? Bachelor's Degree or equivalent technical training in the Automotive Industry3+ years using collision estimating software (Knowledge of Audatex and/or Autosource is a plus)3+ years of Insurance or Collision Repair Facility work experiencePersonal Lines claims process knowledgeTechnical writing skills utilizing proper grammar, spelling, etc.Excellent communication skills, including application of conflict negotiation strategiesProficiency with common Microsoft utilities such as Word, Excel, and PowerPointAny relative experience commensurate with items listed above Our Space  We believe that offices should be destinations where people want to be places where people want to work, play and, collaborate. That is why we spend a lot of time on enhancing our workspaces. Solera's work environments are intersections of the old and the new of the past, present, and future. They are spaces designed to stimulate creative thinking, innovation, and cross-functional collaboration.  We also embrace wellness. Whether it is our onsite or offsite workout centers, nutritional meals and beverages, or endless snacks for focus and energy. This wellness plan is our commitment to healthy living, which spans across our office environments.  TexasSDL2017

Name: Sr. Strategic-Planning Analyst
Description: Texas Health Resources is seeking to hire a Sr. Strategic-Planning Analyst to work Full Time.The address is 612 E. Lamar Blvd. Arlington, TX 76011Salary range is Min. $27.00/hr to Max. $43.67/hr based on relevant experienceWork ScheduleFull Time: 40 hours per week  Monday-Friday  8:00am-5:00pmThis position is a key contributor on a focused, highly visible team that develops and executes robust analytics that inform strategies to meet THR's strategic objectives. Together with the rest of the team, this position plays a key role in: providing information and analyses to support strategic decision-making and acquisition due diligence, performing competitive analyses.• Analyze strategic and operational opportunities within and across specific zones, hospitals, and departments. These assignments will require the use of: hypothesis-based problem solving, fact-based analysis, financial modeling, decision modeling, scenario planning, statistical analysis, and other methods of quantitative analysis as needed to suit the specific problem at hand. Use Excel, Tableau, and Alteryx to perform analysis on large disparate data sets to support strategic. Act as a thought-partner for strategy team members. Help them to identify key strategic issues, create a framework for analysis, and develop insights that provide a data-based analytical set of strategic choices.Gather key inputs for the Strategic Plans for the system and its entities (including service-line specific plans). Provide additional context and analysis that informs the team about forward growth rates by service line and/or geography.Perform periodic analysis on market and competitive trends in a crisp, concise and timely manner. Work with strategy team members to design periodic market and competitive reports which track key trends, monitor and evaluate competitors, highlight innovation opportunities and inform decision-making.Develop and incorporate additional inputs (3rd party research, newsletters, trade magazines, websites, etc.) into periodic reporting (as needed).Work with strategy team to improve quality and usefulness of reporting over time. Manage data warehouse to make data available for appropriate end users, including refreshing the data and providing periodic updates.Contribute to the development and optimization of key THR analytic tools and processes.Assist strategy team in building a THR-specific toolkit for analyzing and tracking service line market sizes, competitor shares, competitor cost positions, and growth rates.Support business development efforts by performing M&A due diligence, valuation and business integration planning for potential acquisitions (as needed). Team members may be called upon to contribute to any and all stages of the business development process, including valuation of potential acquisition targets. All business development activities will require coordination with the THR Business Development group, which owns and coordinates the business development process.Engage in other ad-hoc analyses and information gathering / communications as needed to support the growth and development of the business.QualificationsThe ideal candidate will possess the following qualificationsBachelor's Degree in Business or in a quantitative/technical discipline preferred OR four (4) years strategic analysis experience in lieu of degree is requiredThree (3) years of Strategic Analysis; performing a variety of quantitative analyses (e.g., DCF valuation, ABC analysis, regression analysis, etc.) is required.SkillsStrong critical reasoning and qualitative analysis skillsDemonstrated track record performing a variety of quantitative analysesDemonstrated skills in strategic analysis, market research, financial modeling, and competitive analysisDemonstrated Microsoft Excel skills (e.g., pivot tables, vlookup, sensitivity analysis, etc.)Preferred experience with SQL, Tableau, Alteryx, R and similar programsDemonstrated ability to learn other key software programsGood communication and presentation skillsComfort in working in a dynamic environment and managing multiple projects simultaneouslyAbility to operate independently, with minimal directionStrong teamwork skillsWhy Texas Health Resources?Texas Health Resources is one of the largest faith-based, nonprofit health care delivery systems in the United States and the largest in North Texas in terms of patients served.  Texas Health has 25 acute-care and short-stay hospitals that are owned, operated, joint-ventured or affiliated with the system. It has more than 3,800 licensed beds, more than 21,100 employees of fully-owned/operated facilities plus 1,400 employees of consolidated joint ventures, and counts more than 5,500 physicians with active staff privileges at its hospitals.At Texas Health, we strive to create an atmosphere of respect, integrity, compassion and excellence for all who come in contact with us, be they patients or our employees. We are committed to diversity in our workforce, and our mission to serve spreads across ethnic, cultural, economic and generational boundaries.Texas Health Highlights2018 FORTUNE Magazines 100 Best Companies to Work For® (4th year in a row)2018 Becker's Healthcare "150 Great Places to Work in Healthcare" (4th year in a row)2018 Employees Choice Best Places to Work by Glassdoor

Name: FSARC Intelligence analyst
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.6 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at http://www.jpmorganchase.com/. The Financial Systemic Risk and Analysis Center (FSARC) proactively identifies, analyzes, assesses and coordinates activities to mitigate systemic risk to the US financial system from cyber security threats and emerging trends through focused operations and enhanced collaboration between participating firms, industry partners and the US Government. The FSARC is a subsidiary of the Financial Services Information Sharing and Analysis Center (FS-ISAC), a member-driven organization whose mission is to help assure the resilience and continuity of the global financial services infrastructure and individual firms.The individual selected for this position will part of the FSARC Improve Intelligence This is a full time position located in the Washington DC region. Occasional travel may be required.Primary Duties and ResponsibilitiesThe FSARC Intelligence analyst is focused on contributing to joint analysis for improved government and financial industry awareness. The analyst, working side by side with US government partners, will monitor information sources to identify and assess indicators of cyber attacks against financial sector assets. The analyst will play an active part in developing and maintaining intelligence requirements, and collection plans that enable better analysis for US government awareness of threat activity observed by the financial services sector. The analyst will work with other FSARC elements to measure the effectiveness in countering the identified systemic threats.Responsibilities· Work with the FSARC-member threat intelligence centers to share information and build a strong eco-system for defending financial system assets · Drive collection plans, and research cyber intelligence feeds, based on the intelligence needs of financial sector operations· Prioritize analysis and contextualize findings in relation to FSARC intelligence requirements, in collaboration with US government partners· Contextualize threat activity in relation to financial loss of the target institutions· Track cybercrime and advanced threat activity and report on imminent and emerging threats as well as changes to the threat landscape· Maintain detailed threat actor profiles on adversaries of interest/relevance to the firm, covering tactics, techniques and procedures, intents, goals and strategic objectives· Provide a forward-looking view of the threats, predicting shifts in adversarial intents, goals and strategic objectives· Identify and collect metrics on the effectiveness of FSARC and partner operationsQualifications· Undergraduate degree and at least 5 years combined cyber security analysis experience· Experience determining source information accuracy· Experience with link analysis, data visualization tools such as Palantir, Analyst’s Notebook, or Maltego· Experience leveraging Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) in intelligence collection and analysis· Excellent understanding of networking concepts and Information Security, including emerging threats and attack methodologies· Significant and detailed threat actor knowledge· Specialist training or skills in one or more of the following: · Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) gathering and/or analysis· Social Media Intelligence (SMI/SOCMINT) gathering and/or analysis· Human Intelligence (HUMINT) analysis· Signals Intelligence (SIGINT) analysis· Strong knowledge or experience in one or more of the following: · Investment banking· Asset management· Consumer and/or Commercial banking· Excellent written and verbal communication skills· Must possess a high degree of initiative, motivation and problem-solving skills· Demonstrated experience in critical and strategic thinkingHighly Desired· 3 years Intelligence Community experience and/or 3 years’ experience at an international institution conducting cyber or security/intelligence related work· Working knowledge of global threats to international cyber security, and conversant in the tactics, techniques and procedures used by cyber adversaries· Significant malware analysis, virus exploitation and mitigation techniques experience· Coding (scripting) experience e.g. Perl, VB Script, Python etc.· Experience briefing technical and non-technical audiences on threat activity· Knowledge of financial sector business operating models and attack surfaces· Ability to gain a government security clearance· Experience building professional presentations and products using standard office software applications · Strong collaboration, negotiation and mediation skills among internal and external stakeholders

Such options should address any people, process, logistic, and technology areas that have the potential to detrimentally impact servicesProactively identify problem trends and known defects and work with necessary business and technology support teams to identify options for root cause removal and the corrective actions required to provide acceptable solutions and/or workaroundsAble to produce succinct business–led problem reports and able to articulate reports at an Executive levelExperience:Minimum 8 years related experienceProvide operational incident, problem, change, config, knowledge management in the delivery of large global scaleProven troubleshooting skills within a support environment including strong analytic and diagnostic skills and attention to detailExcellent verbal and written communication abilities, especially the ability to communicate on infrastructure, security, and risk-related concepts to technical and non-technical audiencesAbility to direct the actions of technical resources at various levels in the organization in a professional and effective mannerAbility to communicate confidently and clearly on conference calls, in meetings, via email, etc. at all levels of the organizationStrong organizational skills – the ability to effective manage multiple tasks simultaneouslya img { outline:none; padding:0; margin:0;}img { outline:none;}Reasonable AccommodationSabre is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with disabilities. Name: Sr Cybersecurity Analyst
Description: The Sr Cybersecurity Analyst is responsible for executing a portion of the GM Financial (GMF) Cybersecurity Program designed to advise the organization on its management of cybersecurity risk by organizing information, enabling risk management decisions, and addressing threats to ensure the security of company systems and information assets. The Sr Cybersecurity Analyst is responsible for contributing to the success of comprehensive security initiatives, work with internal and external groups to ensure the program is operating effectively and efficiently, and develop strong partnerships with business partners across the enterprise to ensure company information assets are protected at the appropriate level. JOB DUTIES (Desired Skills) Demonstrated proficiency developing and updating cybersecurity policies, standards and procedures referencing NIST 800-53 controls and the NIST Cyber Security Framework, including implementing revisions in accordance with updates in relevant regulatory or industry cybersecurity practices Experience with audit management and tracking of remediation items and/or findings to completion Demonstrated capability to collaborate with business partners to manage cybersecurity needs Experience with development of security requirements to protect the company from external and internal threats Experience with documentation and reporting of policy or procedure discrepancies and/or change requests Ability to initiate, facilitate and promote cybersecurity within the organization and monitor adherence to cybersecurity policies, standards and controls REPORTING RELATIONSHIP Reports to: AVP Cybersecurity Direct Reports: None Knowledge Must have a high level understanding of the financial services industry, security, risk and privacy Must have current knowledge and stay up-to-date on the latest Cybersecurity legislation, regulations, advisories, alerts and vulnerabilities Must have knowledge of Information Security and Cybersecurity frameworks Ability to clearly explain and articulate technical concepts using non-technical language Proficiency with MS-Office applications including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio and Project Knowledge of security methodologies, policies, standards and industry practices Knowledge of information technology systems, infrastructure and operations Strong analytical skills Excellent verbal communication skills Strong interpersonal skills Ability to meet time sensitive deadlines required Ability to work collaboratively and build consensus is essential Ability to make sound decisions and exercise good judgment Ability to manage business and technical relationships with internal and external clients Ability to work and achieve goals without constant supervision Required Skills Ability to initiate, facilitate and promote cybersecurity within the organization and monitor adherence to cybersecurity policies, standards and controls Advocate for cybersecurity as an essential business requirement and advocate the business need as the foundation for cybersecurity program design Ensure effective communication and partnership with all departments at GMF and serve as a liaison of Cybersecurity and first point of contact for cybersecurity concerns Represent the Global Cybersecurity organization on projects as needed Engage with business partners to translate high-level business requirements into enterprise security initiatives and programs to achieve the GMF's mission, goals and objectives Work closely with business stakeholders and project teams to plan, design and check appropriate levels of security governance, resource management and asset management Assist management with special projects as requested Experience A minimum of 3-8 years of experience in large and complex business environments with a successful track record working directly with senior level management with at least 1 year of experience in one or more of the following domains: Access Control, Telecom and Network Security, Cybersecurity Governance and Risk Management, Software Development Security, Cryptography, Security Architecture and Design, Operational Security, Business Continuity & Disaster Recovery, Legal Regulations, Investigations and Compliance, Physical (Environmental) Security, IT or Security Audit, IT or Security Compliance. Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Financial Analyst  Long-term Consulting Engagement (1+ Year)  Location: Addison, Texas  We have an IMMEDIATE job opening for a Financial Analyst for a long-term consulting role at our client's global HQ's in Addison, TX. This individual will have various assignments including financial management, capacity forecasting, tool configuration/administration (Jira, Quality Center and QuickBase), and adhoc reports. The role will also be responsible for processing invoices, forecasting expenses, and supporting the leadership team. The role will support teams in Dallas and other locations nationally as well as some international support. You will also assist with invoice management, resource/cost forecasting, capacity models, etc. Strong excel skills required. Good grasp of basic accounting principles required. There will be national travel quarterly and international travel once/year.  Required Skills:  o 1-3 years of Financial Analyst experience  o Strong Office skills, especially Excel and PowerPoint  o Senior level Excel skills - worksheet design, pivot tables  o Experience with invoice management, resource/cost forecasting, and capacity models  o Basic Accounting principle knowledge required  o Flexible, proactive and self-managing  o Understanding and experience with project financial management and general budgeting  o Ability to do database design, query creation and/or scripting (inside tools or Excel)  o Bachelor's degree  o Detail-oriented is a requirement  o Journal Entry Experience would be a plus  o Financials (expenditures/resource) Forecast experience required  **To view all of our job openings, please visit: http://www.alleareconsulting.com/job-openings

Name: Sr. Strategic Planning Analyst
Description: SUMMARY: The Sr. Strategic Planning Analyst is a key contributor on a focused, highly visible team that develops and executes robust analytics that inform strategies to meet strategic objectives. RESPONSIBILITIES: Analyze strategic and operational opportunities within and across the company. This will require the use of: hypothesis-based problem solving, fact-based analysis, financial modeling, decision modeling, scenario planning, statistical analysis, and other methods of quantitative analysis as needed to suit the specific problem at hand.  Use Excel, Tableau, and Alteryx to perform analysis on large disparate data sets to support strategic.  Help to identify key strategic issues, create a framework for analysis, and develop insights that provide a data-based analytical set of strategic choices.  Gather key inputs for the Strategic Plans for the system and its entities (including service-line specific plans). Provide additional context and analysis that informs the team about forward growth rates by service line and/or geography.  Perform periodic analysis on market and competitive trends in a crisp, concise and timely manner.  Work with strategy team members to design periodic market and competitive reports which track key trends, monitor and evaluate competitors, highlight innovation opportunities and inform decision-making.  Support business development efforts by performing M&A due diligence, valuation and business integration planning for potential acquisitions (as needed). QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's Degree in Business or in a quantitative/technical discipline  3 years of Strategic Analysis; performing a variety of quantitative analyses (e.g., DCF valuation, ABC analysis, regression analysis, etc.) is required.  Strong critical reasoning and qualitative analysis skills  Demonstrated track record performing a variety of quantitative analyses  Demonstrated skills in strategic analysis, market research, financial modeling, and competitive analysis  Demonstrated Microsoft Excel skills (e.g., pivot tables, vlookup, sensitivity analysis, etc.)  Preferred experience with SQL, Tableau, Alteryx, R and similar programs  Good communication and presentation skills **ADDITIONAL DETAILS***: Position will be Permanent/Direct Hire; Immediate Need  Competitive compensation; hourly rate will be dependent on overall experience & skills  Excellent working environment; continued growth & advancement opportunities  ALL candidates MUST be able to pass a background check AND drug screen **ALL candidates must be eligible to work in the US for any employer; sponsorship and/or transfer of sponsorship not available; No third parties please***

Name: Instructional Designer (IT Business Sr. Analyst)
Description: Instructional Designer (IT Business Sr. Analyst)The instructional designer role will contribute to the effectiveness of a global information technology organization (5,000 employees) through the design and development of engaging training programs. The instructional designer will be responsible for managing programs across all phases of the ADDIE lifecycle. Responsibilities:Determine blended learning strategies best aligned to meet learner and client needs through application of performance assessment, job task analysis, interviews, surveys, and observation as appropriate. Collaborate frequently and timely with multiple stakeholders, subject matter experts, learning advisors, and project teams to create effective learning solutions, assessments, and other learning contentCreate, deploy, and maintain instructor-led and web based training content including text, images, audio, and video editing.Build and publish content for websites, print, and the learning management system.Apply project management practices to independently and proactively ensure all stakeholders have visibility into project status. Address challenges and, when appropriate, escalate issues to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery of assigned work.Conduct reviews and testing of internally developed and supplier provided training materials.Remain current on industry best practices in instructional design and performance technology. QualificationsThis position requires a bachelor’s degree in Instructional Design, Training and Development, or a related field. A master’s degree in one of these fields is preferred and can replace minimum years of experience listed below. Other qualifications include:4 years of instructional design and development experience2 years of training project management experienceAdvanced knowledge of instructional design and human performance technology methodologiesExpertise with content authoring tools used for development of web based training. Articulate Storyline 3 experience preferred.Experience working in the information technology (IT) field is not required, however must be comfortable discussing and researching technical topics including programming, digital/mobile/web, data and analytics, and artificial intelligence. Experience with web development or programming languages preferred.Leadership Skills:Demonstrate adaptability and work well in ambiguous situationsPossess a continuous learning mindset; emphasis on continuous improvementAbility to establish and/or build trust with teams, colleagues, and leadersStrong written and oral communication skills, analytical skills, and ability to map and redesign processesAbility and desire to work in a highly collaborative and transparent role with many stakeholders and clients

Name: Model/Analysis/Validation Senior Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingEducation: Master's DegreeJob Function: Risk ManagementSchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: Yes, 10 % of the TimeJob ID: 18055838 Description  About Citi  Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.  Citi's Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients' and the public's trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.  Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all. Position Objective: The position is a role which encompasses the best of both the worlds; data management /analysis and modeling and forecasting.  The candidate must be a hands on person with a strong back ground in programming, data analysis, data management, manipulate, extract and prepare for model development. The preferred programming tools are SAS, R, Python or MATLAB. Candidate will be responsible foe ensuring all recurring economic and financial data are timely updated revised from vendor sources via API or ODBC connections and that they pass certain consistency and accuracy parameters.  The candidate will also be responsible for building statistical, time series and or macro econometric models that are used for firm wide projections based on internal risk scenarios and regulatory or US Bank Supervisors provided projections.  The opportunity will allow the candidate to work in one of the largest Global financial institution with foot pants across 40+ countries, work in a collegiate environment that promotes innovation, meritocracy, insightful learning and career growth. Qualifications1 - 2 years in related work experience in the areas of database management and analysis in an analytical capacity preferred.Good Understanding of SAS/SQL/C/Java, MATLAB, or background of other relevant tools such as R and Python a plus; proficient in MS Office.Fulfill requests in support of data collection/cleaning/data presentations/ or analyses.Good written and verbal communication skills; ability to translate business needs into system/process designs; comfortable presenting to peers and managementExcellent quantitative and analytical skills, extremely detail-oriented and possessing intellectual curiosityAbility to multi-task and work against tight regulatory and global Citigroup deadlinesAbility to work independently with only baseline instructions/guidelines from management.Experience with econometric forecasting & modeling, machine learning and statistical modeling.Minimum a Masters degree required in statistics, economics, financial mathematics or financial engineering/economics, mathematics, or a related field and a minimum of 2 years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Name: FP&A Analyst
Description: Are You Uncommon?  We're on the hunt for an experienced FP&A Analyst who ranks in the top quartile among their peers. Someone who has a highly competitive and entrepreneurial mindset that is wired with a team-first attitude, has no problem rolling up their sleeves to execute their missions, and can modulate between leading and following as needed.  What You'll Be Doing  At Solera, we believe in providing clarity and focus to what are volunteers are responsible for their mission. The 80's, as we call them at Solera, are the employee's priorities associated with their role or mission. The mission 80's for this role, are:  Consolidate P&L forecasts and results for multiple businesses across the United States Provide information to management by assembling and summarizing data, preparing reports, building presentations of findings and analysis, and communicating recommendations. Build analytical models that utilize both financial and non-financial data to forecast operating results. Additional responsibilities of the role include:Coordinate consolidating and loading budgets and forecasts for multiple businesses into AXPrepare and review financial variances between Actual/Budget/Forecast financial and operational resultsConduct comparable analysis as necessary in support of key business metrics and objectivesPrepare commission files and submit for payrollMaintain financial models and reports relating to sales productivity, revenue, and operational activities Are You Qualified? Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance requiredMinimum two years of financial analysis experience requiredFP&A, modeling, businesses analysis, forecasting, and budgeting experience requiredStrong MS Excel skills (Pivot Tables, Data Analysis, What-If Analysis, PowerQuery, PowerPivot)Strong MS PowerPoint skills (Data links, corporate templates, images, business writing)Understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting PrinciplesUnderstanding of data analysis and BI reportingOrganization and prioritization skills and attention to detailsAbility to work in a challenging, fast-paced environment, often on multiple projects with limited timelinesExcellent written and verbal communication skillsIndependent worker, analytical thinker, ability to conduct research and analysis and solve complex problemsQuick learner, particularly in ability to learn new software programsAbility to practice discretion while working on highly confidential projectsExperience using ERP, Salesforce, and financial performance management systems preferred. The Solera Way  Solera's uncommon culture is based on three simple principles: Think 80/20 (Focus), Act 30/30 (Efficiency), and Live 90/10 (Accountability). We define our mindset using Our 3H's: Humility, a Hunger to succeed, and a desire to Hunt for opportunities to win. We train our volunteers to engage with each other modulating between their intellect (IQ) and emotional intelligence (EQ) using our 3Fs: Facts, Finesse, and Force. Solera has become a global technology leader that is constantly growing in the double digits. The principles, drills, and values associated with the Solera Way have been fundamental to Solera's success and our ability to grow, continuously change, and innovate.  Our Space  We believe that offices should be destinations where people want to be places where people want to work, play and, collaborate. That is why we spend a lot of time on enhancing our workspaces. Solera's work environments are intersections of the old and the new of the past, present, and future. They are spaces designed to stimulate creative thinking, innovation, and cross-functional collaboration.  TexasSDL2017

Name: CIO - Analyst - Business/Systems 6-10+ yr
Description: We are looking for a Senior full stack developer to join the Digital IT Team.  The work you'll be doing will support Verizon's digital and agent-assisted channels that allow our customers to manage their accounts through self-service, shop for new services and monitor their usage. When these applications are working well, they are an important part of the overall customer experience. You'll lead projects, code, and develop the APIs to integrate all that we do with our internal and external systems. You will collaborate with various internal teams on new technologies to make it easy for our customers to do business with us.  Work on multiple projects using on-site and off-shore resources to maintain and develop applications.  Identify and align project requirements and conduct impact analyses.  Work closely with the business team, and other internal IT teams to deliver projects on time.  Perform hands-on coding work on projects to introduce new modular, reusable Service/API or enhance the existing ones. We are looking for : Bachelor's degree or six or more years of work experience.  Four or more years of relevant work experience.  Expert in integrating different output formats like PMML, POJO/MOJO quickly into a distributed Java environment.  Experience in developing micro-services, REST APIs  Experience with Docker containers / kubernetes  Experience with Spring Boot.  Experience in streaming technologies like Kafka/Flink/ Storm etc.  Experience with NOSQL databases like Cassandra, Mongo DB.  Experience in Oracle database. Experience in writing SQL Queries, Stored Procedures, Triggers, Cursors, and Functions.  Experience in design and development of multi-tiered applications using J2EE technologies like JSP, Servlets, JDBC, JNDI, JMS, IBM MQSeries and RMI.  Experience with JQuery, XQuery.  Experience in deploying and troubleshooting the application servers like IBM WebSphere, BEA WebLogic Even better if you have: Ability to analyze and make design and architecture choices with respect to performance and optimization.  Experience in IT systems development with a focus on digital platforms.  Experience with project management tools like JIRA, Confluence. Name: Sales Analyst
Description: Job Summary Provide account and product onboarding, training, and support to clients in conjunction with Account Executives to ensure initial and continuous client usage. Job DutiesManage the account set up process and ensure timely and successful launches by working closely with Account Executives and Agents to gather and review product agreements, overfund agreements, verify rate structure, and profit participation for new account set-ups and account modifications. Enter data for all new accounts and modifications into the EFG core systems via AMS, perform rate and form validation, and complete enrollment of new accounts into the e-rating platform.Facilitate user onboarding and user adoption by working with Account Executives to collect user information, assign appropriate user permissions, and conduct individualized user training around platform capabilities and business processes. Ensure successful account onboarding through rate, form, and data validation prior to and after launch.Maintain all learning and training tools for client facing platforms including Ristken (SPAN, ProfitPro, MenuPro), Client Portal, Cancel Quote, Online Billing, WALKAWAY portal, and the MVP portal. Create and lead web-based training sessions for new users, as well as refreshing the knowledge base of established users. Consistently work toward the goal of increasing client satisfaction and adoption by improving platform and product knowledge.Provide ongoing status reporting around new account launches, product implementations, product conversions, and account modifications.Support new product launches and product enhancements through forms user acceptance testing and configuration, QA of contracts and collateral, managing sales support documents on Salesforce, exhibiting detailed product knowledge and providing support to the field when needed.Perform various support functions including, but not limited to, assisting with new proposals and existing accounts, presentations, and training materials. Providing daily updates to multiple parties regarding ongoing projects is paramount.Job QualificationsBachelor’s degree preferred, with a minimum of five to seven years of professional experience in a corporate or dealership settingAutomotive industry experience, an understanding of dealership culture, and a professional demeanor are vitalIn-depth knowledge of EFG products and services, a plusAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, AS400, Cubes, Salesforce, and Adobe Acrobat are preferred, as well as experience with the delivery of technical software training and customer-facing onboarding/training such as Adobe Captivate or similar toolsMust have excellent interpersonal, communication, presentation and facilitation skills, possess a high attention to detail, and adherence to established processes.Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, respond to shifting priorities, and thrive in a fast-paced, self-directed work environment

Name: Supply Chain Analyst
Description: Buchanan Technologies is currently seeking a Supply Chain Analyst for a long-term (1+ year) Contract opportunity in Hurst, TX! *All interested candidates must pass a pre-employment background check and drug test and must have at a minimum a 4-year degree (i.e. BA/BS). Overview The Supply Chain Contractor provides the skills required to support decision-making within a defined commodity. This includes identifying strategic procurement opportunities, maintaining a comprehensive and current commodity fact base, performing qualitative and quantitative analysis to guide decision-making, and supervision efficient strategy implementation. Critical analytical activities include market supply and demand analysis, evaluation of supplier capacity, raw material and process competencies, and assessment of vendor economics. In addition, the Supply Chain Analyst identifies specific strategic purchasing opportunities including, but not limited to NHA, make-to-buy, long-term contract, and supplier consolidation initiatives.  The Contractor is responsible for managing both the existing and potential supply base strategy for the designated commodity. Included in this responsibility is the evaluation of existing supplier delivery, cost, and quality performance and supplier scorecard performance, working with Supply Chain Operations Support Specialists to implement vendor improvement initiatives, and developing relationships with new suppliers to establish effective partnerships. Qualifications4-year degree (BS/BA); Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Industrial Technology/Management, Engineering, Finance, or Accounting degree preferred.Candidate will be required to have strong computer and analytical skills.Demonstrated experience in using database programs and Excel.Strong ability to apply analytical skills to data and interpret and present findings.Excellent writing, presentation and communication skills.Strong business acumen.Experience working on cross functional production teams; strong project management skills preferred.‘36/44’ work weeks (36 hours one week, 44 hours the next; repeat)US Citizen Buchanan Technologies provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Buchanan Technologies complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Name: Jr. Financial Analyst
Description: Join a multi-faceted / mixed matrix finance team w/ high visibility and a fast pace. We are a data-driven marketing company that thrives on curious performers that enjoy deadlines and fun. We are located on the Coppell/Irving border and you can bring your dog to work and lots of other great perks! JOB SCOPE & PURPOSE The Jr. Financial Analyst is responsible for working with the CFO and Sr. Financial Analyst in running business operations of the agencies. Functions include financial forecasting, planning, reporting, analysis, P&L closure, audit support, corporate reporting and analysis, purchasing and invoice approvals, among other tasks. The role will work across all departments to provide a range of support to internal customers, including management and senior business leaders to effectively operate the business, evaluate new initiatives, set/adjust policies and procedures, and other ad hoc projects. The Jr. Financial Analyst will have exposure to senior management and must become a trusted partner across the organization. MAIN RESPONSIBILITIESAssist in the preparation of budgets and forecasts, corporate financial reporting and analysis, internal operational & management reportingUnderstand the business economics and KPI’s that drive success for the agenciesLearn, assist in development and maintain Excel models that help drive business insight, improve efficiency and elevate service to our internal customersAssist in agency and departmental variance analysis to support and drive management decision-makingIdentify trends and opportunities in agency financials, investigate, understand the drivers and provide recommendations for decision-makingAssist in the creation of management and corporate reporting and presentation packagesAssist in the monthly P&L close process, partnering with the CFO, Sr. Financial Analyst and Accounting to properly prepare the P&L, investigate variances, correct errors, assemble accruals, etcReview and approve company-related expenditure purchase order requests, and review, approve and direct the accounting/payment of company-related vendor invoicesAssist in the periodic audit processPartner, assist and/or take ownership of any internal initiatives that have a financial impactPotential to assist in contract and pricing reviewOther ad hoc projects, as neededPERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS & REQUIRED SKILLSHighly analytical with superb attention to detail and accuracySelf-starter able to expand on up-front direction and runProficient with Microsoft Office suite. Must have strong Excel skills (Pivots, nested formulas, filters, etc). VBA a plusTeam-oriented with strong communication skills and ability to foster relationships with various levels and types of personnelInquisitive and curious, always looking to find new insightsHighly organized and able to meet multiple and competing deadlinesCognos, MS Dynamics AX, HFM, ServiceNow experience a plusService industry or marketing experience a plusEXPERIENCE & EDUCATION1-3 years of prior FP&A, Finance or Accounting work experience with a proven track record of success4-year college Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or FinancePOSITION REQUIREMENTSOvertime as necessary

Name: Data Analyst Pool - Title I 2018
Description: Data Analyst Pool - Title I  2018-2019 School Year  Pay Grade: 603  Salary Range: $48,964 - $61,205  Duty Days: 187  This is a grant funded position  Position Purpose  Helps teachers examine data, understand student strengths and weaknesses, and identify instructional strategies, structures, or programs to address the identified needs. Facilitates data meetings; works with campus administration to keep them informed of on-going and acute needs of teachers and students; builds staff capacity to perform their own data analyses, and determines data trends to meet the needs of students.  Essential Functions Maintains a commitment to the district motto, mission, vision, and values; models district expectations through personal leadership and example; and actively supports the efforts of others to achieve district goals.Promotes an environment of cultural competency and responsiveness for students, parents, staff and stakeholders. Data Analysis and Reporting Prepares student achievement data analysis and reports for the campus principal and faculty.Ensures that data collected, organized, and verified in an appropriate format and accompanied by an effective analysis for data used in instructional planning efforts and accountability.Facilitates data-driven dialogue and guides teams through collaborative inquiry.Supports and trains the cam faculty and other appropriate staff in analyzing common assessments and other relevant district/student achievement data using appropriate technology tools.Designs, develops and delivers reports and presentations on key achievement findings.Contributes to the development, implementation, and follow through on the campus Continuous Improvement Plan.Facilitates staff development workshops on data analysis in conjunction with the campus principal and learning network.Provides input to teacher leaders with regard to making instructional decisions based on student data.Develops resources for the administrative team and teachers as needed to guide data dialogue.Ensures test security, optimal testing environments, and test facilitation for state, local, and norm referenced tests and assessments as needed.Maintains an atmosphere of personal growth including staying abreast of current research-based instructional models that create student achievement.Uses current staff data needs as a guide to develop professional development opportunities to increase teacher effectiveness.Coordinates with campus principals in the implementation of their campus goals and initiatives. Additional Duties Performs all job related duties as assigned and in accordance to the Board rules, policies and regulations.Exhibits high professionalism, standards of conduct and work ethic.Demonstrates high quality customer service; builds rapport/relationship with the consumer.Demonstrates cultural competence in interactions with others; is respectful of co-workers; communicates and acts as a team player; promotes teamwork. Responds and acts appropriately in confrontational situations. Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Knowledge of current teaching methods and education pedagogy, as well as differentiation of instruction based upon student learning styles.Knowledge of school curriculum and concepts.Knowledge of data information systems, data analysis and the formulation of action plans.Knowledge of applicable federal and state laws regarding education, as well as district policies and procedures.Ability to use computer network system and software applications as needed.Ability to develop and implement projects.Ability to communicate effectively with students, parents, staff, community, and stakeholders.Ability to organize multiple tasks and conflicting time constraints.Ability to engage in self-evaluation with regard to leadership, performance and professional growth.Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with others contacted in the course of work.Ability to qualitative and quantitative data to make decisions about teaching and learning including student and teacher assessment. Travel Requirements Travels to school district buildings and professional meetings as required. Required Qualifications Education: Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or universityCertificate/License: Valid Texas teaching certificateExperience: 3-years classroom teaching experience. Physical Job Requirements PHYSICAL DEMANDS REFERENCE Occasionally (0-33% of day, 0-32 repetitions)  Frequently (34-66% of day, 33-200 repetitions)  Constantly (67-100% of day, >200+ repetitions)  Physical and Mental Demands, Work Hazards Tools/Equipment Used: Standard office and classroom equipment including Promethean Board, personal computer and peripheralsPosture: Prolonged sitting and standing; occasional kneeling, squatting, bending, stoopingMotion: Frequent walking; repetitive hand motions; frequent keyboarding and use of mouse; frequent drivingLifting: Frequently light lifting (less than15 pounds); occasional moderate lifting and carrying (15-44 pounds)Environment: Work outside (exposure to sun, heat, cold, and inclement weather) and inside; frequent exposure to noise; frequent districtwide and statewide travelMental Demands: Maintain emotional control under stress; frequent prolonged and irregular hours While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to walk; sit; use hands for fine manipulation, handle or feel and reach with hands and arms using a keyboard and video display terminal. The employee is occasionally required to stand and stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl and climb stairs. The employee must maintain emotional control under stress, and occasionally work prolonged and/or irregular hours. The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally up to 35 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision. The work environment is a standard office setting including standard office equipment (fax, copier, phone, computer, 10-key, etc.). The noise level in the work environment is usually low to moderate.  These statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job responsibilities.SDL2017

Name: Security Operations Center (SOC) Cyber Fraud Analyst
Description: The Security Operations Center Cyber Fraud Analyst will be part of the SOC Team. The team monitors, analyzes and responds to cyber fraud threats on a 24x7 basis.Principle Responsibilities:The analyst performs monitoring, research, assessment and analysis of Digital Fraud Attacks leveraging various Security Event Monitoring platforms including Web Threat Detection, Real Time Fraud Risk Assessment, Big Data and Digital Application Monitoring tools (ArcSight, Splunk, SAS, Teradata, and enterprise real time fraud detection tools.). Previous experience in cyber security operations or incident response is required.Follow pre-defined actions to handle BAU and High severity issues including escalating to other support groups.Execute daily ad hoc tasks or lead small projects as needed.Create and maintain operational reports for Key Performance Indicators and weekly and monthly metrics.Perform assessment as well as troubleshooting to help isolate technical issues with the integration of fraud monitoring technologiesParticipate in daily and ad hoc conference calls to manage quality assurance and documentation related tasks.Identify areas for tuning use cases to enhance monitoring value.Engage with Fraud Policy, Operations, Strategy and other teams for early detection, prevention and mitigation of detected fraudulent activities.About Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.  Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.  Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.Job Skills/Qualifications:4 years working in the security & operations fields.Bachelor's Degree or higher preferred.Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.Strong knowledge of current Cyber Fraud trends including common Account Takeover techniques and banking malware.Deep understanding of Intrusion Detection analysis (TCP/IP, packet level analysis) as well as Application Layer Protocols (HTTP). Advanced understanding of various operating systems (Windows/UNIX), and web technologies (focusing on Internet security).Knowledge of cutting-edge threats and technologies affecting Web Applications.Experience with Big Data Technologies, ETL Tools, Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence technologies is preferred.Experience with any scripting language (Python, Perl, VBScript) is a plus.Experience with vulnerability assessment as well as penetration testing or forensic analysis fields is a plusCertifications from EC-Council, GIAC, (ISC)² are preferred [CISSP, C|EH, GCIA, CCNA].

Name: Financial Analyst Staff
Description: Description:Tactical Missiles Finance Team is looking for a leader that is a self-motivated person with a strong education in business, finance or accounting, who is interested in learning and applying all aspects of defense contract budgeting, earned value measurement, forecasting, analysis and reporting  skills in a fast-paced environment. This position will support a myriad of program finance functions and will include the following responsibilities:  Leads Long-Range Planning (LRP) for business area.  Leads and manages financial metrics for business area.  Effectively communicates the financial performance to senior management.  Provide support to the Contract Status Reviews (CSRs) process to include presentation of financial  data to Sr. Management.  Provides financial leadership and business acumen in working with program personnel across Engineering, Manufacturing, Quality, and Program Office functions to position MFC in the affordability area to win future missile programs.  Leads preparation of budgets and schedules for contract work and performs and/or assists in financial  analyses such as funding profiles, sales outlook, and variance analysis.  Performs and manages employees' analyses and prepares reports to ensure that contracts are within negotiated and agreed-upon parameters and government cost control guidelines.  Assists in the performance of schedule risk assessments to identify and mitigate program cost  and scheduling risks.  Ensures adequate funding availability by maintaining accurate records of expenditures, directing  preparation of expenditure projections, and submitting timely requests for additional funding to  the government.  Incorporates contractual changes into control systems.  Maintains awareness of outstanding work against each contract to maintain realistic contract cost and  schedule baselines.  Performs other related duties and assignments as required. Name: Command Center Distributed Level 1 Analyst
Description: Distributed Level 1 AnalystWho are we?Citi Technology Infrastructure (CTI) provides the products and services that enable Citi's workforce, along with the majority of the financial solutions that Citi's customers rely on. We provide the critical technical foundation for Citi's operations through the infrastructure that runs business and general user computing services. We do this by working as one-team to deliver high quality, reliable and modern infrastructure technologies at the right cost. We drive to optimize the functionality and capability of the infrastructure technologies.This position is an integral part of Production Operations. Production Operations provides the single point from which Citi continually monitors infrastructure and application services, leads major incident response and executes routine, operational tasks. This function drives the execution of service standard procedures, identifying opportunities for improved stakeholder experience while maintaining the daily operations of the business.In CTI we are focused on delivering the best for our clients, and we know that to do this we need a talented team with diverse experiences, backgrounds and skills.Role DescriptionAs an Analyst in CTI, you will gain hands on experience, technical training, on-the-job training, and experience in a dynamic working environment. You will work within one or more CTI functions performing support of technology infrastructure products and services; and/or analysis services on a broad range of assignments. You will have the opportunity to work with professionals across a variety of technology disciplines, gaining exposure to a wide range of teams and cultures. This role has a solid focus on experience, exposure, apprenticeship, and education to make a positive impact in CTI.Key Responsibilities and PerformanceWork with assigned technical area to support high level, quality results according to standards within CTIDemonstrate an appreciation of a diverse workforce using differences to add new value to drive organizational successUnderstand assigned role and demonstrate motivation for a career path within the functionWork within team environments and as an individual contributor, while efficiently planning, prioritizing, and organizing own workload to meet deadlinesUtilize problem solving skills, with a dedication to excellence and ability to propose suitable solutions to a variety of common technology problemsAbility to learn applicable tools for supported technology and related operational processes and procedures rapidlyExhibit sound understanding of concepts and principles in own area and a basic knowledge of concepts and principles in other technology areasWork toward understanding how multiple areas collectively integrate to contribute towards achieving business objectivesStakeholder Management and People ResponsibilitiesDirectly impact the business by ensuring the quality of work provided by self and others; impacts own team and closely related work teams by pursuing mentoring and trainingActively strive towards self-development by creating and following development plans based on discussions with managementDemonstrate desire to build a culture of partnership and collaboration through measurable and impactful resultsDemonstrate personal integrity, strong ethics, an understanding of decision impact, and client confidentialityCore Role CompetenciesTechnical Knowledge: Uses general knowledge of technology and standard principles within specialty area(s) to work on a number of UNIX, WINTEL, LINUX platforms or systems. Competent with standard tools. Supports and operates at a basic level.Personal Agility / Continuous Improvement: Aware of self and impact on others. Responsive to constructive feedback. Picks up on situational cues and adjusts appropriately.Execution Excellence: Has a can-do attitude, has understanding / knowledge on need for adequate analysis and planning, ahead of taking action on opportunity or problem.Effective Communication: Is able to effectively communicate in a number of communication settings (one on ones, small groups most commonly), understands the need to adjust to partners, and provides timely and useful information to others across the organization, encouraging open expression of ideas and opinions.Problem Solving and Decision Making: Makes sound decisions. Considers relevant factors and uses appropriate decision-making criteria and principles. When making decisions, uses a mix of analysis, wisdom, experience and discernment. Assesses business needs, anticipates problems. Works independently and is self-directed.About Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.  Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.  Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.Skills / Experience LevelsWorking knowledge of at least one of the platforms (UNIX, WINTEL, LINUX) will help you in being successful.You have good communication, presentation, and analytical skills with the ability to articulate to stakeholdersYou are hardworking, willing to learn and contribute to the team.You are disciplined and work independently.You are a detail oriented with strong organizational, presentation, negotiation and customer service skillsYou enjoy collaborating and working as part of a cross discipline team.You’re a self-starter with good problem solving skills, and you continuously look for ways to improve things.You understand the importance of prioritization of your work.Providing a great experience to end users is important to you.You have proficiency with MS PowerPoint, Excel, Access or other analytical toolsYou have basic skill and proficiency with applicable technology domain/tools to perform assigned function.High school diploma required.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Self Service Support Analyst IV
Description: If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra Energy family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online. Job Description The CX Technology Support Analyst IV Call Center in the Customer Operations CX Technology Support group uses knowledge of Call Center information systems and sources to provide insightful, actionable knowledge of customer characteristics and behavior related to Call Center Operations including call patterns, call routing, call recording systems, voice and data network and voice switch technology.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include but are not limited to: Integrate and manage call data from various systems including Genesys, Virtual Hold, Verint, IVR, Salesforce Chat, SAP, and external sources.Effectively analyze call routing strategies for customer center. Utilize strong technology management and computer literacy skills to develop business requirements.Apply a wide variety of high-level statistical and mathematical techniques to complicated processes for reporting, forecasting, profiling, and other complex analytical problems.Employ technical knowledge to develop relevant technology solutions for call center operations, contact trends, call segmentation and other characteristics used to segment customers.Actively work with Operations, Consumer, and Business Marketing groups by providing technical expertise, offering original perspectives, and challenging conventional views to better align decision making/perceptions with changing business needs.Work closely with Call Center Operations and both Business and Consumer market key personnel to define reporting needs and follow through with strategic partner to develop these toolsRespond to questions from business clients regarding any aspect of call center technology. Conduct research and analysis to gain a detailed insight and is dedicated to providing clear and credible responses and meeting the expectations and requirements of the business clients.Take initiative to help design, implement, and support call center solutions and reports to determine outcomes and impacts of decisions.Develop and present regular and timely reports regarding project status.Ensure current and accurate process and methodology documentation.Provide direction and guidance to Call Center Analysts.EDUCATION/EXPERIENCEThe minimum education requirements are:High School diploma/GED equivalentBachelor's degree in business or related field strongly preferred; MBA or other related advanced degree beneficialThe minimum experience requirements are:4-6+ years related work experience2-3 years experience with customer facing and project coordination/management methods required3-5+ years developing and analyzing large-scale customer information systems or processesAdvanced knowledge of PC and CX technologies such as Genesys, SQL Server, Virtual Hold, IVR and Verint.Advanced skill in identifying and documenting business requirements.General knowledge of project management principals and execution.3-5 years experience in call center operations and call center technologies or related technologies.General knowledge of Call Center Operations systems, policies, and procedures a plus PHYSICAL/MENTAL DEMANDS AND WORKING CONDITIONS Requires the ability to perform the essential duties and responsibilities in the following environment: Occasional long, irregular hoursUse of a PC, computer terminal and/or telephone over 4 hours a dayOccasional bending, twisting, crouching, pulling, pushing, and/or reaching to access job-related materialsOpen workspace office environmentOperating in a fast-paced professional office environmentSome travel to vendor and supplier locations; occasional overnight travel may be required.Occasionally lifts/moves up to 40 lbs.SCOPE LEVELResponsibility level:Responsible for leading cross-functional work teams within TXU Energy, External Business Partners and Regulatory workgroups with the goal to greatly improve work processes related to TXU retail customer retention and growth. Seeks minimal guidance/works under minimal supervision from Team Leads, Management, SME's, etc. SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES The following knowledge, skills and capabilities must be demonstrated at a proficient level: Excellent negotiating, consensus building and conflict resolution skillsExtensive communication and teamwork skills with both internal and external customersAbility to work effectively in a rapidly changing environmentAble to effectively contribute to and lead small work groups, process team and focus groupsAdvanced Skill in using computer software applications such as MS Office productsAble to solve problems guided only by general organization objectives, policies, and goalsStrong analytical skills, including root cause analysisWorking knowledge of Internet and related emerging technologies used to effectively aggregate/analyze critical business dataExcellent Project Management skillsSkill in developing process flows Job Family  Marketing  Company  TXU Retail Services Company  Locations  Irving, Texas  TexasWe are a company of people committed to: Exceeding Customer Expectations, Great People, Teamwork, Competitive Spirit and Effective Communication. If this describes you, then you will have a good career here!  If you currently work for Vistra Energy, TXU or Luminant please apply via the internal career site.SDL2017

Name: Consolidation Program Analyst
Description: Consolidation Program AnalystCaseStack, a leader in logistics outsourcing and consolidation, has been recognized as one of America’s fastest growing companies by Inc. Magazine and Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50, and Global Logistics & Supply Chain Strategies named the company one of the "100 Great Supply Chain Partners". As an employer, CaseStack was honored as one of the Best Places to Work in Los Angeles in 2011 and 2012, was named a finalist for the 2012 Arkansas Governor’s Work-Life Balance Award, and was recently named one of the Best Places to Work in Arkansas in 2013.  CaseStack provides technology-enabled logistics services including warehousing, transportation and related services to consumer packaged goods (CPG) companies. We are an ambitious organization with a passion for customer service and a proven track record in providing superior logistics solutions. We seek aggressive, self-motivated leaders with the confidence and desire to be part of a high-performance team.As a Consolidation Program Analyst you will manage the daily execution of freight consolidation with CaseStack clients. You will administer multiple clients’ distribution needs through load building which requires extensive interfacing within the operations department as well as carrier and warehouse network. You will track, analyze, and develop variables that lead to consolidation program improvements. This is a deadline-driven, analytics-heavy position. As Consolidation Program Analyst, you’ll be part of the backbone of the daily operation at CaseStack. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONSPrepare accurate and timely vendor pool upload spreadsheets.Accurately build consolidation load spreadsheets within program parameters while maximizing load utilization.Recommend program improvements based on quantitative evidence.Determine viability of best practices of cross docking while factoring in consolidation program constraints.Manage sailing schedules for consolidation programs to achieve maximum potential delivery performance under program parameters, including updates for new programs as well as holiday schedule changes for existing programs.Publish reports on weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis regarding volume and on-time percentage scores.Support implementation team during the launch of new accounts and programs.Receive, analyze, and respond to a high volume of communication each day.Understand the order process flow to contract specifications.Understand system specifications for order releases and tracking.Successfully manage carrier and warehouse partner relationships.Develop optimization strategies on consolidation and create business cases to leverage IT support to execute the strategies.Understand how to deal with client shipment policies, carrier/consignee concerns, special handling instructions, etc.Understand operational challenges with current consolidation programs. Implement improvement initiatives with partner warehouses, internal departments, and retailers to cut lead-time, costs, and complexity.Perform additional duties assigned by company.REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONSBachelors Degree or equivalent work experience required.3+ years of experience within transportation and logistics industry.Experience working with Wal-Mart distribution preferred.Able to identify patterns and craft compelling solutions for profit maximization.Expertise in Microsoft Excel.Sufficient familiarity with web based tools.Strong understanding of product distribution is desired, especially within CPG.Strong talent for multi-tasking and managing competing priorities effectively.Proven track record for implementing innovative solutions to complex problems.Highly organized; attentive to details.Self-directed, yet strong team player.Travel may be required. We offer a comprehensive benefits program (Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Life, 401(k)), and are looking for individuals that have the motivation and desire to grow within this fast-paced environment.  CaseStack, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer supporting a drug-free working environment. We conduct pre-employment drug testing and background screening.  IND 123

CTG's greatest asset is its people, and as such, we are committed to providing employees programs and processes to support their performance, hone their skills, and advance in their careers.
