Name: Lead Financial Analyst, Sec Reporting
Description: Preparing various sections of the quarterly filings with the SEC, as assigned  Leading the process to consolidate and prepare quarterly and annual divisional disclosure packages for review and engage globally with employees to ensure accurate and timely schedule completion.  Assisting in ensuring Company compliance with Xtensible Business Reporting Language (XBRL) data tagging requirements for external reporting.  Proactively supporting the informational requirements of the external financial auditors as it relates to the quarterly reviews and annual audit.  Participating in the review and analysis of divisional monthly financial statements and divisional statutory audit results.  Preparing the monthly, annual and projected calculation of common shares outstanding and monthly and quarterly common stock reporting.  Supporting the periodic calculation of stock option valuations and the calculation of related employee stock option compensation.  Preparing monthly journal entries related to foreign currency hedging activities.  Supporting SEC filings related to acquisitions, including related quarterly disclosures and integration of acquired entities into Company reporting processes  Assisting in the performance of technical accounting research to support inquiries by divisional personnel; ensure consistent application of GAAP and company accounting policy across all divisions.  Proactively identifying process improvement opportunities and execute with conviction to implement identified improvements.  Other duties as assigned by the Director, SEC Reporting.

Name: Service Quality Analyst - VP
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: NoJob ID: 18073575 DescriptionAbout  CitiCiti,  the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and  does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides  consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of  financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit,  corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services,  and wealth management.Our core activities are safeguarding  assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on  behalf of our clients.  CitisMission  and Value Propositionexplains what we do and Citi  Leadership Standardsexplain  how we do it. Ourmissionis to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by  responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic  progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by  constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive  impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of  skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work  every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our  strategic priorities..  Diversity is a  key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from  every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our  workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a  priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where  individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for  others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all. Job Overview: Core Infrastructure  Shared Services (CISS) Service Quality is responsible for managing all aspects  of Production Assurance for the CTI CISS organization. This includes reporting,  oversight and guidance related to the Incident, Problem, Request, Change and Configuration  Management processes and tools, as well as Proactive Error Control.  The CISS Service Quality  Analyst will focus on eliminating the recurrence of Sev-3 Major Incidents  through the use of ITIL processes by analyzing complex issues and identifying  the underlying causal factors of the incidents. Partnering with Level 3 Operational  Resources, corrective actions and timelines will be identified to ensure  complete remediation and a post mortem write up will be written and distributed  to CISS Leadership.  In addition to these  responsibilities, the Service Quality Analyst will provide daily, weekly,  monthly, and ad-hoc reporting of Standard Incidents, Major Incidents, Change  and Request management for CISS or Core Infrastructure Services (CIS), review,  approve and execute Configuration Management (CMDB) updates within the Service  Quality tool set, and provide guidance to CTI CIS staff on tool usage,  functionality, reporting, features and enhancements.Key Responsibilities:Lead Problem Reviews of  Severity 3 Major Incidents:Determine Root and  Contributing CausesIdentify Corrective  ActionsReview Time to Restore  and identify process improvements in order to prevent impact for future eventsConfiguration Management:Review and Approve CMDB  UpdatesExecute CMDB Updates  within the Service Quality ToolEnsure the Service  Quality tool is in sync with external CMDB sources and toolsPerform semi-annual  quality reviews of all CMDB Data for Groups, Applications, Servers, Databases  and Storage for CISS.Reporting:Provide reporting of different  frequencies that identifies areas of improvement and drives behavior for CISS  LeadershipProvide ad-hoc reporting  as neededAssist with the creation  of the CISS Monthly Operational Review (MOR)Service Quality Tool:Provide Support to CIS  for tool functionalityParticipate in Process  and Product Steering Committees as a representative for CTI CISChampion Enhancement  Requests for CIS, from inception, through implementation. Includes use cases,  return on investments, and product testingReview all enhancements,  communicate effect to CIS and provide feedback to enhancement coordinator for  approval / rejection, perform testing and communicate updates to CIS when  changes are implemented QualificationsFamiliarity with ITIL Service  Management definitions and processesExperience with Technical Support (help  desk, command center, project management, etc.)Understanding of OSI Model and how  applications function and interact with different components of the technology  stackConfident communicator at all levels  (from technicians to senior managers)Analytical capabilities with large data  setsExperience with reporting toolsStrong MS Excel and PowerPoint skills

Name: Underpayment Analyst
Description: Do you have an analytical as well as investigative mindset? Do you want to pair that with your knowledge of the healthcare field? Parallon is seeking candidates with revenue cycle/patient financial services experience to be Analysts in our Underpayments department.  Parallon's Mission:  We serve and enable those who care for and improve human life in their communities.  Parallon, a division of HCA, is an industry-leading provider of patient financial and revenue cycle services to acute care providers across the United States. We are dedicated to our values and passionate about finding future leaders for our fast-growing divisions in the Dallas/Fort Worth area. Although we are the largest healthcare provider in the world and experts and leaders in revenue cycle services, we maintain a people-first culture and sense of community.  As an Underpayment analyst, you would be responsible for researching and resolving underpayments from insurance companies such as Aetna, BC/BS, Cigna, Managed Medicare/Medicaid, etc., and assessing Managed Care contracts for appropriate reimbursement to validate the payment received as a contractual underpayment. In addition, Analysts contact payers and pursue collection of underpayment, and perform appropriate follow up with payer for payment as appropriate. They also escalate issues to the Payer Supervisor for immediate remedy, and provide clear and concise documentation of actions taken on each account. Duties include, but are not limited to:Must be able to read, review, and analyze reimbursement contracts from managed care insurancesKnowledge and understanding of 837/UB04 claims and 835/EOB/RABasic knowledge of CPT & HCPCS coding language preferred, ICD-9 & ICD-10 knowledge a plusUnderstanding of HMOs, PPOs, and other Managed Care plansKnowledge, Skills & AbilitiesCommunication - communicates clearly and concisely, verbally and in writingCustomer Orientation - establishes and maintains long-term customer relationships, building trust and respect by consistently meeting and exceeding expectationsInterpersonal Skills - able to work effectively with other employees, patients and external partiesPC Skills - demonstrates proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and others as requiredPolicies & Procedures - demonstrates knowledge and understanding of organizational policies, procedures and systemsBasic Skills - able to perform basic mathematical calculations, balance and reconcile figures, punctuate properly, spell correctly and transcribe accuratelyEducationHigh school diploma or GED requiredExperienceAt least one year of related experience requiredCertificates/License - N/A  At Parallon, every employee is a valued member of our organization. You can expect to receive competitive salary, ongoing professional development, comprehensive benefits package, performance bonuses and more!  Check us out or follow us on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/company/parallon-business-solutions  #ParallonBCOM

Name: SAP IT Analyst
Description: Job description  The SAP IT Analyst role is a hands on role using analytical, consulting, business knowledge, and application solution expertise to effectively integrate and implement technology solutions into the business environment. The SIA is responsible for all aspects of our SAP application that is currently implemented SAP ERP (ECC 6.0) functional solution in Costa Mesa, CA as well and Grand Prairie, TX location. This position will work closely with business subject matter experts as well as others within the Safran Support Teams (in France) to ensure strong alignment between the business requirements/needs and the application solutions/services. The candidate for the SIA role is responsible for developing, configuring and delivering effective SAP specific solutions for our business. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Functional support: oProvide configuration expertise and support for various modules of SAP focusing mainly in SAP OTC (Quote to cash) and MM/PP modules.  oHands-on problem identification, problem resolution and problem documentation and communication.  oProvide SAP expertise for functionality to support the organization business processes in combination with strong Business Process knowledge  oWork with Business users across locations collaborating closely to become a primary escalation point and local go to person for SAP  oAssist team members and business users with problem solving related to the software application, performance and usage; lead support effort to ensure business operations are not interrupted or delayed.  oProvide functional specifications for enhancements, interfaces, forms, and reports (RICEF) to support business requirements for both locations.  oWork closely and effectively with super-users and end-users to gather requirements, understand the production issues.  oManage business software application issues escalation through IT tracking tools to enlist support from Safran / Safran Electronics & Defense / third parties.  oWork with the business to drive requirements into SAP, Kronos and other application/module/solution interface, installation, implementation, upgrades and maintenance.  oPerform user management and implementation of permissions and security policies  oDesire to expand skills in other SAP modules specifically in MRO business( service to cash modules) General: oBriefs leadership as appropriate on situations requiring changes in resources, impacts on established policies, broad project milestones, goals, or projected timetables.  oMust be flexible with work hours as French support personnel may only be available during early PST and/or CST times  oIs responsible for work that involves the design, documentation, modification, testing, installation, implementation, and support of new or existing application solutions  oEstablish and execute test plans to ensure applications are performing expected results.  Job requirements Required Competencies:Education / Experience: Required Qualifications  oBS in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline, or the equivalent combination of education, technical training, or work/military experience.  oMinimum of 5-10 years of IT / Business Analyst experience  oMinimum of 5-7 years of SAP ERP functional/Hands-on experience.  oLegally authorized to work in the US without company sponsorship  oThis position requires use of information or access to hardware which is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR). All applicants must be U.S. persons within the meaning of ITAR. ITAR defines a U.S. person as a U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. ''Green Card Holder''), Political Asylee, or Refugee  Preferred Qualifications  oKnowledge of SAP HANA BI reporting is plus.  oKnowledge of MRO business is plus.  Complementary description  oProduce weekly status report in area of ownership, taking accountability and ownership Skills and Abilities: Position Criteria  oThorough attention to detail and accuracy  oAbility to work independently and in a team environment  oExcellent communication and interpersonal skills. Exhibits clear and concise written and verbal communication.  oCapacity to work in a fast-paced, deadline driven environment with multiple concurrent assignments  oWorks and communicates effectively at all organizational levels and across functional areas  oThe employee maybe required to work beyond normal working hours from time to time as the workload dictates.  oExcellent communication and client liaison skills  oAbility read and follow instructions in English  oTravel (25%)  Company information  Safran is an international high-technology group, operating in the aircraft propulsion and equipment, space and defense markets. Safran has a global presence, with more than 58,000 employees and sales of 16.5 billion euros in 2017. Working alone or in partnership, Safran holds world or European leadership positions in its core markets. Safran is listed on the Euronext Paris stock exchange, and is part of the CAC 40 and Euro Stoxx 50 indices.  In February 2018, Safran took control of Zodiac Aerospace, significantly expanding its aircraft equipment activities. Zodiac Aerospace has 32,500 employees and generated sales of 5.1 billion euros for its fiscal year ended August 31, 2017.  Safran is ranked among the Top 100 Global Innovators by Thomson Reuters and is featured on the "Happy at work" rankings. The Group places fourth on the Universum ranking for the favorite companies of newly-qualified engineers in France.  Safran Electronics & Defense is a world leader in the supply of solutions and services in optronics, avionics, electronics and critical software for both commercial and military markets. The company equips more than 1,000 boats, 25,000 land vehicles and 10,000 aircraft worldwide.

Name: Industrial Security Support Analyst
Description: Sayres and Associates Corporation (Sayres) is a dynamic, Native American-owned, Service Disabled Veteran Owned business that has been providing excellence in service to the Federal Government since 2001. We offer a broad spectrum of technical, engineering and administrative services including: acquisition, financial and program management; fleet synthetic training; logistics; ship construction engineering; systems engineering and integration; wargaming; test and evaluation; security, counterintelligence and policy analysis. Sayres is headquartered in Washington, DC with offices throughout the United States and has a presence abroad.  Our success can be attributed first to a proven track record of performance excellence based on our customer-focused approach to services. We have demonstrated experience effectively managing large contractor teams across multiple functional areas for major programs. Sayres offers financial stability and organizational maturity comparable to a large company, coupled with the agility of a small business, allowing us to provide cost effective and best value solutions to our customers.  Awarded the U.S. Small Business Administration, Washington Metropolitan District Office's 8(a) Graduate of the Year for 2017, Sayres and Associates Corporation continues to grow in a highly competitive environment while exceeding customers' expectations and providing a work experience conducive to personal and professional development.  The position description is only meant to be a representative summary of the major responsibilities and accountabilities performed by the incumbents of this position. The incumbents may be requested to perform position-related tasks other than those stated in this description. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, gender identity, disability or veteran status.Responsibilities Sayres is seeking several experienced Industrial Security Support Analysts with current TOP SECRET clearances, verifiable in JPAS, to support the Defense Security Service (DSS) Southern Regional Office, headquartered in Irving, Texas. (Support at the Irving, TX location is preferred.) The actual employment locations of the analysts are specifically at: Irving, TX (preferred); Atlanta, GA; Huntsville, AL; Melbourne, FL; San Antonio, TX; Virginia Beach, VA. If the analyst is not located at the Irving, TX office, frequent travel will be required to the Irving, TX office from the other offices. There will be possible travel to the DSS Headquarters in Quantico, VA a few times a year. The Industrial Security Support Analysts will assist DSS Industrial Security Representatives (ISRs) with research and analysis to support DSS' new risk-based methodology for providing industrial security oversight. The Industrial Security Support Analysts will be responsible for the following:  1. Identify assets whose loss, compromise, or damage of, would adversely affect national security.  2. Understand the threats to those assets under industry's purview or control.  3. Identify and analyze industry business processes involving those assets.  4. Identify and document the security controls that industry has in place to mitigate the risks to the facility's assets.  5. Assist in conducting pre-security research to facilitate the security review at the facility. Qualifications Education, Work Experience, Skills and Clearance Requirements:  1. Bachelor's degree. Minimum of five (5) years' experience with security-related data systems such as ISFD, e-FCL, and JPAS OR five (5) years' experience in counterintelligence.  2. Minimum of five (5) years' experience in program management support and working with high ranking officials in a management support capacity.  3. Understand and apply the principles of research to analyze, evaluate, and interpret raw data collected from multiple sources.  4. Plan, organize and coordinate research taking into consideration actual or potential problems in finding available or suitable sources of data.  5. Prepare, present, and defend portions of finished research and analysts' products.  6. Available to travel several times a month to Regional Offices located in Irving, TX, and to the DSS Headquarters in Quantico, VA a few times a year.  7. Current Top Secret security clearance verifiable in JPAS. Clearance to be verified prior to start date. Highly Desired:  1. At least three (3) years' total experience through a combination of industrial security and counterintelligence positions.  2. Experience with Palantir. POSITION CONTINGENT UPON CONTRACT AWARD AND GOVERNMENT FUNDING. 0 Job Posted by ApplicantPro

Name: Senior Cybersecurity Analyst
Description: The Cybersecurity Analyst is responsible for executing a portion of our client's Cybersecurity Program designed to advise the organization on its management of Cybersecurity risk by organizing information, enabling risk management decisions, and addressing threats to ensure the security of company systems and information assets. The Cybersecurity Analyst is responsible for contributing to the success of comprehensive security initiatives, work with internal and external groups to ensure the program is operating effectively and efficiently, and develop strong partnerships with business partners across the enterprise to ensure company information assets are protected at the appropriate level. Responsibilities:Primarily responsible for, but not limited to, performing information security risk assessments and control testing.Contributes to maintenance and update of library of information security control standards and procedures based on Information Security policies and procedures and industry best practices.Performs design and operating effectiveness testing on information securityWorks with cyber security leadership to coordinate control requirements and control reporting.Facilitates information security self-assessments with the business and technology teams.Performs information security maturity assessments.Compiles management reports, summary analysis, and detailed presentations to describe risk, controls, and maturity assessments.Job RequirementsA successful background in Information Security and/or Audit, specifically with the NIST 800-53 frameworkExperience with financial frameworks such as FFIEC would be a plus2 to 3 years of experience with ServiceNow, Archer or similar GRC Management SolutionSignificant experience with process analysis (e.g. process mapping)Significant experienced with documenting processes for applications and/or systemsThis position requires leadership skills and project management experience, as well as expertise to ensure effective system-wide security analysis; standards and testing; risk assessment; awareness and education; and development of policies, standards and guidelines.

CitisMission  and Value Propositionexplains what we do and Citi  Leadership Standardsexplain  how we do it. Job Overview: Core Infrastructure  Shared Services (CISS) Service Quality is responsible for managing all aspects  of Production Assurance for the CTI CISS organization. This includes reporting,  oversight and guidance related to the Incident, Problem, Request, Change and Configuration  Management processes and tools, as well as Proactive Error Control.  The CISS Service Quality  Analyst will focus on eliminating the recurrence of Sev-3 Major Incidents  through the use of ITIL processes by analyzing complex issues and identifying  the underlying causal factors of the incidents. Partnering with Level 3 Operational  Resources, corrective actions and timelines will be identified to ensure  complete remediation and a post mortem write up will be written and distributed  to CISS Leadership.  In addition to these  responsibilities, the Service Quality Analyst will provide daily, weekly,  monthly, and ad-hoc reporting of Standard Incidents, Major Incidents, Change  and Request management for CISS or Core Infrastructure Services (CIS), review,  approve and execute Configuration Management (CMDB) updates within the Service  Quality tool set, and provide guidance to CTI CIS staff on tool usage,  functionality, reporting, features and enhancements.Key Responsibilities:Lead Problem Reviews of  Severity 3 Major Incidents:Determine Root and  Contributing CausesIdentify Corrective  ActionsReview Time to Restore  and identify process improvements in order to prevent impact for future eventsConfiguration Management:Review and Approve CMDB  UpdatesExecute CMDB Updates  within the Service Quality ToolEnsure the Service  Quality tool is in sync with external CMDB sources and toolsPerform semi-annual  quality reviews of all CMDB Data for Groups, Applications, Servers, Databases  and Storage for CISS.Reporting:Provide reporting of different  frequencies that identifies areas of improvement and drives behavior for CISS  LeadershipProvide ad-hoc reporting  as neededAssist with the creation  of the CISS Monthly Operational Review (MOR)Service Quality Tool:Provide Support to CIS  for tool functionalityParticipate in Process  and Product Steering Committees as a representative for CTI CISChampion Enhancement  Requests for CIS, from inception, through implementation. Includes use cases,  return on investments, and product testingReview all enhancements,  communicate effect to CIS and provide feedback to enhancement coordinator for  approval / rejection, perform testing and communicate updates to CIS when  changes are implemented QualificationsFamiliarity with ITIL Service  Management definitions and processesExperience with Technical Support (help  desk, command center, project management, etc.)Understanding of OSI Model and how  applications function and interact with different components of the technology  stackConfident communicator at all levels  (from technicians to senior managers)Analytical capabilities with large data  setsExperience with reporting toolsStrong MS Excel and PowerPoint skills

Name: Sr Global ECM Analyst/Datacap developer
Description: Overview  The Global Senior ECM Analyst is a technical subject matter expert for our ECM platforms (IBM Datacap and Case Manager). This includes, but is not limited to, analysis, design, project estimation, as well as product support and systems administration. This position will be responsible for providing installations, upgrades, technical guidance, and specialized support for the development and implementation of ECM-based applications and solutions. This position involves direct coordination with other team members, departments, business partners, and outside vendors on project management. The Global Senior ECM Analyst often functions as the IT Partner and/or BSA projects in addition to acting as the solution architect and developer. The position will also provide guidance and mentoring to team members of all levels. ResponsibilitiesJOB DUTIES Administer the configuration and set-up, manage the upgrades and patching of our ECM platforms (IBM Datacap, Case Manager, etc.)  Plan, organize, and direct/perform the implementation and/or development of ECM solutions in accordance with strategic business plans and requirements  Interface with customers to provide issue resolution for products and solutions  Gather, analyze, and review customer requirements and recommend innovative solutions to appropriate management  Work closely with internal business units to facilitate project completion  Interface with software vendors and suppliers in support of business applications software  Provide business rules interpretation for functional and technical specifications, system designs, and documentation for business solutions  Promote a cooperative and productive team environment  Ensure our platforms and solutions are following modern standards and look for opportunities to implement new technologies  Provide direction and mentoring to team members of all levels  Support all additional solutions and platforms managed by the Global Enterprise Systems team OTHER IMPORTANT DUTIES Maintain technical and functional awareness and competence  Provide Quality Assurance Testing for production implementation  Perform other duties and special projects as assigned/required  Ensure that all work and changes are performed in such a way as to minimize disruptions to the customer and other stakeholders REPORTING RELATIONSHIPReports to: Global Enterprise Systems Manager Subordinates: None Qualifications Knowledge  Knowledge of ECM technologies including but not limited to IBM Case Manager, IBM Content Collector, IBM Content Search Services, IBM Datacap, etc.  Proficiency with Microsoft Office products  Experience in reporting technologies such as Case Analyzer, SSAS, SSRS, Cognos, Excel, Power BI  Knowledge of IT infrastructure and networking technologies  Proactive and solutions driven with a high level of attention to detail  Ability to interpret complex technical publications, diagrams, and project specifications  Ability to interpret business rules and customer requirements for creating system and process documentation, program specifications, and project specifications. Skills Excellent analytical, organizational, problem solving, and follow-up skills with the ability to meet time sensitive deadlines  Capable of relating business issues to the ITS staff to achieve the necessary resolution of issues  Ability to make sound decisions and exercise good judgment.  Interpersonal skills necessary to manage business and technical relationships with internal and external clients  Ability to speak multiple languages a plus  Superior organizational skills in planning and prioritizing own workload and initiatives  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to communicate technical terminology to people with limited or no technical understanding  Experience  Bachelor's degree in computer studies or equivalent experience required  Minimum of 10+ years prior analysis experience in an Information Technology environment and respective business area required  Minimum of 7+ years of work experience in implementing, configuring, customizing, upgrading, managing, and troubleshooting ECM platforms required  Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team and with users at all levels. WORK CONDITION Normal office environment. Subject to stressful situations as they relate to deadlines and dealing with business partners, other departments, and outside vendors. Travel to company and vendor sites is required. Some non-business hours work may be required to perform upgrades, deployments, or maintenance as needed.

The Michaels Companies, Inc., is North America's largest arts and crafts specialty retailer, with more than 1,300 stores in the United States and Canada. Name: Workforce Analyst
Description: **Requisition ID**18-1350**Job Title**Workforce Analyst**Location**Texas**Schedule**Full-time**Type of Position**Regular**Job Description****Location: Irving, TX****Position Summary:**Responsible for the forecasting, staffing, scheduling for a grouping of OEM clients to ensure we consistently meet contractual service level agreements and internal budget/operational efficiency targets. Coordinate with various teams on ongoing operational items as well as upcoming client activities/launches and technical changes that will affect call volumes or handle times.**Duties and Responsibilities:**+ **Forecasting:**+ Generate a detailed forecast for upcoming weeks along with mid-long term forecasts for a grouping of clients.+ Analyze historical data to establish call and update volume arrival patterns, identifying weekly rate-of-change, day-of-week, and time-of-day distribution.+ Perform variance analysis to identify drivers or issues when actuals come in significantly above or below forecast.+ **Staffing:**+ Review staffing at a macro-level (overall resource pool) as well as for individual clients.+ Determine proper actions to take based on staffing levels and identify strategic changes proactively prevent/mitigate future staffing issues.+ **Scheduling:**+ Create flexible schedules that best fit current and future business needs for upcoming new-hire classes.+ Coordinate with operations and training teams to schedule activities such as cross-training sessions, refresher training, team meetings.+ Communicate voluntary shift bids to allocate staffing as shifts in staffing occur due to changes in call volume arrival patterns or agent attrition.+ **Reporting:**+ Create reporting to assist in optimizing SLA performance, operating efficiencies, and assist the contact center teams in identifying agent performance opportunities.+ **Coordination:**+ Coordinate closely with the command center to tie in upcoming plans with real-time actions.+ Cross-functional communication and coordination with a cross-functional team on a variety of client-focused and contact center items.**Supervisory Responsibilities:**+ Assist in the development of the command center team.**Minimum Qualifications:**+ Associate's degree in business or related discipline or equivalent, relevant experience.+ 3 years of experience in a contact center workforce management environment.**Requirements and General Skills:**+ Good public speaking and presentation skills.+ Interpersonal skills and ability to interact and work with staff at all levels.+ Excellent written and verbal communication skills.+ Ability to work independently and in a team environment.+ Ability to pay attention to details and be organized.+ Ability to project professionalism over the phone and in person.+ Commitment to "internal client" and customer service principles.+ Willingness to take initiative and to follow through on projects.+ Spelling, grammar, proofreading and editing skills.+ Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under shifting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.+ Must have legal right to work in the U.S.**Technical Skills:**+ Thorough knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access with experience in formulas, pivot tables, VBA, and creating queries.+ Experience with workforce management (IEX TotalView, Genesys) and call routing/skilling (Avaya CMS Supervisor) applications.**As an EEO/Affirmative Action Employer all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to its sole discretion without notice._Company EEO StatementOur goal at SiriusXM is to provide and maintain a work environment that fosters mutual respect, professionalism and cooperation. Name: SQL Server Analyst

Experience writing custom/complex queries for reporting perspectiveExperience with ODBC, JDBC and TCPExperience with Transact-SQL, replication, DTS/SSIS packages, SQL Agent jobs, SQL Reporting Services, and VB scripting.Experience with design and deploy SSIS packages for data load, reports, etc.    Desired Skills:  Mongo DB and/or Splunk experience a plusAdvanced knowledge of Compliance, Data integrity and Security.Performance tuning using various SQL Server tools and application migrationITIL and/or LEAN process and best practicesExcellent written, verbal and inter-personal skills.   This position is only available to those interested in direct staff employment opportunities with NTT DATA, Inc. or its subsidiaries. Name: Information Analyst
Description: Job ID : ******  Location : Irving, TX US  Level : Experienced Professional Job Category : Information TechnologyDescription : Where good people build rewarding careers.  Think that working in the insurance field can't be exciting, rewarding and challenging? Think again. You'll help us reinvent protection and retirement to improve customers' lives. We'll help you make an impact with our training and mentoring offerings. Here, you'll have the opportunity to expand and apply your skills in ways you never thought possible. And you'll have fun doing it. Join a company of individuals with hopes, plans and passions, all using and developing our talents for good, at work and in life.  Job Role  The Information Analyst provides enterprise, product, and project-level technical and business analysis support that produces consistent, accurate, and complete information requirements. The information analyst is challenged with supporting and enhancing the analytic and reporting lifecycle throughout the enterprise. In support of the analytic and reporting lifecycle, this position will create data definitions that follow established standards and guidelines, develop and manage the logical and physical views of data that are consistent with the business objectives, and provide consulting on new developments within the business intelligence space.  The Information Analyst provides a high level of expertise in a focused area of the business. They will work independently on projects of all degrees of complexity, supporting multiple business units to advance their use of data and analytics. Through independent analysis and guided design, the role defines, develops, and implements data and business intelligence solutions for assigned business areas.  Job Responsibilities Provides business knowledge and support for resolving technology issues across one or more areas of the business and across multiple projects for Allstate's Information Services Group (ISG).Analyzes and translates business, data, functional, and user requirements and/or business rules into analytic and reporting requirements, data models and metadata deliverables by leading and guiding discussions internally with the project team and externally with business and technology partners.Plans, develops and leads information gathering sessions.Constructs and executes complex SQL queries and reviews data profiling results to discover semantics, patterns and value domains of data under analysis.Performs complex data analysis utilizing multiple techniques to determine, document and communicate existing and potential future data relationships, profiles and quality levels; uncover anomalies and variances in data content from expected results.Updates and maintains all logical (conceptual, relational, subject-level and dimensional) data models and other metadata deliverables at multiple levels of detail and functionality for a specific business subject area.Plans, develops and facilitates inspection sessions to validate that modeled data and related metadata deliverables match and satisfy business data requirements.Conducts reviews of physical data model and related technical detail with database administrators and technical developers as part of a single project's development life cycle.Understands, applies, teaches others and drive improvements in the use of corporate metadata development tools and processes.Leads the initiation of new projects through estimation and planning in coordination with other ISG teams and other key stakeholders.Develops and keeps current an approach to data management.Applies knowledge of tools and processes to drive data management.Creates complex technical requirements through analyzing business, functional, and technical requirements. Job Qualifications  Essential Criteria Bachelor's degree in computer science, management information systems, or related field, or a combination of related experience and education.Prior experience in modeling relational databases.Must have a strong capability to deal with highly ambiguous problems. This is demonstrated through step-by-step and methodical approach to scoping, understanding, and exploration to the right solution(s).General knowledge of relational database & data warehousing.Working experience building complex SQL queries.Experience with ErWin or other data modeling tools.Strong ability to visualize complexity as a method of collaboration, and share with team members. This skill is used as a collaboration mechanism to collect more points-of-view in the problem-solving process.Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Desirable Criteria Previous experience as Information Analyst or Business Analyst in a highly technical role.Prior experience in modeling Master Data Management (MDM) systemsHands on experience with dimensional modeling.Experience with an object oriented programming language, preferably Java or Python.Experience with NoSQL databases like MongoDB.Experience with Big Data technologies (Hadoop/HIVE/Spark/Etc.).Working experience with Agile Scrum delivery methodology. The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.  Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands.  As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary - but that's just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you'll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy.  Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.  Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position. For jobs in Los Angeles, please click 'here' for information regarding the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance. Name: Servicing Ops Analyst (SPOC)
Description: Caliber Home Loans, Inc. is one of the nation's fastest-growing mortgage lenders. We didn't move into the fast lane because of clever marketing campaigns or flashy television ads -- our talented employees worked hard to help us rise to the top of our industry.  Here at Caliber, we've replaced the stereotypical corporate culture with a casual "dress for your day"work atmosphere that promotes creativity and a collaborative environment that allows our team members to thrive. POSITION SUMMARY The Servicing Operations Analyst Senior will assist in the analysis of various performance metrics for monthly and ad hoc reporting. Areas of focus will include productivity improvement, reporting development, production of ad hoc data analysis related to productivity KPIs, expenses, and advances. The position is also responsible for assimilating large quantities of data into effective and efficient communication tool and reports, delivering concise, accurate, and timely reports on operations loan data and metrics. RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop an in-depth knowledge of process workflows, system usage and production of various servicing departments.Produce accurate monthly reporting on assigned areas of focus and ensure consistency and accuracy in data, reporting, and results.Track, monitor and address exception results from assigned reports and alert management of any issues.Assist in the implementation of process improvement and quality control initiatives in conjunction with capacity plans and workflow time study analysis.Utilize metrics to drive process and performance improvement.REQUIREMENTS3 + years of experience in operational reporting and performance improvement.Expert skills in Microsoft Access and Excel, including the ability to utilize the following functions: V-Lookup, H-Lookup, Concatenating formulas, Conditional Formatting, and Pivot Tables are preferred.Excellent knowledge of advances and other complex mortgage transactions.Current, working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite, including MS Project, is a plus.High school diploma or equivalent.Previous mortgage servicing experience is preferred.Experience with Fiserv, Aspect, or similar system is desired.Bachelor's degree in Business, Economics or related field a plus.SQL developer skills are highly desired. Our employees demonstrate the Caliber Ways of Work (WOWS) every day through: Collaborating ContagiouslyCaring FiercelyDoing the Right ThingLeading ThoughtfullyCaliber benefits and perks will WOW you! Our benefits package includes: comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance, short-term and long-term disability, 401(k),10 employer paid holidays, as well as numerous employee discount programs.  We are proud to be a military friendly employer, and provide paid leave during military assignments for employees who serve in the Guard or Reserve.  Employees who work at our Coppell headquarters experience additional perks that include: standing desks, complimentary coffee and tea stations, an on-site gym and activities center with ping-pong and pool tables, and an in-house café.  Caliber is an equal opportunity employer.  Job Type: Full-time

Troubleshoots financial issues for solutions with line management.Conducts analysis of profitability and appropriate ROI of supplier incentives. Ensures financial compliance of supplier contracts and ensure proper bill-back percentages for supplier incentivesPerforms other related duties and responsibilities, as assigned.Supervisory Responsibilities: None Competencies: To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the competencies of the RNDC Individual - Administration Leadership Competency Model:Implement Continuous Improvement: Behaviors which result in the improvement of existing processes or development of new processes leading to greater efficiency. It also includes the implementation and management of change. This competency includes creating a learning and training environment, coaching and providing feedback, and developing people’s careers.Demonstrate Professionalism: Behaviors that contribute to creating an environment of respect and professionalism. Demonstrates excellent communication skills; high integrity; personal responsibility and initiative; treats people with respect; encourages diversity; maintains a positive, professional demeanor; and is serious-minded about responsibilities.Create Customer Satisfaction: Behaviors that involve direct interaction with external customers (trade/market) and lead to increased satisfaction on the part of the customer. Includes creating a culture of customer excellence, being responsive to needs, etc.Build Supplier Satisfaction: Behaviors that involve direct interaction with suppliers which lead to increased satisfaction on the part of the supplier. Includes developing strong working relationships, understand and responding to supplier opportunities, being proactive and a good business partner.Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Ability to work with concepts such as limits, rings, quadratic and differential equations, and proofs of theorems. Experience with supply chain software is necessary. Database, spreadsheet and word processing software. Name: Big Data Programmer/Data Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingOther Location: United States,Florida,JacksonvilleEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: NoJob ID: 18073729 Description  The Big Data Programmer/Data Analyst will develop and manage a comprehensive CI/CD Telemetry portal, providing capabilities and services for Citi's Global Consumer Bank (GCB). This role will enable a culture of learning and continuous improvement using actionable metrics throughout Citi's GCB development team. This person will be part of a team designing and developing a custom telemetry portal Hadoop, Splunk, and other big data technologies. The portal will provide GCB development and management teams with real-time insights into their practices, including the CI/CD pipeline, environment health and uptime, project health, application performance and infrastructure performance.  The key responsibility for this role will be Hadoop development in support of synchronizing Splunk data with a Hadoop data source. The person filling this role will also help identify relevant data, analyze, and interpret data so that the GCB team can leverage complex data models and noisy data sources to better identify bottlenecks and opportunities of improvement within the CI/CD pipeline. Knowledge and understanding of statistical techniques suitable for analysis of complex data sets is a definite plus. Proven experience in predictive analytics and metrics formulation. Familiarity with the design and implementation of data telemetry systems. The ideal person will be a multi-talented developer who understands that everything done in technology space must be measured, can be measured and should be measured. Key Responsibilities:Hadoop DevelopmentBig data analysisDevelopment support for the comprehensive Business Intelligence - Telemetry Portal.Collaborate with Product Architecture, Product Owner and key stakeholders to devise and develop cutting-edge solutions.Be an active member of the product development scrum team.Development Value: The job offers the opportunity for the candidate to advance in a technology development role, with exposure to multiple cutting edge technologies, including Java development, Angular UI development, Big Data (Splunk / Hadoop) and eventually machine learning / AI. The position will provide a wide exposure to customers and requirements across Global Consumer Technology. QualificationsEssential Skills:Hadoop or similar technologiesExposure to Splunk or similar technologiesCapable of guiding and inspiring team members, peers and stakeholders to drive the best possible practices Preferred Skills Java Microservices developmentSome experience with Data Science, Machine Learning, and/or Artificial IntelligenceUI / Angular / HTMLKnowledge of SDLC, CI/CD and ALM tools (incl. JIRA, HP ALM, Jenkins, ServiceNow).Proven technical ability with a range of BI and development tools & languages.Ability to think out-of-the-box and give pleasant surprises to end users over the data telemetry served .Proven technical ability with a variety of reporting analytics and data visualization tools such as Qlikview, Tableau, BI Cognos, SQL, Python and R is a plus.Knowledge and understanding of statistical techniques suitable for analysis of complex data sets is a plusFamiliarity with the design and implementation of data telemetry systems and metrics formulation is a plusMicroservice development in SpringCloud.Defining and gathering metrics and KPI through automation.Knowledge/Experience:BS Degree in engineering, science, mathematics, information systems or computer science; or the equivalent in experience and evidence of exceptional ability.8 or more years' experience in enterprise level IT projects.Experience with application / product development, including on-time and in-budget delivery.Experience with BI / Big-data solutions (Splunk / Hadoop).Experience in and understanding of a wide variety of telemetric processes (governance, measurement, etc.).Experience working within an agile software development environment.Experience in designing, deploying and maintaining telemetry infrastructure on private and/or public clouds is a plus.Bachelor degree in computer science or other related or equivalent work experience.CompetenciesExcellent thought leadership in big data and IT development.Strong customer and quality-focus is a must.Sound problem resolution, judgment, decision-making and influencing skills required.Excellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills.Ability to deal with conflicting ideas with emotional intelligence.Excellent English communication skills both written and oral.Hard working and self-motivated. Able to work effectively under pressure.Ability to manage multiple activities and changing priorities. This position is located in Irving TX and Jacksonville Florida.  We have set aside limited financial assistance relocation will be provided for out-of-state candidates.  Apply Now

Name: Credit Analyst - Freddie Mac SBL
Description: Ready Capital offers a positive and diverse work culture incorporated with people who are passionate about their careers. We pride ourselves in being viewed as a premier place to work and encourage you to view our Credit Analyst opportunity. Summary of Position:Credit Analyst supporting Ready Capital's Freddie Mac SBL and Bridge-to-Freddie programs.Support Credit Officers with submissions for Freddie Mac SBL opportunities.Perform initial analysis and size transactions with guidance from Credit Officers.Present/recommend opportunities for new originations.Roles and Responsibilities:Support Freddie Mac SBL underwriting team by conducting initial underwriting assessment which facilitates loan decisioning in a timely and efficient manner.Promptly report to Credit Officers any adverse events or information that would have a material effect on individual loan opportunities.Review and maintain transaction details in the loan origination system; confirm data integrity at each stage of the underwriting process.Uphold proficiency in Freddie Mac SBL and company lending/underwriting guidelines.Establish relationships with internal business partners including Production, Processing/Closing, Collateral Risk, and Legal; collaborate with teams to identify issues in a timely manner, formulate and propose effective solutions.Analyze property rent rolls, operating statements and other financial information to populate the loan sizing template.Perform borrower/guarantor analysis, including financial statements and schedules of real estate reviews.Research and analyze rent and sales comps for a property and convey findings in loan approval documents.Review third-party reports and incorporate findings into the underwriting analysis; ensure reports are prepared to program requirements.Conduct research and analysis of sponsors/management, properties, neighborhoods and other factors of a potential loan to ensure conformance with program requirements; analyze trends unique to the loan request.Perform property site inspections and prepare appropriate documentation relating to inspection in a format consistent with internal and Freddie Mac guidelines.Promote a favorable image of Ready Capital to potential and existing clients.Skills and Experience:Graduation from a college or university with major coursework in a discipline related to Accounting, Finance or Commercial Real Estate is preferred.Minimum requirement of 1 years' experience in commercial real estate lending/underwriting.Experience with Freddie Mac and/or other multifamily programs is preferred.Ability to read, analyze, and interpret commercial real estate property related financial reports and legal documents.Superior communication skills (written and verbal) with internal and external partners; ability to convey findings in a concise and comprehensive manner.Proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel. Ready Capital (NYSE: RC) is a multi-strategy real estate finance company that originates, acquires, finances and services small- to medium-sized balance commercial loans. We specialize in loans backed by commercial real estate, including agency multifamily, investor and bridge as well as SBA 7(a) business loans. Headquartered in New York City, Ready Capital employs over 400 lending professionals nationwide.  Ready Capital offers a full range of benefits, including competitive salary, comprehensive health plans to choose from including dental, vision coverage, company-paid life & disability insurance policies, business casual dress and a great culture!  Ready Capital is an equal opportunity employer (EOE)!

Name: Fraud Risk Senior Analyst
Description: About CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.Fraud Risk Senior AnalystAbout Cyber Fraud Prevention GroupWith increasing focus on Digital, it is imperative for us at Citi to further protect our customers and our franchise from the emerging environmental risks related to financial fraud. Cyber-enabled tools have become more sophisticated and available, enabling fraudsters to effect damage at much greater speed and scale than before. The Cyber Fraud Prevention (CFP) team’s mandate is to predict and deter significant fraud across our Global Consumer Business, leveraging an “all source intelligence” led approach and real-time knowledge transfer amongst GCB Fraud Teams, Security Operations, Citi Security & Investigative Services (CSIS) and other Citi security functions, as well as Law Enforcement and other external institutions to prevent and disrupt significant fraud along the entire fraud lifecycle. Role & Responsibilities:This role resides in the Cyber Fraud Strategy (CFS) team of the Cyber Fraud Prevention organization, responsible for conducting analytics to detect and escalate changes or anomalies in portfolio performance and behavior that could be indicators of potential fraud risk by leveraging statistical models, visual analytics, data science techniques, partnering closely with regional fraud teams and Security Operations Center (SOC).The CFS Analyst is responsible for 1) developing, maintaining and optimizing alerts designed to detect changes and anomalies within portfolio behaviors that may be harbingers of future fraud loss; 2) acting as a Subject Matter Expert as it relates to data sources and coding, and working with the appropriate teams in order to enable the Fraud Fusion Center and SOC to perform their duties by leveraging timely, complete and accurate data.Key responsibilities include: Conduct ongoing monitoring of existing fraud Fusion Center alerts and recommend enhancements to improve fraud detection and reduce false positives.Support development and implementation of the new alerts. Engage with key partners in NA Fraud, Global Fraud, Fusion Center and Security Operations Center to develop requirements for new data needs.Ensure the quality, accuracy and completeness of data available and alerting process.Identify data pain points (e.g. frequency, lack of data) and work on the projects with the appropriate IT team to resolve the pain point.Partner with Business Intelligence teams who store key data in order to determine opportunities to extract directly from EDW/Teradata.Partner with the Fraud MIS infrastructure leads to establish new data transmissions to the Fusion Center.Partner with the Fraud Web Application team to explore opportunities for the Security Operations Center to use web-based tools for Fraud MIS SQL server data for their investigations of alerts.Coordinate the testing and validation of data transmissions between Fraud and the Big Data EAP environment.Provide support on projects to ensure data needs are captured accurately and to drive requirements for data formatting and mapping as necessary.Assist with on-going production support for data feeds sent to either the Fusion Center or SOC.Education & Experience:Bachelor’s degree required (Master's degree preferred) in statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, physics, economics, or related quantitative discipline from a premier institution. 4 years of experience in financial services or risk management (experience in fraud management highly preferred).Understanding of financial crimes, in particular cyber fraud means and threats a plus.In-depth knowledge of the Cards business and risk management concepts and practices, and performance implications of policy/actions a plus.Skills:Excellent quantitative and analytic skills and data-driven mindset; ability to derive patterns, trends and insights, and perform risk/reward trade-off.Effective cross-functional project, resource, and stakeholder management. Effectively engage with internal and external auditors.Proficient in SAS/SQL and MS Office. Experience with the following programming languages (e.g. Python, R) and analytical tools (Enterprise Miner, Knowledge Studio, H2O, Alpine, Tableau) and big data tools (e.g. Hadoop, Hive, Spark) highly desirable.Excellent communicator with strong written and verbal communication skills; ability to create and deliver compelling presentations, translating complex material into narrative suitable to a variety of audiences.Solutions-oriented “can do” attitude, with ability to challenge status-quo and drive innovation via thought leadership while maintaining end-to-end view.Ability to prioritize and reprioritize work and make decisions independently with limited guidance from management.Extremely detail-oriented, with strong; intellectual curiosity. Ability to set and meet high standards.Ability to effectively multi-task and work in a fast-paced and evolving environment.

Name: Model/Analysis/Validation Senior Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingEducation: Master's DegreeJob Function: Risk ManagementSchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: Yes, 10 % of the TimeJob ID: 18055838 DescriptionAbout CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citis Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.Position Objective:The position is a role which encompasses the best of both the worlds; data management /analysis and modeling and forecasting.The candidate must be a hands on person with a strong back ground in programming, data analysis, data management, manipulate, extract and prepare for model development. The preferred programming tools are SAS, R, Python or MATLAB. Candidate will be responsible foe ensuring all recurring economic and financial data are timely updated revised from vendor sources via API or ODBC connections and that they pass certain consistency and accuracy parameters.The candidate will also be responsible for building statistical, time series and or macro econometric models that are used for firm wide projections based on internal risk scenarios and regulatory or US Bank Supervisors provided projections. The opportunity will allow the candidate to work in one of the largest Global financial institution with foot pants across 40+ countries, work in a collegiate environment that promotes innovation, meritocracy, insightful learning and career growth. Qualifications1 - 2 years in related work experience in the areas of database management and analysis in an analytical capacity preferred.Good Understanding of SAS/SQL/C/Java, MATLAB, or background of other relevant tools such as R and Python a plus; proficient in MS Office.Fulfill requests in support of data collection/cleaning/data presentations/ or analyses.Good written and verbal communication skills; ability to translate business needs into system/process designs; comfortable presenting to peers and managementExcellent quantitative and analytical skills, extremely detail-oriented and possessing intellectual curiosityAbility to multi-task and work against tight regulatory and global Citigroup deadlinesAbility to work independently with only baseline instructions/guidelines from management.Experience with econometric forecasting & modeling, machine learning and statistical modeling.Minimum a Masters degree required in statistics, economics, financial mathematics or financial engineering/economics, mathematics, or a related field and a minimum of 2 years related experience or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Name: Due Diligence Analyst - 158134
Description: Veritude is hiring a Due Diligence Analyst to work in Westlake, Texas at Fidelity Investments.  The Due Diligence Investigations group provides discreet investigative support to various Fidelity business units to identify, mitigate and manage risk associated with existing and potential third party business relationships, including vendors, financial services firms, and potential investments, among others. The group also provides litigation support, competitive intelligence, general background and ad-hoc investigative support, as deemed appropriate by Corporate Security’s senior leadership team.  The Analyst is responsible for developing case investigative strategies and analyses in accordance with the overall goals and objectives of the department, as well as the objectives of the requesting client. The group manager or one of the group's other senior members will have direct line supervision for the position and encourages creative thinking, innovative investigative planning/analysis and efficient case management. Primary responsibilities include the following:Conduct open source intelligence (OSINT) research on a wide range of investigative issues, to include media, Internet, database research, litigation inquiries and verification of licensing requirements/regulatory compliance.Analyze research findings to identify risks associated with proposed and existing client relationships.Prepare investigative reports that are thorough, timely, well-written and logical.Manage client relationships to maintain high level of service standards; identify and develop opportunities to enhance relationships with existing clients.Manage a challenging case load while meeting time-sensitive deadlines.Perform ad-hoc projects and investigative research upon request.Education and Experience:Bachelor's degree required.A minimum of 2 years of progressive investigative experience is preferred; particular experience in either law enforcement, the financial industry, accounting/audit, or litigation support/consulting is a significant plus.Skills and Knowledge:Demonstrated ability to conduct investigative research on a wide range of investigative issues, including complex and high profile investigations.Proven fact gathering capabilities, along with strong quantitative and qualitative assessment skills for information obtained, in all forms, are required.Outstanding business writing and oral communication skills.Strong computer skills (working knowledge of on-line database systems and Microsoft Office suite)Excellent time management skillsPrior legal research and/or familiarity with state/federal court systems or court procedures is preferred.Apply

Name: Analyst, Maximo

Name: Contact Center Forecasting Analyst
Description: At Exeter Finance, we are committed to helping customers find the right financing for their next vehicle purchase. By building strong relationships with our customers and network of dealer partners we are able to give options that make sense, getting customers behind the wheel of their car.  Every team member is integral to our success. Whether you’re at a servicing center helping customers with their loans, in the field building relationships with dealers, or supporting the company from its corporate offices, you'll enjoy a nurturing, invigorating and positive work environment.  Our vision is to be a premier finance company and lender of choice known for its People, Performance and Service.  Provide assistance to configure, support and manage the Aspect eWFM database; update new hires, attrition, transfers, and promotions.  Oversees adherence to schedule and staffing needs (i.e., shifts, training, vacation, meeting, overtime, off-line work, exceptions, etc.) to ensure that daily service level objectives are met.  Monitors intra-day call volume to ensure forecast is updated based on actual call volumes. Monitors Real Time adherence, call statistics and communicates with Supervisors to ensure on/off phone activity is managed efficiently throughout the day.  Assist in updating the forecasting model, (FTEs, volume, productivity, etc.) on a weekly, monthly, and annual basis for the assigned areas of the Servicing team.  Provides analysis of key metrics and trends in a timely manner and recommend steps to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the organization.  Generates and communicates off phone activity reports, staffing issues, performance measures & call statistics to appropriate members of management.  Generates analysis and reports to support business case development and to identify and address emerging trends and issues and track performance to forecast to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the organization.  Proactively seeks opportunities to improve processes that lead to operational effectiveness and a positive impact to the customer experience (meet objectives, including meeting expected service levels).  Other duties as assigned.  Exeter Finance LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: Business Systems Consultant

Name: Systems Analyst/Programmer (Application Specialist)
Description: Employer is looking to hire a Systems Analyst/Programmer-Application Specialist for their client in Arlington, Texas Systems Analyst/Programmer The City of Arlington is looking for an Application Specialist who is a motivated, energetic, team player who can quickly learn new systems and technologies and would enjoy working on a small fast paced team. Among other things, this position is responsible for the administration, maintenance, testing, support and implementation of new and existing applications. It is preferred that the candidate have strong MS SQL query writing to include stored procedures, functions, and report creation skills and enjoy working with complex enterprise level applications. Required 1) Ability to assist the primary IT systems advisor on one or more application systems: -Provide functional assistance to departmental customers as needed -Assist application team with testing and implementation of all relevant application software patches, updates, hot fixes, etc. -Troubleshoot reported functionality issues -Develop plans and procedures for remediation of issues 2) Ability to provide analytical, technical assistance, and communication materials relative to the identification, development, implementation, maintenance and support of application software solutions for customer departmental business needs. 3) Ability to coordinate and assist with custom production and/or ad hoc application system reports: -Development, testing, and implementation -Customer training and support -Understand a customers reporting needs, and convert them to technical specifications for the development of custom reports 4) SQL Server 2012 or higher -Stored Procedures -Triggers -Functions Nice to Have 5) Visual Studio 2015 -SSRS 6) Crystal Reports 2011 or higher 7) Angular Java or equivalent Required Skills / Qualifications:Preferred Skills / Qualifications: Go Beyond. www.superiorjobs.com. Name: Applications Dev Intermediate Prgmr Analyst
Description: CitiRisk is a consolidated platform for Risk Management and Risk Reporting across Citigroup globally. It is supported by the Enterprise Technology Solutions within Global Functions Technology Services Organization. CitiRisk provides the strategic infrastructure for Institutional Clients Group, Citi Commercial Bank, Consumer Bank and Investment Products, Treasury and Enterprise Risk Management. This reports to the application development manager under Commercial Bank Risk management. Team will be involved in building Java based microservices to support multiple applications. Basic Database design and principles. Experience in Spring Batch, Caching, Multithreading is a plus. Skills •Strong design & execution bend of mind •Conceptual understanding of models/algorithms •Exposure to Neural Networks •Passion for technology and self- starter •Orientation towards Disciplined development processes •Good skills at building networks  •Bachelors in computer science or equivalent experience. Candidates with passion for coding and systems development from other disciplines also can apply. •1-2 years of experience in Java web service development •Basic to intermediate level experience in an Apps Development role

Name: Senior Oracle ERP Analyst
Description: Senior Oracle ERP Analyst  Evaluate and analyze commercial network operating systems and database applications; Customize, modify, develop, and implement necessary computer needs in Oracle Manufacturing & Supply Chain Management (SCM) Modules including Purchasing, Order Management, Inventory, Shipping, Bills of Material, Engineering, WIP, Advanced Pricing, and Advanced Supply Chain Planning (ASCP); Gap analysis, data conversion from existing systems to new systems; Systems analysis, design, development, documentation, testing, implementation, technical support, and maintenance of Oracle Information Systems; Manage Oracle Workflow and extend workflow processes for the material/order transaction process flows in order to streamline the network and business processes. REQUIREMENTS: Masters Degree in Metallurgical Engineering Material Science, Computer Science, Mechanical or Manufacturing Engineering or related field. In lieu of Master's degree and 1 years of experience, employer will accept a Bachelor's degree or foreign equivalency in Metallurgical Engineering, Material Science, Computer Science, Mechanical or Manufacturing Engineering or related field and 5 years of progressive experience.  Experience must include iProcurement, iSupplier, Oracle Manufacturing & SCM Modules, Oracle Forms/Reports, Oracle XML Publisher, Oracle Discover, Oracle Workflow Builder, PL/SQL, Shell Scripts, HighJump ERP Integrations.
