Name: Applications Support Sr. Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: NoJob ID: 18064608 DescriptionAbout CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citis Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.Citis Institutional Clients Group(ICG) is comprised of diverse, talented professionals globally located in more than 100 countries and territories, collectively representing an unparalleled international network of financial skills and capabilities serving targeted clients. Our clients are top corporations, financial institutions and governments in countries around the world and our mission is to help them achieve their goals. We do so by providing strategic, financing and operational insights and executing tailored product/service solutions, both across our borders and domestically. The ICG responds to clients' changing needs through its long-established relationship coverage approach that provides client solutions utilizing all of Citi's relevant capabilities, including the broadest possible access to financial markets globally. No other institution can match our combination of global insights, client relationship management services, geographic reach and local and cross-border product expertise.The ICG technology is organized into Markets and Securities Services(MSST), Treasury and Trade Solutions(TTS) , Citi Private Bank(CPB) and Information Services Group(ISG). Trade Transaction Services (TTS) Trade Technology organization supports the Global Trade Services, Trade Finance and Supply Chain management segment of the TTS Treasury and Trade business.CITI- with the largest trade services network in the world offers a broad range of solutions that meet our global trade customers needs. From risk mitigation to financing, settlement to information, CITIs trade experts and four, regional processing centers offer around the-clock operations support and deliver world-class solutions to suppliers, buyers and Financial Institutions. International trade is the cross-border movement of goods and services that develop from a business transaction between a buyer in one country and a seller in another country.Job Background / Context:We are seeking an experienced Application Support Senior Analyst within the ICG Production Support organization, specifically within Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS) Technology. The person will be leading highly motivated Level 2 support teams deployed globally which handles the stability and resiliency of the platform. You will also be responsible for running day-to-day availability of the applications and ensures issues or status updates are accurately communicated to partners within the agreed SLA.You should have strong motivation to drive, lead and be successful in your endeavors, great collaboration and team building skills will be a key factor to the success of the team.You should be dedicated, technically astute, well organized, enthusiastic and be comfortable discussing issues with business and technical users at all levels. Do you provide valuable perspective or advice that contributes to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area?Dedicatedly seeks opportunities to work across silos and is able to influence with or without direct authority.We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.Functional Responsibilities:Main focus areas will include promoting stability and quality of support services in line with our strategy and technology management policies, as well as day to day operation and oversight for the various applications operating in the region and globally.Expand, modify and improve Citi Payment Insight system to test, maintain, and monitor systems and programs to support the corporate and retail banking businesses.Ensure that the Citi Payments Insight applications are available and supported as defined in the system service level agreement.Able to analyze complex problems / situations and to propose simple solutionsCommunicate complex technical issues to business users in a language they understandPromote effective knowledge management across the Global Production Support TeamsHelp to define, record and execute application disaster recovery plans and proceduresCollaborate effectively with multi-functional partners, sharing information and knowledge effectively Business KnowledgeLearn the fundamentals of the supported business areas and Translate business issues into technology requirementsEffectively communicate and work well with infrastructure and supporting technology groups across the Big Data environment to drive problem resolution and service levels.Work closely with 1st level support teams and work as part of the 2nd level support team to ensure team is meeting the business requirements.Follow through to ensure each problem is resolved according to SLA.Effectively communicate issues and status updates with business users, development teams and Support Lead.Liaise with users; business sponsors; and other AD groups.Development value:You will gain significant experience of the many technologies we are using to run our Payment Services business regionally and globally, giving you exposure to new and existing methodologies and systems. It will also give you an insight to and understanding of the Citi Payments business. Citi is embedding I.T.I.L Service Management methodology into our support teams. You will also gain experience of this industry standard and recognized methodology for service support and delivery.It is recognized that the best talent often lies within the firm. All career opportunities are advertised internally where staff are inspired to apply for open positions to enable them progress their career or expand their product knowledge or technical skills. QualificationsEssential SkillsBachelor's degree in computer science/computer engineering or equivalent.6+ years work experience in technical production support roles preferably within a large scale, global financial services organization.Working knowledge of ServiceNow tracking system and solid grasp of ITIL practices in the area of Incident, Release, Change and Problem management.Experience in handling communications across business and technology partners at varying levels across a medium to large scale enterprise.Demonstrate individual leadership with good people management skills along with strategic analysis, problem solving, issue resolution and decision-making skills.Ability to build positive relationships in a multi-cultural environment across all levels within IT.Technical Hands on experience in Big Data Ecosystem (Hadoop, Spark, MapReduce, HDFS, HBase, Zookeeper, Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Cassandra, Oozie, Flume, Ignite). Should have hands on expertise in SQL, Python. CR8 experience is a plus.Support or Development experience primarily in UNIX systems with Linux, MQ, Java, SQL, NDM and tomcat server.Basic networking knowledge (load balancers, network protocols).Experience in Autosys job scheduling Monitoring tool like ITRS.Experience writing scripts using Unix shell, database queries, generating capacity and performance reports.Working in multiple application support model is helpful.Understanding of client server architecture (clustered and non-clustered).Personal:Ability to learn new skills quickly with little supervision and work in a team environment.Experience working on a multi-client delivery team.Authoritatively and effectively handles work, time, and resources.Ability to handle high stress and pressure situations and demonstrate Strong problem solving and program execution skills.Demonstrable ability to communicate and develop long-lasting relationships with all levels of Management in a clear, concise manner.Delivery focused, Process oriented and Attentive to detail.

Name: BI Data Analyst/Specialist - 158151
Description: Veritude is looking to hire a Data Analyst at Fidelity Investments, located in Westlake, TX. This Data Analyst, Procurement Analytics, is responsible for data analytics and reporting supporting one or more categories of supplier spend within procurement. The person will have a strategic mindset and work with business partners to maximize Fidelity’s position to regularly negotiate for the right products, at the right price and terms for the firm. The individual will have a strategic mindset and strong communications skills as they partner with internal stakeholders, Procurement leaders, and business partners to achieve scale and efficiency for the firm.  The Expertise We’re Looking For Bachelor’s degree; ideally in a business, finance, analytics or supply chain disciplineMBA a plusDemonstrated success in a complex decision support functionStrong interpersonal, communication and project management skillsAbility to understand, craft, and communicate complex concepts to a broad set of audiencesExperience developing interactive dashboards and data storytelling leveraging data visualization tools, techniques and concepts. Experience with OBI and/or Tableau preferred3+ years of highly-analytical decision support experienceAdvanced use of Excel, including pivot tables, macros, think-cell, Solver and Analysis ToolsProficiency with SQL, SQL datamining tools and relational database designStrong attention to detail, collaborative and ability to multi-task The Purpose of Your Role  The Procurement Analyst will provide analytical and research support within Fidelity’s Procurement organization in support of business planning, strategic sourcing initiatives, reporting, and other key procurement initiatives. In this role, you will be responsible for detailed analytics, decision support analysis, and development of reports, presentations and documentation for a wide and varied range of audiences.  As the Analyst, you will independently make decisions on inputs, interpretations, and information strategies in support of the recommendations and analysis being developed. You will independently identify resources, validate information, identify scenarios, develop data and market interpretations, and provide summary and comprehensive perspective to the evaluation process. The Analyst will need to be self-driven and proactive in achieving the objectives of the role and will need to independently bring value adding input into the commodity strategy planning and execution process.  The Skills You Bring You have the ability to answer complex business questions and tell a story through the creative use of data analyticsYou are curious and excited to learn about new data sources and technologiesYou thrive in a fast-paced environment and are able to balance working on multiple projects The Value You Deliver Developing new solutions and tools that Procurement professionals will use to proactively identify supply chain opportunities across the firmLeveraging data and visualization technologies to uncover insightsParticipating on internal strategic initiatives, sourcing projects, or other special projects that benefit from your subject matter expertiseTranslate findings into meaningful and actionable information to assist Fidelity managers in understanding their spend patterns, purchasing behavior, cost drivers and savings opportunities How Your Work Impacts the Organization  Fidelity’s Procurement organization guides Fidelity business partners to make smart purchasing decisions that reduce risk and maximize value. As a member of the Procurement Analytics & Programs Team, the Procurement Analyst leverages analytical expertise to deliver the tools and information to support the organization’s ability to: Evaluate vendor engagements & leverage supply chain opportunitiesGovern the risk & controls environment as it relates to internal operations and Fidelity’s supply chainImprove Procurement’s overall efficiency, quality and business partner experience Company Overview  At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.Apply

Name: Programmer Analyst
Description: Current Openings  Programmer Analyst  Posting Date: 08/17/2015  Application Submission Last Date: 08/31/2015  Programmer Analysts sought by Vastika, Inc. in Irving, TX (and other U.S. locations as needed).  Work on SharePoint, C#/.Net, Java/J2EE, design, develop, unit test, UI, and web expertise. Assist in development of the application interfaces using latest technologies in C#, .Net/SharePoint, SQL Server, Java/J2EE tools and technologies. Implement user interface designs, developing a variety of back-end business applications and integrating products such as CMS, E-commerce or e-learning applications. Adhere to coding standards and continuous integration methodology. Maintain open communication and a transparent view into project progress with development team and other stakeholders (PM, Dev Lead, etc). Write code so that it is well documented and reusable. Estimate level of effort for specific development components and maintain a deep knowledge of the business and industry. Maintain knowledge of the technology industry, tools, and practices. Be able to debug and fix defects with Test Driven Development (TDD).  Requires a Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or a related field plus 1 year of experience as a programmer in Java/J2EE, C#/.Net, SharePoint, SQL Server. Must have experience in test-driven data development. Requires skills in SharePoint, C#/.Net, SQL Server, Stored Procedures, Functions, Triggers, Database Programming and Administration, Workflow, Java, J2EE, design, develop, unit test, JSP, Servlet, JBOSS 7.x, Web Services, JMS/Camel, Spring, Hibernate, Restful Web Services, Maven, GIT, SVN, UI, web. Required to travel within the U.S. as necessary.  40 hours/week. Must also have authority to work permanently in the U.S. Applicants who are interested in this position may apply at http://www.jobpostingtoday.com (reference # 71183) for consideration.

Name: Sr. BI analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPosition: Senior Analyst BI (18-776)Location: Irving, Texas 75063Duration: 4+ Months Contract role.Job Description The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst for Connected Vehicle Reporting will be responsible for gathering business requirements that pertain to reporting on the Client’s Connected Vehicle organization's marketing activities and key performance indicators. This person will be required to develop an in depth knowledge of CV marketing business processes and corresponding information needs. The analyst will interview users in order to establish reporting requirements, define key performance indicators and their attributes, assess needs for training, and determine user acceptance criteria for development projects. Business requirements need to be captured in technical documents for development teams, including screen mockups and visualizations. The analyst will also be the primary person testing report and dashboard outputs. Duties and Responsibilities: · Assist business staff in the development of business requirements documents, including owning authorship of business requirements when called for.  · Help identify and assess potential data sources, and analyze existing enterprise data warehouse structures to determine relevance to CV marketing reporting.  · Participate in generating high-level solution concepts in consultation with development and quality assurance teams.  · Write functional requirements documents, participate in document reviews with business users and development teams.  · Create dashboard design mockups, using creative methods for visualizing results.  · Document test strategies for report and dashboard outputs, and review test results.  · Maintain an understanding of how the data in the enterprise data warehouse relates to important CV marketing business processes, events and measurements.  · Work cooperatively with analysts and developers to ensure that business requirements guide the development life cycle. QUALIFICATIONMinimum Qualifications: · Bachelor's degree in information technology or related field or equivalent, relevant experience.  · At least 8 years of working experience in a variety of technical roles within information technology.  · 5 or more years of experience in business analysis or data analysis roles in a BI environment. Requirements and General Skills: · Strong interpersonal skills.  · Ability to interpret, analyze and solve business problems with information technology solutions.  · Strong analytical and quantitative problem solving skills.  · Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  · Ability to advocate for the needs of business partners.  · Good public speaking and presentation skills.  · Interpersonal skills and ability to interact and work with staff at all levels.  · Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  · Ability to work independently and in a team environment.  · Ability to pay attention to details and be organized.  · Ability to project professionalism over the phone and in person.  · Commitment to "internal client" and customer service principles.  · Willingness to take initiative and to follow through on projects.  · Spelling, grammar, proofreading and editing skills.  · Creative writing ability.  · Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multi-task, and work under shifting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.  · Must have legal right to work in the U.S. Technical Skills: · Experience using BI tools; experience with Cognos and Qlikview highly desirable.  · Development experience with at least one business intelligence tool such as Qlikview, Tableau, Cognos, or Microstrategy highly desired.  · Experience authoring technical documents such as business requirements, functional requirements, business rules, KPI definitions, database design representations, data and systems flow diagrams.  · Knowledge of data warehouse architectures and processes.  · Understanding of the features and capabilities of one more DBMS's commonly used in data warehousing such as Oracle, Teradata, SQL Server.  · Expertise developing or applying relational and dimensional data models.  · Thorough knowledge of MS-Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access).Company DescriptionComrise is the bridge to the first-rate talent for organizations that recognize the value of their workforce. With locations in the U.S., China, and Hong Kong, we help our clients reach far and wide for both local and international resources which yield the highest return on their human capital investments. Headquartered in New Jersey since 1984, Comrise is a staffing, consulting and enhanced search technology company. For over 30 years we have delighted our clients and consultants by focusing on customer satisfaction, innovation, and flexible workforce solutions. By combining our global networks with our outstanding local offices, Comrise provides high-quality executive search, temporary and temporary to permanent staffing solutions, and cross-border placement services.

Name: Vaccine Analyst
Description: McKesson is in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payors, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting. We believe in the importance of strong, vital organizations because we know that patients can only be healthy when our system is healthy.Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—by joining McKesson you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company—and of healthcare. At McKesson, you’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.We understand the importance of a system that works together. Your expertise, drive and passion can help us improve everything we touch, from providers to payors to pharmacies. Join our team of leaders to begin a rewarding career.Wherever you contribute here at McKesson, you will have the ability to make a real impact in the lives of others.Current NeedVaccine AnalystPosition DescriptionFacilitate the accurate and timely onboarding of new and existing Vaccine McKesson Medical Surgical customers from a contracts perspective. Work directly with MMS Account Managers to ensure that new and existing customers are added to contract costing if applicable within established service level expectations. Partner with Vaccine team in Richmond and suppliers to validate contract costing. Key Responsibilities:Work directly with Account Managers to obtain identifiers required to support the RX customer implementation process (DEA, HIN, 340B ID, etc.).Provide Account Managers with updates regarding vaccine customer implementation status and assist with the resolution of related eligibility issues.Maintain, administer, and verify progress on a regular basis related to assigned implementations in sales force cases.Obtain supporting authentication from drug enforcement agency websites, health industry websites, RX suppliers, and in resolving eligibility issues.Work directly with Account Sales Managers, Account Managers, Project Managers, Directors, and internal partners to facilitate the onboarding process as requested.Administer vaccine contracts through the contract system based on RX health industry websites, portals, rosters, and supplier documentation (including loading customer tiered contracts as supported by supplier documentation).Ensure compliance with departmental and corporate document storage and retention polices.Partner with Pharma Contract Operations and Rx team to ensure successful transition of customers to the correct vaccine contracts and resolving costing issues (if necessary).Adhere to department service level and quality standards as supported through the quality control process and various departmental metrics.Participate in user acceptance testing related to IT initiatives, including the development of test scripts and documentation of testing results.Develop system and process expertise. Represent the department on various project teams as a subject matter expert. Cross train on multiple departmental functions.Minimum Requirements4 years general clerical expericneCritical SkillsSales Force, JDE, Strong Excel skills, Word, PowerPoint, and AccessAdditional Knowledge & SkillsWorking knowledge of the law; Typing, reading, writing and basic arithmetic skills.EducationHS Diploma vocational training or equivalent experience is preferredPhysical RequirementsGeneral Office DemandsBenefits & Company StatementMcKesson believes superior performance – individual and team – that helps us drive innovations and solutions to promote better health should be recognized and rewarded. We provide a competitive compensation program to attract, retain and motivate a high-performance workforce, and it’s flexible enough to meet the different needs of our diverse employee population.We are in the business of better health and we touch the lives of patients in virtually every aspect of healthcare. We partner with payers, hospitals, physician offices, pharmacies, pharmaceutical companies and others across the spectrum of care to build healthier organizations that deliver better care to patients in every setting.But we can’t do it without you. Every single McKesson employee contributes to our mission—whatever your title, whatever your role, you act as a catalyst in a chain of events that helps millions of people all over the globe. Talented, compassionate people are the future of our company—and of healthcare. At McKesson, you’ll collaborate on the products and solutions that help us carry out our mission to improve lives and advance healthcare. Working here is your opportunity to shape an industry that’s vital to us all.McKesson is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer – minorities/females/veterans/persons with disabilities.Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history.Agency StatementNo agencies please.

Name: z/OS Capacity Planning and Performance Analyst
Description: Primary Location: United States,Texas,IrvingEducation: Bachelor's DegreeJob Function: TechnologySchedule: Full-timeShift: Day JobEmployee Status: RegularTravel Time: NoJob ID: 18058620 Description The z/OS Capacity Planning and Performance Analyst requires finely honed analytical and communication skills as well as technical problem solving skills. This is a global support function and requires strong relationship building skills and someone who is able to work in a fast paced dynamic environment.  Ongoing responsibilities include reviewing projects and dimensioning the impact to system usage and calculating financial impacts. It also includes preparing graphical presentations for review with Senior Managers in both technology and the business.  The individual will work with Application Developers across all Citi businesses and assist them with estimating capacity requirements for new projects, estimating increases to existing batch and online processing and providing current workload analysis. The Analyst will review usage reports and determine weight settings for multiple LPARs globally. In this role the Analyst will be responsible for opening change records to implement the necessary capacity changes and they will represent the changes on weekly forums. They will also have responsibility for sponsoring the changes for new CPU installations. In addition to the analytical and project work, the individual will all assist in troubleshooting real time CPU capacity issues and provide support to the Global Command Center in terms of required actions. Overall: Primary Roles and Responsibilities: Integrates technology and finance expertise to manage all phases of capacity management including project estimation, requirements reviews, acquisition forecasting and installation, and monitoring resource usage. Understands capacity management processes and techniques as well as basic project management skills. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas. Ideal candidate will be driven, highly analytical and capable of multi-tasking on a variety of tasks and responsibilities. About Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.  Citis Mission and Value Propositionexplains what we do and Citi Leadership Standardsexplain how we do it. Our missionis to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients and the publics trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.  Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.  Qualifications• Minimum 3 years of experience providing technical support for z/OS mainframes as it pertains to capacity management and LPAR capacity settings. Technical knowledge of mainframe operating systems in the areas of batch and online monitoring, optimization and troubleshooting.Prior modeling experience preferred; capacity planning in a technology environment highly preferredMust be able to communicate effectively with other technical staff including Project Management, other Citi Technical staff, and Application Development groups.Must present analysis/results in a clear and concise mannerMust fully comprehend the tasks, responsibilities, and processes of capacity planning.Will create volume/project impact forecasts at the line of business level and convert those forecasts into future capacity acquisition targetsMonitor usage on systems for comparison to forecast and upgrade standards.Develop PEP documentation for acquisitions, including presentation of requirements, alternatives, and financial impact. Coordinates with Finance for all aspects of financial impact including planning/forecasting, to ensure that latest future staffing needs are driving anticipated expensesContributes to compliance and/or audit reviews from internal and external resources.Real Time Performance Alerts EngineeringReal Time Performance TroubleshootingAd-hoc Performance AnalysisException Reporting and Short Term Trend AnalysisProactive Performance OptimizationSupport of the virtualized environments This position is located in Irving TX.

Name: WMS Technical Analyst, Irving, TX
Description: OverviewAbout PrimeSource Building Products, Inc. With 34 distribution centers throughout the US and more than 1,200 employees, PrimeSource is an international distributor of building materials serving residential, commercial, and industrial new-construction and remodeling markets as a value-added link in the distribution chain. Core products distributed under the nationally known Grip-Rite® and Pro-Twist® brands include: Nails, screws, and collated fasteners; tools, compressors and accessories; residential and commercial roofing products; diamond blades and accessories, gypsum accessories, weather protection and covers, adhesives and caulks, contractor bags and poly sheeting, building accessories; rebar and concrete accessories; and fencing and wire. For more information, please visit www.primesourcebp.com , www.griprite.com, www.pro-twist.comLOCAL CANDIDATES ONLY: NO RELOCATIONThe WMS Technical Analyst will be responsible for the Implementation, Configuration and Technical Administration of the WMS solutions. Providing support to our end user community, developers, business analysts and business process owners for one or more of the following areas in the WMS world: Material Receiving, Warehouse Optimization, Shipping, Inventory Management, Reporting, Analytics and the WMS Integration with SAP.  This position will team with IT Analysts and developers to implement the WMS system using the best business practices available in our industry. As a side duty, this analyst will also work closely to support analysts to assist with the end users support duties. The SAP Technical Analyst will facilitate the implementation and support of WMS related applications to enhance the company’s business functionality and overall performance, while maintaining a high degree of customer satisfaction. WE ARE UNABLE TO PROVIDE SPONSORSHIP AT THIS TIME! ResponsibilitiesResponsibilitiesProject Functions. Planning and tracking project activities, teams’ coordination.Identify tasks and interrelationships to evaluate functional and cross-functional requirements.Lead the Design, Configuration and implementation of WMS system solutions.Write functional specifications for the IT Development Team.Provide WMS first-level of support and guidance to the IT technical team. Troubleshoot, investigate, analyze, and solve software problems.Map company's business requirements, processes and objectives. Name: IT Disaster Recovery Analyst
Description: HMS makes the healthcare system work better for everyone. We fight fraud, waste, and abuse so people have access to healthcare?now and in the future. Using innovative technology and powerful data analytics, we help government and commercial payers reduce costs, increase quality, and achieve regulatory compliance. We also help consumers take a more active role in their own health. Each year, we save our clients billions of dollars while helping people live healthier lives. At HMS, you will develop new skills and build your career in a dynamic industry while making a difference in the lives of others.  We are seeking a talented individual for a **Junior IT Disaster Recovery Administrator** position who will be responsible for supporting overall technical resilience by managing risks that could seriously affect IT Services. *Essential Responsibilities:** + Manage the maintenance and testing of policies, procedures, and collaborate with business and IT teams to identify and plan mitigation efforts, recovery strategies and necessary resources to execute recovery procedures  + Coordinate with other IT business units to keep technical run books up to date at all times  + Coordinate actual, scenario-driven disaster recovery (DR) exercises as well as simulated exercises with business and technical staff  + Assess the impact of all changes on IT Disaster Recovery plans  + Work with the IT Disaster Recovery Administrator to coordinate functional workshops to develop process maps, procedures, methods and other associated process documentation encompassing a comprehensive IT Disaster Recovery program  + Collect and organize information about current systems including applications, hardware, network and infrastructure as well as their dependencies to populate in the CMDB  + Actively coordinate testing schedules, objectives, exercises and reviews  + Obtain and leverage production system knowledge for continual improvement of Disaster Recovery documentation and planning  + Provide support during incidents, widespread outages, disasters or crises that have the potential to require activation of response plans  + Ensure newly introduced applications are prioritized appropriately and DR plans are created Maintenance of DR online repository  + Work with IT Business Resiliency team to understand RTO/RPO for critical business functions and related technology  + Work with other IT departments determine RTO/RPO recoverability options work with the IT DR Administrator to present recoverability options to business partners  + Maintain metrics *Non-Essential Responsibilities:** + Other duties as requested *Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:** + Ability to find creative solutions to difficult challenges  + Should be self-directed and able to work independently  + Ability to collaborate with other IT staff at all levels of responsibility  + Ability to communicate effectively verbally, in writing, and fluently in English.  + Ability to provide a high level of problem solving skills.  + Ability to communicate technology into business terms with customers at all levels.  + Ability to actively collaborate with vendors and other support teams for problem resolution.  + Ability to analyze information and use logic and process to address work-related issues and problems.  + Ability to function effectively under pressure as well as manage multiple initiatives.  + Ability to meet deadlines.  + Ability to work proficiently with Microsoft Word, and Excel.  + Working knowledge of HIPAA privacy and Security rules.  + Ability to work weekends and overnight hours as needed. *Work Conditions and Physical Demands:** + Primarily sedentary work in a general office environment *Minimum Education:** + BA/BS Preferred or equivalent job experience *Certifications:** + ITIL Foundations Preferred *Minimum Related Work Experience:** + 2 Years of experience working in a Disaster Recovery capacity strongly preferred  + 2 Years of experience in various areas of IT preferred  _Nothing in this job description restricts management?s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time._ *Title:** _IT Disaster Recovery Analyst_*Location:** _Texas-Irving_*Requisition ID:** _18001101_ EEO/Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled.

Name: Senior Applications Analyst
Description: Triumph Group designs, engineers, manufactures, repairs and overhauls a broad portfolio of aviation and industrial components, accessories, subassemblies, systems and aircraft structures. We partner with original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and operators of commercial, regional, business and military aircraft worldwide, to provide products and services that solve their hardest problems. So whatever the part, component or complexity of assembly, Triumph is committed to quality, service and meeting the specialized needs of each customer.  Triumph participates at all levels of the aerospace supply chain – from single components, to complex systems, to aerospace structures and their contents. We provide solutions for the entire product life cycle of an aircraft – from raw material to aftermarket service. Our unique ability to integrate a broad range of products and capabilities is our competitive advantage.  The Senior Application Analyst serves as the technical point of contact primarily for the Quality organization of Triumph Group and other assigned functional areas. This role is a subject matter expert who has primary responsibility for data integrity, testing of systems changes and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. The Sr Application Analyst serves as liaison to the software vendor(s) and is responsible to manage the delivery of systems projects and overall ownership of the QMS solution.  The role will own and conduct requirements sessions with business application owners/SMEs/software vendors, document and provide UAT/QA testing of vendor developed solutions and follow all SDLC and change management protocols for software development including signed approvals for implementations.  The role will make recommendations on best practices, define report governance, define, develop and test complex reports as requested using software delivered reporting tools.  It will also have overall responsibility for supporting the application on Triumph servers, including appropriate patching, trouble shooting, upgrades, etc. as needed.  The role will consult and advise leadership on strategy, solutions, ‘best design’ across the QMS roadmap. Successful candidates will be resourceful, confident under pressure, with demonstrated skills in crisis management, expectation management and change management. Candidates will be required to lead the technical analysis, document recommendations, architecture, development and implementation of the overall technical solution.  #LI-KD1  #GDOOR BS in Business or Computer ScienceMinimum of 7-9 years’ experience with , or information technology, or the equivalent combination of education and experience.Five years Quality functional experience within a manufacturing environment a plusExperience with Qpulse a plusMust have strong organizational, presentation, communication, analytical and project management skillsRequires excellent communication, analytical, facilitation and negotiation skills, data process modeling, knowledge of competition, industry happenings and knowledge of how the company is positioning itself is a plus.

Description: U.S. Bank is seeking a motivated Business Systems Analyst with requirements-gathering and functional-design experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. Additional responsibilities include:+ Assists users in understanding application functionality;+ Responds to user-escalated issues from the Helpdesk;+ Manages tickets in support system per SLAs;+ Collects functional requirements from the business line;+ Assists application development team in creating functional designs;+ Aids in testing of applications;+ Analyzes and evaluates user needs;+ Assists in developing and maintaining a complete and accurate understanding of how an impacted business unit conducts its business;+ Assists in developing and maintaining detailed knowledge of the business's current technology and infrastructure from a functional perspective;+ Assists in analyzing and documenting business processes of medium complexity;+ Works with business representatives to identify, analyze, document, and refine detailed business needs of medium complexity and scope;+ Designs functional solutions that appropriately meet the business needs; and+ Reviews test plans for multiple projects and ensures that test cases and results meet requirements.**Qualifications:**Basic Qualifications-Associate's degree or equivalent work experience-At least three years of experience with activities, tasks, practices and deliverables for assessing and documenting business opportunities, benefits, risks, and success factors of potential applicationsPreferred Skills/ExperienceBasic understanding in:-IT standards, procedures, policy-IT environmentWorking experience in:-Workflow analysis-Requirements analysis-Modeling: data, process, events, objects-Business process modeling-System testing-System development life cycle-Business assessment**Job:** Information Technology**Primary Location:** Kentucky-KY-Owensboro**Shift:** 1st - Daytime**Average Hours Per Week:** 40**Requisition ID:** 180042462**Other Locations:** Missouri-MO-Earth City, United States, Minnesota-MN-HopkinsU.S. Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to creating a diverse workforce.U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.

Name: Sr Billing Analyst
Description: Check out the following fantastic career opportunity!POSITION TITLESr. Billing AnalystOVERVIEW AND REPORTING RELATIONSHIPUnder general direction and with some latitude for independent judgment and discretion assists with the day-to-day operations of the Shared Services - Revenue Reporting department within the established accounting policies of the organization. Supports timeliness and accuracy of related analysis, customer invoices and financial data. Additionally, this position is responsible for acting as the primary resource for less experienced personnel.OTHER REPRESENTATIVE DUTIESProactively assists with coordinating and enforcing the operational activities of the Shared Services - Revenue Reporting department that includes monitoring and performing Revenue Reporting processes, maintaining billing integrity, managing credit memos and manual invoicing, monthly late fees, and quarterly broker fee paymentsAssists Shared Services Accounting Manager with the establishment, maintenance and continuing improvement of Revenue Reporting and procedures. Recommends changes in methods or procedures to increase the efficiency of the Revenue Reporting department. Additionally, documents processes and procedures as appropriate.Ensures compliance with all SOX control objectives and corporate policies related to Revenue Reporting activities. This includes monthly review of key AR SOX controls, updates to narratives and testing. Assists with pulling audit documentation relating to Revenue Reporting external audit requests and tracks progress accordingly using provided templates.Identify and implement process efficiencies across the dept. including automation opportunities or workflow enhancement opportunities to reduce manual efforts and improve productivity and overall compliance.Perform month end reconciliations and other monthly financial reporting requirements.Research and respond to inquiries regarding Revenue Reporting issues and problems; create client spreadsheets and track budgets, where needed.Prepare, access, and analyze reports via operating & financial systems.QUALIFICATIONSGood technical knowledge of the accounts receivable function is required.A good attention to detail and the ability to remain highly organized and focused is essential. Incumbents should possess strong analytical skills and be able to make effective judgments and decisions on relative information.Good interpersonal skills are essential. The ability to foster cooperation with a wide variety of partners is required to perform the functions as described. A demonstrated ability to build strong relationships across functional areas is essential. Very good written and verbal communication and presentation skills are critical, including the ability to communicate related issues to senior management.A general knowledge of WageWorks’ products, technologies, selling strategies and internal business functions is strongly preferred.EDUCATIONA thorough knowledge and understanding of finance and accounting as normally obtained through an associate’s degree or equivalent in finance or accounting. Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or related major a plus.LOCATIONTempe, AZ or Irving, TXBuild Your Career at WageWorks!WageWorks enables millions of people to save money on critical expenses like healthcare, dependent care, and commuting, through Consumer-Directed Benefits, such as Health Savings Accounts (HSAs), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), Health Reimbursement Arrangements (HRAs) and Commuter Benefits. WageWorks is a leader in the industry serving more than 6.5 million people for over 100,000 employers, including 63% of the Fortune 500 and numerous public sector clients. WageWorks believes that our success is achieved by its People. Values describe how we work together to achieve our success. It is our employees that drive results through living our Company Values. Every employee at WageWorks is expected to uphold and demonstrate the six Company Values listed below as an additional component of the job description and as a standard of individual performance.Customer-Centric: Our Customer comes first. We aim to serve our Clients and their employees, our brokers and partners, as well as our internal customers.Caring: People are at the heart of our company. We care about people: our Clients, our Clients’ employees and their families, our partners, and local communities, and our fellow employees at WageWorks.Passionate: We love what we do and are passionate about delivering Consumer-Directed Benefits that save people money and enrich their lives.Accountable: We are dedicated to making our team and the company succeed, and we are open, honest, ethical and conscientious, as we deliver on our commitments.Leading: Our actions inspire new ideas and drive change each and every day.Respectful: We value the diversity of our people, treat them with dignity and respect, encourage their development and reward their performance.Why Work for WageWorks?If you're looking for a career that provides plenty of growth opportunities, responsibility, and interesting challenges to tackle, you will find it here.If you want to join a fast-moving, high-growth, exciting company that's a market leader, you’re looking in the right place.But mostly, if you want to help people live happier, healthier, and more productive lives, then you’ll want to work for WageWorks.WageWorks provides equal employment opportunity without regard to pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, race, religious creed, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, mental or physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), medical condition, veteran or military status, marital or registered domestic partnership status, age, sex, sexual orientation, genetic information, gender identity or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation.Employment will require successful completion of a background check.Equal Opportunity for Disabled Veterans, Recently Separated Veterans, Other Armed Forces Service Medal Veterans.Drug free workplace.

Name: Senior HRIS Analyst
Description: Under general direction, responsible for overseeing maintenance, proper function and use of various HR systems, such as, but not limited to Kronos, SAP, Taleo, from a functional perspective by ensuring business processes are followed. Provides functional project management or subject matter expertise for HRIS projects (functional changes or enhancements). Trains and coaches HR team and/or employees and managers globally on processes, procedures and proper information handling. Develops and executes global audit process for HR systems. Maintains functional documentation of systems. Functional contact point to resolve system issues and problem resolution. Responsibility may integrity of processes and data. Liaison to CIO, EDS or other groups to resolve system technical issues that occur globally. Demonstrates broad knowledge of the functional area. Exercises independent judgment. Applies advanced skills, concepts, practices and procedures to complete several small to medium projects or a complex component of a large project. Assists with training, work assignments or checking work of lower level employees. Receives general direction on assignments, with minimal review. Decisions have impact on success of project team, department, work group, and client.  5 years experience in job offered or 5 years experience in Human Resources Consulting. Experience in job offered or related field must include the following: Implementation and support experience of SAP HCM and SuccessFactors, HRIS system configuration with focus on workflows and business rules to ensure business processes are followed, functional HR programs and processes.  A Bachelors Degree in Business, Human Resources Management, CIS, MIS or related field or equivalent as determined by a professional credentials evaluation.  Please copy and paste your resume in the email body do not send attachments, we cannot open them and email them at candidates at placementservicesusa.com with reference #377231 in the subject line.  Thank you.

Name: Controller – VP, Balance Sheet Substantiation Lead Analyst
Description: About CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.The purpose of the BSS GPO is to strengthen controls and transparency of the Balance Sheet by enhancing the quality of the account reconciliation process with strong centralized governance and standardization of the substantiation process, performed in strategic sites, while leveraging best in class automated tools. The individual who fulfills this position will be expected to support initiatives for the BSS commitments related to the Core Capabilities.The Balance Sheet Substantiation Global Process Owner’s (BSS GPO) group provides accounting guidance, control, support and governance for all Citi business units related to reconciliation and substantiation processes. Supporting the BSS project lead in working with Senior Leadership across the organization and with the Core Capability chapter owners to understand the requirements impacting BSS, and manage the scope and expectations of those requirements.Key Responsibilities:Partnering with technology to document requirements for the strategic technology solutions needed to execute on the commitmentsWorking with all Strategic Partner sites to implement the change in BSS processesProviding updates to the project lead and escalating timely if progress in hinderedUnderstand current state BSS processes and technology to ensure alignment with the strategic visionExperience in Banking or Financial Services industry preferredAccounting degree is requiredCandidate will have 7 years of experience with a degree in accounting from accredited institution, a proven track record for success, and preferably be a CPA or equivalent or working towards a certification. Experience with Citi Finance’s strategic technology architecture, Balance Sheet substantiation and other key finance processes across all regions is strongly recommended.Candidate should be willing to travel globally as needed.SkillsThe selected individual must possess the following skills: Well-developed analytical skills Must be able to work independently with very little supervision and handle multiple projects simultaneouslyCommunication skills including excellent verbal, written and interpersonal skills. Proficient in MS Office with Advanced Excel skillsCompetenciesVersatility and high degree of flexibility required. Must possess a strong sense of accountability. Will be required to take responsibility for meeting key milestones to ensure timely execution.Demonstrated ability to execute on key deliverables working across functions, regions and business lines.

Name: Data Governance Program Analyst
Description: Description:Westlake - TX, TX2050R, 2050 Roanoke Road, 76262-9616  Lance Alan Britton  1009-44116 We believe that, when done right, investing liberates people to create their own destiny. We are driven by our purpose to champion every client’s goals with passion and integrity. We respect and appreciate the diversity of our employees, our clients, and the communities we serve. We challenge conventions strategically to create value for our clients, our firm and the world. We live and bring to life the concept of ‘own your tomorrow’ every day. We champion our employee strengths, guide their development, and invest in their long-term success. We hire optimistic, results-oriented, curious, innovative, and adaptable people with the desire to help our clients and one another succeed.  As a company, we were established by Chuck over 40 years ago to champion Main Street over Wall Street, and to help Americans transform themselves from earners to owners. Through advocacy and innovation, we work to make investing more affordable, accessible and understandable for all. As we enter our fifth decade, we are looking for talented, innovative and driven people who believe they can help themselves, and our clients, create a better future. Our Opportunity: Global Data Solutions is responsible for the management and integration of data across Schwab. Our focus is on making data more accessible and available, enabling speed to insight, and ensuring sound governance, resulting in a robust data environment. Ultimately, we will increase the value of our data and better leverage it to create competitive advantage.  The Governance Program Analyst role is a key member of the Data Governance Office (DGO) and reports to the Managing Director Metadata Management. This role will be responsible guiding our business entity partners in developing and delivering successful governance outcomes in support of our Global Data Solutions initiatives. This role will work closely with Data Owners, Business Data Stewards, and Technical Data Stewards to support capture of metadata for the firm’s critical data elements. What you’ll do:Within DGO:Working as a member of the stewardship services team, at the direction of the team manager, you’ll be gathering metadata and/or data quality requirements about critical data elements from across the business.As you gather metadata and/or data quality requirement, you’ll be recording it in the Collibra Data Governance Center and preparing it for review by business partners to ensure we are providing detailed understanding of the data we are bringing under governance.Working with our business partners:You will help them identify critical data elements and ensure they meet the criteria established by the firm for that designation.You will be gathering the information they already have about the data they are managing, as well as helping discover required metadata we don’t haveYou will be working with our Data Management Technology team to coordinate acquisition of technical metadata and help them answer questions about the business use of dataYou will be working with technical data stewards who know the technical structure of the dataYou will be supporting data quality efforts, including data profiling, business rule development and helping identify standards that may be necessary to support data quality at the CDE leveWhat you have:Strong data analysis skills and content knowledge of Data Governance, Metadata Management and/or Data Quality required.Familiarity with data governance tools like Collibra, Informatica (Metadata Manager or IDQ), Oracle EDQ a plus, but not essential. Financial Services background is strongly preferred.Experience in writing business definitions of tables, entities, files, columns, attributes and fields.An understanding of business and technical metadata, data lineage and data models and methods to document this metadata for both technical and business users5+ years of experience in working with how data is described and organized with business analysis and/or data quality methodology is applied.BA/BS (data orientation preferred); MBA and/or advanced degree (attractive).Strong relationship building abilities and partnership skills working with a variety of business and technical associates, and experience working in a highly virtualized environment with partners distributed in multiple locations.Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to quickly synthesize data and develop recommendations.Strong problem-solving ability: both business and technical level.Proven ability as a self-starter, showing strong initiative. Comfort with ambiguity, able to effectively take the conceptual to the pragmatic.Very detail oriented, and the ability to multi-task, work efficiently and meet tight deadlines.Sound judgment, planning, project management and organization skills.Change agent mentality and ability to influence outcomes in a complex organizational environment.You may be asked to demonstrate any of the above in an interview.What you’ll get:Comprehensive Compensation and Benefits packageFinancial Health: 401k Match, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Employee Discounts, Personalized advice, Brokerage discountsWork/Life Balance: Sabbatical, Paid Parental Leave, New Mothers returning to work Program, Tuition Reimbursement Programs, Time off to volunteer, Employee Matching Gifts ProgramEveryday Wellness: Health and Lifestyle Wellness Rewards, Onsite Fitness Classes, Healthy Food Choices, Wellness ChampionsInclusion: Employee Resource Groups, Commitment to diversity, Strategic partnershipsNot just a job, but a career, with an opportunity to do the best work of your life Learn more about Life@Schwab. Name: Acquisition Program Analyst, Senior-Secret (SAF/AQQ-Global Reach Programs)
Description: OverviewOBXtek Inc. is an established award-winning business providing information technology and professional management services to the federal government. OBXtek is a leader in its field and is committed to identifying, developing, and delivering innovative, mission-focused technical and logistical solutions to over 15 civilian and military partners in the Federal Government.  As a prime contractor for 93% of our current work, we possess a robust corporate infrastructure that provides management oversight and support for all our programs. OBXtek pairs lessons learned across disciplines with industry standard quality practices such as CMMI-Dev Level III, ITIL, 6Sigma, PMI, and ISO to create processes that leverage best practices and result in novel, successful solutions.ResponsibilitiesThis contract supports the SAF/AQ organization, other PEOs as directed, and other Headquarters Air Force organizations where it is in the interest of the SAF/AQ to have an acquisition support presence within that organization. The objective is to provide specialized expertise to complement the organization’s inherent resources for effective and efficient mission accomplishment and continuity, introduction of innovation, and enhancement of technical competence. The contractor shall support the entire spectrum of acquisition and sustainment efforts as necessary to support the respective Government organizations. SAF/AQQ – Global Reach Programs directs, plans, and programs for development, procurement, and product support of Global Reach programs. Serves as the focal point within the HAF for Global Reach matters associated with integrated product life cycle management and facilitates Global Reach stakeholder collaboration in addressing lifecycle issues. The portfolio includes current and future mobility, special operations, trainer, and special mission aircraft programs, as well as related systems. Programs include C-5, C- 17, C-130J variants, C-130H, VC-25, Presidential Aircraft Recapitalization (PAR), C- 12/20/21/32/37/40, KC-10, KC-135, KC-46A, CV-22, HH-60G, Combat Rescue Helicopter (CRH), UH-1N Replacement, T-1, T-6, T-38, Advanced Pilot Trainer (APT or T-X), Large Aircraft Infrared Countermeasures (LAIRCM), Communications, Navigation, Surveillance/Air Traffic Management (CNS/ATM), Combat Air Forces/Mobility Air Forces (CAF/MAF) Distributed Mission Operations (DMO), and the Air Force Academy Powered Flight and Glider programs.  The tasks for this position include:  a. Supporting Headquarters Air Force (HAF) budget preparation and defense, SAE oversight and decision-making activities, PEO program execution and oversight efforts of aircraft platforms, and may be required to independently:b. Maintaining and analyzing planning, scheduling, and management data.c. Studying, analyzing, and providing recommendations on requirements, acquisition strategies, program documentation, program phase transition plans, supplemental information, and program execution.d. Providing honest broker assessments of programs approaching milestone decisions and of prime contractor technical and operational issues.e. Researching and analyzing program trends, identifying issues, and recommending solutions.f. Making recommendations on the allocation of funding, establishment of program goals, objectives, and schedules, and the formulation of program direction.g. Tracking compliance with stated program direction and identifying issues.h. Identifying and researching programmatic issues and tradeoffs in terms of required capabilities, costs, and schedules.i. Reviewing and providing recommendations on existing and proposed Air Force acquisition and capability area policies and implementation.j. Reviewing and evaluating the impact of national, DoD, JCS, and civil government policies and activities that affect Air Force acquisition programs and capability areas.k. Maintaining historical Air Force weapon program documentation and developing summary documents/briefings and training material.l. Providing short notice, quick-reaction analyses of critical programmatic issues in the context of Congressional, OSD Staff, Joint Staff, HQ USAF, Major Air Command (MAJCOM), North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), coalition, or bi-lateral activities.m. Preparing Planning, Programming, Budgeting and Execution (PPBE) documentation to ensure they accurately articulate the current program.n. Supporting the HAF review process - Air Force Requirements Oversight Council (AFROCs), Joint Warfighting Capabilities Assessment (JWCAs), Defense Acquisition Boards (DABs), Congressional cycle, Acquisition Strategy Panels (ASPs), Air Force Review Board (AFRBs),Configuration Steering Board (CSB), Government Accountability Office (GAO) reports, etc.o. Reviewing and documenting Mandatory Declassification Review (MDR) and Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests.p. Monitoring on-going studies, analyses, and developmental work relevant to weapon systems.q. Supporting program-specific efforts like Concept of Operations (CONOPS) development, Capability Development Documents (CDD), Capability Production Documents (CPD), Information Exchange Requirements (IER), and requirements working groups.r. Reviewing and providing data to assist in preparation for legislative hearings, program documentation, briefing packages and read-aheads, Congressional staffer visits, and other events to ensure an integrated and consistent Air Force position in response to Congressional questions, issues, and requests for information on assigned program/portfolio.s. Any other tasks closely associated with the performance of duties list above and as coordinated with the COR.QualificationsActive Top SecretClearance Personnel at the Senior level in this position shall have a Master’s degree  At least 10 years of defense acquisition experience with at least 1 year in a HQ staff position.

organizations, external academia, healthcare and research organizations.Develops and administers live and on-demand education and training program for investigators and research associates regarding and committees as required.Performs other duties as assigned.Requirements A. Name: Risk Analyst - Financial Services Merchant Funding
Description: Job DescriptionPosition: Risk AnalystReports To: Risk ManagerSummary: The Risk Analyst protects company business and assets by looking out for fraudulent or otherwise unusual patterns in merchant processing activity, holding questionable batches until an investigation can be completed, and communicating actions and outcomes. Primary Responsibilities · Review Merchant Exception Reports using an online reporting system to identify and mitigate risk and losses related to merchant credit card transactions processed daily  · When deemed appropriate, withhold funding of merchant deposits within authorized limits and initiate a risk review, alternatively, release batches when appropriate  · Collect documentation from merchants, cardholders, issuing banks or ISOs to assess potential financial or compliance exposure  · Monitor daily retrieval reports and work with merchants and other stakeholders to fulfill them in a timely manner; withhold funding when deemed necessary to cover potential exposure  · Scan transactions and batches of newly-approved merchant accounts to confirm transactions processed are consistent with activity expected at the time of account approval  · Contact merchants or ISOs as needed to verify business is legitimate; withhold funding as needed to mitigate potential losses  · Communicate with merchants, cardholders, or issuing banks as needed to obtain documents, assess risk and decide whether to continue to hold or release funds previously held  · Notify the referring ISO/Agent of any holds affecting merchants  · Manage timeline of held funds in order to appropriately handle and release, and remain in proactive communication regarding status  · Initiate or respond to e-mail communications with other MAC (Merchant Acquiring Committee) members regarding fraudulent or high-risk merchants; share information regarding merchant processing patterns where relevant to prevent further or future losses Skills Required · Strong deductive reasoning skills; can infer information gathered from multiple sources  · Able to read and fully understand personal and business credit reports in order to assess a merchant’s financial condition and wherewithal to pay chargebacks or refunds as they may occur  · Proficiency with Microsoft Office applications  · Ability to identify patterns or recognize aberrations  · Conveys difficult news compassionately in support of building long-term relationships with merchants and ISOs  · Demonstrates accuracy with particular attention to detail in a work setting that requires effective time-management skills and strict adherence to deadlines Experience and Education · Minimum of 3 years prior experience in a Risk Management or Credit Underwriting role, preferably within the payment card industry  · Prior use of transaction monitoring or risk assessment software and reporting tools  · Knowledge of TSYS, Cynergy, First Data, and/or Elavon platforms preferred  · Knowledge of G2 web monitoring systems  · Proficient with First Data & TSYS Acquiring Solutions tools, including: Access One, Express/e-connections, CBOS, and MerLink strongly preferred Hours required for this position are M-F 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM. Some holidays, weekends and overtime may be required occasionally.To be considered, please submit your current resume and salary requirement.Company DescriptionSignaPay, a leading merchant services provider dedicated to elevating payments through investments in people, is looking to double the size of its company in the next 3-4 years. In order to accomplish this goal, we are looking to for new members to join our team.

Name: Underpayment Analyst
Description: Do you have an analytical as well as investigative mindset? Do you want to pair that with your knowledge of the healthcare field? Parallon is seeking candidates with revenue cycle/patient financial services experience to be Analysts in our Underpayments department. Parallon's Mission: We serve and enable those who care for and improve human life in their communities.  Parallon, a division of HCA, is an industry-leading provider of patient financial and revenue cycle services to acute care providers across the United States. We are dedicated to our values and passionate about finding future leaders for our fast-growing divisions in the Dallas/Fort Worth area. Although we are the largest healthcare provider in the world and experts and leaders in revenue cycle services, we maintain a people-first culture and sense of community.  As an Underpayment analyst, you would be responsible for researching and resolving underpayments from insurance companies such as Aetna, BC/BS, Cigna, Managed Medicare/Medicaid, etc., and assessing Managed Care contracts for appropriate reimbursement to validate the payment received as a contractual underpayment. In addition, Analysts contact payers and pursue collection of underpayment, and perform appropriate follow up with payer for payment as appropriate. They also escalate issues to the Payer Supervisor for immediate remedy, and provide clear and concise documentation of actions taken on each account.  Duties include, but are not limited to: Must be able to read, review, and analyze reimbursement contracts from managed care insurances Knowledge and understanding of 837/UB04 claims and 835/EOB/RA Basic knowledge of CPT & HCPCS coding language preferred, ICD-9 & ICD-10 knowledge a plus Understanding of HMOs, PPOs, and other Managed Care plansQualifications:Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Communication - communicates clearly and concisely, verbally and in writing Customer Orientation - establishes and maintains long-term customer relationships, building trust and respect by consistently meeting and exceeding expectations Interpersonal Skills - able to work effectively with other employees, patients and external parties PC Skills - demonstrates proficiency in Microsoft Office applications and others as required Policies & Procedures - demonstrates knowledge and understanding of organizational policies, procedures and systems Basic Skills - able to perform basic mathematical calculations, balance and reconcile figures, punctuate properly, spell correctly and transcribe accuratelyEducation High school diploma or GED requiredExperience At least one year of related experience requiredCertificates/License - N/A  At Parallon, every employee is a valued member of our organization. You can expect to receive competitive salary, ongoing professional development, comprehensive benefits package, performance bonuses and more!  Check us out or follow us on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/company/parallon-business-solutions  #ParallonBCOM  Company Description:Parallon believes that organizations that continuously learn and improve will thrive. That’s why after more than a decade Parallon remains dedicated to helping hospitals and hospital systems operate knowledgeably, intelligently, effectively and efficiently in the rapidly evolving healthcare marketplace, today and in the future. As one of the healthcare industry’s leading providers of business and operational services, Parallon is uniquely equipped to provide a broad spectrum of customized revenue cycle services.
